name: Peco Peco
description:
The players seek to assemble different Foods in order to present the best buffet.

The game is played in several round, continuing until no one has played a card after everyone at the table has had a turn.
Each player, during their turn can play 1 Animal card from their hand if it beats the one at the top of the discard pile.
There are 3 types of cards:
- The Cat must be played over/beats the Mouse
- The Mouse must be played over/beats the Elephant
- The Elephant must be played over/beats the Cat

The player is also allowed to pass even though a playable card is in the hand, it is called bluffing.

At the beginning of the next turn, the player can accuse the previous player to have bluffed.
If the accuser is right, the accuser take 1 Animal card from the bluffer's hand, if the accuser is wrong, the accused player can take a card in the accuser's hand.

The last player to have played 1 Animal card wins that round and the prize (1 Food card).

The game proceeds until one player gather 1 Food card of each type: Maki, Sushi and Onigiri.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Set Collection

name: 5 sekund Harry Potter
description: Hello Wizards! A brand new, unusual version of the bestselling game 5 Seconds, set in the world of Harry Potter! Do you think you know everything about the adventures of Harry, Ron and Hermione? Do you know every corner of Hogwarts, every spell and potion ingredient? But can you do it under time pressure? You only have 5 seconds, so jog your memory and don't delay in answering.

name: Nick Groff's Ghost Hunt: The Cleansing of Killian House
description:
The story of Zane Killian is a dark, bloody
stain on Valley Falls history. A noted madman, serial killer, and practitioner of the black arts, Killian was a reclusive
millionaire who had inherited a fortune from his wealthy father. Since Killian’s death in the early 1900’s, many who have
set foot in the mansion have never made it out to tell about it. Many souls that have explored the dismal hallways of
Killian House have met an untimely demise, and it is believed that Zane Killian found a way to cheat death. You have
been tasked with helping famed paranormal investigator, Nick Groff, explore the Killian House and locate Killian's secret
that binds him to the house. Your investigation may involve speaking with the spirits of Killian’s victims who are still
believed to inhabit the house. No doubt, if they are able to communicate they will be too happy to share information on
how to eradicate Killian’s spirit and see justice finally served. Cleanse the house of the evil bound spirit of Zane Killian
and restore peace to this dark corner of Valley Falls.

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided,visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find whats missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Game of Gnomes
description:
Be the first to grab the correct gnome!

A round begins by one player rolling the three dice. Each die represents either a shirt colour, a garden tool or a stylish accessory. Using the provided grabbers, players try and be the first to grab the gnome that matches all three categories rolled.

The first player to grab the correct matching gnome wins the round. Be the first player to grab 5 gnomes and win the game!

name: Pecking Order
description:
In this fun, fast-paced game, players play their cards simultaneously, quickly see which colour appears on the most cards, and then its a race to grab the totem pole with the correct colour nearest the top before anyone else can get to it.

It’s everyone for themselves!

—description from the publisher

name: Escape from Ghost Castle
description:
There is a chill in the air! Hide in a mysterious castle and avoid the ghosts that have decided to find you in their house. This ghostly adventure game for the whole family sends one player to hide in the castle, while the others play as the ghosts and try to find his or her hiding place. There will be no shortage of excitement, as both the hider as well as the seekers collect points until the very end! Who is victorious?

—description from the publisher

name: Das magische Siegel
description: With your combined efforts, you were able to locate the three most powerful artifacts of the wizarding world in your school! However, your joy comes to an abrupt end when you realize that the dark wizards have already entered the school grounds. Will you manage in time to find a suitable hiding place for the artifacts and seal them up forever?

name: Großstadtdschungel
description:
In broad daylight, an armed gang had stolen five valuable paintings from the art museum. The police are under enormous pressure to track down the thieves as quickly as possible and secure the loot worth millions!

In the competitive dice and card game Großstadtdjungel, players take on the roles of detectives who are investigating various locations around the city. In doing so, they not only have the common objective of the investigation in mind, but also their own personal advantage. Because at the end of the day, fame and honor await the cleverest investigator in the urban jungle.

—description from the publisher

name: Murder Mystery Party Case Files: Killer Startup
description:
Startup founder Dan Killian has been murdered. He fell 12 stories to his death, from the building where he had started his first company. As a Detective First Class and a new hire with the Seattle police department, you have been assigned to work on the Killer Startup case. In this case file is all the evidence to help prove who committed the murder.

Solve a murder mystery with friends. Open the Killer Startup Case File to start the crime scene investigation. The hunt is on to find a killer and it’s up to you to solve this cold-case mystery. This Case File includes all the evidence you need to solve the murder. Review every clue and piece of evidence in this unsolved mystery case file.

Players need to hunt through the evidence to find the killer and determine the motive, means and opportunity of each suspect. During a murder investigation, a detective must answer the following 3 questions: 1) Motive: Who had a reason to kill the victim? 2) Means: Who had access to the murder weapon and victim? 3) Opportunity: Who had a chance to kill the victim? Is any particular person unaccounted for during the time the victim was killed?

If you get stuck anytime during your investigation, you can access misplaced case files online for hints to keep you moving. Once you think you know the solution, access complete solutions online to confirm your suspicions and make an arrest.

Enclosed you will find the following:

- Case Evidence (32)
- Crime Scene Photos (5)
- Suspect Photos (9)
- Newspaper and Magazine Articles (3)
- Instructions and Suspect Sheet (2)
- File Folder (1)
- Links to Online Hints and Solution

name: LUNA Capital: Promo 2 – Dice Tower 2022 Cards
description:
Originally available as part of Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter Air Pack

Short-Term Concession 16
-7 points
-requires 2 Project tiles of specified type arranged as shown on the Concession card

Long-Term Concession 10
-9 points
-requires a meteorite surrounded on all 4 orthogonal sides with Construction cards

name: ReaLies
description:
Deduce the Truth: Lie your way to a win with ReaLies! This funny, creative and easy-to-play party game is all about convincing others that your lie is the truth, while also attempting to guess the real answer.

How To Play: The host draws a card and reads it out loud. On the Dry Erase boards, players write down their most believable response. The host reads all the answers out loud, and players must vote for which they think is the truth. Win points based on who votes for your response, and by guessing the real truth!

—description from the publisher

name: Jeopardy!: Card Game
description:
Enjoy America’s Favorite Quiz Show with this quick-to-play travel card game. Each deck plays out like a full episode, complete with Jeopardy!, Double Jeopardy!, and Final Jeopardy! rounds.

One player is the host and will be checking the correct answers, as the other players take turns selecting the trivia questions to answer. A grid of cards simulates the television show layout, and each of the four included episodes can be played once.

—description from the publisher

Not to be confused with a game published by Mattel with the same name but radically different gameplay.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: まじかる☆ベーカリー ～叛逆の魔法少女～ (Magical ☆ Bakery: Magical Girl Rebellion)
description:
Korone's Magical Bakery, which earned sales and success by any means necessary, is now the number one bakery in town. But there's a problem: the part-timers working at the store don't think the manager is going to pay them properly, and they've challenged her to a magical duel, with their salaries on the line! But if the store doesn't stay open, no one gets paid at all. Can the workers prevail with victory uncertain, and their salaries at stake?

Magical Bakery - Magical Girl Rebellion is the sequel to Magical Bakery - I'm the Manager, and the third game in the Magical Bakery series, with its own unique gameplay.

One player is the manager, and the other 1-3 players play as the workers in a magical duel. The workers want to win their pay, but the manager's goal is not to pay them anything, and the manager has powerful magic conferring a significant advantage. Over the course of ten rounds, the workers and manager select magic cards, and then secretly pass them to the manager, who will then declare who won the round - but once per game, the manager can lie! If the workers catch them in a lie, they win the round, and if the workers win three rounds out of the ten, they win.

name: Misión Antártida: Modo Cooperativo
description:
A cooperative variant for Misión Antártida, delivered in the March 2023 Ludoty Box. Includes 1 die.

In Cooperative mode, each player will use a game sheet, but at the end of the game all players will add up to a single joint final score.

name: The First Boba Tea Shop in London
description: In The First Boba Tea Shop in London, you are the franchisee of a famous Taiwanese milk tea stand, managing an increasingly agitated line of customers outside your store desperate to try the newest craze. You need to play as many cards as possible into four ordered queues. If someone tries to cut in line you can either kick them out, or clear the whole line. To win, you must go through the whole deck without discarding any four cards of the same rank.

name: Similix
description:
Lynx eye or eagle eye – who will have the best vision in this matching race?
In this simple yet effective game, the players compete against each other to try to find the silhouette card that matches the illustrated card.

—description from the publisher

name: Kabuki temple
description:
The night is your friend. The shadows are your shelter.Move quietly and avoid useless fights. Find your prey and complete your mission.

To play, you'll need a pencil and a 6-sided die. Walk the paths and look for the power-ups you meet along the way.
You can use these upgrades to increase your Hide skill or your Fight skill.
Keep track of your characteristics by checking the boxes on your character sheet.
When you meet enemies and have to fight roll the dice, modify the result thanks to your special abilities and compare the result with the values indicated next to the enemy; if the result is equal or greater you have won and can continue the mission.
To win you must reach the temple and defeat the final boss.

—description from the designer

name: Eisbrecher
description:
Break the (d)ice from the floe! Try to score it before it melts away!

Will you keep a cool head or will your points run between your fingers?

In this quick dice game mass isn't everything. Because even if you gain the most ice in the first phase (breaking), you might lose it all in the second phase of the game (scoring).

At the beginning a 4x4 (d)ice floe floats between you. With the fire dice you break ice from the floe and gain it. And if you separate single dice from the rest you also gain those!

Once all the ice has been collected, you continue to the scoring phase. In this you try to turn your ice into points. But if you risk too much, it might melt instead. And even the other players threaten your ice. If they roll doubles, some of your ice might melt! Only a shield token can save you ... hopefully you've gained one in the breaking phase!

Eisbrecher can be played by families but it certainly rewards forward thinking and thoughtful risk taking.
mechanics: Finale Ending, Map Reduction, Pieces as Map, Re-rolling and Locking, Take That

name: Cthulhu Wars: Buffthulhu
description:
This Great Old one for the Great Cthulhu faction was released as part of Cthulhu - The Art of Richard Luong.

Rules:
How to Awaken Buffthulhu:

There must be a gate in Great Cthulhu's starting Area (can be abandoned or enemy-controlled).
If this is first Awakening, pay 10 Power. Otherwise, pay 4 Power.
Cthulhu appears in its starting Area. (Remember to gain 1 Elder Sign).

Cost: 10/4
Combat: 9
Ability: None

This unit can be awakened instead of the standard Cthulhu unit whenever Cthulhu is awakened, and was originally developed for Cthulhu - The Art of Richard Luong.

name: Battle of The Electric Vikings: Can I Play With Vikings?
description: 10 new cards based on the ever popular Iron Maiden! With the new words you'll be making great Maiden songs like: Run to the Hills, Aces High and Number of the Beast.

name: Crossbows and Catapults: Chariots Battleset
description:
Business as usual on the Crossbows and Catapults field of battle. Two players set up their defences, position their warriors and then fling missiles at their opponent!

The addition here is the chariots - these are 'fired' by catapults and launched across the battlefield knocking down the enemy defences.

name: K-9 Capers
description: The object of the game is to be the first player to collect all nine cards in order from 1-9 to complete the dog show scene. Thirty-six dog cards (four of each kind of dog) are shuffled and placed face down in a 6x6 grid. Roll a 6-sided die (with numbers 1-3) and turn over the number of cards that match the roll. If one of the cards matches the number the player needs, it can be taken from the grid and added to his or her collection. Face-up cards that cannot be taken are turned face down. If the player can collect all the cards turned up, he or she can roll the die again. K-9 Capers is one of the games in the series titled “12-minute Games” produced by Gameright.

name: Half-Time Football
description: Half-Time Football follows all the rules for playing professional football. You can play the game in four quarters. Decide on how many minutes you want each quarter to last. Dice change hands according to whether you are on offense or defense. Use the score board and pegs to keep track of your score. Use the football to mark the line of scrimmage and the down.

name: Speedway
description: Speedway is fairly simple auto racing game that lasts three laps. The main mechanism is roll and move for speed. There is, however, a little strategy as you must declare intentions to change lanes or pass before you roll and you can get caught. Also, there is an Ave Caesar like pit stop requirement forcing drivers to decide whether to make a pit stop on the first or second lap (pit stops on the third lap require an extra lap to finish the race.) Once the decision is made, it then becomes a matter of planning to get to pit row.

name: Triple Flips 1: Horses
description:
Triple Flips 1 includes Steeplechase Championships, Ride-em Cowboy, and Ride the High Country.


Steeplechase Championships, for 2-4 players, uses a linear path of obstacles, each labeled with the rolls (on two dice) required to pass it. For instance, to start, you need to roll 2-5; then to clear the water jump, 6-9; then for the brick wall, 10-12. To clear the logs at the end, you need to roll doubles.



Ride-em Cowboy (a rodeo game for 1-4 players) is a game in which it is appropriately difficult to score well. Appropriately for simulating a rodeo, players often won't stay on the bronco long enough to score, but, on the other hand, occasionally someone will ride the whole way out.



Ride the High Country is just a basic roll-and-move game for 2-4 players.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Cilada
description: Cilada (Ambush) is a kind of mix between Checkers and Chinese Checkers. 2 players try to move their tokens to the other side of the board while capturing the tokens of the opponent. Game released between 1974 and 1978 by Grow.

name: I Scream
description:
Yummy! What a collection of ice cream treats! Can you be the first to hold a set of 4 of the same treat and cause all the players to scream with delight? A true ice cream frenzy that's sure to get your mouth watering. Hungry for more? If you lose the first round, you'll get another chance to snag yourself a treat in round 2,3,4 and more!

Object: Collect a set of 4 identical ice cream treats.
publishers: IDEAlogists LLC, Madd Capp Games, MJ Moran Company

name: Sherlock Holmes
description: The players move figures representing Holmes and Watson around a board representing London trying to uncover 6 clue cards relating to a specific mystery before their opponents. There are no dice or spinners, just tactical movements based on deduction and skill.
publishers: Abel Klinger, Capiépa Éditeur: Jeux Éducatifs, Majora, Tri-ang

name: Tripoley Word
description:
A Fun Twist of the Classic game.
Players in this quick-playing word game compete to win the pot! Be the first to play a double letter word or seven-letter word and win the pot. Players compete for 12 pots total per round. No worries if play gets hectic, the letter tiles securely lock into the molded grid. And scoring is easy, the player with the most chips after three rounds wins!

For 2 - 4 players, ages 10 and up. Contents Include: 100 molded letter tiles, molded tile grid, perimeter chip board and instructions.

name: Last Chip Standing: Devil's Luck
description: Last Chip Standing: Devil's Luck is a fiendishly simple, feather-light game of chance for 3+ players. In this Wild Western game of chance, roll dice, pass and steal loot, and be the last outlaw with chips to win the whole pot.

name: Cruel Seas: Imperial Japanese Navy Fleet
description:
Imperial Japanese Navy Fleet

Cruel Seas focuses on the cat and mouse hunts that happened nightly in the Philippines, Guadalcanal and the Solomon’s. They could be IJN sub chasers stalking a crippled US submarine, or mine layers playing their trade at night. Most commonly it will be Japanese barge convoys defending themselves in shallow water against rapacious PT boats. Turning the tables, a late war game could be played out with American landing ships and the terrifying Shin’yo Kamikaze craft.

The IJN, therefore, is an interesting mixture of the very sophisticated and the very amateur, boldness being a connecting factor whether in battleships or tiny craft. It is a do or die force, get in close and things will go well, dither or maintain the range of the allied technology and firepower will overreach you.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Revolution Timeline: México
description: Goal of the game: to be the only person with no cards remaining in front of you. If the players believes that their card dates from BEFORE the initial card, they place their card to the LEFT of the initial card, if they believes that their card dates from AFTER the initial card, they place their card to the RIGHT of the initial card.

name: The Game Of Quotations
description:
A quiz game based upon quotations from famous people. There are decks of Question Cards in different categories - True Or False, Quote Vote, Buzz Words, Missing Words, Who Said That? - and a set of player cards showing these sections. Players are dealt a hand of player cards, play one and must successfully answer the test on the relevant Question Card to dispose of it. Other players can poach questions to get rid of their own cards. First player to clear their hand wins.

Well produced but a standard party/quiz game.

name: Peter R. de Vries: Misdaadverslaggever
description:
In this game the players are trying to solve a crime by combining different clues. The trick is which clues to use and which to discard. If you play your cards right you will be able to close the case by connecting all the five facets of the crime: Suspect, Motive, Witness, Crime scene and Traces.

The game is named after the "famous" Dutch crime reporter Peter R. de Vries.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Kugelhund
description:
Bella and Bello are completely over the moon! Their friend Isabella has come to visit unexpectedly. And of course they want to give her their best bones. But where on earth have they buried them? Oh yes, under the garden gnome and there, beside the watering can.
Bella and Bello run about tirelessly, burrowing here and digging there...
The one who guides them over the lawn skilfully and is first to dig up the bone for Isabella together with them wins the game.

This game is played with two "dogs", wooden balls with ears attached to them, which are placed in a box which has several holes in the bottom. Each hole is marked by an item: watering can, a garden gnome, etc.

In the standard version of the game, a pile of cards each displaying two items is placed in the middle of the table. The active player takes the box and tries to roll the two dogs in the holes with marked with the items on the top card. If he succeeds, he gets to keep the card. In the meantime, his neighbour is repeatedly rolling a die which has a dog on one side. If he rolls the dog, then the active player's turn is over. The first player to gather three cards wins the game.

In the no-dice version all cards are arranged next to each other on the board. On each card, a burrowing chip is placed, face down. Some of these chips show a bone, others do not. When it is a player's turn, the tries to move the dogs into two holes, and then gets to inspect the burrowing chip on the card corresponding to the holes that the dogs have gone in. If the chip shows a bone, he gets to keep it, otherwise it is returned to the card. When there are only eight chips left on the card, the game ends, and the player with the most bones wins the game.

name: Torn Armor
description:
Torn Armor is a fantasy squad-based tactical miniatures board game for 2-4 players. Based in the mythical World of Torn, it presents the lore, races, people, heroes, and history to players through the use of game-play scenarios. The core set focuses on the conflicts between two factions:

The Sisk Empire: an expansionist society, believing that their advanced culture and religious ideology are something from which everyone can benefit. Unfortunately their war-machine is thinly stretched, over-taxed, and on the brink of collapse. They seek wealth, raw materials, technology and slaves.

The Maychians: anthropomorphic creatures that live in the so-called "New Continents" in the northern hemisphere. Their land is an undiscovered country, full of untapped resources and ancient ruins. The Maychians possess primitive technology, but are fervent in their desire to defend their homeland and resist the Sisk invasion.

Included in the core set are 39 highly-detailed miniatures, 12 unit stat cards, a full color rule book, full color scenario book, 4 double-sided color battle posters, 8 Magical Item cards, 8 Spell cards and 25 dice of 5 different colors.

The battle for Torn World begins as the Sisk explorers land on the beaches of the "New Continents" with the intent to discover and claim ancient magical relics from a forgotten age. But the Maychians have spotted the intruders and are ready to stop them at any cost! Which faction will prevail? Only you can decide!
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Open Drafting

name: S. Jorge Trophy
description:
This game is about the Castle of S. Jorge, a castle that is in the centre of Lisbon and has more than 1.000 years of history.

In this long history, the Castle has had several masters and has known all kind of characters. From the iron age Chief to the last King of Portugal, from the Roman Governor to the Arabic Sultan, from Kings to Scientists, from Navigators to Middle Age Writers, all of these have marked their presence in the Castle and their history is vivid in our memories still today.

In this game, 12 of the most prominent characters that have lived in the Castle dispute a tournament. This tournament happens only each 1.000 years, and the winner will reign over the Castle for the next 1.000 years.

To win this tournament, each character must walk around the board paths and some secret passages, and collect and preserve 3 S. Jorge Trophies. But be careful with the false trophies, they weight on you and slow you down.

You also have to be aware of other characters: if they encounter you, they may steal your trophies. Or you may steal theirs. Or you may discard some of your "non-valid" trophies on their back. Or the opposite. Anyway, something may happen.

And, of course, you have a special ability. Something that only you can do. How to take the most of it, that's your job.
mechanics: Area Movement, Pick-up and Deliver, Variable Player Powers

name: Kleurensalade
description: Players take turns attempting to extract their own pieces from the colorful jumble on the round base.

name: Star Wars Electronic Battle Command Game
description:
Star Wars Electronic Battle Command Game was a space exploration game that you could play by yourself or against 3 other players. The screen was an LED grid which showed coordinates. You could 'zoom' in on a coordinate to get a closer look at a star system, or come across other player's ships.

Quotes from the box:

"A game that brings you the space battles of Star Wars with three levels of play..."
"A self-contained Micro Computer Game which allows you to simulate all the exciting action and strategy of Hyperspace combat."
"Display panel which shows you your location in Hyperspace along with planets and enemies."
"You can choose to take evasive maneuvers from your enemy, go to battle stations or screen up for invisibility."

From the rulebook:

"Star Wars Electronic Battle Command Game is probably the most exciting computer game you will ever play!"
categories: Electronic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Le Secret de Grimbergen
description:
Le Secret de Grimbergen (The Secret of Grimbergen) is a deduction game produced for the Grimbergen Abbey Brewery in Belgium. The game is described as being a "Medieval Adventure" and is published in French and Dutch.

From the box:

Walk through the corridors and rooms of Grimbergen Abbey to find the monks that will permit you to discover the secret of the beer that you wish to make. You will need to unite the three monks that each know a part of the secret, in one of the rooms in the Abbey. In order to do this you will need to enter the secret maze, pass through obscure tunnels and battle with your adversaries. Who will be the first to discover the Secret of Grimbergen?

Components:

1 board
2 d6
5 playing pieces
1 pad of sheets showing plans of the Abbey
12 monk markers
12 'secret' cards (showing which three monks you need to find)
44 Abbey cards
5 pencils
1 set of rules

name: Gulpin' Guppies
description:
From the publisher:

Something's fishy around here....it must be Gulpin' Guppies! Gobble up the competition as you swim toward the beach, but don't let them gobble you first! Goofy Gulpin' Guppies fit inside one another, making quick fish food out of unsuspecting swimmers! Make your way as you watch out for the wave or you may get all washed up! Be the first to get all 4 of your guppies to the beach, and you're the Guppy that gets the glory! Ages 4 and up.

Players are trying to get their four fish through a set of rapids. The first player to do this is the winner. Obstacles like hungry bigger fish and furious waves try to spot you from getting through the rapids.

name: Penguin Picnic
description:
All the penguins are going to gather for a picnic today. They will float on their icebergs and have lots of fun! Who will catch the most fish? If it is you, you'll win the game, but beware, you could end up with only fish bones instead of fish!

For ages 5 - 10

name: WWF World Wrestling Federation Wrestling Trivia Game
description:
Take your knowledge to the mat with this trivia game about wrestling. 800 WWF trivia questions.

Take your knowledge to the mat with this fascinating trivia game about wrestling! Young people can play with the old "pros"...Everybody wins! - But there is only one champion!

800 World Wrestling Federation Trivia questions - 5 levels of difficulty - Each player (or tag team) selects a level, and the tournament begins. Go for that World Wrestling Federation Championship belt... Pin your opponents! Create your own "dream team".

At the end of the tournament - claim the "prize" (the best spot in front of the tv?) - Until the next match.

name: Krill
description:
A Whale of a Game

Krill is a card game about food chains in Antarctica where Krill, tiny little shrimps, form the base of an entire eco-system. Players draw from the deck and try to create chains of animals and plants which they place on the table. And with the play of the right predator card you can steal cards from other players to add to your own.

Here's the box description:

"Dive right into the Antarctic Ocean community with KRILL the marine food chain game! From microscopic plants to 30-ton whales, to harvest by humans, players try to survive the Antarctic waters in this fascinating card game. Deck of 77 cards includes an introduction to the Antarctic Ocean food chain and instructions for 5 different games."

name: Kitty Corners
description: Finny's fishing for trouble. And Meatloaf is hungry...again. Roll the dice and catch the kitties' crazy antics. Match the two dice to a square on your bingo board, then mark that square with a mouse. But watch out, roll "Scat Cat!" and your mouse gets away. The first to get bingo wins. Top Cat!

name: How to Be a Complete Bastard
description: The board represents a lavatory system. Dice are rolled to direct movement on the board. There are three packs of Bastard cards. Players start the game with two or three cards. Bastard cards can be used by any player BEFORE rolling the dice on their turn. Only one card can be used at a time. Most cards contain an unpleasant dare which you or your opponent are required to perform, Failure to perform the dare satisfactorily leads to a move forward as directed down the lavatory system. Other cards allow you to fend off dares, miss turns or simply move any opponents piece you choose. To prevent players from hoarding cards, any player who holds more than three cards at the start of their turn must move forward six spaces. The winner of the game is the player LEAST far down the system when his first opponent arrives in the sewage works at the end.
categories: Humor, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Duck-A-Roo
description:
In Duck-A-Roo, the little ducks quack happily and swim around the pond. They all want to follow their mother in order to be good ducks, so they try to keep pushing their way to the front of the line – and with your help, they'll make it there!

To set up the game, place the twenty color tiles face down in the center of the table, then place the mama duck, with the three baby ducks in a row behind her. On a player's turn, she reveals the color of one of the face-down tiles. If it matches the color of the duck at the back of the line, she keeps the tile and scoots the duck forward so that it's right behind its mother. The player takes another turn, searching for a tile to match the color of the duck now at the back of the line. If the player doesn't find a tile of the proper color, her turn ends.

Once the final tile has been claimed from the center of the table, the game ends. Whoever has collected the most tiles wins!

name: The Hobbit Game
description:
[From Kulkmann's Gamebox]

The board is a large forest scene with five white trails with white, green and red numbered dots. The trails connect Hobbit Hill(start) to Lonely Mountain (drawing of a treasure trove, mountain and smaug) You travel one of four trails (varying degrees of difficulty) to Lonely Mountain where you get either 20, or 30 gold coins (depending on difficulty of trail). After you reach lonely mountain, you travel back to hobbit hill and do it all over again.

During your travels you may buy equipment (little cardboard pieces) that affect your interaction with the "adventure" and "creature" cards. Equipment you can buy (listed on board with cost menu): Ring, Sword, Map, Armor, Eagle

There are red (creature) and green (adventure) cards. These cards depict scenes from the animated cartoon and have brief descriptions of what happens (much like talisman adventure cards).

name: Contra o Tempo
description:
Name three national holidays. Or three famous “Silvas”. It's easy, isn't it?
Now imagine doing it in a few seconds, and with all the players watching you. You will be surprised, as it is not as easy as it looks!
Contra o Tempo brings 300 cards with funny and unusual situations for you to quote. A timer marks the time you will have to give the answers. And time is very short!
The game even has cards at different levels of difficulty, for you to play with your family or friends.
Try playing a game Contra o Tempo and see that not everything is easy when you are under pressure!

name: Stargate SG-1: La Vengeance d'Apophis
description: Tilsit Éditions gives you the chance to travel across the universe to prevent the accomplishment of the revenge of the Goa'Uld System Lord, Apophis. Put together an SG team and step into the Stargate to reach your objective --but beware, there are a few hundred Stargates which can be connected in over 137 thousand million different ways! Don't give up just yet: you can count on the assistance of the Tollans, Nox, Asgards and the Tok'ra.
categories: Exploration, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Ferrari F1
description:
Ferrari F1 simulates a Formula 1 race in which the players' cars move around a track, aiming to be the first to complete the race. The game was endorsed by Michael Schumacher, a multiple World Champion F1 driver.

There are 18 possible race tracks that can be built from different arrangements the 4 double-sided game boards. The players choose a track and roll dice to determine whose car token is in pole position (first at the starting line). They each have a dashboard that shows the gear engaged for his or her car and its fuel gauge.

Taking turns, players move their cars according to the position of their gears. They can roll dice to pull ahead, moving into spaces that match the color rolled. This action costs fuel, which is subtracted at the end of their turn. The game's rules also cater for accidents, pit stops, and other events in an F1 race.

The game ends when all players move their cars two complete times around the track. The winner is the one who is the first to do so.

name: The Powerpuff Girls: Flying Action Game
description:
Features the "PowerPuff flying pole". Attached to the pole by a string is a plastic model of all three PowerPuff Girls flying together. When you reach certain areas on the board, you place the pole there, holding it with one hand and the plastic PowerPuff model with the other. The goal is to make the model "fly" around the pole by swinging it, to knock down surrounding villains and score points.

Swedish version of a game called PowerPuff Girls: Flying Action Game from Drumond Park Ltd..

name: L'Encanteur
description:
L'Encanteur - the French fish auctioneer
The bidding's master of ceremony - l'encanteur - used to sing prices.
The song-bidding system is a two-phase process : first, the price decreasing phase and then the price increasing phase.
Each player impersonates a restaurant owner.

Goal : Be the first to serve your secret fish-combination after having made your shopping at the song-bidding.
Game turns are played by pairs : morning is when you go to the song-bidding and buy your different species of fish or seafood, afternoon is when you try to serve the best your clients.

Number of players : 3 or 4
Ages 8 and up
Average length : 15-20 mn.
Number of cards : 110 cards (rulebook in French, English, Dutch, German)

name: Crazy Crab
description: Once you start the game, the Crazy Crab jiggles, jerks, scoots and darts. Crab claws from every player frantically grab for their pearls. Just when you think you've got one, the crazy crab might knock it out of your claw. The first player to get all of their colored pearls and then grab the crazy crab is the winner.

name: 6th Year Cwali
description: This game was a freebie with the purchase of a Cwali game at Essen 2002. Came with only the 5 polyhedral dice (4-, 6-, 8-, 12-, and 20-sided). Object: In every turn you try to make an unbroken chain of dice in which every die with more sides has a higher number.

name: Spider-Man
description: Spider-Man is a simple movie-related game for children. Players move Spider-Man over the roofs of a 3-D town (NY), gathering tokens and playing cards, in order to accumulate resources for the final duel with Goblin.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Alf Game
description:
FROM THE BACK OF THE BOX: "What's going on? ALF is trying to find his ol' buddy, Lucky the cat, and take him out for lunch. But Mrs. Ochmonek, the nosey neighbor, is prowling through the house! The first player to help ALF avoid Mrs. Ochmonek and find Lucky wins!"

The Alf Game casts players as ALFs (Alien Life Forms), the star of a 1980s television sitcom, in a quest to take the neighbor's cat, Lucky, to lunch (literally).

As Alf, the players take turns, rolling dice and moving through the house on one of the dice's results. The other die is used to move Mrs Ochmonek, the cat's owner. She will avoid the spaces that have the Tanners (the family who took in Alf) on them. If she lands on Alf, he must move to the nearest family space.

The first Alf to land exactly on Lucky's space wins and ends the game.

name: AquaTerra
description:
Subtitle:
"God created the world, but the Dutch created Holland"

Description:
Help build the future of the Netherlands. With AquaTerra.

As a Project leader, deployed by the Ministry of Transport, Public Works and Water Management, you realize prestigious projects. To do this, you must have technical, economical, judicial and political "expertise". Use these expertise’s in an optimal way to realize your projects. But be ware!

Unforeseen events will cause you to adjust your plans and cooperation is necessary. The project leader that uses his expertise’s in the best way, wins. Good Luck!

Box contents:
The box contains a manual, a custom game-board, a small cloth bag (just large enough for an adult hand), 40 expertise chips, 30 play-cards, 14 project tiles, 4 score markers, 4 plus-tokens, 1 die, 1 die-shaped round-marker.

The board depicts the Netherlands in a Geo-thermal style, with a grid overlay. The grid shows project locations, matching the 14 project tiles, coded 'Project A' through 'Project N'. Every project square shows the potential maximum points that a single player can gain from that project.

Game Play:
Lay project tiles on a board, and surround them with expertise tiles. When a project has enough expertise, it is completed, and the player that contributed the most expertise wins.

During their turn, players throw the die and move the round-marker along the game-board as many spaces as the die indicates. Depending on the place the round-marker ends on, one of several things may happen. Sometimes a project tile may be drawn from the draw bag and placed on the board. Or the active player may draw one expertise chip from the faced-down set and place it on the board. In order to do this, they must move their score marker backwards on the track as many places as is indicated on the expertise chip that they have drawn. Another option would be drawing a play-card, which are similar to Monopoly chance cards.

When a project has enough expertise added to it (by placing expertise chip next to it) players see who gets how many points from their contributions. They then move their score marker forwards on the track the same number of points that they have collected from the project. The expertise chip attached to the project do not recycle back into the draw pile.

The game ends when either a per-determined number of rounds (based on the number of players) has been played or when all projects have been completed or when all expertise chips have been used up.

Note:
This game was supported by the Ministry of Transport, Public Works and Water Management.

name: Sorry! Madagascar Edition
description: The classic Game of Sweet Revenge with a theme from the animated film "Madagascar".
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Stop the Presses!
description:
We need to bring in enough Stories, illustrated with photos and cartoons and advertising contracts to meet the printing costs and staff payroll. If we can't meet these combined costs, then it is a case of STOP THE PRESSES! There isn't enough money to print our beloved Weekly Illuminator.

Our revenues come from reader circulation and advertising. We have a team of fine reporters chasing down stories, an advertising representative working magic on securing contracts, a photographer with an eye for photos that sell, a cartoonist who knows how to stir up controversy to add readership and, last, but not least, an editor with a warm, soft heart and steel-like brain (or is it the other way around?) -- as well as a steady hand for guiding our newspaper through thorny issues such as the libel suit, the press union's demand for a pay raise, people offended by our cartoons... imagine their nerve telling us what to publish and not to publish!?!

Contents:
1 gameboard
1 reporter pawn
1 press time marker
1 die
55 cards:
10 staff
2 cartoons
1 comic page
6 photos
6 issues
12 ad contracts
18 assorted stories
rules

name: Lucky Luke: Villin lännen peli
description:
Lucky Luke - A Game of the Wild West is a simple set collection game. There are ten different gangs of outlaws in the deck. Each turn, one outlaw card is turned face up. Each player chooses one of their sheriff cards, which are then revealed simultaneously. The player with the highest sheriff cards wins the outlaw card.

Collecting a complete gang gives a cash reward. The player with the most money wins. There are also five special cards in the outlaw deck: Lucky Luke and Jolly Jumper let the player draw outlaw cards from the deck. Ran Tan Plan causes some captured outlaws to escape.
categories: American West, Card Game, Comic Book / Strip
mechanics: Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Trick-taking

name: Cranium Bingo Bunch
description:
Contents

2 Special die
32 cards to make two boards in 4x4 grid
instructions
cloth drawstring bag


Made exclusively for Starbucks Coffee stores. Bingo Bunch uses 2 special dice with pictures of cartoon heads and bodies that when rolled match 75 cards depicting the various combinations of the dice. (25 combinations are possible, with each card repeating 3 times for a total of 75 cards)

Players each deal out 16 cards in a 4x4 grid in front of them, and by rolls of the dice try to be the first to get four in a row for a bingo, or turn over all the cards for a blackout.

The game can be played more simply for younger players using 9 cards in a 3x3 grid, or more difficult using 25 cards in a 5x5 grid (which limits the game to three players based on the number of cards in the deck).

The Bingo Bunch are the characters when heads and bodies match correctly: Allie Astronaut, Sammy Snorkel, Regina Ballerina, Eugene Unicycle & Glorp, a one-eyed purple alien.

The game also comes with a small travel pouch, so the game can be easily taken on the go.

name: Solairis
description: Players are one representative of the seven races of the Solairis system. They duel using spells that are powered by power cards. When one has lost the last hit point they lose. If you run out of power cards the spells are reshuffled and a new hand of spell and power cards are dealt.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Variable Player Powers

name: Agente Secreto
description:
A deduction and logic game.
Two countries have sent their best agents in a secrete mission. Your goal is to discover which mission and which agent was sent by the other player.

name: Bakugan Battle Brawlers Skill & Action Game
description:
Description: You and your opponents become the ultimate Battle Brawlers and must save the Bakugan that are trapped in Vestroia!

Release the Rods that trap them, and catch them as the plummet down to Earth!

Catch as many Bakugan Balls with the gaming scoops, be the first player to build your Gate Card puzzle and win!

Warning! Beware of Hydranoid.

Object of the Game: Be the first player to catch enough Bakugan Balls(Marbles) to complete your Gate Card Puzzle, 4 pieces.

Play Summary: One Player pull a rods out of Vestroia (the tower) which will release Bakugan Balls (Marbles). The players whose turn it is try to catch these Bakugan Balls with the two game scoops, if he catches the ball before it stops rolling the player gets a Puzzle piece for his Gate card puzzle. One of the Balls is the evil Hydranoid (the black marble), if you catch the Hydranoid you lose a gate piece. Scoops are passed clock wise and play continues until one of the players wins. When all size Marbles are released from the tower return all the rods and marbles and continue playing until you have a winner.

Not the CCG/CMG (Collectible Marble Game?) but a stand alone board game with a very similar title and theme.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme
publishers: Nelvana, SEGA Corporation, Sega Toys, Spin Master Ltd.

name: Red Baron
description:
Red Baron is a low complexity, quick playing board game of World War I air combat. This is not an aerial combat simulation by any means. It is a relatively simple "beer & pretzels" game in which the players use cards to fly their fighters, bombers, and balloons.

The game is two-dimensional (no altitude considerations) and features three aircraft types (fighters, bombers and balloons). Players use cards to maneuver their aircraft (one per card play) with the aim of collecting victory points by shooting down enemy aircraft, bombing ground targets (with bombers) or conducting aerial observation over no man's land (with balloons). The players each start with six aircraft but can vary the assortment in an effort to pursue differing victory strategies.

The game comes packaged in a ziploc bag that contains the 11" by 17" card-stock (unmounted) board, 38 playing pieces (counters), 28 cards and 4 pages of rules.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War I

name: buzzer
description:
The game has four modes: a quiz game, a taboo like game, a "finger on the trigger" game, and a game where you have to name as many words as possible fitting to a description.

All games are moderated by the included big red button. The button has a clear voice output in German for that purpose. It can also count presses and has a simple timer functionality.

The buzzer runs on 3AA batteries, a board, 4 pawns, 56 cards, 4 pencils and instructions are included.

When opening up the buzzer, a simple PCB with English descriptions shows up. It seems the board can hold also alternative speech chips, so it could be available in other languages as well.
categories: Children's Game, Electronic, Party Game, Trivia

name: Planeta Nomino
description:
Story:

April 2053. A group of space explorers arrives distant planet Nomino. On the spot they discover numerous mysterious objects. Nobody knows what is the purpose of the items they encountered. Yet, the astronauts have to give discoveries appropriate names as soon as possible due to the request of the mighty press syndicate being a sponsor of the expedition. The public is waiting for more news about expedition findings and scientists, threatened by news mogul with financial cuts, must act quickly…

Overview:

“Planet Nomino” is a family party game where players match bizarre names to even stranger objects.

In each round the players reveal a thing, put the spinning top in motion and then discuss the best names for it. In order to win player may need to convince other researchers that one of the picks is the best (even if it is obviously the worst one!). As soon as the spinning top stopped, they vote for each proposal and score according to the result of the ballot.

There are two modes of play: Simple, for young scientists, and basic, for more experienced astronauts.

In simple mode the player gets the points if she or he voted for most popular name (the one, which according to player’s opinion fits the object best and thus got majority of the votes).

In basic mode there is one more twist added. Each player gets each round new character card. Each character pursues own secret agenda and gains points if specific names had or had not been used (even if these were better choices than others).

The game continues until a player reaches 7 victory points.

name: The Apprentice
description:
The players interpret the role of witches involved in battle to become 'Queen of Witches'.

Every player has at his/her disposal a chest full of mice. Mice yes! In the game the mouse represents the 'magical power' of the witches. Each player starts each game with ten mice. During the game mice will be killed by spells and the winner will be the only player having at least one mouse left in his/her chest!

name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Card Game
description:
From the Press Release:

This travel-size card game asks players ages 6 and up to join forces to defeat Max Winters and his Alien army. The 52-card pack features Briarpatch’s transparent “see thru” cards. Each game comes with 40 TMNT cards, 10 Alien cards and 2 rule cards. For 2-4 players.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: HoloGrid: Monster Battle
description: HoloGrid: Monster Battle is a symbiotic combination of physical components (two decks of 36 cards and two device stands) and a mobile app that uses the camera on a tablet device to render the cards as monsters, very much in the style of the chess-like game that one can see played by R2-D2 and Chewbacca during the original Star Wars movie. This is not a card game that happens to be playable in an AR fashion, but rather a video game that employs a physical CCG to build your monster teams.

name: SHAEF
description:
SHAEF is a two-player WW2 card-driven wargame covering the ten months following D-Day in Western Europe.

One player takes the role of SHAEF – Supreme Headquarters Allied Expeditionary Force commanded by US General Dwight D. Eisenhower. The Allied player’s goal is to control at least two of four key locations in Germany before the end of March 1945. The Axis player seeks to frustrate these plans, but can win an instant victory if he can repel the Overlord invasion.

The historical armies and corps that fought in the campaign are represented by stand-up counters moving on the map. Smaller forces, plus combat support and special tactics, are handled by beautiful cards.
categories: Card Game, Wargame, World War II

name: Kalle Anka spelet: Guldgrävarjakten
description: Each player takes on the role as one of five Disney characters. Each turn you move a number of spaces, as indicated by your player board. Some turns, you must draw a card and follow its instructions. Keep moving, until you reach the second board were you are trying to strike gold (represented by a ball) by putting your plastic pickax in holes. The Swedish title translates to "The Donald Duck Game - The Gold-diggers Hunt"

name: Check the Ripper
description:
Hunt serial killers with Chess moves. The game board shows a grid of squares on a map of Britain and Ireland. The players try to track down serial killers hiding in cities. At the start of the game, plastic chips which show one of four serial killers are placed face down on the cities. Players choose their detective and place it anywhere on the map. There are also four cards with images of the four killers; the top one of these is flipped open.

The active player rolls two dice which show chess pieces. If the two dice show different symbols, the player can move his/her detective the corresponding moves (i.e., any distance diagonal for a bishop). If the two rolls are the same, though, a new killer card is flipped open. If a player lands on a chip, the chip is flipped over - if it shows the same killer as the card, the player can either score points or flip over other chips with the same killer. If s/he makes a mistake, though, all points from that turn are lost. If the killer doesn't match the card, it is just returned and the players try to remember its location.

When two detectives meet, they duel each other (higher die roll wins); the winner looking at a chip and placing the loser anywhere on the board.

When all 16 killer chips have been collected ("all cases solved"), the game ends and the player with most points is the winner.

name: Kecke Frösche
description:
The bold frogs are engaging in their antics: along the shore, on the pond, and underwater. The croakers are cheeky and the players help them have their fun. The stork can interrupt the fun only for a short time.

Part of the Goldsieber à la Carte line of games.

name: What a Performance!
description:
From the publisher:

Can you pretend to be a monkey, make a noise like a firework or wiggle your ears? If you can't, use the magic decoder and reveal your hidden forfeit! Be a star and rise to the challenge in this all-action game of fun for all the family.

Players roll a die and move thier counter toward the finishing space, performing activities along the way depending on where they land. The activities are

Who am I?
Make a noise
Forfeit
Action
Spin It

name: Pocket-Escape: Das Phantom im Park
description:
Always and everywhere ready for use: Pocket-Escape: Das Phantom im Park features characters of the detective agency Dyscover from the ESCAPE Dysturbia series!

Private investigator Angus Montgomery becomes the target of the underworld organization Syndicate: An anonymous caller threatens to pass on piquant details from his former life as a policeman to the press. Montgomery suspects an ex-colleague behind the unknown who has become a syndicate, but there is no evidence! Together with Ada Svoboda, computer specialist and member of the detective agency Dyscover, he sets out to expose the culprit.

28 pages of puzzles and difficult decisions await you. Pocket Escape: Das Phantom im Park fits in every pocket — the ideal case for your home or travel bag!

name: Heiße Karten
description: Heisse Karten, or Hot Cards, is played with a deck of cards showing the numbers 1-48, with even numbers in black (positive points) and odd numbers in red (negative points). Cards are played in a series of tricks, with the highest black card always taking a trick. The highest numbered red card also takes a trick if only red cards are played. Players need not follow "suit." Cards - both negative and positive - are actually worth their face value at the end of the game, with the highest scoring player (after deducting negative points from positive points) the winner. The 48 cards in this older German game each have unique artwork with the numbers incorporated into fanciful, colorful animal drawings.

name: Who Am I? The Biography Game
description:
Blurb from the back of the box:

Every life has a story.

For the past twelve years, Biography and A & E Television Networks have profiled well-known personalities from all walks of life - from actors to astronauts, sports heroes to scientists, politicians to playwrights. Who Am I? The Biography Game challenges your knowledge of such personalities through clever clues and insightful anecdotes as players hear first-person hints and have to guess "Who Am I?"

Based on the column from Biography Magazine.

Ages 12 and up

name: Mr. T Game
description:
This game is based on the mid-80's cartoon of the same name, where Mr. T coached a gymnastics team made up of teens (who also used their gymnastics to fight crime).

Mr. T's Gymnastics Team has to get to the airport before the clock runs out (and presumably the flight leaves). Each member of the team has three errands they have to complete - pick up their gym suit from the dry cleaners, say goodbye to the team mascot, stop by the police station to report a crime and so on. Along the way, players can land on spaces with red stars that inflict random punishments and rewards on them.

Only through clever use of the team bus and careful planning to get from errand to errand can the player beat the rest of the team to the plane.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Dirty Pictures
description:
Dirty Pictures styles itself as a mature guess-the-drawing game for 3 or more players.

Each player is given an amount of time (indicated by a sandtimer) to take his or her turn to score points. The player moves his or her piece on the result of a die roll, then draws a card from the deck corresponding to the landed space. He or she then starts drawing out a sketch about the Word or Phrase without saying anything; gestures are allowed. He or she scores 5 points when another player guesses correctly the Word or Phrase. The active player continues the roll-draw-sketch process until the timer expires. The next player then begins his or her turn.

The first player to score a total of 100 points wins and ends the game.
mechanics: Line Drawing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Beyond 2000: The Game
description:
Based on the highly successful Science and Technology TV series from Australia.
Players attempt to reach the central portion of the board comprised of three central rings, where they compete to become the first to gain control of the future.

name: Golden Trivia Cards: Major League Baseball Edition
description: MLB themed trivia game. Contains 216 trivia cards with 1,296 questions in six categories: Hitting, Pitching, Franchise Facts, All-Stars and Awards, Post-Season Play, and Names and Numbers. Game was published in 1984 so keep that in mind.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Memory, Sports, Trivia

name: A Fistful of Turkeys
description:
"Some Turkey Games" (aka Metagaming) released this game after Steve Jackson left to form Steve Jackson Games (SJG). The game is printed on a large, single sheet that folds down into a microgame size plastic bag. This copies the style and format of the first releases from SJG (Raid on Iran, One-Page Bulge, and Kung Fu 2100).

While not a very exciting game, it is a playable two-player hex and counter game where Billy has to "splat" six turkeys in less than ten turns within the confines of the turkey hatch.

More interesting than the game itself are all of the parody touches, such as a bogus author introduction, an angry letter from a customer, a fictional game list, silly versions of major game company logos, and the manner in which "Some Turkey Games" is printed at the bottom of the cover (copying the style used on the early SJG games).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid

name: The VCR Wrestlemania Game
description: Players vie to win the championship belt by moving to the end of the game track. Player's take turns being on the offensive, driving their opponent back while pushing forward themselves. The game uses a VCR tape directing some of the action starring your favorite 1980's WWF stars.

name: The Game of HotSeat
description: Players are dealt five cards. The first player rolls the die to determine which player is on the HotSeat. They must then truthfully answer a question asked by the player who rolled the die. They may use a Pass card to get out of answering, or a Rebound card to force the the asking player to answer the question. The first player to use all of their cards wins.

name: Die Gentlemen bitten zur Kasse
description:
"Die Gentlemen bitten zur Kasse" (The Great British Train Robbery) is a game about the famous English train robbery in 1963.

Each player must pick up mailbags at certain places of the board and bring them to 3 hideouts on the board. There are several obstacles to fulfill this: Scotland Yard can confiscate the bags for example and a player must pay kind of bribe while carrying a postbag. Earning money can be done with buying farms and these farms can also protect a player while staying there.

The game ends, when all mailbags are taken off the train. The player, who could bring the most mailbags to the hideouts is the winner.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Go Teddy Go!
description:
From the Ravensburger Catalog:

The bears love to play hide and seek! Roll the colored die, move along the path, and hide your three bears first to win. A sliding panel reveals caves for the bears to disappear into as their laughter sounds from a hidden voice chip!

Involves color recognition, association, simple strategy.

Ages 4 and up.

name: Grouchy Ladybug Game
description:
From the Publisher:

The Grouchy Ladybug Game brings the Eric Carle book alive with a whale of a game board complete with a moving whale tail. Children move their ladybugs through the game, practicing manners, meeting animal friends and gathering a nice meal!

Each player starts with a grouchy, hungry ladybug and an empty leaf. Players move around the board finding food for their hungry ladybugs. In this game, it takes a polite "please" to move ahead and feed a ladybug. When players land on a ladybug space, they choose an animal card and explore the relative size of various animals.

Contents include a giant game board with moving whale tail, 4 ladybug game pieces, 12 animal cards, 50 aphid (bug) tokens, spinner & instructions. For 2 to 4 players. Ages 3 and up

name: Smul slakken
description: You play with your snail on a board filled with coloured marbles. You roll the dice, choose a starting point on the board and you pickup all marbles of the colour on the dice, as long as they are next to each other. If you meet a frog of an other colour then the dice, your turn is over. Same thing for your next turn, roll the dice, choose a starting point and collect as much marbles of the colour on the dice. First player to collect 10 marbles wins
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: MB Jeux, MB Spellen, MB Spiele, Milton Bradley

name: Kocham Cię, Polsko!
description: ("I love you, Poland!) a trivia game with questions about Polish history, culture, sport and movie celebrities, and songs. uses talisman-style roll-and-move mechanic. players need to answer correctly questions in each of 6 different categories on the way to the finish space in the center.

name: Pamieć `39
description:
Pamięć `39 (Memory ’39)

Get to know the history of Poland’s 1939 war of defense!

Everyone is familiar with memory games. With their simple rules and the excitement of rivalry, memory games appeal to both children and adults, and older players do not necessarily have an advantage over younger ones. Ever since they first appeared in the 1950s, games that involve looking for pairs of identical objects have enjoyed unflagging popularity and thousands of versions have been produced. While Memory ’39 continues this long tradition, it also introduces a certain element of novelty.
Designed by the Institute of National Remembrance, this game not only improves the players’ power of concentration but also helps them to memorize the events of 1939 that are so important for Polish national identity. Memory ’39 makes use of archival photographs illustrating Poland’s 1939 war of defense. A historical commentary on each photograph is provided in the enclosed brochure. Together with the commentary, the photographs tell a short history of the September campaign. To make the distant events more vivid, the black-and-white photographs have been tinted with great attention to historical detail.

The box contains:
– 48 game cards with archival photographs
– a brochure with historical commentaries on the photographs

(From back cover)

name: Barnyatzy
description: Yahtzee variant with five colour dice instead of number dice. Unlike most such variants for children (for instance Yahtzee Jr. which in Swedish has the same name as this game), in this one you do not keep a record of categories chosen in previous rounds. Instead each round involves rolling and aiming afresh for one of five categories: two pairs (2p), three of a kind (3p), full house (5p), four of a kind (7p) or five of a kind (10p). After ten rounds, points are added up to determine the winner.

name: World Wide Hockey
description:
Ice Hockey themed game for two players.

The play consists of players forming teams of three attackers, two defenders and a goalie from cards of values 1 to 12, rookie, golden helmet, captain and special referee cards, and then trying to break through the opposing players defenses by playing higher or equal cards than the defender. After three periods the player who scored the most goals wins.

Includes a game board, a scoreboard, 185 playing cards and a set of rules.

name: Find Monty!
description:
In the game box you will find a large green wooden bed, a red blanket, a small blue pillows, a game pad with carpet and the cheeky cat Monty. In the photo cards you can see where Monty is hiding - on the bed, under the bed, next to the pillow.

In turn kid takes the photo card and must reconstruct the scene like seen on the card to score a point.

Player with the most points scored if the deck is exhausted is the winner.

name: The Next Big Thing: The Game of Entrepreneurship
description:
A board game for people who are interested in being startup superheroes, changing the world, and becoming billionaires. Players take on the role of startup founders to create "the next big thing", bootstrapping using their initial cash savings and superpower skills (i.e. programming, design, sales, marketing, etc.) to create a minimal viable product, gain initial traction, and then go on to raise multiple rounds of capital from investors, increasing the value of their company, but while also having their founder's ownership get diluted.

During the game players will experience many of the ups and downs of the entrepreneurial journey including: increasing revenues while balancing against expenses to grow the company, various significant events (good and bad), and creating an impact that changes the world. There are also multiple paths such as an accelerator path, pivot paths, and in the end (if you haven't gone bankrupt) players decide to either take the acquisition path or IPO path. Along the way players also collect impact points, as it's not just about the money, from sustainability, ethics & diversity, social impact, and health & wellness. The winner is the player who exits ("cashes out") with the most money by creating the company with the largest valuation while still maintaining the most founder's ownership and generating the most positive impact on the world.

name: La zingara
description:
This board-game is inspired to the famous Italian tv-show, which aired in the '90s.

It's a simple quiz game about traditional Italian proverbs.

Italian slogan:
« Io so chi sei, e se tu vuoi, ti dico che destino avrai, buona sorte o guai.
Luna Nera sì o no lo vedremo fra un po' con le carte che la Zingara ti fa »
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Würdest du lieber ...?
description:
Would they rather run naked across the marketplace or spend a week in total darkness? Would you like to attend a carsting show that all your friends see or spend a night with a person you do not like?

This card game provides answers to franchises that you've never set yourself up to, opening up completely new insights into yourself and your fellow players. A player draws two cards and has to choose one, while the other player must try to guess which of the two cards the player has chosen. if he guesses correctly he gets a point and whoever could collect the most points wins.

name: Kill Your Friends
description:
Kill Your Friends - A Bloody Good Card Game is an adults only card game combines shedding, matching and knock-out style game play with a dark and twisted satire on modern life.

A quick and easy game to play again and again, Kill Your Friends is also an eye opening look into our narcissistic society with each card featuring a unique “death”. Whilst some of the “deaths” are a bit of fun and some are just plain silly, others provide a crude, shocking and provoking social commentary covering topics such as depression, police brutality, addiction, health trends and much more which will surely provide a point of conversation around the table.

What’s better is the actual game play. A mongrel cross between UNO, Survivor and Presidents and Arseholes, Kill Your Friends brings out and amplifies the natural competitiveness and aggressive nature of people playing card and board games.

Win by shedding all your cards or simply be the last one standing, Kill Your Friends is a quick and easy game to play again and again, and there is still a clear tactical element to win this “bloody good card game” that will be sure to build a fun rivalry amongst friends.

Created by award winning product designer Leigh Ryan (Dyson / Quad Lock) and illustrated by Adrian Dutt (Howling Owl / Spectres) and being shipped by Blackbox (the team behind Cards Against Humanity).

Kill Your Friends is available this October exclusively at www.killyourfriends.co

—description from the publisher

name: David and Khanjar: Yom Kippur War in 1973
description:
This is re-build edition of Lion of Sinai which waspublished by Kilovolt Design in 2016.

This is a war simulation game talked about Yom Kippur War in 1973 for 1 - 2 players.
Components
A1 size board x 1
Counters x 280
Hint card x 2
Dice x 2
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Zone of Control

name: Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom
description: Be the first player to move Indiana Jones, Short Round, and Willie Scot past the many dangers and hazards and finally across the rope bridge to safety.

name: Illusions
description:
198 optical illusions are at the heart of this game. Players move on a modular board comprised of 9 sections, 6 hexagons and 3 obtuse "L"s, to capture the prize pieces on each section. The cards, board sections and prize pieces are suppurated into three categories; Reflected Images, Mixed Images and, Impossible Figures.

The active player roles the die and moves; if he/she lands on an Illusion space, they draw an illusion card and pick whether they see "A" or "B"; the cards have illusions on them that can be seen in two ways, e.g. do you see A: the two faces looking at each other or B: the goblet. The player indicates which they saw, using a hidden disc marked A and B, then the player next to him/her announces which way they believe the active play saw the image, the active player then reveals the disc. Each card has instructions on the back, one for both A and B, that will help or hurt a player. If the announcing player was correct, they choose who must follow the instruction otherwise the active player chooses.

Prize pieces must be landed on exactly and, once a player wins a prize piece they may move the part of the board it was on. This can be used to break the board into separate sections, stranding opponents. The rules vary based on the number of players playing but, collecting a requisite number and type of prize pieces wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Finanssinero
description: Finanssinero is a stock market game involving the biggest Finnish companies. It is possible to buy and sell shares and use prognoses to predict future market development.

name: Hex-A-Gon
description:
Players in Hex-A-Gon want to seize as many knights as possible, and whoever seizes the most knights wins.

To set up the game, lay out the hexagonal game board, which is covered with a hex-shaped pattern of hexagons with five hexes per side, then place one knight on each space of the game board other than the center hex. (P.S. Hex!)

On a turn, a player chooses one knight on the game board, then jumps one or more knights with it in succession. When a knight jumps, it lands on one of the three hexes (if empty) on the opposite side of the knight jumped, then the player captures the jumped knight, leaving an empty space that can be landed in during future jumps – even during that same turn. A player must make at least one jump, if possible, on her turn, but she is not compelled to make more than one. The game ends once no more jumps are possible.

Hex-A-Gon includes rules for solitaire play, as well as variants that randomly hide "treasures" – colored wooden bits – inside some of the knights prior to the start of the game. Depending on the variant rules used, these treasures provide a player with positive or negative points, allow a player to freeze knights and prevent them from being captured, or blasts knights away from the treasure.

name: Insey Winsey Spider
description: A very simple game for children Ages 3 - 6. Each player has a board representing a waterspout and a (large) plastic spider to use as a pawn. A spinner is used to advance. Spin up a storm and your spider gets washed back down to the start.

name: Pursuit of Happiness
description: A card game using standard cards that gives players a unique way of making melds. In addition, the melds in each suit have different abilities. Diamond melds let you acquire more cards; Spade melds let you attack your opponent's melds; Club melds let you defend against attacks; and Heart melds give you happiness, which is the goal of the game. A good mix of luck and skill that has a different feel than most card games. Plays best with 3 or 4 players.

name: Common Ground
description:
Common Ground is a board game in which players or teams compete to come up with words from different categories that contain matching sequences of letters. The longer the sequence, the more you score. Here's a quick example:

Category 1 = "Transportation" - Item 1 = "CAR"
Category 2 = "Vegetables" - Now try to think of a vegetable that contains "CAR"? If you said, "CARROT" you would score 3 points because C+A+R are 3 matching letters in sequence, common to both CAR and CARrot. If the Transportation Category item was AIRPLANE and you responded with the Vegetable - EGGPLANT, that would score 4 points because P+L+A+N are letters in sequence and in common to both airPLANe and eggPLANt.

In the game, one player turns over a category card and names 3 items from that category. After each player has written these items in the left column of their answer sheet, a second category card is revealed. All players then have one-and-a-half minutes to find Common Ground. The player with the highest score advances. During the game, players use strategic option cards to challenge their opponents and advance along the board toward victory, but get ready for instant verbal challenges that occur whenever landing on an opponent's space.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Champions
description:
Champions is a fantasy fighting CCG. To quote the rules: "There are two sets of Champions Battle Cards 'Monster Wars' and 'Medieval Battle'. In each series there are two sets of cards, Monsters or Warriors (Characters) and Spells or Weapons (Specials). Spells are used by Monsters to increase their fighting strength; likewise Warriors use Weapons."

The Character Cards are printed with attack and defense values, and the Specials have either an attack or a defense value. All have some artwork and (tongue-in-cheek) text. The Character Cards also have scratch-off areas.

During the game each player has a hand of 5 cards and a deck of 15. The first player attacks with 1, 2 or 3 Character cards and some number of Special cards, and the other tries to defend against each attacking Character by laying down a Character and Specials having the same or higher value.

The unique feature is that, according to the rules, each losing Character has a scratch-off area removed, which shows a new and "almost always" weaker attack or defense value. The final scratch-off is always zero, at which time the card "needs replacing". So not only are the cards collectible, they are also destructible!
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting

name: The Big Bang Theory: Fact or Fiction Card Game
description:
This game is a small card game with 180 trivia cards in a little tin. It is small enough to fit in a small bag.

Roll the die to get a Fact or Fiction card. Answer a card correctly and you win that card. Be the first person to collect 5 cards and you win the game.

name: Little Dory Goes Home
description:
Themed on Pixar's "Finding Dory" movie, help little Dory find her way back home by matching shells which become a path back to her parents!

Each player chooses a colored path. The shells are placed face-down on the board.

On their turn, a player chooses one face-down orange and one purple shell. If the pictures on the shell match, they are placed on the player's path. The winner is the first person to build a path to the home space.

Includes:
1 Game Board
48 Plastic orange and purple game shells
2 sticker sheets (stickers must be applied to each plastic shell)

name: Jagun Fighters
description:
This collectible miniatures game from Bandai is basically a cross between Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Card Game and Pass the Pigs.

The minis are rolled like dice, and have different results based on if they land on their feet, lying on their side, upside-down, etc. The "eye" is a symbol with a clear plastic dome over it, and each mini has a different symbol on its front and back, which gives them additional powers if they land with that side face-up. The minis are split into fighters and wizards; the fighters attack each other, and once all your fighters are dead you lose, and the wizards act as support troops (similar in function and diversity to traps in Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Card Game).

name: When was the last time...?
description: When was the last time you drank juice with a straw? Or when was the last time you saw a windmill? When was the last time... is a game where you answer these kind of questions while other players try to guess the answer. The better a player guesses, the more steps he scores – the first player to reach Finish wins!

name: Fire At Will!
description:
