Fire at Will! is a real-time card game. Two players take on the role of airship captains in a fictional civil war era steampunk universe. Players play cards from 6 randomized command decks and play them into action piles in order to score successful shots against their opponent. While speed is important, accuracy is vital - one wrong play could cause your cannon to blow up during the Scoring Phase!

Fire at Will! features both beginner & advanced modes - allowing new players to learn the patterns of the game gradually. Intermediate mode introduces Battleflag cards, which can be played to mess with your opponent and provide additional scoring opportunities.

The Master Gunner cards add an additional layer to the game once you're ready. This set of 4 cards for each faction provide fun ways to mess with your opponent.

name: Earth 667C
description:
Set in the near future, Earth 667C gives 2 to 6 players the opportunity to save humanity from our sun going supernova. In twenty solar cycles, the sun will explode and destroy everything in our solar system. Use the remaining resources of our planet to construct your ship in orbit. Build it fast. Build it strong. Build it to save as many humans as you can and launch your spaceship to the nearest exoplanet before the supernova.

Constructing your ship is only half the game. For those that survive the solar event and launch their ships, they must face new challenges on the way to our new exoplanet home, Earth 667C. The Journey to the new planet has boosts and perils along the way, including black holes, quasars, enemy vessels, and asteroid fields. Your ship building skills and the luck of the dice combine to determine your crew and survivors' fates. Will you be the first to Earth 667C?

Earth 667C is a card and turn-based tabletop game for 2-6 players or teams. Perfect for ages 10 and up, the game is fun, encourages strategic thinking, and includes just enough chance and player relationship dynamics to create three game phases with unique challenges.

Phase 1: Ship Building
Purchase Ship Components from Space Dock, and construct the fastest ship carrying the most people. Customize your ship by doubling your navigation for better travel. Double your engineering department for increased speed. Or, add more food and life support to increase your capacity to carry survivors. Pick your strategy for your ship and start building. Optional Ship Components are available for purchase. Components like weapon systems, shuttle bays, and radiation shield provide bonuses or protection during The Journey.

Phase 2: Launch Your Ship
When the Solar Cycle hits 8, you can launch your fully constructed spaceship. Roll the dice and aim for 12 or higher to push your ship into position for The Journey. Get 12 or lower? Then you must wait, and hope that the solar clock does not tick down any further. You must launch your ship before the clock hits zero, and the sun goes supernova.

Phase 3: The Journey
When the clock hits zero and sun engulfs the Earth, the real Journey begins. Play a single turn journey, or an eight turn journey. Roll the dice and discover what boosts and perils await you while traveling to humanity's new exoplanet home. Encounter new enemies that attack and slow your ship, or pass a strong hydrogen cloud that boosts your engines. Utilize your optional Ship Components to ward off enemies or discover wormholes to increase your speed. This phase will put your ship building skills to the test. The events during The Journey can slow the fastest ship, and propel others to victory.

Be the first ship with the most survivors to reach Earth 667C and ensure the survival of the human race on our new exoplanet home!
categories: Card Game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Treasure of the Lost Temple
description: Treasure of the Lost Temple is an adventure game for one or two players. Each player takes the part of a treasure-seeking archaeologist, who must traverse the Lost Temple, reach the Eye Room to obtain the Jeweled Eye, and retrace his path to escape from the Temple in a given time limit, before the Temple Doors will be sealed shut, trapping him forever."

name: Miliard w rozumie
description: Game based on Polish TV show. Players roll a die and move their pawns on the board. Different locations on the board indicates different categories of questions. We have science, nature, art, humanities and others. In some situations players must take part in a knowledge duel. After correct answer player gain money and moves his/her pawn forward. If he/she doesn't know the answer, moves backwards or pay the fine.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing, Trivia
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Snoopy's Doghouse Game
description: Everyone is helping Snoopy build a new doghouse. All the parts are there but you must spin the spinner to get the parts you need.

name: Letter Factory Game
description:
The LeapFrog Letter Factory Game teaches children to recognize colors, letter names, and phonics in a boardgame setting. An electronic device instructs the players to put a particular letter card into the device by name, color, or sound. If successful, the player advances his marker around a scoring track from the "Start" space to the "Winner" space, which teaches children to count.

From the game box:

The race is on! Play and learn letter names and sounds with actions, music and wacky Professor Quigley to guide you every step of the way! Games automatically adjust to skill level, to keep children learning at just the right pace.

2 Games in 1

1. Counting Colors and Letters

Learn letter names and sounds by matching color cards to move around the board!

2. Leaping Letters

Listen to the letter name or sound, and then find the card that matches it!

name: Monopoly: Boy Scouts of America
description:
(from bsa-gyc.org):

The world's best-loved board game now celebrates 95 years of strong Scouting values, leadership, and fun! Monopoly®: Boy Scouts of America is played just like the original game, but now features a custom board, cards, money, and pewter playing tokens, including a campaign hat, pocketknife, Scoutmaster cup, Boy Scout sign, flashlight, and Yucca backpack. This officially licensed Monopoly game is great fun for the pack, troop, team, family, and friends. A perfect gift for anyone in Scouting.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Das Sams
description: Kosmos´ next attempt to capture the crown of "Kinderspiel des Jahres" and from the same author as "Das Kleine Gespenst".

name: Tank Commander
description:
Command and plan your Tank Battles.

In this war situation, you are the commander of a forward tank unit and the objective is to gain control of this map sector by destroying the enemy supply base, and thus force a total retreat, or by knocking out enough enemy tanks so that they concede defeat.

Both players have 10 tanks, 2 transporters and 3 bridges at their disposal to beat the enemy.

A transporter can move bridges or tanks that were shot.

The board shows rivers, mountains and flat terrain, that result in movement and shooting ristrictions.

name: The Movie Misquote Game
description:
Film magazine Little White Lies invites you to relive 300 movie moments – from the iconic to the downright filthy – in this hilarious new party game for film lovers.

Simply pick a quote and ask your friends to transform it by filling in the blank with a phrase from another classic film. The funniest movie mash-up wins!

Each player must use one of the ten cream cards in their hands to complete the film quote started with the orange card in the centre. An example of an orange card is "As far back as I can remember I always wanted to be a __." This could be answered with cards such as "Fat ballerina" or "Your boyfriend's dick." The winner of each round is the person with the funniest answer, as decided by the group.

—description from the publisher
categories: Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: How to Train Your Dragon: The Hidden World – Battle Royale Game
description:
A king of the hill game, won by occupying the top of the board (comprising 4 levels) for three turns. Featuring direct confrontation between the dragons from the show (each with slightly different abilities), resolved by rock paper scissors card plays followed by dice rolls, as well as further direct interaction through take that "loot" cards.

—user summary
categories: Fantasy, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Jigsol
description:
From the designer:

The firsts are born in bursts, and the best of the rest are obsessed." This is how I defined that illusive state, the 'open' or 'perfect' game, in 1976. Since perfection is all but impossible to achieve, I decided to design all-inclusive or 'peri-' games, Jigsol' is the first of the series.

Designed to play with more versatility and challenge than any other word game, Jigsol' is ideal for any player who can spell 24 words or more. For those who are curious, a Jigsol is a 'jigsaw solution'. Jigsol is a legal word when playing this game.
-E.M.W.

Each player starts with 25 letters printed on hexagons, the timer is started and each player tries to form an interlocking word puzzle. When the time is up each player calculates his points. When all 25 letters are used a player receives a delta mark on the score sheet (small triangle) and 25 points. The game ends when someone gets 5 or more deltas, or at 200, 500 or more points.

name: Monday Night Football: Interactive TV Card Game
description:
From the box cover: "Feel the Intensity, Play by Play."

This card game is intended to be played while watching a televised football contest. Each player is dealt a hand of seven cards, each with a football "event" on them. For example: Hand Off, Field Goal Made, Pass Reception. When a player has a card that matches the event that just occurred on the televised game, they must be the first to play it, thereby scoring the points on the card for that event (the rarer the event the more points). When a player plays all seven of their cards, he gets a seven point bonus, everyone tallies their scores and a new hand is dealt. Play continues until the end of the game and the player with the most points from completed rounds is the winner.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Sports

name: Junior Othello
description:
Published by Peter Pan Playthings under license from Anjar Co. USA, Junior Othello is Othello played on a 6x6 board (rather than an 8x8 board).

This shorter version of Othello has been solved - it is a win for the second player.

name: I Dream Of Jeannie
description: Simple roll and move game based on the TV series of the same name which was on from 1962 to 1967. The show starred Barbara Eden as Jeannie, Larry Hagman, later of Dallas fame, as Astronaut Tony Nelson ("Master") and Bill Dailey as Roger Healy, Nelson's astronaut friend.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Scatz
description:
SCATZ is a dynamic boardgame combining Blackjack and dice into a unique game. SCATZ, a fast-paced game in which tossing the dice determines your fate.
(From the box)
publishers: Go Anywhere Games, Ikron, R. D. Retort Enterprises

name: Connis erste Spiele
description: Connis erste Spiele is a collection of four introductory board games for youngsters: a memory game, a cooperative tile game, and two classic game designs.

name: Name 5 Card Game
description:
Can you name 5 things that could make a person sneeze? How about 5 TV dads? ...5 video games? ...Fruits or vegetables beginning with an "a"?

Name 5 is the outrageous party game that asks the easy questions you know the answers to. Sure, you know 1 movie starring America's sweetheart or a certain Hollywood heartthrob... maybe even 2... but can you Name 5???

—description from the publisher

name: Poop tracks
description:
Follow the tracks, don’t step in the scat, and spot that animal! Spin the spinner to draw cards, and complete the scene featuring each animal in their habitat, along with the correct tracks and poop! The first player to complete three scenes wins! Play this game a few times, and Jr. Ranger’s will become expert animal trackers. Don’t be afraid of the stinky.

—description from the publisher

name: EAUCHEMIN
description:
Sail the waters and become the master of trade.

In this region where the River Fune flows quietly, all logistics depend on the transportation by ships. Along the riverbanks, various industries such as iron, stone, and fabric thrive.

As the leader of a trading company in this city, your goal is to become the behind-the-scenes ruler at the center of logistics. You will transport materials brought from upstream to the downstream city, utilize accumulated wealth to strengthen your company's ships, and expand by hiring new employees.

However, the competition on the river is fierce, and other companies are gaining momentum. You must skillfully transport materials, establish dominance in the city, and continue to overwhelm other companies.

A tale of wealth and glory unfolds through Worker Placement × Majority Battle. Steer your ship and pave the way for the future of the city.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Pick-up and Deliver, Worker Placement

name: Star Wars: Star Destroyer Strike
description:
From the publisher:
Choose carefully or the enemy will strike! Strategy and suspense collide in this exciting escape game! Advance your Resistance heroes toward safety, but move fast-the Star Destroyer Finalizer is on your tail. The spinning starship of the dreaded First Order can aim in any direction, and you may be in the line of fire! Bounce the beam off the mirrored deflector shield toward your enemies, and evade the surprise laser blasts! It's fast-moving, family fun in a galaxy far, far away!


Choose to play as Resistance or First Order
Use the Deflector to block or redirect the laser
For 2 to 4 players
From the new film, Star Wars: The Force Awakens

name: Beneluxreise
description: Like Deutschlandreise, Beneluxreise is a predecessor to "Explore Europe". Players try to optimize their route to visit six randomly dealt places in The Netherlands, Belgium and Luxembourg.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Cube
description: Challenge your family to games based on the hit ITV gameshow The Cube . The show's nail-biting format has been cleverly downsized for this fun family game that retains all the best elements of the series. There are seven rounds of physical and electronic challenges to complete and players have just nine lives to use up before being booted out of the game. There are options to do a Trial Run or Simplify the challenges, just like in the show, and with 50 different games included, The Cube Game is sure to keep the whole family entertained. Designed for two to six players aged eight and up, the The Cube Game is great for fans of the TV show but just as fun for those who are new to the format. Features: Family game based on the ITV gameshow Complete seven rounds of games to win 50 different games to complete Use your nine lives, Trial Run and Simplify tokens For 2 to 6 players, aged 8 and up
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Booze Cruise
description: Booze Cruise is a trivia game from Britain that is all about beer, wine, and various liquors. The game plays sort of like Trivial Pursuit with a few twists. The game board is a map of the world with travel routes between cities. Each player is assigned 5 breweries that must be visited. Players travel between cities that are home to these famous breweries or distilleries answering trivia questions. A die roll determines what category of trivia question the player must answer. A lucky die roll results in Chance cards and Airline cards, which can be cashed in to move directly to distant cities.

name: Verdict
description:
One of the original set of Avalon Hill "Adult Games" which include Gettysburg, Tactics II, U-Boat & Dispatcher.

Verdict is an authentic all-skill game in which two or more players conduct a criminal court trial based upon the rules of evidence. One player takes the part of the prosecutor and the other player the part of the defense counsel. There are 15 separate criminal cases in the Verdict Case Book, each of which is a complete game in itself.

Roberts' co-designers, Nissen & Thiem, were two attornies.

Original Game Contents:

game board
16-page case book
2 Verdict Instruction Sheets
2 Rules of Evidence Sheets
1 Verdict Solution Wheel
7 plastic pawns (1 red, 6 blue)
2 parts trays.


Summary of Play
1. Prosecutor selects case.
2. Prosecutor offers physical facts. Prosecutor solution wheel is consulted if defense objects.
3. Prosecutor examines witness.
4. If Prosecutor pawn lands on cross examination space Defense has option to cross examine.
5. Prosecutor may continue examination.
6. Defense Counsel examines one of his witnesses. If Prosecutor objects, Defense Counsel's Solution Wheel is consulted.
7. If Defense pawn lands on cross examintion space Prosecutor has option to cross examine.
8. Defense may continue examination.
9. Prosecutor and Defense alternate examining witnesses.
10. As soon as one lawyer has 3 pawns in the jury box a surprise witness card is revealed.
11. First lawyer to get 4 pawns in the jury box wins. If neither does a retrial is necessary.

name: Parallelslalom
description:
2 players try to get "downhill" first. There are lot of games which use this principle of dexterity.
4 balls and a moving board are the content of the game.

name: Abi 94
description:
Abi 94 is a card game. It makes your dream possible. You can play for good marks in school. You have always been a loser in school? Change it, even if it only works in this game.

The game was re-issued each year from 1993 to 1998, with a year update appended to each edition. The name comes from Abitur. Entrance to universities in the Federal Republic of Germany is dependent upon the German secondary school leaving certificate, called the Abitur. Students can obtain the Abitur upon successful completion of thirteen years of primary and secondary school and passing grades on the Abitur examination.

name: Christmas-opoly
description:
From the Late for the Sky website:

It’s beginning to look a lot like Christmas!

Get your lights up, your presents wrapped, gather family and friends, and pop the lid off Christmas-opoly! Watch out Players! You may be run over by a reindeer! Be nice...or you may end up with a lump of coal!

To play, collect Christmas properties, increase your property value by buying presents and trading them in for a Christmas tree. It’s all fun and games until someone blows a fuse, gets snowed in, or gets sent to 'Naughty' and is out of the game for three turns!

Whatever happens YOU BETTER NOT POUT! Christmas-opoly is a game to celebrate the season!

MERRY CHRISTMAS TO ALL!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Dračí hrad
description:
In Sárkányvár (Dragon's Castle) the players can take role of one of the 6 characters: archer, barbarian, dwarf, etc.
The game is separated into two parts: in the first, you will have to collect your equipment (weapons, magical items, food, etc.), and in the second you can explore the castle of the dragon, find treasures, fight monsters or the dragon itself. The game ends when one of the players finds the lost scepter (or optionally you can play until you defeat the dragon), and the winner is the one who has the most gold pieces.

Can be played as a cooperative game too.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Maze, Mythology
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Het Grote Belgiëspel
description: Travel the ten provinces of Belgium answering trivia questions about the history, geography and organisational structures of the country. Players gain fries (Belgian, of course) by answering questions correctly. The first player to reach the Royal palace in Brussels with 20 or more fries, wins the game.

name: Socks in the City
description:
From the publisher:
You place the hexagons on the table and the 12 socks (two of each color) on 12 of the hexagons. A very few hexagons are already connected for both players.

With the sticks the player try to connect the hexagons with the socks of the same color. These score in dependent of distance.

name: Don't Tip the Cows
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Cow Tipping is America's second favorite sport (only to fishing) and this fun stacking game has it all. 18 adorable, stackable cows, just waiting to be stacked and tipped. The goal is not to be the one to make the stack fall.

name: Monopoly: 1999 NFL Gridiron
description:
This version of Monopoly plays just like the normal version of Monopoly (with the exception of using a coin toss to determine who goes first). All of the properties, prices and cards are the same, just named after teams, or football-themed. Chance and Community Chest are AFC and NFC. The railroads are replaced by two teams each and the rest of the properties are one team each. The utilities become TV and Radio.

The two Super Bowl teams from 1999 (Broncos as Boardwalk and Falcons as Park Place) are set as the most expensive, with the rest of the teams just filling out the rest of the properties around the board (including railroads) in the order of their record for the 1998 season.

There are bleachers and stadiums for houses and hotels, and the playing pieces are all football themed, with football shaped dice rounding out the game.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Dino Kontra Dino
description:
The aim of Dino Kontra Dino is to complete as many event cards as possible.
The game is played over a number of rounds. At the beginning of each round, a new event is drawn. During a turn, players play one of the three cards from their hand (and then draws a new one) face down. Then, all players reveal their card simultaneously. Event cards are then resolved depending on the icon featured on the dinosaur cards. The game goes on until a player plays the last card from their hand. The player who completes the most events wins.

name: Intuition
description:
Unusual party game from the mid-trivia binge. Players are to collect five experience tokens and one skill chip from each of the seven intuitive areas. The game includes hundreds of props for the different intuitive skills, which are as follows:

Pattern Perception: name a word which is printed in a very blurred fashion.

Psycho-Osmosis: Determine the meaning of a selected Hieroglyph.

Analysis: Select the two points of a large maze which are connected.

Imagination: Draw an abstract image card and name four things it could be (may require a vote from fellow players).

Connection: Draw two abstract image cards and state how they could be connected.

Recall: Look at an image and recall five or more of the eight items depicted.

Recognition: Look at an image card, then turn it over and point out the three images which weren't on the face.

The trick here is that all these actions have a 12-second time limit. No analysis paralysis. Players pretty much have to shoot from the hip or, that is to say, use their intuition.

A second edition was published and the meta-game of this edition was to intuitively figure out the exact date and time of that release. First 100 correct guessers were to receive a limited 2nd edition.
categories: Deduction, Educational, Memory, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Memory, Pattern Building, Roll / Spin and Move, Voting

name: Inventions
description:
Described as "The funny Patents Game"... the game that keeps you guessing.

The game consists of a 224 page book which has patent drawings of close to 100 crazy and unusual items. Your job is to identify the device, figure out what it does, and decide how it is supposed to work. Points are awarded for identifying the item. Bonus points are awarded if the year the patent was granted can be guessed (within 7 years).

The first player to 21 points is the winner.

name: Wall Street
description:
Wall Street by Ass is a stock market game with an interesting pricing mechanism: Players are dealt "quote cards", which can be used to modify any stock's quote provided it is within the range of the old quote (usually within +- 20%).
Advanced rules allow free trade between each other.

name: Conquistadores
description:
On an hypothetical American territory, the European colonizing nations of the XVII century send their expeditions searching for buried treasures. At the same time they try to hinder and eliminate the opponents, thanks to the feeling of hate separating the Indios and the white devils.

There are two ways to win the game: find half of the hidden treasures with your Conquistadors, or use the Indians to eliminate the Conquistadors of your opponents.

name: Funky Monkeys
description: A children's game (Ages 4 - 10) in which players swing through the vines (on the gameboard) collecting banana cards. The player with the most bananas at the end wins. Different spaces have various effects on the players, including the banana peel spaces which drop your monkey all the way down to the bottom of the tree.

name: The All American Trivia Board Game
description:
From the box:

Do you enjoy trivia games, but are tired of being asked questions about the Queen of England? Perhaps you just want to learn more about your own country! Well, this game is for you! The All American Trivia Board Game features over 2,000 all-American questions falling into four different categories: Geography, History, Arts, and General. Designed for two or more players, Ages 16 and up. This game is both fun and educational.

name: Don't Drop Mama!
description:
A balancing game where the object is to see who can raise Mama Tortellini up the highest by placing the Tortellini Brothers underneath her, one by one , as she stands on tip-toe atop her balancing platform.
Contains: Acrobatic base, mama piece and platform, 12 tortelini brother pieces (3 each in 4 colors), die and labels.
publishers: Estrela, Parker Brothers, Pressman Toy Corp.

name: Wide World of Sports Golf Game
description:
Game consists of 9 2-sided thick cardboard depictions of the golf holes (18 different holes, in all), 42 distance cards (no duplicates), and a 'putting green'.

For each hole, the objective is to use your dealt card choices to secretly bid for your shot length. Longest shot is #1, shortest is #4, etc. Pre-designated spots for each shot are on the hole cards, with "par minus 2" sets of spots per hole. Bid to avoid the trouble locations - behind trees, or in the sand or water or out-of-bounds - or being too far from the pin. Pre-planning is important on the longer holes, as some types of trouble are worse than others (penalty strokes), and because there will be multiple secret bids on the par 4's and 5's.

When you do get in trouble, roll the die and consult the hazard chart. Keep track of all shots/rolls/penalties - maximum is 3-over par per hole.

After everyone has gotten to the green, then they get to use the plastic putting green. By placing a marble somewhere behind the line designating their 'distance' to putt, they try to get the marble to roll into the hole!

name: Pilgrimage
description:
From the rulebook:

This is PILGRIMAGE, a game in which players move across Europe to the Middle East, from London to Jerusalem. Players follow routes used by early crusaders and pilgrims and many have adventures along the way. Players learn geography; they also learn about daily life in the middle ages. The game is competitive; you may choose to play PILGRIMAGE One Way, in which case the first player or team to arrive in Jerusalem wins. Or you may choose to play PILGRIMAGE Round Trip, in which the game is won by the first player or team to reach Jerusalem and return to London.

PILGRIMAGE is a game of chance, played with dice, pawns and Bane and Blessing cards which are drawn as the game proceeds. The events described on these cards have been collected through careful historical research.

PILGRIMAGE One Way takes an hour or more to play, depending on the number of players. The game is designed for 2 to 6 people, ages eight to adult.

name: Ghost Writer Mystery Game
description:
Ghostwriter and the team need your help to solve 60 all-new mysteries. From the Empire State Building to Jamal's home, from stolen backpacks to missing jewels, you'll share clues with the other players as you race to be first to solve three mysteries.

Every player receives a Casebook. This book can be used to solve the mysteries. The youngest player starts the game with Case #1. He serves as the reader. Throughout the game the players are looking for different clues. The game is played in three steps.
- look at a drawing at possible solutions
- unscramble letters to form a word
- listen to clues to find words that form a final clue

The first player which has solved three mysteries wins the game.
categories: Children's Game, Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Rail
description:
This game has interesting ideas, especially in the manner you accrue track. The locomotive shaped board has many segments. In your turn you must move to an adjacent segment and you can then take the track allowed by the new segment that you are in. Furthermore, next turn, you cannot move back into the segment you were in at the start of your last turn (In other words, you cannot go to and from between the same two segments). However, it is possible to impede an opponent because no two players may be in the same segment. As up to six can play, this board can get pretty crowded. In each segment (except for two special symbols) there are images that relate to the piece of track you receive. This track is laid on the tabletop area, there is no board on which they are to be placed. Therefore, your direction and length of track is only limited by the size of your table!

Track received must be added to one of your lines immediately. The objective is to build three independent lines that end up with a black tile (a station). When one player has achieved this, the game ends and you score a point for every track tile on your network. The most points, wins (note that this might not be the player that ended the game).

name: Playmobil: Alarm! Alarm!
description: Goal is to get rid of your own cards as fast as possible. First the table cards are laid out - leaving space in between for other cards. The other cards are dealt out. The active player can play up to three cards placing them along one of the table cards with a suitable motive. If a player can't place any cards he has to pass. Table cards with four played cards are removed from the game and the surrounding cards are dealt to the one who last placed a card. Winner is the player with the least cards who didn't have to pass.

name: Color Clowns
description:
A game of Creating and Matching Colours.

2-4 Players ages 4-7 (front of box) or 5-8 (back of box!)

Game Contents:
o 4 playing boards
o 36 translucent tiles in 3 geometric shapes and 3 colors
o 2 special playing dice, one showing shapes and the other colors

Object of the Game:
To be the first to change the colors of the clowns to green, orange and purple.

How to Play:
o Each player, in turn, rolls the dice
o Player must then place a tile matching the shape on the die on a similar shape of a clown on the board so that the color now created on the board matches both the color rolled on the other die and the frame surrounding the clown.

Example: 1st die Triangle - 2nd Die Green

Player may either place a yellow triangular tile on a blue triangle on the board, or a blue triangular tile on a yellow triangle. Each will create the colour green.

name: The Manager
description:
A game of soccer team management. Be a manager, buy players, get the results, build your team and increase the profits.

A game for 2 – 6 players Ages 10 and up.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Set Collection, Simulation

name: Duran Duran: Into The Arena
description:
Players move around the outer circle of the board trying to collect five matching pairs of disc tiles (upon which are the group's singles). For each pair the player also takes the matching video tile which is worth additional points. Once a player has five matches they can move to the inner circle where they try to collect and play a band member tile for each of the five band members. Once this is accomplished, the game is over. The person with the most points wins.

Game insert includes a brief history of the band.
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: The Adventures of Rin-Tin-Tin
description:
THE ADVENTURES OF RIN-TIN-TIN, based on the popular TV, radio and movie shows with the same characters. This thrilling game of the Old West is played by 2 to 4 players who ride with Rinty, Rusty, Lieutenant Rip Masters, Sergeant Biff O'Hara and Corporal Boone and the U.S. Cavalry across an action-packed board in a wild chase to capture outlaws. The outlaws and their stolen gold are hiding in the 4 Territories of the West, shown by the Red, Yellow, Blue and Green sections on the board. The object: For each player to capture as many Outlaw Circles as possible and collect the biggest amount of "Boodle" i.e. money or loot.

Game comes with; 40 US Cavalrymen in 4 different colors, 8 Rin Tin Tin figures, 1 Spinner, 8 Boodle Cards marked 0 million, 2 million, 5 million and 10 million dollars.

name: Collectable Monsters!
description: Despite the game's title, probably not a Collectible Card Game. Cards are labeled with numbers from 1 to 5. For each number N, there are N different monsters with that number on them. Players take turns playing cards to their personal tableau of monsters; at the end of the game, players score points for each monster they have played, but the value of a monster is diminished if you have played other monsters with the same number but different species.

name: Frosty The Snowman
description:
The object of this game is to bring Frosty back to life by being the first player to reach his Magic Hat. Before you can do this, you'll have to complete the rest of his costume by collecting 6 Costume Cards: mittens, boots, scarf, broomstick, corncob pipe and eyes of coal.

Using a spinner for movement, you first travel along the outer track. If you land on a space with a Costume Card that you don't have, you keep it. When you have all 6 Costume Cards, you may move to the inner track. The first player on the inner track to land on the Frosty Space finds Frosty's Hat and wins the game.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Skript
description: As opposed to building words out of letters a la Scrabble, each player finds a word in the dictionary, which the others must try to figure out during the course of the game. Various cards can be used to obtain hints, including getting the first three letters of the word, getting all the letters in the word except the first three, getting the definition, consulting the dictionary and getting more cards.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Dice, Word Game

name: Inspektør Spot
description:
Memory game with a twist.

One player plays the thief, while the rest are detectives. The thief draws 3 out of 8 clothes cards, while the remaining 5 are put back in the box. 56 pictures of the possible thief are put out face up on the table. Each picture is identified by three different pieces of clothes. The detectives takes turns to pick a picture and the thief has to admit how many correct clothes are on the picture. First detective to pick the correct picture scores one point.

The game consists of several rounds until each player has played thief. The played with the most points at that time wins, and can call himself Inspector Spot. In case of a draw the number of cards used will be used as a tiebreaker.

name: Pit-Witz
description:
Pit-Witz is an abstract strategy game system made in Singapore. The rules that come with the set describe 9 games that may be played with the set.

In the basic game of Pit-Witz, each player has 8 pieces and tries to get them from his corner to the opposite corner. The board is like a cross-word grid and pieces move like chess rooks. In making a move, the pieces have to move all the way down a corridor, until they encounter a dark square or another piece. Other games add the use of dice and money (called witzers).

The names of the other games are:
Jet-Witz
Banditz
Dice-Witz
Plus-Witz
Haggle-Witz
Stomp-Witz (also known as Beetles)
Claim-Witz
Morlocks

name: Sex & Booze & Rock & Roll
description: "A Fun Packed Evening of Entertainment!" As you move around the board you will answer trivia questions on the subjects of SEX, BOOZE and ROCK 'N' ROLL. This game is a treat for trivia fans, but there is an extra dimension where players, on certain squares, have to do more than answer questions....You may have to name 10 words relating to sex, beginning with the first letter of your surname, drink a full glass of whatever the person to your right is drinking, or maybe hum the intro to "Smoke on the water"
categories: Mature / Adult, Music, Party Game, Trivia

name: Die Wilden Fussballkerle: Tooor! Das wilde Fussballspiel
description: A fast soccer game in that the players play the Ball through solving of multiplication tasks. The various Numbers on the Gameboard are interchangeable, so every Match is a different challenge.
categories: Educational, Math, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Sports
mechanics: Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Matrix
description:
A simple abstract game played on a 5x5 board (minus the corners.) The board has a 3x3 area in the middle with the numbers 1 through 9, plus 3 blank spaces adjoining each side of the board. The object of the game is to reach all 9 numbers by creating 'matrixes'. Each player has 2 pieces which are placed one at a time on the bank spaces on the outside edge of the board. Each player also has a list with the numbers 1 through 9 written on it. On a player's turn, he moves his pieces 3 to 5 spaces along the outside of the board, trying to form an intersection with a number. Each time the player forms an intersection with a number, he marks it off his list. The first player to mark all 9 numbers of his list wins.

http://www.printgames.net/english/matrix/detail_e.htm
mechanics: Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement

name: The Annoying Thing Game
description: Roll the Die...It's a 5. How quickly can you name 5 sticky things? Well, try it with the annoying thing bellowing in your ear! You just can't hear yourself think. Before you know it, you're out of time! Keep each completed card...The player with the most cards wins!

name: Cram!
description:
From the Publisher:
'The phenomenal new board game where college life collides with pop culture. Cram! is the intensely competitive laughing, guessing, acting, drawing, singing, shouting game for your whole body. On the riotously fictional Cram State University campus, players form "Study groups" to move around the campus and engage in various high energy, pop culture related courses including Cramspeak, GroupTroups, TimeTrivial, Illustronomy, Lyriculous, and Slangshot. Watch out! Your extra-curricular goofing off might affect your grades! Ages 13 and up, absolutely no real education required!'

Players are formed into two teams (study groups). Each group circles the board (the campus) twice, stopping to be graded on challenges (classrooms). From the winning study group, the two players with the highest score (grade) go on to compete for Doctor of Culturology.

From the box:
'Cramspeak - use sounds, gestures, words, phrases and charades to get your StudyGroup to shout out the right answers.

GroupTroupes - Shout out answers based upon a performance by your entire StudyGroup.

Illustronomy - Your StudyGroup must guess the answers based upon your multiple drawings.

TimeTrivial - Your entire StudyGroup must guess the correct answer to a multiple choice trivia question.

Lyriculous - You sing the tune to a popular song and your StudyGroup has to name it.

SlangShot - Your StudyGroup must provide as many slang words for a common word or phrase as possible.'

This game was the winner of the "All Star Radio Networks" 2002 Party Game of the Year.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Party Game, Trivia, Word Game
publishers: Front Porch Classics, Mojo Board Games, University Games

name: XIG 4E: Fire Pathway
description:
XIG is a tile-laying game where players try to be the first to complete their own pathway - based on one of four elements: Earth, Water, Fire, and Air - as quickly as possible by laying down puzzle-piece style tiles. There are also cards that can help you advance or hinder your opponent. The pathways are sold in complete sets, and booster packs of cards are currently planned.

The base game includes the Water and Earth pathways. This is one of the first two expansions for the game (the other being the Air pathway). It includes the entire Fire pathway, a set of XAG cards, a small "collector's" box, and 2 special bonus "new edition" XAG cards plus 1 special "limited edition" foil puzzle piece. Other future expansions are hinted at in the rules.

Expands:

XIG: The Four Elements
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Puzzle

name: Skipper: Barbie's Little Sister
description: This is a game about Skipper (Barbie's younger sister) and her horse Prince. Appropriate for 6 to 10 year olds. It is a simple roll and move game. The object of the game is to be the person who reaches the BEST IN SHOW square at the center of the board while holding; a card for your horse Prince, your tack, your riding habit, your club pin and 25 points . Players roll and move around the board. On some spots on the board you will be given the opportunity to enter the SHOW RING and score points for how your horse does. Those points can be traded in for some of what you need. Necessary money is accumulated as you go around the squares on the board.

name: Slap Wacky!
description:
Slap Wacky is the fast and fun game where you rush to put together the most wacky shape patterns before the cards run out!

Quickly place cards on the table to put together shape patterns as fast as you can. When you complete a pattern, slap it to get the points before another player uses a block card against you. The player who scores the most points wins the game!
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Cranium Grab & Go Hoppity Winks
description:
From the publisher:

Tiddlywinks gets a fun Cranium twist!

Think your frog-hopping skills are top notch? Give it your best shot with Cranium Grab & Go Hoppity Winks!

How many flies can your frogs catch? Can you hop a frog using something other than your finger? Cranium spices up the traditional game of tiddlywinks with frogs, flies, lily pads, and fun new Cranium twists that will keep players laughing and coming back for more.

What's in the box?
Hoppity Winks includes 6 frogs, 3 lily pads, and 9 flies.

name: Criss Cross
description:
Criss Cross is played on a cross-shaped board with each player setting up their five pieces in one arm. A ball is placed in the center. The object is to get the ball into an opponent's goal.

Players are moved by die roll, one at a time. If a player's piece ends up in the space with the ball and they have the majority of the pieces in the space they take another turn to move a piece with the ball.

If you succeed in carrying the ball over an opponent's goal line they give you a scoring marker. To win the game you must score six goals and they must be divided evenly among your opponents.

There are a few additional rules covering things such as interceptions.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Musketier: Im Auftrag der Königin
description: Paris in 1625. The players take over the role of the musketeers Athos, Porthos, Aramis and D'Artagnan trying to travel from Paris to Calais. During the travel the musketeers are attacked by the troops of cardinal Richelieu. Each round one of the musketeers must sacrifice in order to fulfill their quest. The one surviving is D'Artagnan the winner.

name: Ninja Golf: 18 Holes of Death!
description:
You’re a ninja at the “Jade Tee” golf championships. The winner of this tournament will bring great honor to his or her house (and get some super-sweet merchandising deals to boot!). Do you have the focus and concentration to sink a birdie while being shot at with a blowgun? Are you wily and subtle enough to replace your opponent’s golf ball with a smoke bomb without being noticed? Do you have what it takes to win in the cutthroat world of Ninja Golf?

Rules and Printable pieces available at http://www.invisible-city.com/play/394/.

name: Monkey Business
description:
A children's game from ELC. Very similar to Monkeying Around. Spin the spinner to see how many of your monkeys you may hang on the palm tree (or if you must hang one of the heavy gorillas instead). Think before you place your monkeys because, if you are not careful, the tree will collapse and the monkeys will tumble into the crocodile infested pond below. First one to hang all their monkeys on the tree wins.

Similar to:

Hanging Monkies
Monkeying Around

name: The Official Tour de France Game
description:
A very large bicycle race game, published in Denmark in 1998. The first edition contained stats for riders in the 1998 race season. Other seasons were to follow.
The game was so large it actually came in two big boxes. Total weight was just over 15 lbs. (7kg)! One box contained the basic components to play and the other contained the specific components required to play the 1998/1999 race season. With the modular boards, just about any race course the Tour de France covers could be duplicated.
Each rider stats card will determine if they are a star rider, mountain or sprint specialist or a good all around rider. These cards are based on real rider’s stats. At the start of the game each player will build a team of 9 players that includes one star rider and the team you build to support him.
The box came with four rule sets: Danish, German, French & English.
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Spider-Man & Friends Gotcha Card Game
description:
The game includes 36 Super Hero cards that portray one of six super heroes on one of six different backgrounds. In addition, there are six blank background cards and six clear cards that contain an image of one of the super heroes. During the game's set up, the background cards and the clear super hero cards are randomly put together. The rest of the cards are dealt out to the players and they form a draw pile in front of each player.

Game play consists of a player drawing his or her top card and displaying it face-up on a shared draw pile. If the card color and super hero matches any of those displayed on the table, a player yells "Gotcha" and then slaps the pile, taking all the cards below. If the card does not match any of the combinations, play simply moves to the next player.

The player who gets all the cards wins. The game also comes with a set of basic rules to play the game with young children.

name: Monopoly: Brighton & Hove Edition
description: The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Brighton and Hove, in the United Kingdom.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Slug in a Jug
description:
A childrens game, or rather rules for three different games. The box contains the rules and a set of tiles. Each tile shows a word with a picture to illustrate it. The tiles are in groups of 4 and all tiles within a group rhyme.

The three games are basically variants of memory or pairs though in one of the games children are encouraged to make silly sentences out of the words they are collecting.

name: Megalopolis
description:
A sort of Monopoly clone developed and produced by Globo Giocattoli. Differs from the classic Monopoly for the names of the various "properties" (replaced with the names of cities, such "Rome", "London" and so on, grouped by country).

Also, the player range is different, allowing for a maximum of 8 players instead of 6.

A portable version of Megalopolis has also been released by Globo Giocattoli: this version is for 2-4 players and is contained in a small plastic wallet which can be brought around easily.

Rules are almost identical to the ones in Monopoly, with the exception of some small differences.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Władca Podziemi
description:
This fantasy tile placement game has similar mechanics like DeathMaze (1979), or Citadel of Blood (1980). Heroes go into dungeons and fight monsters they spot. But Wladca Podziemi has some differences to titles mentioned above.

1. All characters are in fellowship. They go together and don't fight against each other. If there is only one player - he leads all characters.
2. Characters fight in formations. First line can use short weapons. Second line must use long range weapons, and cast spells. Last line don't fight this battle, but are safe from monster attacks.

In fact, characters in game - are heroes from Fellowship of the Ring (LoTR), and the labyrinth they explore - is Moria. Even the hardest boss is called Balrog. But this is unofficial LoTR inspiration.

name: Tribe
description:
In Tribe, four ancient races (Elves, Dwarfs, Goblins and Faeries) race to be the first to reach their tribal mount, the winner receiving the right to rule over the land for the next 400 years. To do this they must employ all of their skills to jump, climb, confuse and capture their opponents.

Home Page: http://www.racetorule.com/racetorule/index.htm

name: Finger Bowling
description:
This game consists of ten miniature bowling pins (each about 2 inches in height) and a miniature bowling ball (a marble with a diameter about the size of a quarter).

Can be played alone or with a group.

Regular bowling rules apply.

name: INTRIKY
description:
Is card game from the world of mafia. Each player is trying to reach the significant part of the most powerful people in the city. Be the first who control at least four of them and the city "victory" is yours.
Cards are divided in 3 categories
- Intriguer - necessary for activation of sentences
- Intrigue card - most in game - have 4 different meanings
1 - for composing of sentences (intrigues)
2 - symbol in right corner - sentences from cards with same symbol gives you additional advantage
3 - represent money
4 - can be played as single card
- Cards of powerful people in city (provost, taxi driver, pilot, murder, thief, ....)

Game is based on drawing a cards from witch you compose the sentences (each card contain part of the sentence), Longer sentences allow you to make more complex and powerful actions.
In each turn, you can just draw one card, and play one card.
Other advantages depend on composed sentences (intrigues).
Rules of the game are quit simple and in fact almost everything is allowed, so also depends on you how you are able to control and make deals with other players.

Simply - Fast and funny party game

name: Trivial Pursuit: Gastronomie en France
description: A regional variation of the Trivial Pursuit game, this one focus on asking and answering questions about french food.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Mokadi
description:
Mokadi is a game of building and dismantling a tangle of sticks in equilibrium. The sticks may move but should never fall down.
A game of dexterity and balance.

name: Zermatt
description:
Zermatt is an abstract tile placing and path traversing game with a mountain climbing theme.

Two to six player take turns placing six-sided tiles on a hexagonal grid and move their playing pieces (mountain climbers) from their respective base camps towards the summit. Special tiles are used to block opponents' movement up the slope.

The first player to successfully navigate their mountain climber from the bottom of the mountain to the top is the winner, but beware, sometimes the mountain wins and no climbers are able to reach the top.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Maze, Print & Play, Racing, Sports
mechanics: Action Points, Network and Route Building, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: Företagsspelet Kapital
description:
This is a game about earning money by trading stock. One unusual feature is that the winning conditions isn't specified. These must be agreed upon by the players prior to the start of the game. Various events will happen which will influence the exchange rates etc.

The companies used in the game are actual companies which existed then the game was published. Quite a few of them have changed names or disappeared.

The first edition of this game, Lemeco's, were published in about 1965 - the same year Skandinaviska Bankens new head office at Sveavägen in Stockholm were taken into use. And that building features on the game board!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Happy Sheep
description:
From the rulebook:

Every Sunday, you and your relatives meet at your dear Aunt Dolly’s place for tea and cupcakes.

Dolly is a mad-keen knitter, whipping up a cosy garment every week. It's your job to supply her with the wool from her flock of happy sheep; the fleece of four sheep will meet her needs.

However, she only wants wool of one colour- either black or white. And since her sheepdog Fang ran off with a Bichon Frise last year, those four sheep will need to be within arms reach for you to gather them in.

Will you be the one who gathers the four sheep first, thereby winning Aunt Dolly’s biggest smile- and the biggest scone?

Happy Sheep is a fast, fun game of strategy, memory and bluffing. It takes 15 seconds to set up, two minutes to learn, and five minutes to stop laughing when you trick someone into crying "Happy Sheep" and proving they don’t know black from white.

Includes strategies for gamers and a simple variant for very young kids.

How to play:
Mix the 20 tiles (10 black, 10 white) face down and form them into a 4x5 flock. On their turn, a player slides out one tile and looks at it. If it's one of the 4 show-off sheep, they show everyone and put it back in the same place. Otherwise, they may rejoin the sheep to the flock face-down wherever they please.

As soon as any player thinks they know where four sheep of the same colour are in a 2x2 group, they yell "Happy Sheep" and turn over the four tiles. If they're right, they win; if not, they're out and play continues.

It sounds simple, but with other players moving tiles, bluffing and sabotaging, it's easy to get beaten to the win or tricked into calling incorrectly.

For strategic players, the backs of the tiles come in with and without daisies, so by some careful calculation it is possible to improve your decisions...

name: Official Hockey Hall of Fame Game
description:
(From the official site)

The Official Hockey Hall of Fame Board Game — a fast-paced game of skill, strategy, knowledge and luck that the entire family will enjoy playing. The game contains hundreds of fascinating trivia questions about the greatest and fastest game on Earth. Have hours of family fun trying to guess the identities of the greatest hockey legends of all time. The Official Hockey Hall of Fame Game is an authoritative masterpiece of trivia and a who’s who of hockey, as well as a tribute to the greatest players who ever played and those still playing the game. The Official Hockey Hall of Fame Game can be played over and over again by fans of all ages.

name: Monopoly: Isle of Wight Edition
description: Version of the board game Monopoly, with the traditional properties replaced with locations from the Isle of Wight including The Needles, the Isle of Wight Festival and Osbourne House which was Queen Victoria's residence on the island.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Madeline in Paris Game
description:
Join Madeline in a race through Paris as she hunts for Genevieve's lost pups. A perfect first board game for young Madeline fans.

Includes rules for cooperative and competitive play. No reading required. Develops skills of decision making, memory/matching, visual interpretation and social development.

Contents: Game board, 4 Madeline playing figures with bases, 15 game tokens, rules for two ways to play, a brief guide to Madeline's Paris

--from the publisher

The objective is to circle the board, and in the process to match pictures. The gameplay is comparable to Candyland.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Horse Race Game
description:
This is a fun game for 2 players. You are trying to race a horse to the finish line, but along the way some of the holes will "swallow" up your horse and you have to start all over with a new horse. First one to the finish wins!

Object: Be the first to get a "horse" peg to the finish line
Rules: Each player selects a color. Players alternate turns rolling the single die. From the starting position move a peg the number of holes as on the dice roll. Note that SOME of the holes in the board have no bottom. A horse that lands here will fall through he board into the box and be out of the game. Player must then start at the beginning with a new horse. Winner is the first person to reach the last hole on an exact roll, or if a player loses all his pegs, the remaining player is the winner.
Alternate play rules: You may enter more than 1 horse of your color on the board. You must make a legal move every roll, and 2 horses cannot occupy the same hole.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Hilo
description:
Game is played over several rounds. Each round players try to build either the highest or lowest four digit number by rolling a die and placing a corresponding chip.
Players have to 'guess' whether a high or low number will be good, since they only know one 'public card' and their 'hidden card'. Once all chips have been played all cards are turned over and determine whether the highest or lowest number wins the round.

name: 1 vs. 100 DVD Board Game
description: In this DVD game, host Bob Saget asks players multiple-choice trivia questions, as they compete against 100 Mob members. The object of the game is to eliminate the entire Mob and win up to $1,000,000 in pretend money. The host asks the player and the Mob the same multiple-choice trivia question. If the player gets it right, they win money for each Mob member that answered incorrectly, plus eliminates those Mob members from the game. If the player gets the question wrong, the Mob splits the winnings and the game is over. At certain points, the player will have opportunities to stop the game and leave with their winnings or risk all of their winnings and play for more money. This DVD Board Game includes the DVD game and player cards.

name: Bizaroïd
description:
Speak and remember: can you introduce yourself properly and get the number of eyes, noses or ears right like all good Mishmashian Martians from planet Mishmash?

In this game, each player is a Martian. In the beginning of the game, each player receives a portrait, which indicates how many eyes, ears and noses he has.

Each turn, a player plays a card with an eye, ear or nose on it. He then has to call another player, using a prescribed phrase which includes the count of eyes (or ears, or noses, depending on the card place) the calling player and the called player have.

If a player gets the phrase wrong (or hesitates to long), he gets an extra eye, ear or nose (again depending on the card played) which is added to his forehead by means of a ribbon each player wears on his head. This extra feature has to be taken into account in future turns.

If a player gains his fifth additional ear, eye or nose, he is out of the game. The last player to remain wins.

name: Vereimejate Kants: Kõige kõhedam lauamäng
description:
Vereimejate Kants - Kõige kõhedam lauamäng (Bloodsuckers castle - the creepiest board game)

A population of humans are in danger. Behind the gray walls of the big castle, a clan of bloodsucking vampires have been living for centuries. The monsters and their evil master Thanateros have been terrorizing people for a long time and they have had enough of deaths and horror. Four bravest warriors will lead their soldiers to end vampires reign with superior "Speed", "Accuracy" and "Strength".
To get to the castle they first have to go through a dark forest where they have to fight with werewolves, zombies, forest vampires. In the castle real challenge awaits, there are vampires that have powers that no man can match. Unless the warriors find the amulets that make them worthy. By killing weaker enemies, player can collect amulets, what they need in order to enter the castle. 5 similar is required. Extra powers will be given to player when he collects the amulets.He can use second-level heroes, which are coming out from the "treasure" deck. As will be other cards that give bonuses or will ruin you.
Player are using dice to move and actioncards to fight the monsters.
Player can enter the castle when the amulets are collected. There player needs to fight even stronger vampires and after many fights, he needs to reach the master vampire Thanateros, which will be the final battle.
After victory, final move will be to roll the dice and see what happens to you in the future...
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Stratak Wars: Test- und Reiseset / Test and Travel Set
description:
Stratak Wars Test- und Reiseset / Test and Travel Set is a strategic- and tactical boardgame for 2 players.

The Stratak Wars - Test- and Travelset is used for testing the Stratak Wars battle system or for taking it with you during your travels.
It offers rules for beginners and advanced players.

The game-board differs to usual Stratak Wars game-boards as the upper side displays small countries with neutral cities only. The backside displays small neutral islands. So every player starts with one of the small countries instead of a big one and can expand quickly. This will cause heavy attacks at the front line to allow supply setup next to the front line.

Additonally this board can be used to enlarge the playing field of Stratak Wars: Der Auftakt / The Beginning together with additional boards 5/7 and 6/8 to a playing field with 9 boards.

So a large continent with a coastal border or a large area with an inland sea can be created. If a playing field with an inland sea is created, the landing ships can use their advantages against tanks because of their speed to build bridgeheads with loaded tanks on opposite countries. Beside tanks, fighters, bombers and ownership counters, infantry units are included as well.

Anything else is similar to Stratak Wars: Der Auftakt / The Beginning

The objective is to conquer most of the cities within a playing time as agreed at the beginning of the game. So the playing time is flexible and can be decided by the players.

Each player starts with his own small state on the edge of the gameboard and expands his influence by conquering cities and other small states on the playing field. Depending on the units he chooses for combat, he has advantages against the units of other players which are influenced by the landscape as well concerning movement and combat.

Supply points are gained for recently conquered cities only. So you have to move forward, if you want to expand your armies.

The rules include basic rules, advanced rules, alternative rules, a sequence of play description, a display section for the landscapes, cities and a counter description.
categories: Economic, Territory Building, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Inter Ação
description: Inter Ação is a game in which players randomly draw cards and have to either drawn or mimic the object, action, people or animal in the card. If the player team correctly identifies the answer, they advance in the board. If they doesn't identifies or if the opposing team identifies first, the opposing team advances in the board.

name: Peppa Pig: Tumble & Spin
description:
Shuffle the cards and place them face-down, in a circle around the Peppa Pig figurine. The youngest player begins by spinning Peppa as hard as he can. Wait until Peppa comes to a full stop. If she stops by your marker, listen carefully to what Peppa says (If Peppa stops in between two markers, she is talking to the person whose marker she has just passed.):

1. Peppa says “One!” - Turn over one of the cards. Call out the friend’s name. Is it your friend? then you get to keep the card. Is it one of the other player’s friend? Then show the card to the other players and put it back in the circle.
2. “Two!” You’re lucky! You may now look at two cards. Call out the friend’s name each time you turn over one of the cards. Is your friend on either of the cards? Then you get to keep that card. If it’s one of the other player’s friend, then show the card to the other players and put it back in the circle.
3. “Close your eyes!” Oh no! Now you have to give back one of your cards. Close your eyes while the other players hide it among the cards that are on the table. They must not tell you where they have put it!

The winner is the player who can collect all their friend picture cards first.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Electronic, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Champion
description: A swedish game from late 1960's where you manage a dog kennel. You buy dogs and enter them into competitions in different countries, breed them, sell puppies and try to make your kennel the most valuable of all the players. The game board has one path that everybody has to follow and you spin a wheel to move. Every square you land on says something that alters your situation in some way. Maybe you get to mate your dogs or they get sick. At the end of the trail the player with the most valuable kennel wins the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Angry Birds: Star Wars – Millennium Falcon Bounce Game
description:
This game one of the many games in the Angry Birds Series.

From the publisher:

Bounce into action with the new Angry Birds Star Wars Millennium Falcon Bounce Game. Bounce three balls at the Millennium Falcon to knock down as many enemy pigs as possible, and land in the cockpit to score big! Players can also unlock Angry Birds Star Wars in-app content with a special code in each pack.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme

name: UNO: Jelly Belly Special Edition
description:
From the back of the box:

"UNO teams up with Jelly Belly for this special edition of the fast-paced card game loved by millions. Each game box includes a special deck of bean-shaped UNO cards, Jelly Belly jelly beans and special rules that sweeten the play."

Contents:
54 cards
3.5 oz. Jelly Belly jelly beans (5 flavors)

Compared to a standard Uno deck, there are half as many cards, with only one Wild and one Wild Draw Four but still four zeroes. The rules state that when you force someone to draw cards (with a Draw 2 or wild Draw 4) you can take that many beans from the source pile. If you collect 10 beans, you may immediately discard all cards but one in your hand.

name: Slovenský a český film
description:
Slovenský a český film (Slovak and Czech Cinema) is a movie trivia game.
In the game, there are 1800 interesting questions mainly about Slovak cinema and also 300 tasks for the party variant of the game. Questions are divided into six areas: film before 1989, after 1989 , filmmakers and actors, bedtime stories and fairy tales, movie lines and misc. You move your piece by throwing a dice and you have to answer one question in every category correctly before going to answer three final questions. First player to do this wins a game.
There is also a party game variant where you perform, describe or draw movies or filmmakers.

Components:
Double-sided game board
One Die
300 cards with 1800 trivia questions
100 cards with 300 party version tasks
6 Player Tokens (1 x 6 Colors)
36 Scoring Wedges (6 x 6 Colors)
One sand timer for party version
Rules of Play
categories: Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: The Pomors
description:
The Pomors are the people, who live on the coast of the White sea, or how it was called in the past, Mare Album in the North of Russia. You take the role of brave fishermen, who send their ships to fish and to hunt marine animals at the White sea. You have information about fish stocks, you should wisely use it and send your ships to the best fishing places. You can also try to get ahead of your rivals, by going further than any other into the sea and getting the biggest catch. But don’t forget, that sea weather often changes and the storm can cause damage to your ship!
Moreover, in those old times, the only way to keep the catch was to salt fish in barrels. So, along with fish, the Pomors need salt. If your options are limited at the moment, you can stop fishing and sell your salt to the other fishermen. If you correctly set the salt price, you will not only repair your broken ships but also get good earnings.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Trilogía El señor de los anillos
description:
Contains 3 games based on the great trilogy of Lord of the Rings:

-The Fellowship of the Ring.
Players: 2-6
Up to 6 breeds will conquer areas that give gold and strength.

-The two towers.
Players: 2, 4 or 6
The ring bearer and his teammates will have to go forward until Mordor, while the hordes of Sauron must intercept them.

-The Return of the King.
Players: 2-6
Until 6 characters must climb Mount Doom. The player that reaches the Chambers of Fire wins the game.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Adventure, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Mythology
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid

name: 13 Frights of Halloween Card Game
description:
13 Frights of Halloween Card Game is a trick bidding game where you blindly wager candy treats in order to win candy tricks.

The game is played over 13 rounds, with players Trick-or-Treating at the beginning of each round to increase the strength of their candy stash.

On every round of play, each player will:

1. Steal a Card: Go Trick or Treating and pick a random card from the player’s hand to your right.

2. Play a Card: Play a card trying to win that round's treat!

3. Draw a Card: All players will always have 13 cards in hand.

To win the game, you total up points earned from Trick cards as well as leftover candy (which is worth 50%, since it’s now "stale"). The person with the most points wins.

name: Office Shark Tank: Don't Get Eaten Alive!
description:
Office work is bad enough but with the addition of office sharks, it's deadly! Start your day at the 9 a.m. starting space and try to avoid being eaten alive by the mechanized hungry office shark. Flick the spinner and depending on what it stops on, you either advance or retreat. After moving, if you land on one of the "blood spots", it's feeding time! Wind the shark up, set him on the playing board and let him rip! After 3 bites, you're out of the game. If you make it to the end of the day at the 5p.m. finish line, you've made it out of the office alive!

A fun little mini board game to play in the office or at home!

name: Re-Extinction
description: In Re-Extinction, dinosaurs have been resurrected for battle. Armor your dinosaurs to defend them from environmental hazards like stale grandma smell and boiling rivers of taco meat. Make every other player's dino re-extinct and be the last surviving dinosaur!
categories: Animals, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor

name: Alaska (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial Fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.


This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop. You can use stations if you wish.

There is an extra set of cards for the "cities", each with a value to be earned by visiting that "city". These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. Some of the cards give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks, though there are limited selective options for these.

The main new rule is the option to discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn. This is very useful if you are desperate for engines or a particular colour card. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Star Trek Road Trip
description:
Roll and move game set in the Star Trek TOS milieu

From the rulebook:

Travel the game board of uncharted systems and planets to compete in Starfleet Academy's 'Enterprise Challenge." Carry out board actions, gain phaser tokens, and acquire access codes to enter deep space in order to collect federation tokens. Be the first cadet to complete your score card by returning all 4 unique federation tokens to your dormitory and win the prestigious 'Enterprise Challenge.'
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Unnützes Quizzen: Weihnachten
description:
Unnützes Quizzen: Weihnachten("Unuseful Knowledge: Christmas") is a German Trivia Game with obscure facts about Christmas.

From the Publisher (translated):
"Test your unuseful knowledge! How many needles are on a christmas tree? What are the names of Santas reindeers? And do the americans really decorate their christmas tree with prickles? The big questions about christmas - in this quiz from the popular section of the NEON magazine, they will all be answered"

From the publisher (German):
Teste dein unnützes Wissen! Wie viele Nadeln hat ein Weihnachtsbaum? Wie heißen nochmal Santa Claus‘ Rentiere? Und schmückt man amerikanische Weihnachtsbäume wirklich mit sauren Gurken? Die großen Fragen zur Weihnachtszeit – in diesem Quiz zur beliebten Rubrik aus dem NEON-Magazin werden sie alle beantwortet! Für zu Hause, für unterwegs, für zwischendurch: 99 Quiz-Fragen zum Immerdabeihaben.

name: Hashtag the Game
description:
Hashtag is an interactive storytelling game for small to medium groups. It’s great for an icebreaker or as a way to get to know your friends and family better. Everyone has their favorite stories to tell, but some stories have been buried over years of neglect. It’s time to dust off those old pages and share ‘em. A set of Ninja throwing stars you got for Christmas when you were 12? An excursion into the snowy wastelands in a beat up old car? Tell your stories and other players will interact by hashtagging your story!

Players take turns telling stories based on prompts as the rest of the players lay down hashtag cards that are relevant to the story. At the end of each story, players receive 2 follower tokens for each hashtag card they played, while the storyteller receives 1 follower token for every hashtag the other players laid during the story.

name: Harry Potter: Le jeu – 1000 questions et défis
description:
From platform 9 3/4 to the final battle of Hogwards, a journey through the movies of the Harry Potter series. Answering questions, take on challenges, pay forfeits... and prove that you are the biggest fan of all times!

In this game, players roll a dice an move along the board answering questions and taking on challenges based on the 8 movies from the Harry Potter saga. Players have to act swiftly each turn is timed using an hourglass. The first to reach the last frame wins the game.

Du quai 9 3/4 à la bataille finale de Poudlard, un voyage à travers tous les films de la saga Harry Potter. Répondre aux questions, relever les défis, exécuter les gages... et prouver qu'on est le plus grand fan de tous les temps!

Dans ce jeu, les joueurs lance un dé et se déplacent le long du plateau en répondant à des questions et en réalisant des défis basés sur les 8 films de la saga Harry Potter. Les joueurs doivent agir rapidement car le temps est compté par un sablier. Le premier à atteindre la dernière case gagne la partie.
categories: Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Open Drafting, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Guess What + Who
description:
This board game includes 6 exciting games that both children and older ones, will love. It will provide many hours of fun and laughter for the whole family and friends.

Who? Everyone knows what/who you are but you... Make smart questions to find it.
Who/What you think you are? Find the person or object the others wrote on your card.
What? Describe the content of the card
Guess! Find the hidden person or animal
Four: Create a pile of 4 cards and place your hand above them asap
What is missing: Find what is missing and place it on the correct line

name: Dice'n Score! Farm
description:
Description from the publisher:

In the Yahtzee-like dice game Dice'n Score! Farm, players get to throw the dice up to three times on their turn while attempting to make high-scoring sets of animals. Choose carefully which ones to score as each line of animals can be scored only once! If all the possible choices for a roll have been filled, then you must score zero points in another box of your choice.

If you score 18 or more points on the upper half of the score sheet, then you receive 10 bonus points. Roll five identical items, and you get a 10-point Big Farm bonus. Whoever has the highest score when all the score sheets are filled wins!

name: Peppa Pig: Treasure Hunt Game
description: This is a pirate swine themed spin and move game. Players get to move in a freeform pattern instead of following a specific set path. Certain spots have tokens that players earn when landing on them. On the underside of the tokens are various items. Players get a card With a list of 6 items that they must find to win the game.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Pirates

name: The Battle for Gotham City
description:
Gotham City is plagued by its most famous villains: Joker, Riddler, Penguin, Mr Freeze, Killer Croc and Man bat. Each player takes on the role of Batman, in a race to defeat these villains and save the city.
