Players roll dice and move around the board collecting tokens and fighting villains, in order to collect transport tokens. these are in the form of the Batmobile, Bat Boat, and Bat Cycle, each of which allows the player to advance to the next level of the board. The first player to defeat a villain on level 4 is the winner.

name: Šeimas
description:
A game of political satire. A parody of 2016 Lithuanian Parliament election.

You are the leader of a political party which has 10 members. There are only two months left until the elections and events occur every day leaving no time for rest. On your road to success you will deal with social, economic and internal events and of course you will be part of scandals. By successfully resolving an event you will obtain rating points however by being part of a scandal you will lose them. You will be able to exchange rating points to the control of ministries and that will determine who will rule Šeimas.

In Šeimas as well as in Seimas (Lithuanian Parlament) the elections is the time for challenges.

—description from the back of the box (translated)

Each player has 10 party member cards. Each party member has positive or negative competence points in each of the four fields (economic, internal affairs, social and scandals). The five event cards are picked, which represent an event happening each day of the working week. Events might be positive (economic, internal affairs or social) or negative (scandal). One event is opened and players bid party member to win (resolve) the event or not to be part of a scandal. Winning the event gains you rating points, which can be combined to obtain the control of ministries. By participating in a scandal players lose rating points, which can lead to losing the control of ministries. After the week ends (fifth event is resolved), played party members are returned to the player and the new week is started. The game is finished after two in-game months (8 weeks or 40 events) or when one player controls at least 7 (out of 14) ministries. The winner is the player who controls ministries which required most rating points to obtain.

—user summary

Politinės satyros žaidimas. 2016 m Lietuvos Seimo rinkimų parodija.

Jūs vadovaujate partijai ir dešimčiai jos rinktinių narių. Iki rinkimų liko vos du mėnesiai, o kasdieniai įvykiai neleidžia atsikvėpti nė minutei. Kelyje į sėkmę, Jūs spręsite: socialinius, ekonominius, krašto įvykius ir, be abejo, dalyvausite skandaluose. Sėkmingai išsprendę įvykį, pelnysite reitingo taškus, tačiau įsivėlę į skandalą juos prarasite. Reitingo taškus galėsite iškeisti į ministerijų kontrolę, kuri nulems, kas valdys Šeimą.

Kaip Seime, taip ir Šeime - rinkimai visada yra išbandymų metas.

—description from the back of the box (Lithuanian)

Kiekvienas žaidėjas turi 10 partijos narių kortelių. Kiekvienas partijos narys turi teigiamų arba neigiamų kompetencijos taškų kiekvienoje iš keturių sričių (ekonomika, krašto ir gamtos, socialinių ir skandalų). Ištraukiamos penkios įvykių kortelės, kurios reprezentuoja po įvykį įvykstantį kiekvieną darbo savaitės dieną. Įvykiai gali būti teigiami (ekonominiai, krašto ir gamtos ar socialiniai) arba neigiami (skandalai). Vienas įvykis atverčiamas ir žaidėjai stato partijų narius kad laimėtų (išspręstų) įvykį arba neįsiveltų į skandalą. Laimėjus įvykį gaunami reitingo taškai, kurie gali būti panaudoti įgyti ministerijų kontrolę. Įsivėlęs į skandalą žaidėjas praranda taškus, o tai gali reikšti jog jis praras ministerijų kontrolę. Po savaitės (kai išsprendžiamas penktasis įvykis), žaidėjai atgauna panaudotus partijos narius ir pradedama nauja savaitė. Žaidimas baigiasi po dviejų žaidimo mėnesių (aštuonių savaičių; 40 įvykių) arba kai vienas iš žaidėjų kontroliuoja 7 (iš 14) ministerijas. Laimi žaidėjas, kurio kontroliuojamų ministerijų vertė didžiausia.

—description from the back of the box (User summary)
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Deduction Name Game
description:
Deduction Name Game is a party game aimed at guessing the secret names of other players. To start, each player will write down a secret name. Players should try to write a name not easily connected with themselves, as the goal is to use deduction skills to figure out the names each player has secretly written.

All written names will be placed into a bowl, and read out loud once.

The starting player tries to guess the name of another player. If they are right, they get that player as their teammate! If they are wrong, that player becomes the guesser, and the game continues. As the teams grow, more names are guessed, until there is only one secret name left – the winner!

-description from designer

name: Never Have I Ever: Family Edition
description:
Never Have I Ever: Family Edition is a party game. Everyone gets 10 Play Cards and takes a turn reading a Rule Card. During each round players have a chance to admit whether they're 'guilty' or 'not guilty' of a Play Card. If you're guilty, you get to keep it. First person to collect 10 Play Cards wins.

The game has 224 cards specially curated for games with families. It also have 6 custom paddles, and a spinner.

—description from the publisher

name: Gogo CHALLENGE: Round 02
description:
This is the second instalment in the Gogo CHALLENGE series. It's a game in puzzle form in which the tiles must be used to assemble a square by laying out square tiles in a way that adjacent tile edges show the same symbol. The pieces are "reversible" and each figure is "coded" so that one knows what there is on the other side of the card without having to turn it. There are multiple solutions. There are two difficulty levels: the Simple Gogo and the Supreme Gogo (more difficult).

Gogo Challenge can be played alone or against opponents with a timer.

name: Wizard Tournament
description:
Турнир Волшебников ("Wizard Tournament") is a fast-paced spell-shouting game of reaction in which players take on the roles of young wizards swinging their wands, casting spells, summoning magic crystals, and protecting themselves from the Dark Lord.
Each player starts the game with a magic wand, 5 crystals of one color of their choosing, and 1 crystal of each color that was not chosen for the game.
The game is played over a series of rounds. Each round, 2 dice are rolled. Die sides correspond to the colors of the magic crystals. Additionally, one die contains a white side and another die contains a black side.
Different combinations make different players cast certain spells (Attackus, Defendus, Captus, or Iamsafus), and whoever is the first to do it right either protects their crystals or gets a chance to take one from the opponent — or even steal some from the Dark Lord himself!
Whenever one of the players has the majority in three crystal colors and doesn’t have the Dark Lord’s mark on them, the game is over and that player is declared the winner!
Count fast, be sure enough to cast your spells with a steady hand, and don’t let other wizards get ahead of you!

—description from the publisher

name: Ecliptic Travelers
description:
Let’s make a journey to the world where eclipses often occur! Together we will propose a journey route to make this voyage a wonderful experience. Who will be the Greatest Contributor to the journey route?

Ecliptic Travelers is a competitive game for 2-5 players. The player plays a hand in his turn and proposes a journey route. The player who has used all the cards from his hand is praised for being a Great Contributor to the journey. The player who becomes　twice a Great Contributor to the journey, is the winner of the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Matching

name: Kivi Shapes
description:
"A dice game shaped for tactics"

A follow-up to the 2016 game Kivi (Finnish for "stone"). It's Yahtzee again with a game board instead of score sheets, but this time we have 5 dice instead of 6, the dice have six different symbols in two different colours instead of pips, and the game board grid is 5x5 instead of 7x7.

—user summary

Kivi Shapes is a tactical game of dice where the players score points by building lines of consecutive stones. The dice decide where a stone can be placed: The shapes on the dice should match a combination of shapes on the game board. A minimum of three stones in a vertical, horizontal or diagonal row are required to get points. Should you stake on your own row or block another player's game? When the game board is filled with stones, the game ends and it is time to find out who has the most points.

Kivi Shapes extends the Kivi game series: Easier tally and bigger parts are better suited even for younger players. Award-winning Kivi quality!

Contents: Game board, 5 dice with symbols, 64 stones

—description from the back of the box

name: Heximania
description:
From the box:

Spinning the board as you go, you'll take turns placing letter tiles, earning points for each word you build. As long as letters are adjoining and in the proper sequence, words may be read in any direction - up and down, backwards and forwards.

Once the board is full, the player with the highest score wins! Fast-paced and easy to learn, Heximania can be played at various skill levels - perfect for the entire family.

name: Block 5: The Card Game
description: Block 5: The Card Game consists of cards numbered 1-10, but without 5s and with a few marked 3+. The goal is to get rid of one's cards. At the start of the game, players lay out rows with the sum of five (1,2,2, for instance). When a player adds the fifth row, s starts a new block by placing an individual card on the table. This card shows the number which has to be added up to. A player who cannot place a row draws a card. A player who places a 3+ card draws three cards, keeps one and gives the other two to two other players. The first player to get rid of all her cards wins.

name: Het Huis Anubis: Het levenselixir
description: The board is a 3d house with 4 levels and players try to collect ingredients for their elixer by moving around the house, taking care to avoid Victor, who steals ingredients.

name: Żubr Pompik
description:
Żubr Pompik is a memory kids game in which players try to gather as many flower sets as possible by receiving a reward for good memorising animals positions in the forest.

Every turn a player has to throw two dice and move "Żubr Pompik" (European Bison with a cute name "Pompik") on the path the number of spaces equal to one of the dice or both combined. Then the animal tile from the space the bison landed is revealed and put on the space the bison has started his turn. Now a player has to point the second animal of this kind by revealin appropriate tile. If they succeed then they get a flower tile in of the three colors randomly.

The game ends after a specific number of rounds when the bison walk around the forest. The player to gather most sets of three different flowers is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: The Game of Ladybirds
description:
There are 24 cards - 4 of each numbered 1-6 on the back (in the style of a 6-sided die). Each card has a leaf and a number of ladybirds from 0-3 on the front.

At the start of the game, the back of the cards are showing (so each leaf is hidden), but on his/her turn, a player rolls the die and picks up a card of that value.

Near the end of the game, if you roll a number that has no cards left, you pass on to the next player. The game ends when the last card has been turned over and the winner is the player with the most ladybirds.

A luck based game which small children enjoy and which teaches simple addition and the numbers on a die.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Number

name: Monkeys!
description: Monkeys! Who knew it could be so tough to keep a banana? Scare the monkey away from your precious bananas or send monkeys after your opponents. Oh, and try to stop laughing before time runs out. Join your friends in a frenzy of fast-paced silliness!

name: Monsters & Maidens: Epic Dice
description:
The expansion to Monsters and Maidens includes a total of 4 black dice:


1 Adventure Die
1 Season Die
1 Tool Die
1 Fate Die

name: La Batalla
description:
The battle.

Strategy and trickery.

With the correct placement of the pieces and an effective tactics, a player can impose to his adversary.

The preparation of the game is basic, in order not to obstruct the offensive action of the own pieces and to disable at the same time the free action of the pieces on the contrary, inside the own field. There are five types of different pieces for team.

Content:
- Pieces:
1 standard-bearer
4 cannons
2 planes
10 cavalry
13 infantry
- 1 board
- 1 tray
- 1 Instructions
The objective is to eliminate the standard-bearer of the opposite team.

name: Bass Ackwards
description:
Game description from the publisher:

It’s the game where the right answer is wrong! Teams start at the finish space and try not to get to start. Read the answer that’s on the card, then read the three questions below it. Try to select one of the two WRONG questions. If you do, you stay where you are on the game board – but if you pick the correct question, you move closer to start.

name: Rock Paper Scissors Bomb
description:
"A futuristic version of the quick-draw rock, paper, scissors game with four bomb cards"

The game contains 41 cards in a mix of rock, paper, scissor, and bomb cards. Players divide then deck and reveal cards from their own decks one by one. The winner claims both cards (with bombs always winning), and the player with most won cards after the decks are exhausted. Ties are set aside and awarded to the winner of the next card-duel. Essentially, the game is War with Rock-Paper-Scissors combat resolution.

name: Match 'Em
description:
The object of the game is to be the first to win three hands. In each hand, players aim to play all of his/her cards before the opponents.

The game comes with a plastic play mat. It basically outlines where each player plays his/her cards and where the stockpile is placed.

Players attempt to match the exact sum of the previous play with one or more cards from their hand.

name: The Chronicles of Run
description:
Chaos and Order clash, and the fate of the world of Run hangs in the balance. Choose sides and fulfill your destiny!

The Chronicles of Run is a two-player game based in a fantasy world, based in abstract strategy and tile placement.

At the begining of the game players take their cards, tokens and screens. They create the world of Run by placing the hexagonal land tiles. Lands are divided in two zones, one for attackers and a second for defenders, and they have a different importance in the game that is represented by its points of power.

In each turn players choose and place one rune token (that represents a hero with a different value of fate) on a land tile free. After both sides have played, tokens are revealed, their cards placed aside and their skills applied.

Runes represent very powerful skills that can modify the position of characters, boost them or win a challenge against an specific opponent. This allows a great variety of tactics and tricks to overcome your opponent's minions.

This process is repeated until all the lands have a hero of each side (Order or Chaos). Then challenges are resolved in each land around the world. The hero with more fate wins the challenge, and its controlling player gets the points of power from that land.

After all challenges are done the game ends, and the player that achieves more points of power wins.

—description from publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Gazobu
description:
A big vacuum cleaner has sent lots of monsters in the cosmos. You must gather them in families in order to score points.
During the game, cards are drawn to form two columns. The cards can have monsters on them, or various bonuses/penalties. During your turn you can choose to take a whole column in your hand, but you can only do that four times. You then must draw two new cards to extend the columns.
The columns will grow during play until someone picks one up and starts a new one.

At the end of the game, you must arrange the cards you picked up in order to have majorities for each monster type. If you do you will score points, if you don't you will loose points.

name: Cloister Games
description: Cloister Games is a nicely presented compilation of four medieval games, typical of those found etched onto monastery floors. Fox and Geese is played on a board instantly recognizable to us as solitaire. The single Fox wins by jumping over the geese, landing on an empty point and thereby diminishing the flock until it is no longer viable. The geese win by hemming in the fox so he cannot move. It's not easy to win as the geese. The fascinating game of Merels is better known as Nine Mans Morris and has an entry to itself elsewhere in this database. Albuquerque is perhaps the pick of the bunch, with a strategy resembling a cross between draughts and Merels and its influence is clearly to be seen in modern derivatives such as Kensington. Finally, Fierges is identical to draughts but without the compulsion (huffing) rule. Each game is eminently playable in its own right and, together, provide a fascinating insight into the development of modern draughts (checkers). The four boards are beautifully illuminated in medieval style and accompanied by wooden pieces.
mechanics: Area Movement, Enclosure, Point to Point Movement
publishers: Historical Collections Group plc, Oxford Games, Ltd.

name: Win By A Nose
description: Win by a nose features Mr. Nose - the funniest, most far-out way to pop the dice you've ever seen. Just give a pull on his bright orange nose and watch the dice bounce up in his hat. He's so much fun to play with that you'll want to pull his nose over and over again. To win you have to be the first player to get your nose piece to the top level of the game board and complete the face.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Thomas the Tank Engine:  Thomas Numbers Game
description:
From the box:

Self-correcting Adding Fun--Thomas the Tank Engine rolls down the tracks bringing an exciting new numbers game for children. Come and play with Thomas and his friends. You'll learn your numbers and how to add them, too!

To Play: Spin the spinner to choose the numbered pieces that fit in your train. When the train is completed, the pieces add up to the number on the end of the car. Verying levels of play make the game fun for beginning and advance players.

Skill for Young Players: Beginners can play by recognizing and matching numbers. Advanced players will understand that various combinations can be used to add up to the number on the end of the car. All players learn important social skills: taking turns, sharing and respecting others.

Contents:

4 Playing boards
24 Number pieces
1 Spinner
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Math, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Number, Trains

name: Cortex Challenge: Print & Play Demo
description:
A true test of players’ thinking, memory and speed skills, players use all of their brain power to compete in 8 different challenges, from duplicates, touch tests, logical series, mazes, color puzzles and more. -- —description from the publisher.

This Print & Play Demo contains only 8 cards

Published during the COVID-19 2019-2020 Pandemic. The publisher posted:
"In these difficult times, we see families needing joy and entertainment more than ever; turning towards board games and party games to bring their loved ones together. We at Asmodee have created free print & play versions of some of our most popular family games, for anyone to print, use, and enjoy from home."
categories: Card Game, Educational, Memory, Party Game, Print & Play, Puzzle

name: The World of Wall Street
description: Bookcase game similar to 3M games of the time. Players move around the board buying and selling shares of stock in eight corporations. News headlines and random events impact the price of the stocks daily. The player with the most money after 24 days (rounds) wins the game.

name: Xevoz
description: A one-on-one fighting game that uses highly articulated, customizable, fully interchangeable figures based on the Stikfas line of figures. Various factions duke it out using customizable dice to determine battle outcome and effect with the players removing parts from their figures as they take damage, and adding back as they heal.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Fighting, Science Fiction

name: Colorful Caterpillars
description:
Colorful Caterpillars is a fun children's tactics game. The game is to get all of their own larvae first on to the game board. Players place their larvae on to the game board in turns. A great maneuvering game, where the larvae can be put this way, that someone else need to take theirs off or can't put their on to the board. Age range of more than 4 years.
Each player gets larvae pictured tiles, where in every single one of those is two holes, but they are in different places. One in head and tail of the larvae, or body and tail and so on. The tiles are in four different colors for each player. The game board have different colored circles on it, and your goal is to make your larvae complete by placing them in a way the circle match the color underneath (yellow to yellow). Win by getting rid of your tiles first.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement
publishers: Nelospelit, Nelostuote Oy, Otto Maier Benelux B.V., Otto Maier Verlag, Saenggak Plus Edu, Tactic

name: Rummikub 8 Round Rummy
description:
"It's a Rummikub card game with a new twist."

The deck has cards with 1-7 objects in 2 colors and 3 shapes, as well as Jokers and Reverse & New Hand cards. Eight goal cards, numbered 1-8 are placed on the table, and everyone starts with a 7-card hand. In a turn, each player draws a card and discards a card. The first player to fulfill the current goal (e.g. to get all cards of the same color) takes the card for that goal, discards his hand and draws a new hand. The other players continue playing with their current hands. Once all goal cards are taken, the player with the highest total of goal cards wins.

name: Hände weg!
description:
This is a game for ages 10 and up. The box contains a board, 28 cards, 5 figurines, 100 colored chips and 20 white chips.

The board contains a circle with 8 fields, on which the figurines are moving. Next to 6 of those fields there is a field to put a card on. The cards have values between 3000 and 10000 DM and corresponding 3 to 10 fields to place chips on the cards.

Every player gets one figurine and the chips in the corresponding color. The figurines are placed on an empty field on the board and each player gets 2 white chips. The remaining white chips are placed in the middle of the board.

The cards are shuttled and 6 of them are placed face up on the discard fields.

On your turn you can move your figurine 1 to 4 fields clockwise. The field you're ending on defines what you can do next. When you end on a field with a card laying next to it, you have to put one of your chips on the card. The fields on the card are numbered and have to be covered one by one.

Do you reach the red field on the board, then you can place a chip on the card of your choice. On the blue field you can exchange a chip of your color from your supply for a white one. The white chips have a special function. During your turn only one colored chip can be placed, but on that same turn several white chips can be placed on the same card. Instead of a colored chip you can also play one white chip. White chips are neutral and don't belong to any player once they are placed.

When a figurine arrives at an already occupied field, the new arrival has to discard one of his chips. After that the player can continue his turn.

There is a scoring as soon as the last field of a card is covered. The player who has placed the last colored chip on that card gets the card. After that, the opposite card goes to the player who has placed the last colored chip on that card.

The chips that were on those cards leave the game. New cards are placed.

The game ends when no one has any chips left. The winner is the player with the highest total value on his gained cards.

name: Denkste!
description: Think! This race game involves moving your coloured pawn along the track according to selections made with rotating discs, with some element of double-think. Not a dice game as the cover illustration shows. NOT to be confused with Denkste by Hexagames, which is a dice game.

name: Bandito
description:
"Hands up!“ the bank robbers shout as they ride at full gallop into the western town. This quiet little town has never seen so much action as the sheriff gets a posse together to chase after the robbers. Is it the man with the beard or perhaps the one with the red scarf? The player who recognizes the robber in the wanted poster first receives a deputy badge. He can only be made sheriff if he manages to catch more than one robber.

—description from the publisher

name: Blackout
description: Let the good times roll with this fast-moving variation on Bingo. Be the first to cover up the last numbers on five Blackout cards to win. Dice determine the numbers to cover up, but special dice rolls include wild, remove and re-roll, allowing more game play variations. So get ready to roll and prepare for an extended Blackout! 2-4 players Ages 8 and up

name: Electronic Battle Cry!
description: Do you have what it takes to capture THE HILL? Think fast as the electronic commander orders your troops forward. Your army will be called at random, so be ready! Then move your soldiers quickly -- one at a time -- and only when they're called. But beware! There are other armies alongside that also want THE HILL! You struggle upward! The pace quickens as you're ordered to move each soldier faster and faster! Your outer defenses are eliminated without warning -- and you lose the soldiers left behind! Yet the summit is so close. Will you be the last surviving army and win the game?
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Electronic, Fighting, Wargame
mechanics: Grid Movement, Map Reduction, Square Grid, Static Capture

name: Flip 4
description:
This game helps children practice their basic math skills. Players roll the dice then add, subtract, multiply, or divide to place markers on numbered board squares. The first player to line up four of his pieces in a row wins - unless his opponents flip him to another square first!

From other pictures on he web, the game is a 5x5 grid with "Flip 4" in the corners. The rest of the squares have numbers.

name: CHiPs
description:
Each player takes the role of a motorcycle cop. The object of the game is to capture the four criminal cars of one's own color. A pair of six-sided dice have a drawing of a car instead of a six.

A player's turn begins with a roll of the dice. Whenever one of the dice shows a car, the player may move the criminal car of any opponent. If both dice show numbers, a player moves one's own motorcycle. However, the motorcycle must follow the rules of the road. The criminal cars are not bound by the rules of the road! Whenever both dice show cars, a criminal car of the rolling player has flipped and is immobilized for the rest of the game.

The game is named after the popular television series of the same name.

The newer version that features the 2 main actors from the TV show on the front cover (Image below) has a Publishing Year of 1981.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Congo
description:
Over the 1982-1983 Christmas holiday, Demian Freeling's father, famed abstract game designer Christiaan Freeling, suggested to his then seven-year-old son that he should design a chess-like game using a seven-by-seven board and seven yet to be defined pawns on the second rank and a royal piece in the middle. Drawing on his own experience with Chess and Xiang-Qi, Demian came up with Congo in just over an hour's time. Games tend to be fairly quick and bloody.

Set on an African Savannah with a river running horizontally across the board, the central royal piece is, of course, a lion, and a player wins by capturing the opposing lion. Lions move by stepping one space in any direction, but (except to capture the opposing lion for the win, which it can do by facing the opposing lion on an open file) is confined to the three-by-three area in the middle of its side of the board.

Reading the initial setup across the first rank, there is a zebra that moves and captures like a Chess knight. Next is a crocodile that can move and capture by stepping one space in any direction or may race all the way to the river on an open file or may swim horizontally within the river along its entire unobstructed length. Next comes an elephant that moves and captures by jumping one or two squares orthogonally. Next is the lion, then another elephant. Next is a monkey that moves by stepping one space in any direction or captures (possibly repeatedly) by jumping over pieces by a short leap (i.e., the monkey's capturing movement is like the piece movement in Halma, but with immediate capture). Last comes the giraffe, which can jump one or two steps in any direction or capture by jumping onto pieces two spaces away in any direction. Like animals on opposing sides are lined up opposite their counterparts.

The second rank on each side is filled with un-promoted pawns that move and capture by stepping one space straight or diagonally forward, and may (but only from across the river) also retreat one or two spaces straight backward without capture. Pawns promote to a super-pawn upon reaching the last rank, and may additionally move and capture one space horizontally or retreat one or two spaces diagonally backward from any space on the board. Any piece except the crocodile may only stay in the river for one turn, after which it drowns if not moved further.

name: Spel van de Eeuw
description:
Het spel van de Eeuw (The Game of the Century) is a trivia game with questions regarding persons, events and developments from the 20th century.

The questions are arranged in five categories. The game is played on a board depicting 60 fields, arranged in a circle. Each field has a colour corresponding to a category; every sixth field is a large scoring field.

On a player's turn, he rolls the die and moves his pawn as many spaces in the direction he chooses. He is then asked a question from the category of the field he landed on. If he answers the question correctly, he gets to move again.

If a player lands on a scoring field and manages to answer the question correctly, he not only gets to move again, but he also receives a century chip of the correct colour (if he doesn't have one in that colour yet). The first player to collect century chips of all colours wins the game.

The game can be expanded by adding questions from the various editions of Spel van het Jaar (Game of the Year).

name: Man vs. Apocalypse
description:
Man vs. Apocalypse has 2 decks, the Scrounging Deck, and the Apocalypse Deck. The scrounging deck contains all the people and items you will need to survive.

The Apocalypse deck contains the disasters and the Apocalypses themselves, at the end of the every round one of these cards will be reveled and have to be dealt with.

At the beginning of the Man vs. Apocalypse you and your friends will draw up to a full hand(5) of cards from the Scrounging Deck. You can play as many cards as you want from your hand on your turn, but be warned, if you run out of cards in your hand you are killed and have lost the game.

As you play these cards, each survivor have special abilities that can help you, some will provide you some defense vs. a specific disaster, other may bring a useful skill, some are only useful for a time, before they must be sacrificed for the greater good(You).

On their turn a player will draw 2 cards,(no more then 5 in hand) and be place in play as many as he wants. Once all players have gone you draw from the Apocalypse Deck, these cards will force you to discard your survivors in play, discard cards from your hand or create other chaos.

Once all players have dealt with the Disaster that was drawn, the play starts with the first player again.

The goal is to survive to the end of the Apocalypse deck, only then can you begin to rebuild.

name: MZM: Midnight Zombie Marathon
description:
MZM – Midnight Zombie Marathon

When Crazy Earl told us that Aliens were coming, we did not believe him. That did not stop him though. He put all his supplies into the sewer to protect them from tractor beams. Little did we know, zombies would soon infest the sewers and slowly take over your town.

Run, Dive and Dash your way past Zombies in the sewers. Find the hidden treasures of gas and food and barter your way out of town. If you are lucky enough, you might even find old Earl or his crash test dummy in your fun and crazy adventures.

This 1-4 player game is rated 13+ and comes with an easy to play rule book and personal deck with unique zombies to plague your adventures.

Single Player:

Game play revolves around running through the sewers to collect enough gas and food to barter with so you can get a ride out of town. Sounds easy right? We recommend you try to be careful because there is a limited amount of cards in the deck. The zombies will pop out of you, give you hugs and then go back into the deck. This creates a fun, creative and fun horde mechanic that is both simple and exciting. Can you get all you need before you have nothing left but zombies left in your deck?

Multiplayer:

There is only one seat in Earl's truck, and with so many people buying for it, it is up to you to out collect your friends.

While this setup is designed to work much like single player mechanic wise. The cards are no longer discarded, but go back into the deck to provide nonstop fun. With only ten rounds, you need to collect all you can before your friends do. How can you do this? Simple, bet your friends during their turn to try to wrestle their cards away from them and into your personal pile. Once all the players have a single card of their own, betting opens up and allows you to bet, roll and do whatever it takes to win. Do not worry... The zombie horde is still trying to hug its way to your brains, but can you outpace them and wave goodbye to your friends?

Follow us here at:

www.ArchNemesisGames.com
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: tri-FACTa
description:
From the publisher:
Make addition and subtraction 3 times as fun! Dish out the numbered playing cards, then using the familiar triangle board as a visual cue, fill in the missing spots to complete fact families. Be the first player to play all your cards, and call out “tri-FACTa"!
Includes triangle game board, 100 cards (facts up to 20) and 4 trays

Object of the game:
Be the first player to play all your cards, and call out "tri-FACTa!"

name: 신묘한 사다리 (Mysterious Ladder)
description:
Race to the Gold Coconut!
On a bountiful and rugged mountain live the descendants of the Monkey King. These monkeys are now looking for new leadership. It all began with the rumor of a golden coconut at the mountain peak. Excited, the monkeys decided that the one to claim this coconut would become the leader. The first player to reach the top receives the Gold Coconut and wins.

Players roll a die and move up the levels of the pyramid -- unless they hit a space with a slide which sends them back to the previous level.

A 3D Snakes & Ladders type of game.

name: Cards Against Marvel
description: This is a Marvel-themed Cards Against Humanity clone. Follows the standard Cards Against Humanity rules.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Tech Bubble
description:
In TECH-BUBBLE, 3 to 6 players ride the technology market roller coaster at the turn of the 21st century as it surges and eventually plunges. The players represent various market sectors during the "Dot.Com Bubble". They make decisions to stay in the market and ride out the surge or get out before the bubble bursts. Timing and nerves of steel are everything. And along the way players can affect each other's investments and decisions by crafty play.

Due out October 2009
categories: Card Game, Economic, Educational, Industry / Manufacturing, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Commodity Speculation, Hand Management, Stock Holding, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Punderdome: Food Fight Expansion Pack
description:
The smash-hit party game Punderdome has proven that people can’t get enough of silly wordplay. Finally, here is a Punderdome expansion pack tied to one of the most popular themes ripe for punning: food. Add this pack of 50 cards that includes 50 food-themed nouns and 50 punny Q&As to the core game for a fun, more accessible way to play. (This expansion pack includes a link to access the original game instructions online.)

With 50 yummy nouns and 50 groan-worthy jokes, this Punderdome expansion pack proves that wordplay is here to stay. Add these 50 cards to the original game for a more dynamic experience.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Punderdome: Wild Things Expansion Pack
description:
The smash-hit party game Punderdome has proven that people can’t get enough of silly wordplay. Finally, here is a Punderdome expansion pack tied to one of the most popular themes that is perfect for punning: animals. Add this pack of 50 cards that includes 50 animal-themed nouns and 50 punny Q&As to the core game for a fun, more accessible way to play. (This expansion pack includes a link to access the original game instructions online.)

With 50 animal-themed nouns and 50 groan-worthy jokes, this Punderdome expansion pack proves that wordplay is here to stay. Add these 50 cards to the mother game for a more dynamic experience.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Eyewitness Newsreel Challenge: A VCR Game
description:
Innovative and exciting, Eyewitness Newsreel Challenge is an ideal way to use your VCR. It combines the enjoyment of VCR viewing with the competitiveness of a game. It's great fun to play with any size group!

As an "eyewitness," you'll watch newsreel clips from yesteryear - clips that are always interesting and often hilarious. Take good reporter's notes, because when each one-minute clip is over, you and your teammates must create questions about what you've just seen and heard: " What number did you see on Babe Ruth's football jersey?," "Did you catch the name of the canary who bicycled though Central Park?"

Stump the opposing team, or answer their questions correctly, and your team moves ahead on the scoreboard. There are over 100 vintage clips in 15 different categories-from Hollywood to History-from Daredevils to Disasters-from Inventions to Industry. Each of the clips can be played again and again, because the players make up the questions.

So, dim the lights. Take a step back in time. Invite family and friends to see who's got the scoop when you play Eyewitness Newsreel Challenge!
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: The VCR Quarterback Game
description: Included in your new VCR Quarterback Game is a VCR tape (choose between VHS or Beta) filled with incredible live-action NFL footage that can be used again and again. You shuffle the cards, roll the dice, call the plays and your favorite NFL teams run them for you. No two games are EVER the same, so you get hundreds of hours of fast-paced game playing. All this combines to make The VCR Quarterback Game the only NFL interactive VCR football boardgame available. It's perfect for football fans, novices or anyone who likes fast action and fun.

name: Viamala
description: A simple game where people try to build a path by laying tiles on the table. These tiles can be acquired by rolling a die. You can also use the die result to obtain action cards or move the pawn.

name: Fruit Frenzy
description:
From the publisher:

A fruity card game that's fun and simple to play
Collect five matching fruits to win, but watch out, when the spinner shows "fruit frenzy" it's everyone for themselves!

This game is designed to improve observation skills, develop social communication and promote healthy eating.

name: The Game of LIFE: It's A Dog's Life Edition
description:
Publisher Blurb:

The world famous "Game of Life" has gone to the dogs in the best way possible. The goal is to end up at the Pouch Poarch with the most "dog bones" and puppies. In the process you can ben sent to the Puppy Obedience School or be a House Pet. As in the normal "The Game of Life" there are pit falls and riches. Try to talk and earn 20 "dog bones"! Muddy Paw Prints on Rug pay 15 "dog bones"! Visit the beach or the park to earn or lose more "dog bones". Get married and have puppies! You can even customize your token and play with your own dog. Contents include game board, plastic game board pieces (spinner,fire hydrant, dog house, tree and pooch palace), bone money pad with pet insurance certificates, fire plastic cars, cardboard dog tokens including blanks for customization, puppy pegs and illustrated instructions.

name: Icebreaker Snow
description:
Based on the animation of the same name, Icebreaker Snow is a cooperative board game, where players try to pilot all ships to harbor before the deck runs out.

To pilot a ship home, one ice breaker has to be on same location with the ship, and another on the destination harbor.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Noah's Ark
description:
The Deluge is near and Noah has build the Ark to save as much couple of animals as possible. He needs your help!

Each players plays the sound of an animal with the electronic ark. Then must turn the right card. if the cards fits with the animal, then the player move that animal one step closer to the ark.

The player that manage to bring all 6 animals to the ark wins.

name: TriBond for Kids
description: Be the first player or team to move your game piece from the purple triangle, clockwise around the board and back into the purple triangle. Game pieces are moved by answering tribond kids clue-sets. A clue-set is a list of three things that has something in common.
mechanics: Memory, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mythology: The Game
description:
[From publisher's website:] Play the part of one of the mighty heroes of legend - Theseus, Perseus, Odysseus, Heracles, Jason, or Achilles - and work your way through the Labyrinth, battling opponents, slaying the fearsome Minotaur, and ultimately finding your way out of the maze. The Labyrinth rotates, so the challenges you face will change from game to game!

This is the fourth installment of Ology World games. The others include Dragonology : The Game, Wizardology : The Game, and Pirateology : The Game.

name: Cranium: Hullabaloo DVD Game
description:
From the publisher:
Just pop in the DVD, and the Hullabaloo host will guide you through your adventure, from setting up the 16 animal play pads to standing on a purple Cranium pad to start. You'll fly like an eagle to a triangle, stomp like a gorilla to a red pad, and swim to an animal that lives in the ocean!

Play along with the Hullabaloo Kids on-screen as you follow the host's instructions. When you hear, "Freeze!" everyone stays still and waits for the lucky pad to be announced. Everyone touching the lucky pad is a winner, and every game ends with a different celebration -- winners might take a bow, dance, do a victory jump, or … who knows? Part of the fun is finding out!

name: Ghostly Estates
description: Ghostly Estates is one of the Milton Bradley "Flipsiders" games that resembles an audio cassette until you "flip" the game open. Using a spinner for movement, each player moves room by room through the haunted house gathering 4 objects in this order: The Candle, The Map, The Key, The Gold. After both players have taken a turn, the ghost is moved to a random room. If this room is occupied by a player or players, they drop the last object they gathered and must go backwards to gather it again. The first player to return to the START circle on the porch with all 4 objects wins.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Hope City
description:
Hope City is a cooperative board game for 3-6 players. The Citizens work together to achieve objectives, construct City Sites, and build Hope City. But Punks attack, corrupt, and make objectives harder to achieve. If Citizens become corrupt, they can break bad. If they fail objectives, Urban Blights can emerge! The Citizens have 7 years to build Hope City otherwise chaos could bring the city to ruin!

Citizens collect resources which they use to attempt an objective card. There are conditions too which must be met to achieve the objective. Sometimes this requires a vote, rolling the dice, moving to a different city space, removing a punk, or pulling the right resource from the bag. Every objective has rewards for success or consequences for failure. The major objectives always reward success with "Construct 1 City Site." But they are expensive and take collaboration. There are some cheaper objectives that offer this reward but more luck is needed.

Citizens have talents & temptations as actions. Temptations corrupt citizens as do successful Punk attacks. If the citizen takes too much corruption, they break bad and can harm the team. Citizens can become good again, though.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Flush!
description:
A crisis has occurred in the most unlikely of places: the bathroom!! So gear up and get ready to capture the ugly creatures that have invaded the bathroom form underneath the toilet. Flush is a fast paced game where players race against the clock to get all their creatures into the toilet before it flushes and they get wet. Now you can play with the toilet water!

The first player starts the game by lifting the toilet lid, this will start the game and creatures will start popping out so you can capture them. Once the toilet starts to spin, scattering creatures everywhere, all players compete at the same time by attempting to capture the creatures of their headband color with the magnetic plunger--no hands allowed! Once you have shown your skill by capturing one of the creatures with the plunger attached to your headband you need to send the creature back into the toilet. Remove the creature from the plunger(now you can use your hands) and use the Flipper located on the game base that matches your headband color to flip the creature into the toilet. You need to work fast to get as many of your creatures into the toilet before the toilet flushes and sprays water into your face. Be brave and keep competing to capture the most creatures you can during the last 30 seconds of the game while the water is spraying. When the toilet stops spinning the game is over (approx. 3 minutes). This is the most fun you will ever have with a toilet. The player with the most of their colored creatures in the toilet will be the winner!

Contents:

Game base
Water basin insert
Smiling toilet timer
4 2-piece magnetic headband plungers
24 magnetic "little creatures"
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Humor, Party Game, Racing

name: Get a Life
description:
In Get a Life, you want to assemble either the best or worst life possible from the cards available to you — but which way you want to lean depends on the secret goal you receive at the start of the round.

Each round one player is the "contestant". Each other player receives one card in each of five categories — companion, transportation, location, occupation, accommodation — as well as a "Best" or "Worst" goal card. Players must reveal two of their five cards, then they use the "get a life" cards to acquire, steal or give away cards, all while trying to shape the "perfect" life. At round's end, the contestant judges which player has the best life and which has the worst — and if these players have the right goal cards, they take a scoring chip.

Whoever ends up with the most scoring chips after a certain number of rounds wins.

name: Excuses, Excuses
description:
"The Excuse-Filled Game When You're Late for Work"

Navigate your pawn from home to work, choosing your mode of travel: walking, taxi, bus or train. The winner is the first player to face the Boss in his office and have the required Good Excuses --as indicated by the Face the Boss card. The players use the other cards to help themselves along or get each other in trouble. A good time ensues. ;-)

The Canadian bilingual edition has a reversible board (French on one side, English on the other). Wooden pawns and dice.

name: Noah's Ark
description:
This game is a distant relative of "Survive!" which introduces a number of interesting twists.

You are Noah's helpers and are competing to bring the best variety of animals on board before the waters rise too much. The board and bits are very nice plastic, except for the animals which are cardboard (and whose bases tend to fray after a while). There is a big Ark sitting in the middle of the board that acts as a four-slotted piggy bank. A whole bunch of four-squares bases shaped like lightning bolts come in three colours and represent the cool (white), temperate (green) and hot (yellow) continents. Each of these bases can hold an animal. The bases and animals are deployed semi-randomly at the game outset by all players (this could need to be better constrained by the rules as the set-up has considerable consequences on the game's outcome); the restriction is that each continent must form a single land mass. Although the bases come in three heights, this is ignored in the rules.

The animals are colour-coded at their bases to indicate on which continent they belong. They all come in pairs. Some animals are predators, with a red background. You must deploy them so as to split the pairs. Your little boat has room for two animals on board. You cannot carry a predator and a prey at once, but all other combinations are OK.

You roll a six-sided die to move; on a one, a continent base sinks (is removed) instead; you do not move. The flooded base cannot have an animal on it, so if there are no floodable bases, you reroll. Otherwise, you must use the exact die roll to move with --diagonals aren't allowed. Once beside a continent, the die roll is used to send an "expedition" to catch an animal, which again must be reached by exact count. If the trail goes through another animal as well, you have the option of capturing it too. You go back to your two "berth" spaces beside the Ark to drop the animals off --this also gets you a free second move.

Once the last animal is removed from the land, the game ends instantly. All animals in transit (on board players' boats) are discarded and those in the Ark are scored. Prey are worth one, predators two. A pair of animals doubles in worth. If you have animals from each of the three continents, your score doubles.

As the Ark hides the animals dropped in its compartments, there is an element of memory involved --you should try to remember what each player has brought back so far to have an idea of who's in the lead.

The movement system is annoying because diagonals aren't allowed (so parity conservation is enforced) and actually makes the game drag a bit at the end; it'd suggest playing that exact rolls aren't required --or that diagonals are allowed.
mechanics: Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection

name: Obsession
description:
This is essentially 3D Nine Men's Morris with dice.

The board consists of three stacked surfaces, each looking like a progressively smaller Morris board. They are numbered from top to bottom.

The first play phase is placement. The dice dictate where you can appear. For example, a throw of one and two allows either one piece on board two, or two pieces on board one. Placements are mandatory. You may be forced to pass if no placement is possible.

Once all of your pieces are placed, you use the dice to move them (the transition turn may feature a placement and a move). Here too the dice dictate the moves: a throw of one and two allows either one piece to move on board two, or two pieces on board one, or one piece from board two to board one (or vice-versa). Moves are mandatory.

As in Morris, every time a three-piece alignment is formed (including vertical ones), this is a Mill and one opposing piece of the miller's choice is removed. Pieces in mills are protected. Multiple mills may be formed by a single move. You win by grinding the opponent down to two pieces.

The four-player game is a partnership game.

name: Pyramids and Mummies
description:
The box contains two different games: The Pyramid Game and The Mummy Game.

The Pyramid Game is a cooperative game in which players decipher messages in cryptic rebus writing and work together to build a pyramid. In The Mummy Game players compete to be the first to reach the mummy chamber by following the hieroglyphic path and interpreting rebuses.
categories: Ancient, Children's Game, Educational, Exploration, Puzzle
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Endangered
description:
With the increasing public concern over the growing number of endangered species and the inhumane treatment of animals, FAMILY GAMES has developed a line of board games, card games and puzzles in order to enlighten children of all ages to the animals’ predicament.

ENDANGERED is a realistic and fast paced game which makes participants aware of the plight of endangered species as they travel the world searching for reasons and remedies to aid their chosen animal.
categories: Adventure, Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Environmental
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Lecker Darwinismus
description:
Lecker Darwinismus is a satirical game where players play sets of 3 card on the table representing the people, politics, terrorists and the USA. By playing actions cards of one type higher, players try to win sets played by the other players. In the end, players score for card won from other players plus the sets collected they still own.

The illustrations of the game as well as the theme reminds of classic satirical comic books. First offering of this new designer/publisher

name: Bau auf!
description:
Bau auf (build it up)! Each player is a craftsman and builds his own house. But who can build a house exclusively with doors and shelves? Players are missing many kinds of building material, which has to be traded with the other house owners. Thus one exchanges a door for a heating or a plug socket for a tap. In that way the house is gradually finished. But the game takes a twist, as a player has to set a column in his house whenever he throws a six with the dice. With the fifth six one receives the ceiling plate of his house and continues to build on the first floor. Whenever one player has the first house finished (after the completion of the first floor) the game ends, but the finishing player does not necessarily have to have won. For each complete room the players get points, and whoever has the most points wins the game.

Bau auf! is set in the former GDR and gives a funny insight with which problems people had to cope in that time, when they wanted to build a house.

name: Grapevine
description:
From the game rules: Each player travels around the board, trying to collect different wines and bring them back to Norwich. Each wine is worth a different points value as shown on the card.

Multiple game end options: Race Against Time (game time limit, high score win) or the Connoisseurs' Collection (first one to collect a fixed number of wines from different regions.)

Games Workshop designed and published the game for Colman's Norwich Wine Shippers

name: Annie
description: Help Annie escape Miss Hannigan's Orphanage and reach a happing ending. Roll the special dice to move Annie forward and earn lucky stars. But watch out for Miss Hanningan. If she rolls against you and wins, Annie heads back to the orphanage and you give back some stars. Because when the orphans work together, earning lucky stars is easy. Whoever has the most stars at the end of the game in the winner.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Passport
description: Before you can scale Mount Everest or stroll the Champs Elysees you have to know where in the world they are. So get your bags packed and your travel documents in order. You are about to embark on a journey that could take you anywhere from Beijing to Santiago. And all you need is your passport. Just hop on your private jet and the talking computer will direct your travels, asking you questions about the region on which you have landed. Be the first to collect all your passport stamps, and you win.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Electronic, Transportation, Travel, Trivia
mechanics: Lose a Turn, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Golden Trivia Game: Disney Edition
description: The object is to be the first player to reach a predetermined number of points by answering Disney trivia questions. The questions are divided into six categories: Animated Films, Live-Action Films, Disney on TV, Disney Directory, Entertainment Worlds and The Disney Story.
categories: Card Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: International Insult
description:
The Game of Bare-Fanged Diplomacy.
True or False: Diplomats at the U.N. are dedicated to lofty causes like peace and world brotherhood.

If you answered 'True' you need this game. We'll cure that hopeless idealism - with riotous good fun!

If you said 'False', you want this game - where world-class brinksmanship is like a good ol' fashioned two-fisted domestic squabble. You're pretty good at that, right?

International Insult is today's new fast-playing, easy-to-learn, super-strategy, endless variation, tons o' fun card game!

You're a diplomat at the summit on Global Goodwill and Endangered Polyesters. Spies and saboteurs abound. Your goal: achieve lasting fame by elbowing past every rival from the "Vestibule of the Meek" all the way to the coveted "Mock Throne". You gain by insulting diplomats from other lands. War could result. True-to-life diplomacy ain't pretty - but 1,000 insults inside make it easy!

It's time to cut thru the substance and get right down to the froth. Time for a tempest in a teapot. It's time for International Insult.

Ages 10 to adult. 3-6 players.

Contents:

90 Insult Cards (6 different nationality suits, each with 15 insult topics)
Three types of wild cards ('kindling'): 6 Saboteur, 6 Spy, 12 Rude Waiter, and 6 This Means War
6 National I.E. nameplates
Play Board
6 Color-coded Movers
6 six-sided Dice
Rules
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: NFL Armchair Quarterback
description:
From the back of the box:

NFL Armchair Quarterback lets everybody play along with the action of a football game, on TV or at the stadium.
Score points by guessing the plays before they happen.
Match your knowledge of football strategy against the players, coaches, and everyone with you as you try to predict:
Will they complete the pass?
Will they run left, or run right?
Will the defense force a turnover?
Or sack the quarterback?
NFL Armchair Quarterback is the first game that lets you play along with the action of a real football game-professional, college, even high school-on TV or live at the stadium. A must gift for football fans of all ages.
Comes complete with: 4 playing boards, roster pad, scoreboard, 6 styluses, scoring pen, and set of rules.
No television set included.

name: Rebels
description: In this game one player controls 16 rebel soldiers and the other player controls the loyalist general, a single piece. The rebels attempt to capture the general by occupying two points adjacent to the general on a straight line. The general captures rebels by moving into such a position, resulting in the two rebels being removed from the board.
publishers: (Public Domain), ABRA, Fratelli Fabbri Editori  (Fabbri Editore)

name: Eloise Game
description:
From the box:

There is absolutely so much to do. We must, must get ready for the party tonight. But where are Skipperdee and Emily and all the rest of our party guests?

From the rulebook:

OBJECT OF THE GAME: Players work together to find all the party guests and take them to the penthouse party room before the clock reaches 6. The party begins with songs, jokes and games performed by the players.

name: Fantasy Island
description:
From the publisher:
Welcome to Fantasy Island! Want to be a Star Ship Captain or a Fashion Model? Maybe a Millionaire? These are just three of the twelve terrific fantasies you can try for. Mr. Roarke and Tattoo will be your hosts...but look out...they've got surprises planned. You may set out for Adventure Valley but wind up on Misfortune Mountain! You can be sure you'll visit all of the island as you race to collect kisses, money and adventure awards you'll need to make it to the main house and become the winner. It's a fantasy come true!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: China-Vietnam War
description: Ultra rare Chinese wargame from the 80s concerning the Chinese invasion of Vietnam 1979. As far as the info I have goes, the rules are all in Chinese and this game does not have a CRT and combat is card driven.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hexagon Grid

name: Alternative Sekigahara
description:
SGB-3 Alternative Sekigahara (1983) (JPY 1800)
The first six pages cover the events leading up to the battle, while the next 12 pages cover the rules of the game and the rest are a detailed description of the participants involved. The map contains four 11x17” pieces, making one whole map together. The map does not use full-hex terrain symbols but does include a vast array of set-up boxes for the different clans involved.
As its name implies, this is a alternative history of the Battle of Sekigahara in 1600. The counters have a combat and movement value with some of the troops having their combat number in parenthesis (the musket-armed troops I bet, but there does seen to be a lot of them). There is a neat time spiral in the middle of a roster page (what is recorded there, I have no idea), as the CRT is a ‘push-style’ one, with the results of ‘AD’, ‘AR’ ‘Eng’, ‘DR’ and ‘DD”. Apparently the game lasts twelve turns, but there is no indication of turn length, map or unit scale.

name: Die drei ??? und der Poltergeist
description:
Deduction card game based on the Three Investigators stories. The 3 ??? are Jupiter, Bob and Pete (in the German version - Justus, Bob and Peter). There are 3 types of suspect card, place card and mystery card and 3 cards which show all 9, plus 3 detective cards (Justus, Bob and Peter), 4 player pieces and the gameboard.

Guess the gameplay could be described as Cluedo meets Go Fish!

name: Ki-Yo
description: Teams of two players, each using a pointed rod, must cooperate to lift a flat-ended rod from the table and place it on a delicately balanced set of platforms without dropping the rod, knocking other rods off, or upsetting the balance of the platforms.

name: MASH Game
description: Race to obtain the Jeep and/or the Helicopter, then rush to the Finish space under the Tent to receive their transfer orders. The first player to reach the Tent with the Jeep or Helicopter (or both) gets a transfer home and wins the game.
categories: Humor, Korean War, Medical, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Archieball
description: A strategy game where players are dealt hands of cards containing specific patterns, and a central trough of white and dark colored balls sits in the middle of the table between all players. Each player on their turn is allowed to lift one ball out of the tray and place it on either end of the line. Because the tray is slightly curved, all the remaining balls bunch together. Players try to win pattern cards by moving the wooden balls to match the card pattern.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition

name: Space Rummy
description: Forty-eight card deck rummy game in which each card has a factoid about the corresponding planet, sol, comet, or asteroids. Seven card hands, play to 100 points. Asteroids are wild. Unusual mechanism is use of comets to "crash" into one of an opponents cards placed face down. If a planet is hit, that card must be discarded.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Space Exploration, Trivia
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Life Begins at 40
description:
From the box

LIFE BEGINS AT 40 - Survive until you're 40. Then it's fun all the way in this exciting new board game!

SURVIVE UNTIL YOU'RE 40?
In the first part of this fun-packed board game each player has to reach the great age of 40. Along then way you'll be collecting all those responsibilities like kids, house, car and mother-in-law...and paying for their upkeep, whilst trying to maintain a cash balance - and a sense of humor. The quicker you reach 40 the less responsibilities you'll take on!

THEN IT'S FUN ALL THE WAY!
The second part of the game is a race to early retirement, the first player there being the winner. But you can't win however while you still have the responsibility of a Bank Loan, Mortgage or kids - so they'll have to go!

name: Dallas in a Box
description: A Monopoly clone from Late For The Sky; this version is based in Dallas, Texas. It has spaces such as Sonny Bryan's, Big Tex, Farmer's Market, Reunion Tower, Southfork Ranch, Dallas Theater Center, and West End. The tokens include a pretzel, heart, boot, football, star, and armadillo. Cards include local events and staples of life in Dallas.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Playoff Baseball
description: Home team rolls the pitching die, recording balls and strikes as in normal baseball. If "hit ball" appears, visiting team rolls the hitting die which may indicate a ground out, fly out, foul ball, error, or fair ball. Fair ball means the batter then rolls the results die to see how many bases are gained by the hit. Outs and base runners are recorded on the small wood board with pegs. The small plastic case contains the rules, wood board, pegs, and the wood game dice.

name: California Dreams
description:
From the back of the box:

Be the one to help the "California Dreams" reach the top of the charts. . . and win!

Jake, Tiffany, Matt, Samantha, Tony, and Sly are in the garage making music and writing lyrics. But they need your help to reach their dream: to rise to the Top of the Charts!

You can do that by landing on special spaces and scoring points!

Secret Dreams cards reveal the band's dreams. Then you get to select a dream of your choice. If your friends match you, everyone can score!

California Dreams cards can be good: score points when Tony buys new drums. Or not so good: When Tony loses both drum sticks, that's a BUMMER point.

Lucky Star cards can tell you that someone in the band thinks you're a great dancer! Guess who it is. (Is it Jake? Maybe Matt?) If the spinner matches your guess, you collect points for them and help them move closer to their dream!

name: Imagine That! The Puzzling Memory Matching Game! Under the Sea Edition
description: You'll need a sharp eye and a keen mind to make a match from the sea of cards. Each match gives you another piece of the picture, but beware of the your opponents - they are trying to solve the same puzzle! Who will be the first to collect all nine pieces and win? Hidden among the cards lie rewards and perilous dangers. Search for the elusive "Treasure Chest" and steal a card from any player or hook the "Big Catch" and discover two extra cards. But watch out for sharks! A "Shark" card means you'll have to put a piece back!

name: Giro Binaca
description:
This game is another cycling race game.

The race track is formed out of 15 cards which are laid one after another. There are 10 'incident' cards which are put face down on the table, and each player also has 14 movement cards, on which there are depicted 4 possible actions and one or more arrows.

The players choose a movement card simultaneously and put them together. The arrow(s) on the card of player 1 determine the actions player B has to take and vice-versa.

First to finish wins the game.

Originally released by Edizioni Giochi Lasco from Milan, 1952, this game was re-released in 1993 by Edizioni Lo Scarabeo from Torino.

name: Antipod
description:
Antipod is a connection game with unequal goals played on the two halves of a sphere.

Antipod is played on two equally sized hex boards, typically with six cells per side. The board is set up with a black piece in the center of each half, forming Black’s antipodal goals, and white pieces placed at the six corners of each board, forming White’s handicap pieces.

Black wins by forming a chain of black pieces between the antipodal goals of each board half. White wins by preventing a Black win. This amounts to completing a cycle of white pieces around at least one of Black’s antipodal goals. Exactly one player must win.

name: Smullers
description:
The map of this children's game shows a spiral parcours. On the fields there are six different animals and their favourite fodder shown. The cards show the animals printed on the map while eating. The pieces are big wooden pawns. The kids roll and move. If they land on a field with an animal that's eating and they have the card with their preferred food on the hand they roll again otherwise it's the next players turn. The first player arriving at the end wins.

A lot like game of goose. On the board there are drawn several animals, all with their favorite piece of food. You can use cards to move faster if you land on an animal of which you have a card. (for example: if you land on a monkey you can use the monkey card to move to the next monkey) You start the game with four cards, but you can gain additional cards during the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Mál og menning, Otto Maier Verlag

name: Holiday Shuffle
description:
From the box:

Bet you didn't know that Sibling Appreciation Day was in the same month as Mother's Day. And National Relaxation Day is the day before Joke Day, with Watermelon Day two days after. In this game of fun days and holidays you must take the dates you're dealt and rearrange them in chronological order. So plan your strategy and pick your day. You may even find a new holiday as you play.

name: Tic Tac Twice
description: Each player places a playing piece on the same picture on each board. The goal is to place four playing pieces in a line across, up, down or on a diagonal on one board. Players have to play on two boards at once, so a good move on one may not be a good move on the other.

name: Disney Princess Gowns & Crowns Game
description:
From the manufacturer:

Like all Princesses, these four want to go to the ball. But only one will get to. Which will it be? Cinderella, Belle, Aurora or Snow White? Help these Princesses find their gowns, crowns, purses and bouquets then hurry back to their castles to get dressed up before the Prince arrives. The first Princess dressed and back to their castle will be the queen of the ball and live happily ever after! No reading required to play.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Magna Force
description: A balance game in which players must roll a die and remove a pillar from the tower that matches the dies' color. The pillars are removed by using a magnetic rod. Play continues until the tower collapses. The player who made it collapse gets no points, and the others add up the pillars they successfully removed, tallying up their scores.
publishers: Discovery Toys, Kod Kod, Regev Games

name: Expert: Um Desafio Inteligente
description:
The game has 260 cards each containing one topic (e.g. major American countries) and six solutions (e.g. Brazil; Mexico; USA; Canada; Peru; Argentina) each one represented in one color. A hidden die with six colors is rolled and, depending on the color you or your team gets (which only the opponent player or team knows) you have to ask questions to the other player or team to discover the correct answer, determined by the colored die.
As more as your answers are correct the more you walk on the board. The game is finished when you complete the board.

name: X is for uneXplained
description: Answer questions on UFO sightings, Psychic phenomena, Out of body experiences or Alien abduction. Be the first to collect cards from all the different categories and return to Earth to win. A different take on the Trivial Pursuit theme for all those who believe the truth really is out there.

name: Who's on First?
description:
The hilarious guessing game based on the famous all-time classic comedy routine.

Game players try to guess where their opponents have placed their players on the baseball diamond playing board, and the player guessing the locations of all players in the fewest number of guesses is the winner.
categories: Humor, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Sports

name: It-DAH-gan
description: There are 60 cards with ranks from 1 to 15, quantities ranging from two 1's up to six 15's; 15 of the cards are worth a point each. All cards are dealt out. The player receiving the 15 marked "star-DAH" begins by playing any number of 15's. Each player in turn then either passes or plays the same amount of cards as the last set played, but with a lower rank. When all but one players have passed, the last one to play takes all the cards played and starts a new trick with one or more cards of the same rank. The round continues until all players are out of cards; then point cards taken are scored. The first player to go out begins the next round by getting the two best (i.e., lowest-numbered) cards from the last player to go out, giving any two in return; likewise, the second to go out gets the best card from the next-to-last to go out. (With three players, the first and last to go out exchange one card.) Play continues until one player reaches 50 points.

name: It's a Knockout
description:
Based on the hit BBC television program of the same name, 'It's a Knockout', versions of which ran concurrently in countries across Europe. Contestants competed in silly obstacle course type games, usually wearing equally silly costumes. Regional heats culminated in the winners representing their countries in international contests known as "Jeux Sans Frontières" (Games Without Frontiers). The board game was originally created in Britain in 1974 and became the Australian Toy Association's game of the year in 1986.

Players move around a playing board until they land on one of the 'games' that include variants on tiddlywinks, target shooting, blow football and bowling. The position that players finish in the sub-games determines the amount of points that they receive. Each player has a "joker" that can be played before any one game and they get double points for that game.

The player with the highest number of points wins.

The game is designed for children, but is enjoyable when played by adults that remember the television program.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Croner, Denys Fisher Toys, Harbutt's Ltd., Majora, Orli Jouet, Papita, Paradigm Games Ltd, Strawberry Fayre

name: Zitadelle
description:
The board of this game shows a grid of straight and diagonal lines. 39 of 60 intersection can be occupied a playing piece, the others can only be used as temporary stopover.

Each player has 3 tin figures: 1 knight, 1 lansquenet (mercenary soldier) and 1 archer. Object of the game is the capture of the opposing citadel and holding it during one turn.

All three playing pieces can make a move over 2 intersections during a turn - changing directions is allowed. The lansquenet (mercenary soldier) can only move on diagonal lines, the archer only on straight lines, but the knight can move on all lines.

name: Six Men's Morris
description:
"Six Men's Morris is played in the same way as Nine Men's Morris, with two changes, the first is that each player has six men and the second is that it is played on [a modified] board (which is similar to that used by Nine Men's Morris, except it lacks the outer set of lines)."

Variation: Five Men's Morris is played on the same modified board, but using 5 men on a side instead of six.

name: Schöne weite Welt
description:
There are six boards showing the 6 continents (Australia also shows Indonesia and Papua New Guinea). The boards show the maps of the areas. With each boards comes a set of tiles that can be placed on to the map to form a grip. These tiles show a nice drawn version of the map in front (with some scenes and tourist attractions of the area) and on the back there is a reference to cities or other landmarks corresponding to the tiles place on the board.
Each player now gets a board and tiles, shuffle the tiles and start to be the first to complete the grid. If you do this by the front side (puzzling) or by the backside (looking for the places and using the front only to see where its correct) is up to you. Player finishing first wins. Of course, everybody should play with every continent.
And of course, quite a lot of the countries have changed since this game was published.

name: Animal Smackers
description:
The board has air-holes in it and a plastic animal piece is placed over each one. Each air-hole is connected to a hole around the edge of the board. Using a small pump, players take turns to blow air into one of these edge holes, hoping it will correspond to an animal shown on one of the cards in their hand. The pump will cause one of the animals to jump upwards. If the animal matches a card in your hand, you can grab it and claim that animal. The winner is the player to collect the most matching animals.

For ages 6-12.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Memory
publishers: MB Giochi, MB Jeux, MB Spellen, Milton Bradley

name: 1 vs. 100 Card Game
description:
Based on the NBC game show of the same name.

2 Players - One is a contestant and the other is host. The contestant answers trivia questions. The host draws from the mob deck and records the contestant's winnings and mob players out on a right answer. The contestant must decide to quit or play on, because a wrong answer will cost the contestant everything. They switch roles after one game. (Note: A contestant can play up to 12 questions, even if the contestant eliminates 100 mob members.)

Multi-player - Same as above, except the following: extra players are the mob, the mob doesn't have to answer the questions, and they split the money from the contestant when the contestant gives a wrong answer. Game ends when everyone plays each role at least once.

Either way, the person with the most money wins.

Contains 400 questions, mob deck, and score pad.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: The Jumbo Book of Board Games
description:
