This book of games is 30 pages long, and is a hardback. The dimensions are 250mm (10") by 355mm (14"). There are fifteen separate boards, including a Chess / Checkers board in the front papers and a Backgammon board in the end papers

John Astrop has written a short introduction, outlining the games he has chosen for this book and categorizing them in four groups:
Easy Race Games (for small kids)- Ludo, Fire! Fire! (Snakes and Ladders), Steeplechase and Dragon.
Harder Race Games (for older games) - Palm Tree, Shunting, Jackpot and Space Race.
Position Games (dependent on strategy alone)- Checkers, Chess, Nine Men's morris, Five Field Kono, Asalto
Wargames (strategy, imagination and luck) - Chess, Spychase, Warlord and Backgammon.

Palm Tree is a combination of Ludo and Snakes and Ladders, with a nice art deco board.

Space Race, Shunting, Warlord, Spychase and Jackpot appear to be original games. The others are either classic games or re-themed roll-and-move games.

Space Race is a bigger scale version of Ludo, requiring the players to roll the right numbers to build their rockets before starting on the trip to the Green Planet. There are various squares on the way that give different results as you land on them. The only strategy comes in deciding which piece to move.

In Shunting players again roll and move, but have to pick up four trucks before returning to the start. Players have only one train each, and can only move in one direction in a turn, but can then change direction on the next direction, as if they were trains passing through points. Trains block each other, although they do not get bigger with extra trucks on.

Warlord is a capture game with a pre-Raphaelite design. Players have 4 pieces starting at castles on the corners on the board, and can move any one of these 4 in turn. Landing exactly on an enemy piece captures it, and the captured piece can then be moved back to the castle and imprisoned. Players can release captive pieces through the enchanted forest or lake. A single piece can capture more than one enemy piece, but if that pile is recaptured, all friendly pieces go free.

Spychase is similar to Scotland Yard, with no hidden movement. The spy player attempts to steal a set of plans by rolling and landing on them, then escaping to the airport or docks. The police players cannot capture the spy until he has taken the plans. At that point the police player then tries to block in the spy player so that he cannot move his full roll.

In Jackpot, the 2 players move their pieces up a fruit machine the full number rolled, but can only move a piece when the fruit under the piece moved is shown on the row of 6 fruit that the piece arrives on. If no forward moves can be made, a piece must be moved down the dice roll instead. Once all three pieces are at the final squares, a player wins.
categories: Book, Dice, Medieval, Racing, Space Exploration, Spies/Secret Agents, Trains
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Monopoly: Chelsea Football Club Edition
description: The classic boardgame takes on a new shape in this Chelsea edition. Featuring stars from the current squad alongside heroes from Chelsea's illustrious past and two of the club's greatest managers, this version of Monopoly requires players to accumulate wealth by aquiring stands and stadiums. Community Chest and Chance cards are replaced by Home and Away cards. It's an absolute must for all Chelsea fans!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Coventry
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Coventry, in the United Kingdom.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Monopoly: Thunderbirds
description:
Thunderbirds to the rescue with 6 collectable die-cast vehicles! Complete with Evil Hood mover for optional play.
Join the Tracy family, Lady Penelope and all your other favourites. Race around the board on an International Rescue mission. Buy and sell vehicles, characters and locations. For extra fun you can add the special Evil Hood gameplay. Stay cool under pressure – may the richest player win!
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Thunder Bay On Board
description:
[from back of box]

The "City by the Bay takes pride in being a place for all seasons, where there is fun for all ages, all year round. Thunder Bay is unique, rich in character and culture - recently named Canada's Cultural Capital. Nature and history have formed many of our traditional tourist attractions, but there are still plenty of secret places and undiscovered highlights to explore.

name: That's Right, That's Wrong!
description: That's Right, That's Wrong! is an educational/family question-and-answer game for kids by author Alan Katz. Main goal of the game is to win points by providing the WRONG answer to a trivia question (out of a choice of two answers). Each set includes 298 multiple-choice trivia questions (plus 16 extra-hard special questions). Length of game varies with number of players. Game can be played solo (to see how fast one gets to 3 points) or in groups of any number.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Party Game, Trivia

name: Whirlpool
description:
NOTE: This game board is included in Brian Love's "Play the Game" (1978). While correctly presenting the theme of the game, Love simplified the rules considerably, removing much of the natural "whirlpool" action and reducing each player's pieces from two to one.

Whirlpool is a 2-4 player game from British games maker Chad Valley and functions as an inverted race game: the last player to reach the center (the Vortex) wins. Like Goose games and most other simple spiral race games, there is no strategy, only luck. However, it is fast-paced and fun, especially for kids.

Each player has two pieces of their color and must start them on the track on their first two turns. From then on, they must always move their rear-most piece. If a piece lands on another piece (of any color) they must move it forward an equivalent number of spaces to their roll, which can set off a huge chain reaction if one piece lands on another piece, which lands on another piece, etc. This simulates the "pull" of the whirlpool.

Four "Reserve" spots set just before the Vortex function as last-minute reprieves, with different actions depending on whether the Reserve matches your color or not. On leaving the Reserves, pieces are flung into the Vortex - a dramatic ending! When all others have been sucked into the Vortex, the remaining piece is the survivor and wins the game.
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Union Pacific-opoly
description:
from the publisher's website:

A game for train lovers across America!

More than 140 years ago, President Abraham Lincoln signed the Pacific Railroad Act. With this historic stroke of a pen, the stage was set for Union Pacific to open the American West to settlers and, in the process, connect a continent. The transcontinental route heralded the Industrial Revolution and modernized transportation, turning the grueling, six-month, $1,000 journey from New York to San Francisco into a week long trip costing a mere $70.

It took an army of 20,000 men, working 12 to 16 hours a day, seven days a week, for six years, to connect America east to west by rail. It was a remarkable feat, as the system was built primarily by hand. With the driving of the Golden Spike on May 10, 1869, the route was complete, and a vast, largely unpopulated region was poised for growth.

Today, the 50,000 men and women of Union Pacific still connect America’s communities, transporting the raw materials and finished goods that keep our economy, and our country, moving.

Tokens include: Railroad crossing signal; Engineer’s cap, Golden Spike, Caboose, Locomotive, and a Lantern.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Sportz Dice: Football
description: Dice game of American football. Features 1 kicking die; 2 offense dice (1 run; 1 pass); 2 defense dice (1 run defense; 1 pass defense). Players roll off to determine results of plays, keeping track of field position mentally or on paper. Follows rules of football.

name: Racing Worms
description: Racing Worms boldly states that it is "A Little one's First Game", with no reading skills required. Each player controls one flexible 3-D worm (complete with hat and eyes), with a peg at each end which fit into holes in the board. On your turn you spin a spinner which gives two numbers ranging from 1 to 3- you move the front peg one number and the back peg the other - subject of course to the bendiness of your worm! Each player advances along their own track from their plant pot to an apple tree. The tracks do crossover so worms do get in each other's way. First to the apple tree wins!

name: Basket Case
description:
This a game billed as the Headband Hoop game; it has 20 balls in 2 colors. You put the basket on your head and either you toss your colored balls up an into the basket or your opponent tries to get his colored balls into the basket on your head. (Your opponent has the advantage of a better perspective, while you have control of the basket since it is on your head.)

Played by switching off in rounds.

name: UNO: Eragon
description:
Another Uno variation. Relive the magical story of Eragon with 112 custom cards featuring Brom, Galbatorix, Arya and the rest of the epic cast.

WHAT MAKES THIS DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: Zar’roc card and rule:

When you play this card, you choose another player and view their entire hand. You can then take any card from the other player's hand and, in return, give them any card from your own hand. You choose the cards to be traded. You then determine the color to be played in the next round (any color including the color in play before the Zar'Roc card was laid down). The Zar'Roc card can be played as your last card allowing you to go out.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Monopoly: Horse Lover's Edition
description: Monopoly with a horse theme that involves buying up your favorite horse breeds. For 2 to 6 players aged 8 and up, it comes with 6 pewter tokens (boot, apple, horse, trailer, horse shoe, and saddle).
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Barbapapa: Ett kul förvandlings-spel
description: The Barbapapa-family are on a picnic and they come across different places where Barbapapa and Barbamama needs to transform themselves so the children can pass. On the road they encounter a lot of garbage which they pick up. It is important to clean up and take care of nature. Everyone helps with the picking up but the one who has picked up the most and transformed it into flowers wins.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Environmental, Novel-based, Racing
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Martian Gunslinger
description:
"In the western areas of Mars, where men are men and the horses love them for that, is the setting for our tale of power, control and a really nice peanut butter and jelly sandwich. This is where the land is untamed, the people are wild and lawlessness reigns. Do you have what it takes to make your mark on this dusty land and call yourself a true Martian Gunslinger?"

The entire game is found at the Icehouse Games Wiki

Game System

Icehouse Pieces


Design Competitions

Ice Game Design Competition - Entry in 7th Competition

name: Conni im Kindergarten
description:
In this game, Conni and her friends go for the first time to the Kindergarten.
Everyone has to hang his or her coat on a special coathanger, that is marked with a special symbol.

All players try to find the 8 images that make up the coathangers in the classroom by selecting a card and flipping it.
If the image revealed is the same as one of the missing images on that player's card, then he or she can take the card and place it on the card.
The first player to find all 8 images for his card wins the game.

name: Top Dog
description:
This is a game intended to teach children about dogs. The rulebook has a general information section on dogs, including what meaning of different behavior in dogs, what an angry/scared dog looks like, and how to teach children about dogs. Sometimes, the rules instruct the players to act dog like (barking, rolling etc.)

The game includes a board with an imaginary village printed on it, 4 playing pieces (dogs) on plastic bases, a deck of cards which represent 24 breeds of dog - some of which are "leaders" - and one 6-sided die. All of the dogs belong to families living in the village, identified by the first letter of a dog's name.

The game is subdivided into 6 different variants:

Game #1: 2-4 players, 10-15 minutes. This is described as a "warm-up" game, the board is not used. Players are "leader" dogs trying to gather their own pack by drawing cards blindly. The player with the most dogs after all non-leader breeds have been drawn wins.

This game also has a solitaire variant.

Game #2: 2-4 players, 30 minutes. Again, the players represent leaders trying to gather a pack. This is accomplished by visiting the 4 houses in the village to pick up dogs, then take them to the dog park.

This game has rule variants to make it a bit more challenging.

Game #3: 2-4 players, 20-30 minutes. Again, the players represent leaders, but this time they already have a pack. The players must return the dogs in their pack to the families, then find a way to their own house.

Game #4: 3 or more players, 10-20 minutes. This time the players must co-operate to gather a pack and take it to the dog park, playing against time (die rolls).

This game also has a solitaire variant.
Game #5: 2-4 players, 20-30 minutes. This is basically a version of the Game of Authors - players are trying to complete series of dogs belonging to the same family.

Game #6: Solitaire, variable playing time. The aim is to rescue dogs from the kennel by pairing up the kennel dogs with free dogs.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Five Little Monkeys Jumping on the Bed Card Game
description:
A card game for 2 or more players Ages 3 and up.

The first player to make the target number number of pairs is the winner. A player can only match one type of pairs throughout the game; either happy monkeys or sad monkeys.

Based on the popular book series by Eileen Christelow.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Educational, Novel-based, Number

name: Cars Champion Checkers
description:
This is the classic game of Checkers but it includes 3 enhanced gameplay options where kids can use special abilities attributed to various pieces associated with the Cars characters.

There are 4 ways to play:
Normal checkers - Plays with standard checker rules.
King Conflict - When a checker is "kinged", flip it over to reveal its special Cars skill.
Power Challenge - A head-to-head challenge where all the Cars characters are revealed and you must decide when to use their special skills.
Ultimate Race - You know which spaces your Cars characters are hidden on, but does your opponent?

Each side has 7 pieces with stickers of different Cars characters on them, normally hidden from view by a flip-up "hood ornament mover" mechanism, along with a number of plain checkers pieces without stickers. The Cars characters represented include:
Lightning McQueen (Turbo Jump power)
Sally (Caution Cone power)
Guido (Repair power)
Mater (Tow Rope power)
King (Speed power)
Doc (Drafting power)
Luigi (Fender Rub power)
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Bamse 5:an
description:
Children´s game featuring Swedish cartoon bear Bamse and his friends. The 56 cards are evenly distributed between players. In order, each player turns up the top card of his/her deck and plays it on the table. Each card features 1, 2, 3 or 4 pictures of one of the characters. When a player´s card adds the fifth picture of the same character to the table, that player picks up all the cards from the table and adds them to the bottom of his deck. Then the next player plays his top card.

As players lose their last card they are eliminated form play. The winner is the last player with cards remaining.

A very simple card game without decision making, much like War and similar games.

Contents
56 cards
2 additional cards with rules
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Monopoly: Coburg
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Coburg, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Bear Game
description:
The Bear Game contains five dice, with a bear replacing the "1" on each. Players take 4 turns (representing the four seasons) rolling all five dice trying to obtain the highest point total. Players score points in the first three seasons only when one bear is rolled and score in the last season (winter) only if no bears are rolled.
The instructions also include "bear facts."

name: Hirnakrobaten
description:
Mind Acrobats: The players must find a way to the goal through the mind paths of the game board as quickly as possible.

Edition Spielbox #85 - from issue 5/2008

name: Monopoly: Brest
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of the city of Brest, in France.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Rukshuk:  Pagota
description:
Pagota is the sequel to the award-winning stacking game, Rukshuk.

The goal of Pagota is to build tall towers using stones valued at 1 through 5 points. At any time a player may bow out and take the sum amount of their points, rather than risk building their tower higher.

name: Spøkelsesspillet
description: Players take turns moving ghosts in a ghost house. The player who first move their ghost out of the house is the winner, but beware: ghosts may change player during the course of the game.

name: Shoving Match: Ring-Out Championship
description:
Shoving Match is a quick game between two players. All you have to do is knock your opponent out of the ring. It starts out simply enough, but before you know it, the game turns into an incredible mental exercise as both players try to outmaneuver each other, remember each others' patterns, and keep their opponent guessing.

This game was designed for the DIY Print-and Play dice contest found here:http://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/405493
categories: Bluffing, Dice, Fighting, Print & Play, Sports
mechanics: Memory, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Infecta
description:
From the rules:

Infecta is the game of cell survival. A life-and-death struggle between single-celled organisms involves two players in a rapid action contest of dice and strategy. Each opponent attempts to inflict the foreign cell by exposing it to a carrier virus while defensively contracting its own cell wall and shifting its nucleus out of danger. As in life, fate is decided by aggression, instinct and luck.

Description:

In Infecta each player controls a cell made up of a nucleus piece and many cell wall pieces. Each player also controls six virions (virus particles) which can destroy other pieces; the object is to destroy the opponent's nucleus, all the opponent's virions, or all the opponent's cell walls.

On a turn the active player rolls two dice and moves pieces accordingly. Virions can only move in straight lines, and each one must use the full amount rolled on one die. The other pieces can split dice and move in any combination of directions desired. Rolling doubles entitles a player to another turn (though this cannot be repeated) and also to restore a destroyed virion under certain conditions.

name: Coast to Coast
description:
This is a 1922 game by the Canada Games Company of Toronto, Ontario. A very colorful map, but of Canada and the top of the United States. It is a fairly typical roll and move game. The smaller 1st version, uses metal rail spike pieces that are actually jabbed into the board (they are called tacks in the instructions) to mark player movement.

The later 2nd version (Copp Clark Game) uses plastic pieces and a larger version of the map. The later edition instructions still retain the 1922 Copyright of the original game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Canada Games Company Lmt., Copp Clark Publishing Company

name: Besser Essen
description:
"Besser Essen" is a board game based upon a german TV show about healthier eating. The two to four players have to arrange a healthy food plan for one week, including three meals a day, snacks and drinks.

Each eatable item is represented by a card and has a point value and a fat value. The point value is good for the scoring, while the fat value is important for planing the daily dishes. Each day only allows 15 fat points in total for the meals, the snacks and the drinks.

To make the game more interesting you cannnot only play cards onto your own meal plan, you can put cards to the meals of your opponents, too.

After each day, the players get points based on there meal decisions and after one week the game is over.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Monopoly: ProRail
description: The famous monopoly game made exclusive for the company ProRail. A Ducth railway company. The streets are replaced by the most important stations.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Knobelschatz
description:
Luck-based game for children. Each player has a treasure card. The active player rolls three dice, and for each roll of

1: takes a card from the left neighbor
2: takes a card from the right neighbor
3: takes a card from the draw pile
4: takes a card from any player

If a dog symbol is rolled, the active player takes a dog piece which protects his/her cards. When the draw pile is used up, everyone flips over their treasure cards, and the player who finds the largest combined treasure is the winner.

name: Balyna Magnetic Super Soccer
description:
Soccer game produced by Balyna (Toogood and Jones of Whitstable in Kent) in the United Kingdom during the 1950s.

Game consists of:

- playing board
- four adjustable metal legs to be inserted at each corner of the board
- two plastic goals
- two plastic playing rods with a magnet at the end, one each of red and blue
- four plastic players with magnets on their bases, usually 2 red and 2 blue players
- a small plastic ball
- rules

Each player has a magnet on the bottom of its base, which was manipulated by a rod (with a magnet on the end of it) which went under the table. The magnets of each team are polarised in reverse, so you cannot move your opponents players with your rod. The rod is used to drag your players across the board, thus allowing you to push the ball around.

The game board is a smooth hardboard surface, marked out with a football pitch, and a basic raised surround to stop the ball going out of play.

Magnetic football is excellent fun - a splendid ice breaker at parties and games evenings - and requires a surprising amount of skill. If you move the players too fast, or use too much power, then it is very easy to leave either the player or the ball behind! Although you cannot control your opponent's players, your reversed magnet can be used to flip them over.

name: UNO: Kung Fu Panda
description: Join Po & the Martial Arts Masters for an UNO card game showdown! Challenge any opponent to a Kickin' Battle with the exclusive card & rule! And Don't forget to yell UNO when you are about to become the Chosen One!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Dice War
description:
Dice war is a two player game played with 33 six sided dice in a similar version of the classic card game WAR.

The object of the game is for a single player to capture his opponents 16 dice.

There is a single die that is also used as a "Miss" roll. This miss roll comes into play and makes the dice odds a little different on how you would actually capture the opponents die. (This is all explained in the Word Document Rules).

This is a simple but fun game for folks who like rolling dice.

You can also substitute the type of dice you play with for other variations of the game.

name: Das Super Mario Spiel
description:
The game's theme is based on the GameBoy Version of Nintendo's "Super Mario Land" from 1989.

Story
Princess Daisy of Sarasaland was kidnapped by the monster Tatanga. Super Mario and Luigi travel through the kingdoms of Birabuto, Muda and Easton to reach the kingdom of Tschai where the princess is held. The first player who reaches Tschai and beats the evil Tatanga and the other players frees the princess and wins the game.

Contents:

1 Board
8 Figures in 4 different Colors
1 Dice
60 Cards


Flow of Play
Each player has two figures (Mario and Luigi). Players roll a die to determine how far one of their figures can move. The board has some special places like traps and questionmarks. Traps cast the figure some spaces back. Questionmarks let the player draw one of the cards. On these player may find enemies which can be fought by a die roll or special items which let them avoid traps or enemies. The player who reaches the final place with both figures has to defeat the last enemy and the other players by rolling the dice.

name: HouseBoy the Board Game
description:
In this fun and frisky board game made by gays for gays, each player takes on the part of one of rich old man Jonathan Glamcock's household employees. Jonathan only has 9 days left to live and he is willing to leave his entire fortune to the houseboy who proves most dutiful.

Of course, the boys are all young and randy and have to find a way to balance doing their chores to earn points and getting busy with their peers without getting caught on the cameras the old man has installed throughout the mansion.

Gameplay is easy, quick and fun. On your turn, you must move to a different room in the mansion and either do CHORES (rolling dice to place cubes for points) or HOOKUP with another houseboy in order to gain more cubes if you're running low. You keep rolling your dice until your boy rolls a tired icon and ends his chore or a camera icon that ends the hookup.

The player with the most cubes on the board at the end of the game will earn Jonathan Glamcock's entire fortune!
categories: Dice, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Kreuz und quer durch Europa
description: In this game the players travel through europe from city to city answering questions about the destination city to collect the city cards. They have to travel on different vehicles like plane or ship according to the route they take.

name: Buzz Off!
description:
Electronic game that is a parlour game version of something you might see at a fairground.
A twisting metal rod lies between two plastic holders. A player must take a device with a small metal loop and move it along the rod without touching metal against metal. If you set the buzzer off, you have failed and the next player can try.
The most successful attempts wins after a pre determined time limit runs out.

name: Lettres Rummikub
description:
Word Rummikub, with cards instead of tiles. Players use their hand of cards to make words Rummy-style. In addition to laying new words, a player may rearrange any word to make a new word with the same letters plus at least one new letter.

Points are scored for words but if you have more than one word in front of you, only the longest counts (1 point per letter).

The winner is the one with the most points after a set number of deals.

name: Bluff
description:
Card game with a lot of bluffing involved.

Rules (as written on the back of the box)

The object of the game is, by bluffing, to be the first player to dispose of all his cards.
The cards are shuffled and dealt to all the players. The player to the left of the dealer begins by placing one card face down onto the centre of the table and names its picture, for example saying "flower". The next player puts a card on top of it also saying "flower", this is when the bluffing comes in. Each player in his turn has to claim to lay the same picture as that which was started with whether he has one or not. Play continues in this way until the call comes back to the player who started the round. He calls again the name of the picture he started with and lays a card. This is the end of that round. The next player starts a new round by placing a card on top of the cards already on the table (if any) and names the same or a different picture.
Any time a player thinks another player is bluffing he may challenge him. If he is in fact bluffing and has not laid the card he said, he has to pick up all the cards on the table and add them to his hand. If he was not bluffing the challenger has to pick up all the cards.

name: Im Märchenland
description:
Objective: be the first reaching target space 'E'
- simple 'Roll & Move' game/ moving by turns -
each player moves his/her meeple according die roll
ending on a numbered space follow instructions of the rule sheet

remarks:
unbalanced events

name: Monopoly: Ulm – Neu-Ulm
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Ulm, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Mega Bloks Domino Build
description:
This Mega Bloks Dominoes Build game challenges players to match cards with colors and animals to win block pieces. The first player to collect all four animal block pieces and build their zoo friend wins.

Oversized blocks and cards are perfect for little hands.
Details:
Includes: 30 cards & 16 Mega Bloks
Ages 3 years & up
For 2 to 4 players

(website)

name: Pohjanmaan Tähti
description:
The goal of the game is to find a gem from Finnish province called Ostrobothnia.

Players roll a die and move their button forward trying to find a gem called Star of Ostrobothnia. During the trip players flip tokens and cannot know what they will find. Players can crash to the knife, which is humorically a some kind of symbol of Ostrobothnia, and have to answer a question which asks knowledge of Southern Ostrobothnia. Players can open a token with a gallant hat and it amuses with aphorisms and grumbles. Players can also drift to a prison with Isoontalon Antti and Rannanjärvi, which are famous characters of Ostrobothnia.

In the game players move their buttons in earth, sea and air.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Star Wars Galactic Conquest
description:
From the back of the box: "The Rebel Alliance and Galactic Empire are at war - whose side are YOU on? Who will reign supreme in this clash between the Rebels and the Empire? The Galactic Empire and Rebel alliance are locked in an epic battle to take control of the galaxy. In this game, featuring classic Star Wars characters, players must use their troops to advance the game board, occupy planets, fight battles and ultimately conquer their opponent."

Star Wars Galactic Conquest is a hex based strategy game where players use pawns and character pieces to conquer the key planets of the Star Wars universe. Victory is achieved when all planets have been captured and one player controls the majority (5 or more) of planets.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Rainbow 7
description:
Everyone wants to see the first rainbow in the sky because of the satisfaction it brings.

In Rainbow Seven, you are an explorer looking for that "First Rainbow" – but you're not the only one, so you'll need to be quick to collect the seven color clues and find out where that first rainbow is before the rain stops. Watch your bearings, and don't let the North, South, East, or West lead you away from that first rainbow...

name: McDonald's Flying French Fries Game
description: This is a chance game for up 1 or more players ages 4 and up. The object of the game is to pull a french fry out of the fry container. When you pull the wrong fry you then get to watch 'em Fly! Two french fries are connected with a string and activate the spring loaded bottom tray. If more then three players are playing then as the person the pulls the wrong fry makes 'em fly they are eliminated until one person is left in the game

name: Duel (fan expansion for Dominion)
description:
This is an unofficial fan-made expansion and is not affiliated with nor endorsed by Donald X. Vaccarino or Rio Grande Games.

Victory over your neighbors has always been kind of a big deal for you, but just when you thought building yourself the single most impressive empire in the land was all you had to worry about, the stakes went and got higher. Your victory points are now tied to your very life! It all started with that foul-cursed gold. In the future, you will never trust anything given to you by a man in a village who won't stop spinning when you try to look at him. Of course, now you have access to incredible power, but each time you use it, you bring yourself closer to your own demise. With great power comes great responsibility — or something like that.

Fortunately, you aren't alone in your fight. A ragtag band of mercenaries has arrived in the kingdom to save the day — or rather to fight for whoever has the coin. Your mercenaries can wreak havoc on your opponents, but if a stronger warrior takes them by surprise, the resulting curses find their way back to you. This war has turned you into a gambling man (or woman, as the case may be). How much of your own life will you risk to bring down your opponents? Oh, and remember to get your shots.

For Duel, players need the Treasure cards, Victory cards, Curse cards, and Trash card from Dominion or Dominion: Base Cards to play. As with other Dominion games, players must choose ten sets of Kingdom cards for each game.

Duel introduces several new "Curse" cards to the game of Dominion, the generation of a more advanced "Curse Deck", and a new token: the "curse token". It also introduces a "life points" system adding another win-condition to the game; in games with this condition, curse tokens modify a player's "Life Points" total. (If the "Life Points" win condition isn't used, whenever a card requires a player to gain +Y (curse tokens), that player must take one curse token for each curse token specified by the number "Y". Each curse token is worth -1 VP.)

Duel also introduces a new "Attack/Action/Reaction" card type, the "Warrior Cards". The strength of each Warrior Card is represented by a number within a shield symbol for each Warrior Card. The strengths of each Warrior Card range from 1-10, with 1 being the lowest strength and 10 being the highest strength. When a Warrior Card is played as an Action, the player playing the card first resolves the actions printed on the card in order from top to bottom (e.g. “Gain a Silver” for the Silver Knight; “+1 Card then +1 Action for the Warrior Angel). After unique actions have been resolved, resolve the “Each other player gains a Curse” effect common to all Warrior Cards. This effect causes each player to draw a card from the Curse Deck or play a Reaction card in response. These Warrior Cards can also be played as a Reaction card to another player playing a Warrior Card as an Attack card; In this case, the two Warrior Cards "Duel" eachother, and the one with the highest power wins the battle (and unique results are followed as indicated on the cards and within the rules).
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Scrabble and Yahtzee
description: A tin box combining two classic family games. Scrabble includes a split quad-fold full size board, 100 full size wooden tiles, 4 wooden tile racks, instructions & plastic tile bag. Yahtzee contains a small dice cup, 5 slightly smaller than standard 6 sided dice, 8 plastic chips, Yahtzee scoring pad and instructions.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Spelling, Tile Placement

name: One Day in London
description:
One Day in London is a path finding game, based on the actual map and stations in the London underground. It borrows some basic mechanics found in the Ten Days in... series of games, but with connectivity rules appropriate to a network of train lines.

Players construct a 10 stop trip through the London tube, starting with cards representing 10 random stations. Cards are placed, one at a time, into a rack representing the trip. Once placed, cards can never be moved except by exchanging them for one of the available discards or from a draw pile.

Online Play


Boardspace.net (real-time, AI option)


Mobile Apps

Boardspace.net local multiplayer or online, IOS
Boardspace.net local multiplayer or online, Android

name: Lau Kati Kata
description:
Lau kata kati (or Lau Kati Kata) is a two-player abstract strategy game from India, specifically from Lower Bengal, United Provinces, Karwi Subdivision where it is called Kowwu Dunki.

The game is related to Draughts and even more so to Alquerque. Pieces are captured by hopping over them, and the board is composed of two triangle grids.

It is the same game as Butterfly (game) from Mozambique, which suggests a historical connection between the two games.

Lau kata kati belongs to a specific category of games called Indian War-games, and the other games in this category are Dash-guti, Egara-guti, Pretwa, Gol-skuish. All Indian War-games have one important thing in common, and that is that all the pieces are laid out on the grid patterned board, with only one vacant point in the center. This forces the first move to be played on the central point, and captured by the other player's piece.

To capture all of the opponent's pieces, or be the one with more pieces when no more pieces can be taken by either player, or stalemate the other opponent's pieces such that they are immobilized.

It is important to realize that Lau kata kati's board is the basis of other games, in particular, Dash-guti and Egara-guti. In serves as a basis for other games in the same way that the Alquerque board and the draughts board is a basis for other games.

name: Guinness World Records: Das Spiel
description: With Guinness World Records: Das Spiel, everyone can experience this fantastic history of world records at the gaming table, with approximately 400 illustrated question cards that players large and small can all guess at — and the closer you are to the right answer, the more points you receive.

name: Tu dors au gaz
description:
Tu dors au gaz, released as Qui dort dîne in Europe, is a party game to play during a meal.

To play, three cards — two blue and one red — are visible to all players. One player takes the role of the master, and when the master does the action named on one of the cards, if the card is blue the first player to do the reaction named on the card wins one point and becomes the new master; if the card is red, the last player to do the reaction loses one point and names another player as the new master. If the master does the action of a blue card three times without any reaction, he wins this card (one point). The first player to earn three points wins the game and doesn't have to do the dishes.

name: Disney Princess:  Palace Pets Royal Pet Salon
description: Get regally pampered in the dreamy, 3D Royal Pet Salon. Move your adorable pet from room to room through doorways sized just for castle cuties. Look for posh pet products, from fancy soaps and shampoos to tiaras, collars, and sweet treats—all hidden throughout the salon! If you find something pictured on a face-up card, it’s yours to keep! When the time is up, all of the Palace Pets leave the salon with the grooming goodies. The player with the most wins!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Go Fishing
description: Go Fishing is a magnetic fishing game for kids where you use your pole to try to find the color of fish that comes up on the spinner and put it in your boat. They game combines the dexterity of catching fish with a magnetic pole with the memory of where the colored fish are.

name: Monopoly: Gdańsk
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Gdańsk , a city in Poland.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Unnützes Quizzen: Länder und Leute
description:
Unnützes Quizzen: Land und Leute ("Unuseful Knowledge: Country and People") is a German Trivia Game with obscure facts about different cultures and geography.

From the Publisher (translated):
"Test your useless knowledge How many snails eat the French a year? Which fundamental rights have Norwegian cows? And have English women really the biggest breasts in Europe? The key issues from around the world - in this quiz to popular section of the NEON magazine they will all be answered! For at home, on the go, for in between: 99 quizzes to always have."

From the publisher (German):
Teste dein unnützes Wissen Wie viele Schnecken essen die Franzosen pro Jahr? Welche Grundrechte haben norwegische Kühe? Und haben Engländerinnen wirklich die größten Brüste in Europa?Die wichtigsten Fragen aus aller Welt – in diesem Quiz zur beliebten Rubrik aus dem NEON-Magazin werden sie alle beantwortet! Für zu Hause, für unterwegs, für zwischendurch: 99 Quiz-Fragen zum Immerdabeihaben.

name: Unnützes Quizzen: Sport & Spaß
description:
Unnützes Quizzen: Sport und Spaß ("Unuseful Knowledge: Sports and Fun") is a German Trivia Game with obscure facts about sports and games.

From the Publisher (translated):
"Test your useless knowledge! What is the name of the house pig of Mario Balotelli? How many football teams are in the Vatican? And who actually holds the world record in the concrete block smashing? New issues from the world of sport - in this quiz to popular section of the NEON magazine they will all be answered! For at home, on the go, for in between: 99 quizzes to always have."

From the publisher (German):
Teste dein unnützes Wissen! Wie heißt das Hausschwein von Mario Balotelli? Wie viele Fußballmannschaften gibt es im Vatikan? Und wer hält eigentlich den Weltrekord im Betonblockzerschlagen? Neue Fragen aus der Welt des Sports – in diesem Quiz zur beliebten Rubrik aus dem NEON-Magazin werden sie alle beantwortet! Für zu Hause, für unterwegs, für zwischendurch: 99 Quiz-Fragen zum Immerdabeihaben.

name: Doc McStuffins: Ich packe meinen Arztkoffer
description: Another Ravensburger mini game. Doc Mcstuffins is a toy doctor, and she has her own toy practice in the garden of her parents. She lost her syringe, the stethoscope, the magnifying glass and the scissors. All players are small Doc McStuffins, who are trying to find the missing medical instruments, and put them into the suitcase. They do this by dice rolling, and look for the symbol they got, into 3 covered section in the box. The one who found them first is the winner.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Woo!
description:
From the package:

The board game where fast fun adds up!

Spell the numbers ONE through TEN using letter tiles. Spell N-I-N-E, score 9 points. Each word you spell gives you points equal to that number. Got it? Spell T-E-N and you're really on a roll! But, look out! If somebody else has the WO-O tiles, you could lose your T-E-N points and they'll be up O-N-E plus T-W-O! Reach 21 or more points and win! This easy-to-learn tile game is great for introducing simple addition and spelling concepts.

name: Puppy Up
description: It's the Tipsy, Topsy Numbers Game that includes three levels of play: number recognition, counting and addition! Pick a card and practice counting or adding the puppies and checking your answer by balancing numbers and puppies on the adorable scale! It's an entertaining way to introduce children to math and get them excited about learning! For 1 to 4 players, ages 3 and up. Children also have fun weighing other household items...how many puppies does this or that toy weigh? And the puppies are toys themselves, too! It's tons of fun with STEM! Colors will vary.

name: Ran ans Beet!
description:
Does the stupidest farmer have the biggest potatoes? Not in this game! This is because the clever cultivation of beds, which is about the meaningful juxtaposition (mixed culture, plant friendliness) and succession (fruit sequence), leads to a sumptuous harvest and thus to win the game.
Gameplay: Players systematically grow vegetables, fruit and herbs. They plant according to the garden calendar and promote the growth of their plants. However, a lot has to be taken into account. Are they low or flat rooted, weak, medium or heavy consuming? Does the plant have a long or short growth period? In addition, weather caprioles, beneficial insects and pests, the neighbor or other imponderables can influence the tranquil gardener life.
Game objective: The players try to "harvest" as many self-planted as also by other players placed plant cards. Whoever has the greatest harvest yields is the winner of the game.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Bored Room
description:
Bored Room is an easy-to-play, but hard-to-win party game pitting you against your co-workers in a series of challenges taking place during a work meeting! That's right, your company is going to be paying you while you play this game. That's definitely a win-win! *cough*

Three dice are rolled before the meeting, comparing the results to the list of activities. All players attend the meeting and complete as many of the rolled challenges as possible to score points. After the meeting ends, players reconvene to tally up scores and declare a winner.

With multiple modes of gameplay and included badges of honor, you'll be sure to liven up your stuffy work environment in no time!

name: Microworld: BoardGameGeek Promo 1
description:
Microworld has modular rules that you combine to create several different scenarios. This promo supplies two new additional rule tiles that you can add to the base game to increase the variability of the game even more.

The first additional rule (B1) applies during the setup: it gives a personal secret goal tile to the players, but only the first player who reach the goal will score the points. Moreover, you will find a bonus Goal Tile in the promo.

The second additional rule (D1) applies during the game. It establishes that when players place in outside cells they will score one more point.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Wars: Trivia Box
description: The game features a series of challenging trivia questions. Players alternate turns asking questions and earning Star Wars picture cards for correct answers. There is also a "steal" mechanic that allows opponents to steal each others' cards. The first player to earn four picture cards wins the game.

name: Literatour
description:
A trip around the world of books.

Travel with us: travel the world of literature from the living room of your home with our exclusive board game.

Have fun with LiteraTour, the challenge of readers:


Círculo's exclusive board game to enjoy as a family.



Play as if it were a parchís or put yourself to the test with questions and challenges.



Have fun while learning about literature.


LiteraTour is an entertaining and educational board game. It has different levels of complexity and with it you can demonstrate your literary knowledge and spend pleasant evenings with your friends or with your family.

There are two types of game: the traditional one, similar to the classic parchís, and the advanced, which incorporates questions and challenges that dynamize and complicate each game a bit. Do not worry, there are questions and challenges of different levels so that both big and small have a chance to win.

name: Craits
description:
Craits (sometimes spelled Crates or Creights) is a card game played by anywhere between two and five players. It was invented in the 1970s in Cambridge, Massachusetts, and is derived from Crazy Eights; in fact, the name Craits is derived from Crazy Eights itself. Craits is similar to the marketed game Uno, which has its own specialized deck, and many cards assume the functions of Uno's specialized cards.

The goal of the game is to be the first to get rid of all your cards. When it is your turn, you may play a card from your hand that matches either the suit or the rank of the most recent card played. If you cannot (or choose not to ) play, you draw instead.

Many cards have additional effects, such as forcing other players to draw, reversing the direction of play, etc.

name: Host Your Own Race Night
description:
Part of Cheatwell Games series of 'Host Your Own' games. This version contains 100, 500, and 1000 notes which players use to bet on the outcome of races. The game contains a wipe clean board and temporary marker to go with a bookmakers ledger.
The races themselves consist of clips of Greyhounds on a DVD accompanying the game which are played to give the results.

name: Emojinks: A Fast-Paced Emoji Card Game
description: This is a fast paced game in which each player has a card with a number of emoji images. Each pair of cards have exactly one matching image. The goal of the game is to find the matching image faster than your opponents. There are two sides to each card: an easy side and a more advanced side.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game, Real-time

name: Unnützes Quizzen: Pannen & Katastrophen
description:
Unnützes Quizzen: Pannen & Katastrophen ("Unuseful Knowledge: Glitches & Catastrophes") is a German Trivia Game with obscure facts about different disasters.
—user summary

"Test your useless knowledge!
How many cigars have been on board of the "Titanic"? In how many years our galaxy will collide with the neighboring galaxy Andromeda? And is it really true that in Jamaica a whole beach has been stolen?
For at home, on the go, for in between: 99 quizzes to always have."
—description from the publisher (translated)

"Teste dein unnützes Wissen!
Wie viele Zigarren gab es an Bord der "Titanic"? In wie vielen Jahren wird unsere Galaxie mit der Nachbargalaxie Andromeda kollidieren? Und wurde in Jamaika wirklich mal ein kompletter Strand gestohlen?
Für zu Hause, für unterwegs, für zwischendurch: 99 Quiz-Fragen zum Immerdabeihaben."
—description from the publisher (German)

name: Hooplastack
description:
Swoop the hoop... but don't let the tower tumble!

Players stack a set of wooden shapes in a tower, lower a hoop down onto the table around the tower, then try to quickly "swoop the hoop" to pull out the lowest shape from the tower. If they succeed, they put the shape on top of the tower and pass the hoop to the next player. The player who knocks the tower over loses.

name: Eye Eye Captain
description: All hands on deck in Eye Eye Captain! The weird birds have dropped their piles everywhere. And oh, now the captain has lost his glass eye. It criss-crosses over the ship, very close to the piles. Keep track of all the confusion and collect the piles as quickly as possible. Win as a team or for yourself!

name: Crime Stories
description:
In the semi-co-operative card game Crime Stories, each player draws cards from different categories such as crime scene, perpetrator, motive, and cause of death, then writes a short crime story based on these keywords.

Next, all other players try to discover what this story is about, asking questions about the keywords, determining the details, and reconstructing the case. If you don't want to write a story yourself, you can present the stories of thriller author Veit Etzold included in the game.

name: Phoque!
description:
You can write it anyway ... in the end it has to mean the same thing.

Answer questions to which there is no good answer and collect more points by matching your answers with those of other players.

How we play PHOQUE!

Draw a card and read it aloud.

Everyone writes their answer.

We compare answer and every one that looks the same gets points.

If you're really hot, you might get bonus points!

Here is in very summary how the 5 types of card are played:

There is not really a good answer. Each player scores one (1) point for each answer identical.

A question related to the reader. Each player scores one (1) point per answer identical to another player and two (2) additional points if you have the same answer as the reader.

A question related to one of the players. Each player scores one (1) point for each answer identical to another player.

A question where you have to find the common point between two things, people, objects, etc. Each player scores one (1) point for each answer identical to another player and two (2) additional points if you have found the answer on the card.



Vous aurez beau l’écrire de toutes les façons... à la fin du compte faut que ça dise la même affaire.Répondez à des questions auxquelles il n’y a pas vraiment de bonne réponse et ramassez plus de points en matchant vos réponses avec celles des autres joueurs.

Comment on joue à PHOQUE!

Pige une carte et lis-la à voix haute.

Tout le monde écrit sa réponse..

On compare les réponses des joueurs et tous ceux qui en ont une pareille font des points.

Si t’es vraiment hot, t’auras peut-être des points boni!

Voici en très résumé comment se jouent les 5 types de carte :

Il n’y a pas vraiment de bonne réponse. Chaque joueur marque un (1) point par réponse identique à un autre joue.

Les questions qui ont un lien avec le lecteur. Chaque joueur marque un (1) point par réponse identique à un autre joueur et deux (2) points supplémentaires si vous avez la même réponse que le lecteur.

Les questions qui ont un lien avec l’un des joueurs. Chaque joueur marque un (1) point par réponse identique à un autre joueur.

Les questions où devez trouver le point commun entre deux choses, personnes, objets, etc. Chaque joueur marque un (1) point par réponse identique à un autre joueur et deux (2) points supplémentaires si vous avez trouvé la réponse de la carte.

name: Lights, Camera, Action
description:
Get everyone on set and get rolling with this fun family game for movie buffs! Lights, Camera, Action is the ultimate movie themed party game where players have to draw, hum, mime and describe their way to Hollywood stardom! The perfect game for film fans, Lights, Camera, Action puts your movie knowledge to the ultimate test. Players pick a card featuring a famous film, then roll the die to determine the challenge. Depending on the result of the die, players then have to either ask trivia, hum, draw, mime or describe the film to the other players. So maybe your movie trivia is pretty good, but what about your drawing or miming skills? Lights, Camera, Action comes packaged in a neat clapperboard style box and includes 50 question cards, a notepad, pencil, sand timer and custom die. A great game to enjoy with friends or family, Lights, Camera, Action is a fun, fast paced movie quiz game that gets a little more from its star performers!

—description from the publisher

name: Adventure Island: How it all began
description:
Tutorial in German
These cards tell how you stranded on this island.
Trough small adventures you learn the important rules.
The main game is needed.

Tutorial auf Deutsch
Diese Karten erzählen wie Ihr auf der Insel gestrandet seid.
Durch diese kleinen Abentuern werden wichtige Regeln gelernt.
Das Hauptspiel wird beötigt.

name: Clue: Penny Dreadful
description: Mina Murray has been killed and the murderer remains at large ... lurking in the darkest corners of Victorian London. The city howls for justice and closes in on those known to be closest to her. It is up to you to sort through the clues and discover WHO killed Mina, Where they Killed her and with What weapon.
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Murder/Mystery

name: Pictionary Air: Kids vs. Grown-ups
description:
This new version of Pictionary Air is a head-to-head battle of kids vs. grown-ups!

This new design allows the younger kids to have an easier time drawing in the air. The clue cards for kids now have pictures on them as well as words, to give them a visual reference for their drawing. In addition, every clue on each card for kids is worth two points, whereas only the last clue on each card for grown-ups is worth two points (all others are worth one point).

There are also new, updated clue cards for grown-ups as well.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Line Drawing, Team-Based Game

name: Rune: Dark Master Micro Expansion
description: Pass to the dark side. Place the dark rune trying to stop your opponents plans.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Puzzle

name: Blanc-Manger Coco: Le Coming Out
description:
The irreverence Blanc-Manger Coco now explore the theme of LGBT + culture, published in partnership with the magazine Têtu.

Mix the cards or not with the other games in the range: you decide.

Contains 160 reply cards and 40 question cards.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Truth or Drink: Second Edition
description:
The all-new Second Edition of Truth or Drink contains 410 intensely personal questions across 4 different levels of intimacy.

This updated edition contains over 80% new and revised questions from the original, but as before, they're grouped into:

Happy Hour: For when you need help being nice. Get to know your acquaintances better.
On the Rocks: Get more personal with these good-friends questions featuring just the right amount of bite.
Last Call: Probing questions for your deepest and darkest friendships.
Extra Dirty: Extremely NSFW questions will have you learning way more than you should.
Each box also contains our brand-new Buy a Round cards, to make more people answer any question, as well as a handful of blank cards, for brewing up your own spicy inquiries.

Add one of our expansion packs (available separately) for an even more probing experience. Will you tell the cold hard truth or have a nice stiff drink?

—description from the publisher

name: Who Wants To Be A Millionaire Board Game
description:
Bring home the nation's favourite game show and go head-to-head with your family and friends in the race to reach £1 million.

Relive classic moments from the show and tackle the iconic money ladder using only your wits and digital lifelines (accessible through a smart device) to reach the top. But watch out! Get a question wrong and you fall back to your closest safe haven.

Do you have what it takes to win a (virtual) million?

—description from the publisher
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Go Elsa Go
description:
Help Elsa navigate the rough waves to bring her face-to-face with the Nokk. But be careful the water is choppy, one wrong move and you may get swept back to shore! The first player to help Elsa reach the Nokk is the winner.

Each player gets 4 Elsas to play with. You move your Elsa by drawing cards from common stock. You can move 1-3 steps forward, 1 step back or rotate the Nokk. By rotating the Nokk random field is opened and if your Elsa is standing on it, she is drawn in ice cold water. And you have to forward with your other Elsa.

name: Monty Python and the Holy Grail: The Game
description:
Play as King Arthur, Sir Lancelot, and the rest of the brave Knights on their Quest for the Holy Grail! Players travel a twisty maze of paths to visit the many absurd and memorable locations they saw in that one movie, all while avoiding the Black Knight who stalks the Players across the board. Each location has its own unique purpose that will bring the Players one step closer to earning the Valor points they need to find the Holy Grail first, but your fellow Knights won’t make it easy when they band together to hurl insults and sabotage your Quest. And just when you think you’ve got it all figured out, another Player catapults a cow at you and you’re suddenly left reevaluating your life choices. Everyone’s a “frenemy” in this official play-at-home adaptation of the cult classic movie the New York Times once called “a marvelously particular kind of lunatic endeavor”.

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Humor, Medieval, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Interrupts, Kill Steal, Point to Point Movement

name: Snow White and the Eleven Dwarfs
description:
Living with a clan of Dwarfs can be quite an adventure. They're hardworking and dedicated, but their tendency for messiness and love for food fights can make things challenging. Despite these quirks, they have hearts brimming with kindness and a wickedly delightful sense of humour. When it comes to hide-and-seek, their version is absolutely hilarious and bound to leave you in stitches.

Snow White and the Eleven Dwarfs is a game for 7 to 18 players, and is perfect for parties and family gatherings. It is a team deduction game, with Snow White on one side, and the Dwarfs on the other. Dwarf identities are secret, and Snow White needs to find the Dwarf named Happy. The Dwarfs work together to figure out who among them has overslept and is late for work.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Math, Number, Party Game

name: Matchmaster
description:
The game takes 13 rounds. Each round the number of Cards will be lifted or lowered. Players have to say, how many tricks they will take this round. Who was correct, gets points. Who was wrong looses points. The winner is the one with the most points at the end.

Material: 52 cards, 50 matches, 1 ruleset

Das Spiel geht über 13 Runden. Pro Runde wird die Anzahl der Karten um eine erhöht bzw. wieder verringert. Die Spieler müssen pro Runde vorhersagen, wie viele Stiche sie machen werden. Wer richtig vorhergesagt hat, bekommt Punkte. Wer falsch lag, verliert Punkte. Wer am Ende die meisten Punkte hat, gewinnt.

Bestandteile: 52 Karten, 50 Streichhölzer, 1 Spielanleitung.

name: Dark space quest
description:
Travel through space to seek out elements that will let you go back home safely. Face enemies you meet and do not lose your route using the special warp drive.

To play, you will need a pencil and three 6-sided dice.
Explore the map and collect power-ups to become stronger and defeat the enemies you encounter.
You can use these upgrades to increase your Precision skill or your Survival skill.
Keep track of your characteristics by checking the boxes on your character sheet.
When you encounter enemies and have to fight, roll the dice, modify the result thanks to your special ability Accuracy and compare the result with the values indicated next to the enemy; if the result is equal or greater you have won and can continue the mission.

To win, you must collect the 4 elements scattered around the map and return them to their respective spaceports. Once they are all in place you can access the route to your planet and win the game.

—description from the designer

name: Kinder Mau-Mau
description:
Children's card game.

Every player gets five cards. A random card starts the discard stack. Each player must try to add a card to the stack. It must either be the same colour or the same number. Next player does the same and so on. If a player cannot make a legal play, he draws a card from the deck and adds it to his hand. The first player to use all their cards, wins.

To spice the game up, any player can play an Action Card to the discard pile in their turn. This causes annoyances such as;
Next player misses a turn;
Next player draws a card from the deck;
You can choose the colour that the next player must play to;
All players jump to their feet and make the sound of the animal currently on top of the discard pile. The first to do so is alright but all the other players must draw a card.
And their are further action cards than these examples.
publishers: ASS Altenburger Spielkarten, moses. Verlag GmbH, Ravensburger

name: People Weekly
description: The rich. The famous. The powerful. They're today's people—making today's news. Everyone wants to know as much about them as possible. And most likely, you're no exception. But how much do you really know about today's famous people? Enough to answer 3,000 trivia questions in categories like SONG, TUBE, SCREEN, PAGES, JOCKS, and CHATTER? Enough to bet on your knowledge—and move rapidly ahead? Enough to trick—and slow down—an opponent? Adapted from the ever-popular PEOPLE WEEKLY magazine, this fast-paced, fascinating game is sure to provide the answer whenever the question is fun. [Please note that this is not the same as the Patch Products game of the same name produced in 2002.]

name: Snatch
description: In Snatch, a new take on Spoons and similar designs players try to collect the full set of one type of animal card, while passing unwanted cards to the next player. Aside from simply collecting all of the cards, though, a number of tokens lie in the middle of the table, and if a player can collect a set of cards matching one of these tokens, then they can collect one fewer card and still win.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Fact or Crap: Hollywood
description:
From the Publisher:

We’ve dug up the dirt on Hollywood! Fact or Crap Celebrity Edition lets you uncover the outrageous truth about Who’s Who in Hollywood by asking the only question that counts: Is it Fact, or Crap? In this fast-paced trivia game, your aim is to wow the opposition with how much you know about Hollywood celebrities and their paparazzi-filled world. Get to the truth of it all with Fact or Crap Celebrity Edition!

Features

Uncover the outrageous truth about Who’s Who in Hollywood by asking the only question that counts: Is it Fact, or Crap?
Answer correctly, and you'll win tokens. Choose the wrong answer, and give up a token! The players with the most tokens at the end wins!
Includes Rush Hour cards: Answer quickly to win the most tokens possible!
Fact or Crap Celebrity Edition has tons of celebrity trivia with attitude and is made for 3-8 adult players.

name: Opération Nez rouge: Le jeu
description:
In Opération Nez rouge: Le jeu, players form teams of two persons: one driver and one passenger. Each team tries to be the first to get home! The passenger shouldn't snooze! Give the right indications to the driver to ensure to come safe! Driver, you'll try to understand what your funny passenger is telling you.

The game is played in successive rounds. The winning team will be the first one to complete three itineraries. One player picks up an itinerary card and will try to give indications by funny words and gesture. The other player (driver) will have to switch cards displayed in front of him to replicate the right itinerary of the objective card.

name: Hydra
description: Hydra by Gilbert Levi is a tile-laying game with 60 square tiles. Players take turns to draw and lay tiles, which show the snaking, dividing body or multiple heads of the Hydra. When a Hydra is totally completed, you score for the total number of heads, with a bonus point if there 3+ heads. Usual rules for tiles laying. Rather simple graphics, good for kids.

name: Jeu du Président
description:
The players campaign to become the French President by canvasing in the 99 French departments.

Contains:
1 board (representing France with its 99 départements)
2 dices (0-1-2-3-4-star, 5-6-7-8-9-star)
52 cards challenge (DEFI)
40 cards campaign (campagen electorale)
61 cards electors (ELECTEURS)
48 markers of each of the 4 majors french parties (Républicains Indépendants, Parti socialiste, Rassemblement pour la République, Parti communiste)
4 player aids
1 rule

name: Christopher Robin's Pooh Goes Home to Bed Game
description:
The object of the game is to move your piece from "The Edge Do Not Cross - Start" to "HOME" using the cube of wood (dice). The first player to achieve this is the winner.

Each player must choose to be either Pooh, Tigger, Piglet or Eeyore. All players should place their pieces at the START. Taking turns in a clockwise direction from Pooh onwards each player should move their piece along the track in front of them. You will arrive at a point where another track crosses the one you are on and you will see a signpost with LEFT, RIGHT, UP and DOWN on it. Now throw the dice. If the dice lands on LEFT, follow the track to the LEFT etc..

name: King Down: Keepers of the King
description:
Expansion to King Down which contains 20 new miniatures and 20 new character cards.

New minis are Bow (Archer), Bash (Paladin), Block (Guard), Beast (Beast) and Cog (Maester). A motley crew of powerful but capricious characters.

Bow (a.k.a The Archer) can "take" pieces from a distance, without moving, while Beast (a.k.a The Beast) cannot move, unless it is taking another piece. Bash (a.k.a The Paladin), on the other hand, can move quite freely, yet he himself is taken whenever it takes. Block (a.k.a The Guard) cannot take, yet no other piece can take him down. As for Cog (a.k.a The Maester), well let's just say he's a very resourceful guy...
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: "SHOTGUN!": The Road Trip Game
description: Road trip boredom is about to become extinct: Introducing Shotgun!, our brand new family card game guaranteed to create the most memorable & hilarious drives of your life! Compete with your car mates by playing dares, trivia, challenges, questions, and more. With over 200 cards, you'll be entertained the whole trip -- and no two games are ever the same. So, fasten your seatbelts and hit the highway -- it's about time for a road trip! Don't forget to add Shotgun! to your packing list!

name: Da Capo!
description:
Played with a giant deck of 150 cards numbered 1-10 and 18 joker cards.
Players have individual card stacks of which only the top card is open. The goal of the game is to get rid of one's entire stack first. This is achieved by putting cards down on stacks in the middle of the table. Those stacks have to be in numerical order, starting with 1 and finishing with 10 (there are Joker cards to fill gaps). The players also have their own individual stacks on which they can put open cards for later use.

Republished by Amigo in 2009 under the name Da Capo, with only 15 Jokers included (and with a new design).

name: Kroko-Ei
description:
Crocodile Egg. 24 square tiles show various crocodiles hatching from their eggs. You have to get the heads and tails to match, coming out of the right egg. Very cute graphics.

Ages 5 and up.

name: Shrek 2: The Twisted Fairy Tale Game
description:
From the Publisher:

"It's a Far Far Away adventure.

Princess Fiona is being held in the evil Fairy Godmother's castle, and our heroes (SHREK, DONKEY and PUSS IN BOOTS) are headed to the rescue. Race through Far, Far Away battling Corrupt Cops, Royal Knights and Angry Villagers. But it's not all about combat. You get to burp, imitate Donkey and sing lines from the movie. Not to mention meeting Gingy and all the fairy tale creatures. Will the handsome Prince kiss Fiona and make her his beautiful princess forever? Not if Shrek can help it!"

name: Dallas
description:
This is a game for ages 10 and up. The theme is based on the TV show with the same name.

The aim of the game is to earn as much money as possible. You can achieve that by buying and selling cattle, oil sources or farmland. Other sources of income are the rents for ranches. These rents are higher for more expensive ranches and are getting even higher if the owner owns several ranches.

If you succeed in buying and selling often, you will gain money more easily.

The game is played on a board comparable with a Monopoly board. The game mechanics are the same as those used for playing Monopoly.

name: Who Is The Biggest Pervert?
description:
The game where players answer questions about naughty things they have done in order to determine which of them is the Biggest Pervert!

Sample questions are:
-Have you ever shopped in a store for sex toys?
-Have you ever talked dirty during a prank phone call?
-Have you ever gotten aroused at a dentist appointment?
-Have you ever filmed a homemade porn movie?
-Have you ever fondled someone who was asleep?
-Have you ever shared nude pictures of yourself on the internet?
-Have you ever spied on someone who was changing clothes?

Includes:
Gameboard, 216 question cards, 6 game markers, rules.

name: G.I. Joe Live The Adventure
description:
From the Manufacturer
Object: Outmaneuver the attacking Cobra soldiers, and be the first to collect 6 Badge of Honor tokens.

Players take turns rolling a die and moving a single G.I. Joe pawn (Falcon) around a circular board. Most spaces consist of a "battle" with a Cobra soldier. Battles are resolved by the active player and an opponent of his/her choosing each playing one of two cards. If the active player wins, he receives a Badge of Honor. The first player to earn six Badges of Honor is victorious. Yo Joe!
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
publishers: Milton Bradley, The Great Games Company

name: A Terrible Time: The Party Game Where Everyone Loses
description: Teams of at least two join forces to complete a challenge in one of three categories: Art, Facts, or Performance. If you successfully identify the TERRIBLE THING in under 60 seconds, you advance. Should you be unable to identify a TERRIBLE THING, you must do a TERRIBLE THING by drawing from the Humiliation deck. The first team to make it to HELL wins.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Trivia

name: Eye Remember
description: The game that’s fun at first sight. Players have six categories to choose from, there are 10 items listed on each card. When a card is flashed, you’ll all have 30 second to look at it and memorize what’s on it. When the card is turned away, you try to recall all 10 items and others can steal everything you’ve remembered.
publishers: Brio AB, Canada Games Company Lmt., Casper

name: Hund herum!
description:
Turbulent roulette for delicious bones...

On your marks! Get set! Woof! Time after time the ball rolls through the gardens with the naughty dogs in pursuit. Where the ball stops, the dogs uncover some tasty bones. Whoever collects the most bones, whether by skill or by luck, will be crowned the leader of the pack. Exciting to the end, because dog-roulette always has a surprising twist.

name: Dingus
description:
This is a card game in which everyone wins except for one person---the Dingus.

The idea is to dump the amout of cards you have in your hand by spelling DINGUS on other players score piles. When someone runs out of cards the game is over and the person with the most amount of letters (some cards have 2 letters) is the DINGUS, and THAT is a very bad thing. Very bad.

name: Jackpot Payoff
description: This is a knock rummy game with slot machine symbols on the cards. The deck has 8 cards each of five different suit symbols plus 12 useless lemon cards. Each player antes, gets 5 cards and can draw from the deck or the discard pile. A cloth mat shows point values for various hands. A player knocks when he thinks he can beat everyone else. If this caller wins, he collects the chip value on the chart from the others. If not, the person with the highest scoring hand collects from everyone including double from the failed caller. The antes build up a jackpot every hand which is collected by anyone who gets five of a kind.

name: Monopoly: Dog Artist
description: Using a technique known as “strange ratio” photography, Artlist International has captured the expressiveness and curiosity of man’s best friend. Now Mr. Moneybags celebrates the popular line of canine photos with this special edition of Monopoly.
