Wheel and deal for the popular pooches including the lovable Labrador, the pugnacious Pug, the dutiful Golden and the faithful German Shepherd. Game includes game board, property trading cards, custom dog money and banker’s tray, 32 food & water bowl cards, 32 dog houses & 12 kennels (in place of houses and hotels), two dice, six custom pewter tokens and rules.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: The Watergate Scandal
description: This game is basically an adaptation of the classic card game sometimes known as "I Doubt It" or by other, ruder names.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Monkey, Ninja, Pirate, Robot
description:
Bathed in the atomic radiation of a reactor core, strange champions fight to the death, in order to claim the sweet, sweet uranium... and victory!

MNPR Deluxe is a fast-paced, beer 'n pretzels game suitable for all ages. Each player takes on the role of a champion of a powerful (yet somehow down-trodden) secret group, each with access to unique abilities. Then, they beat merry hell out of each other until one competitor stands victorious.

Re-implemented by:

Monkey, Ninja, Pirate, Robot Deluxe

name: Battle for Bataan
description: A two-player regimental level simulation of the 1942 Japanese assault on American and Filipino forces in the Philippines. Bi-weekly turns. DTP format, appearing in Panzerschreck Magazine issue 9 (winter 2002-03).

name: Trivial Pursuit: Pocket Player Set – TP's People
description:
(From the box:) Trivial Pursuit Pocket Player Sets let you play a great new way - anywhere, without a board! With the new Pocket Player Spinner/Scorers, just spin to select a question category and slide to keep track of your score. The first player or team to score correct answers in all six categories wins. Here's a fast-playing game that goes right to the heart of Trivial Pursuit. Those famous, fascinating questions!
1,440 all-new questions about famous - and infamous - personalities.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia
publishers: Chieftain Products, Horn Abbot Ltd., Parker Brothers, Playmix, Selchow & Righter

name: Godzilla Game
description:
Godzilla Game
"Will you survive the mighty monster's attack?"

Game Includes:
Space Spinner and moving Space Platform on a Space Base
24 Multi-colored spaceships (4 sets of 6)
Instructions

Load the spaceships on the Space Platform! Whirl the Space Spinner! Rotate the Space Platform! Watch Godzilla Spring out and grab a spaceship! No one knows when! Player with the last spaceship left wins the game!
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: GO mental FUNDAmental
description:
From the Publisher:

"GO mental® FUNDAmental can be played either as a stand-alone game or in conjunction with the classic GO mental® so that younger and older players can play, learn and enjoy together! Whether you’re a kid or just a kid at heart, no one’s left out. And, with the Junior Rules, players even younger than 8 can join in with cards you design especially for them! With GO mental® FUNDAmental the entire family can GO mental® at the same time!
Plus, with questions carefully tailored not just towards what kids know or should know but also to what kids care about, with GO mental® FUNDAmental, the interest never flags. It mixes a cunning kaleidoscope of education and entertainment, school stuff and cool stuff, in a constantly changing flurry of facts and fun from math and music to Mary Kate and Ashley; from science and sports to SpongeBob and Spiderman; from geography and history to Star Wars and dinosaurs; from basic biology to Bob the Builder."
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Math, Music, Sports, Trivia

name: Astrobirdz
description:
In the Astrobirdz card game, you decide how many tricks you can perform with the hand of cards you've been given. Each round your high cards equal fantastic sport board tricks you're trying to perform to gain all the trick cards for that round. Each turn you draw from one of the six foil BERZERKERBIRDZ cards and use their powers to help you win the contest.

This edition of the ASTROBIRDZ card game includes a full color deck of 54 cards, 6 foil BERZERKERBIRDZ cards, an ASTROBIRDZ fingerboard, a score pad, and a set of rules.

The Astrobirdz card game is a game of strategy and skill as you use the cards you've been dealt to perform as many tricks successfully as possible. The game is great fun for two to six players, ages 10 and up. Each game takes from 20-40 minutes depending on how many players there are in the game.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Science Fiction

name: Flits de Muis
description:
A game where a player tries to get the wooden mouse as fast as possible to its destination in the food chips, while another player tries to solve the dexterity game. If the player gets the food before, he gets to keep it.

Fritz der Mäuseblitz is a game for children 6 to 12. There is a board with squares between the mouse hole and the pantry. Each round, a player plays the mouse and his/her left neighbor tries simultaneously to catch the mouse. After each turn, roles turn clockwise. The player with the mouse rolls a D6 die and moves the mouse from the hole to the pantry and back to get food. Simultaneously, the other player tries to put 2 mouses in 2 traps in a tiny dexterity game. If he succeeds before the mouse reaches the pantry, he gets 2 food cards (with a number value on it), if he succeeds while the mouse in on its way back to the hole, both players get a food card, and if the mouse reaches the hole, the "mouse player" gets 2 food cards. The winner is the player with the highest total on his/her food cards.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Racing, Real-time
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Fädelraupe
description:
The caterpillar grows with each little disk. Thread correctly, and learn to distinguish colors while playing.

Ages 3 and up.

name: Kellogg's (Ten Pin) Bowling
description:
From the rules: "If you don't know or understand bowling, this game will teach you. If you do know bowling, this game will be a challenge to your knowledge and ability."

Simplistic playing card driven game. I believe I got the games from Pop-Tart boxes. I am aware of 8 games in the series.

name: Dracos: El Señor del Laberinto
description:
From the box:
"Dracos dominates the Galaxy, his power over it is complete. The only hope for the Planetary Systems under his domain lays in their representatives, who must cross the Maze by their own means, against the full power of Dracos"

This is a light maze/exploration game played on a 22x26 grid where 1-4 players assuming the roles of each of the Planetary Systems emissaries try to take their ships from one edge of the labyrinth (the board) to the opposing edge. The "walls" (or energy screens)that the labyrinth is made of are secretly deployed on a control sheet by the Dracos player, and are not visible at the beginning on the board.

The emissaries and Dracos take turns moving their ships, the emissaries trying to find a path to reach the edge of the board or in the case of Dracos, trying to destroy the ships of the emissaries.

During their movement, the emissaries can use several tools to avoid the dangers, such as scanners, lasers and shields, and in addition can cooperate exchanging these tools. Dracos has its own ships and the labyrinth itself to stop and destroy the other players.

Each player that reaches the goal square scores a marginal victory, while a total victory can only be achieved if ALL emissaries reach the goal, so cooperation is encouraged.

name: House of Whack
description:
From the publisher's description:

"...you are ready to visit the wondrous House of Whack, the legendary extra dimensional mansion full of bizarre rooms, fiendish minions and outrageous artifacts.

The House looks different each time you play because the board unfolds as you open doors to reveal new rooms. Will you grab a snack from the Vending Machines or find yourself in the middle of the Minefield? Each room affects the way you play the game, presenting new strategies and dangers. And that’s not even taking into account the Whack Deck, which is full of entertaining wonders. Face the House’s wicked minions and traps, recruit allies to aid you, and discover violent and valuable props to add to the blender of mayhem that awaits you inside this game.

Whether you enjoy playing via cleverness, deceit, brute force, or cooperation, House of Whack has something to offer everyone!"

Home Page: http://www.houseofwhack.net

name: Knickerbocker Glory
description: This childrens game consists of a set of cardboard cutouts of glasses. Children each take a 'glass' and take turns to roll a dice (different colour on each side). Rolling different colours allows children to fill up their 'glass' with different coloured fruit pieces. First to complete their knickerbocker glory wins.

name: What's That?
description: A "parlour game" in which points are scored by being able to identify everyday objects from photographs of them taken from unusual angles or close-up. Each guest gets a photograph and, during the course of the evening, when socialising, they can ask to see the other's photograph. They then write down what they think the answer should be. When their record sheet is full, they give it to the host. The one with the most correct answers wins.
publishers: Dennis's, Gibsons, H. P. Gibson & Sons, Party Games Publishers, Pepys (Castell Brothers), Universal Publications Ltd

name: Femetta
description: Femetta, a cardgame with a board, where you should collect as many card with the same number as possible, or have as many cards with the same colour as you could. Every third round the points become higher.

name: Chicken Run
description:
The folks down in Looney Hollow ain't famous for their culture, which is most evident when one notes their favorite sport: chasing down chickens. People come from all around the Hollow to watch when two families challenge each other to a Chicken Run. The only problem is that the spectators are usually so unruly and fanatical that they feel obliged to join in the game.

Be the first player to capture two chickens with family members of the same size as the captured chickens, while dodging and trampling unruly spectators and opposing family members.

Chicken Run is a barnyard sport simulation requiring 2 Treehouse sets, a 5 x 9 grid and two 6-sided dice.

Game System

Icehouse Pieces


Design Competitions

Ice Game Design Competition - Entry in 7th Competition
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Dice, Humor, Sports

name: El Listón de MARCA
description:
El listón de MARCA is a game for most athletes and for those who know most of all about sports. It can be played by up to 5 teams of one or more players. The aim is to build the word "MARCA" with a letter of each color. This requires successfully responding to questions in every major category using the boxes provided for this purpose. During the game the players will answer several questions about the world of sports to reach the main squares where they obtain letters of different colors (tokens).

This game is a fun game for the entire family and especially for sports fans in general. The game system is based on Trivia games.

MARCA is currently the best-selling sports daily in Spain and designed this game in 1997 for sale along with the newspaper for several weeks.

name: Activity Turbo Junior
description: New edition of the well known party game Activity where players have to describe words verbal, pantomimic or by drawing. In this edition the words are familiar to children and they have to describe as much of the 4 words as they can in 60 seconds.

name: Thomas & Friends: Birthday Surprise Card Game
description:
Sir Topham Hatt has been invited to a surprise birthday party, but he needs help from the engines to find his ticket, birthday card, and a special birthday gift. Be the first Really Reliable Engine to bring Sir Topham Hatt to the party to win!

Components:

52 jumbo cards
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Trains

name: 39 Clues: Search for the Keys
description: Players move around the world map gathering keys by solving geographic trivia clues. The winner is the first player to collect 4 keys.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Novel-based, Spies/Secret Agents, Trivia

name: Arena Assault: Catfight
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Battle as a heavy hitting Athena or a versatile Purrtek. Grab a group or friends, blast, pound and bash them into kitty litter on your way to victory. Arena Assault is an expandable card game compatible with all other Arena Assault games and decks. Games are fast and furious, even with large groups, allowing for many battles to be played in one game session. Includes two 50 card decks, rules and 20 Arena Gear cards. So, gear up and get ready for battle.

name: Das Ü-30 Quiz
description:
Objective:
be the first climbing up victory points list to the top
- moving/acting by turn -

each player throws the die, moving round the board, drafting cards (some multiple choice), finding questions for answers out the 60's - 90's, gaining victory points.

Contents:

1 game board with two game plans
55 quiz cards with 6600 questions and answers
4 Betting Chips
36 Number of chips
1 dice
4 game characters
1 set of instructions

name: Marvel Heroes Unite!
description:
Portable lunchbox game. The Marvel Heroes are always equipped and ready to go and now you can follow suit. Have great time wherever your adventures take you. Heroes unite. Players 2-4.

Product Features
The Marvel Heroes are always equipped and ready to go and now you can follow suit
Have great time wherever your adventures take you
Heroes unite
For Ages 4+
Players 2-4

Players roll dice on their turns in order to match the superhero icons on the dice to the villains currently at large on the table. To capture a villain such as the Lizard requires one Spiderman icon. To capture Galactus requires one each of Captain America, Hulk and Spiderman. Players may reroll "misses" but once an "X" is rolled, that die cannot be rerolled so there is a slight press-your-luck element.

There are some wild cards that give players an icon of their choice. Some other special cards give players extra rerolls or force a player to give up one of their previously captured villains.

The winner is the player who has captured the most villains when the deck runs out.

name: Game Developerz: Mobile
description: A 33-card expansion, which includes: new mobile companies, pick-up-and-play games, and mobile fun facts.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Video Game Theme

name: The Discovery Game
description:
The Discovery Game is designed to be played by a married couple. It creates an atmosphere of exhilaration, where a couple can experience something similar to those initial "falling in love" feelings. During this process, true intimacy is developed and deepened. That being said, the game is also competitive; the couple competes one against the other as they both enjoy the benefits of their new-found intimacy. It is simply a great date night in a box— accessible anytime and anywhere— no costs, no distractions, no preparations, no planning.

The Discovery Game is effective for the newlywed, the empty-nester, for couples that are very close and those who are struggling. This is possible because the couple controls the content and the pace of intimacy. The discovery game simply provides the environment and the parameters necessary for a great date to take place. Consequently, the game provides the perfect environment for a connected couple seeking an exciting night of physical intimacy, while also providing the perfect environment for a couple hoping to re-establish friendly lines of communication.

The game is a Focus on the Family "Reviewed" product. It has also received endorsements from FamilyLife, The American Association of Christian Counselors and Shaunti Feldhahn (the best-selling author of "For Men Only and For Women Only").

In that there are property spaces one may purchase, and because the Reality Check spaces often impart financial setbacks similar to those encountered in real life, The discovery Game is sometimes said to be similar to Monopoly and the Game of Life. The discover Game is different from those games in that it was designed to generate intimacy in a relationship. To that end, the discovery spaces are among the most important spaces on the board. For when a player lands on a discovery space he or she draws a discovery card. The cards prompt the player to several types of actions— all of which promote intimacy. The discovery Game is also unlike many adult board games which are purposed on inducing sexual intercourse. Sexual intercourse is often the outcome for many couples as they play, and The discovery Game does encourage mild physical intimacy and hugs, it is never coercive. Sexual intimacy that is spawned by The discovery Game is always the free choice of the players— as a couple— and the natural result of emotional intimacy.

Spaces unique to the game are:

The "Wish Space" (when a player lands on this space, using the included sand-timer, he or she must perform the wishes of his or her partner for two minutes. These wishes might be sexual in nature, but they might also involve household chores— It is always up to the players and the actions must be mutually consensual).
The “Center Square” (is a jackpot where monies from the players are directed at various points in the game. If a player enters the Center Square and rolls doubles, he or she acquires all of the money in the jackpot. If a player cannot roll doubles he or she can use his or her “Get Out of Center” card. If he or she has already used that card, the player may exit the Center Square by removing an article of clothing (socks, shoes, shirt, it is the players choice). A player can enter and exit this space from any Reality Check or discovery space on the board, and the Reality Check and discovery spaces are located all around the board. This makes the Center Square an extremely helpful way of navigating the board.


One of the greatest things about The Discovery Game is, no one feels like they are working on their marriage! It's just fun! This is a tool that has been used by thousands of strong and struggling marriages alike, to move them toward passion. It normally takes at least an hour to complete. However, because much of the game is dependent on the discussions which ensue from the discovery cards, the discussions themselves determine the time it takes to play the game.
mechanics: Action Points, Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Simulation, Trading

name: Stratos Spheres
description: Stratos Spheres is a the classic four-in-a-row game without the restrictions of the 2D board. In fact, there's no board at all because you build the game as you go. Using three-dimensional spheres, each player tries to connect four of their spheres in a row while stopping their competitor from doing the same. The first to connect four spheres horizontally, vertically, or diagonally wins.

name: WineIQ
description:
Wine IQ is the ultimate game for wine lovers, letting everyone shine and have a good time. The two levels of difficulty and the ability to play in a team make it a very sociable game. In the first round it comes to your knowledge; in the second to your memory. From the classics to the forbidden wine napa in Casablanca, from the wine to the glass, with this game you will discover fascinating things.

—description from the publisher

name: Phrase Daze
description: Divide into teams/players and place the deck of 50 cards facedown in the middle. The team going first turns over a card and tries to guess the well-known phrase that the image represents. The team/player has three guesses. One of the opposing teams/players can check if they guess the correct interpretation (answer). If the active team guesses the correct answer, they get a point. If they don’t guess the correct answer within three guesses, they don’t get a point. Play then passes to the next team/player. The first player or team to score fifteen points wins.

name: Magic: The Gathering — Innistrad: Double Feature
description:
This special limited-edition booster expansion for Magic: The Gathering contains all the cards from Innistrad: Midnight Hunt and Innistrad: Crimson Vow in a unique black-and-white style.

Each booster pack of Innistrad: Double Feature contains 7 cards Midnight Hunt and 7 cards from Crimson Vow (4 commons, 2 uncommons, and 1 rare each), plus 1 card from either of the two sets in an all-new "Silver Screen" foil treatment that resembles the traditional foils seen in other sets, except that the sheen on them is silver instead of rainbow.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Income, Interrupts, Take That

name: Studium | No Exit
description:
Dive into a unique Gothic horror fantasy board game experience that will keep you on the edge of your seat! Featuring more than 40 beautifully-sculpted miniatures, stunning gothic horror artwork, and a compelling campaign style gameplay, this tile based dungeon crawler will keep you and up to three fellow victims of the Studium coming back for more.

Players take on the role of newcomers held at the mercy of the menacing forces that control the labyrinthian Studium. Having been brought together to form a house, they are tasked with delving into the darkest depths of the Studium to eradicate unspeakable horrors. While exploring the ruined halls of the Studium, players will be challenged by engaging story events. The choices that players make may have grave consequences for their characters, their companions, or even the whole of the Studium. Combat features a familiar dice rolling experience that uses each players individual equipment and skills to provide greater depth.

Studium | No Exit is intended to be played in multiple play-sessions, with player characters evolving over time. Shaping each character are milestones that provide vital enhancements to survivability. Milestones can reflect the accumulation of knowledge, the honing of battle crafts, the cohesion of working as a team, or even romantic bonds forged between two characters. Additionally, a unique “Reflection” system allows players to leverage the Studium’s abundant resources to forge formidable weapons, armor, and accessories.

Explore an ever-changing labyrinth of terror and battle unspeakable horrors. Unlock the secrets of the Studium, upgrade your gear, and join forces with fellow survivors if you hope to make it out alive... Studium | No Exit aims to be the horror-filled board game adventure that you won't soon forget.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Fantasy, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Legacy Game, Line of Sight, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling, Tile Placement

name: Halloween II: The Game
description:
In Halloween II: The Game, players will roll dice to move their characters around the board, collect weapons, draw cards, enter dangerous 'Shape Zones,' work around unpredictable obstacles, and strategize together in an effort to stop Michael Myers from reaching and killing his intended target, Laurie Strode.

—description from the publisher
categories: Horror, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Murder/Mystery, Trivia
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Saved by the Bell Game
description:
Be the first player to score 30 points. To score points, you must land on a classroom space and have a matching Note card. You also go out on a date with Zack and Slater and meet other Saved by the Bell kids in different places at Bayside High.

The question cards have trivia, truth-or-dare, or bonuses on them. Answering a question correctly lets you move one or two spaces on the board. You can also move by spinning "Go Anywhere", which lets you go anywhere on the board.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Red Guard
description:
Mapless counter game for up to 6 players on the Great Proletarian Cultural Revolution, 1966-69.
Different factions within the Chinese Communist Party vie for control of important sites such as the Military Affair Committee or the Flying Pigeon Bicycle Factory, while trying not to plunge all of China into civil war and chaos.
Meanwhile, Chairman Mao floats around the arena.
Will your faction be ready to assume power when the Great Leader departs the workers paradise ?
Or will you be able to exert your dominance even before the tragic event?

36 tiles create a map of important Chinese political, military and social sites.
1 sheet of 208 counters shows the forces involved, divided among Party cadres, Workers, Red Guard activists and People's Liberation Army units.
categories: Civil War, Modern Warfare, Political, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Area-Impulse, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Fairy Tale Assassin League: Red Riding Hood Rampage
description:
Fairy Tale Assassin League is a story telling card game. It asks the question: “What happens when Snow White goes to Las Vegas and turns bad?” There are no more happy ever afters.

The game starts with players choosing a fairy tale character; one will be the villain, the remainder good. Each characters starts in one of six locations (restaurant, parking lot, theater, stage, kitchen and back alley). The first act of the game is to come up with reasons why the bad guy has to go down. The bad guy starts by bragging about how bad they are. The heroes then say how they have been personally hurt by him. Players can jump in with suggestions for other people’s stories.

The rest of the game is about bringing the villain down (and maybe to justice). The bad guy starts the game. Players take turns to add to the story, assisted by a tableau of scene cards (representing some key point in a revenge story plot) and action cards that can be played from hand. Another player’s version of events can be challenged by playing an action card. Challenges are resolved by rolling dice, with the winner winning the card their opponent used. All cards are worth victory points.

The aim of the game is to score the most victory points while also telling an interesting story.

The publisher intends to produce two 54 card decks. One will be titled Red Riding Hood Rampage and the other Snow White? Not Anymore. The two decks can be combined to make a larger scale game.

name: Disney The Lion King: The Game
description:
Try to avoid Scar and the hyenas as you travel through the African savanna.
Collect tokens as you make your way around the game board—4 matching tokens gets you the win!
Exciting and engaging gameplay provides a whole new type of Lion King experience.

—description from the publisher

name: UNO: Barbie
description:
Another Uno variation. It features Barbie and friends on the back of the cards and a Barbie-esque decorative scheme on the front including a phone, purse, hat, perfume and flower.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The Friendship card. When a Friendship card is played, it allows you to trade cards with another player, exchanging your entire hand for theirs.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Pro Soccer
description:
Object of the game : To be the player that coaches the soccer team scoring the most goals.
To Play the Game:
Players take it in turns to move 3 player figures & then roll dice for how far the 'kicked' ball travels. Includes 20mm miniature soccer players in red & white plastic, a ball piece, A3 size map of playing field, 2 six-sided dice, rules on the bottom of the box, & an A5 size reference guide booklet.
The booklet provides diagrams of how to play such manoeuvres as: kicking the ball, defensive blocking, passing the ball, team passing, defensive formations, out of bounds play, corner kicks, penalty kicks, goal kicks, throwing doubles and scoring goals.
The chess-like squares are 15mm wide & represent 4m of playing field (about 1:300 scale).
The playing pieces for the figures are about 20mm high (about 1:75 scale).
The procedures for playing the game lend themselves to expansion & variants.
Looks more complicated than Table Soccer according to paperwork provided.
publishers: John Sands Pty Ltd, Milton Bradley

name: Settling Zion
description: This game is what I would consider Settlers of Catan on a square grid. There are no roads needed to place the settlements, but you have to pay for them by using resources collected from a die roll that corresponds to a number on the area. Because the grid is used, the players place settlements on the cross of 4 corners, and have access to all of the resources touching it. The main goal of the game is to build your settlements, advance them from branches to wards to stakes (settlement to city) so that you can collect more resources (1,2 or 3). Then along the way the final goal is to pay for certain cards with resources and money(gold resource). After all the cards have been collected by the players the one with the most of these special cards (3 different kinds) wins. Along the way there are special cards that allow for the "robber" (every player rolls on the end of their turn to see if they are robbed [on doubles of the dice]) to not influence you, the black crickets card to unaffect you via the seagulls card, missionary cards, divine inspiration cards, paying tithing bonuses, etc. The components need some help, being that it does look like a first production. Thicker cardboard than normal games might have. Instead of a deck of cards, they come in a sheet you have to pull apart. For a first try it wasn't bad, except the trench (folded area of board), which makes placement on that area annoying.

name: Scooby-Doo and Scrappy-Doo Game
description:
From inside the Box: The doggy detectives are on a treasure hunt in a Haunted Castle. Help the pooches seek and search by being the first player to move your Scrappy-Doo playing piece into the treasure room. If you do, you'll wint the game. Of course, Scrappy moves only along a special path...and the number of spaces he moves is determined by the movement of Scooby-Doo along the outer "castle wall" path.

This is a light-weight "spin and move" game from Milton Bradley. It was really cheaply made, using all thin, carboard parts and a lower-than-average quality board. It's suggested for kids ages 6-10 years old.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
publishers: MB Jeux, MB Spellen, MB Spiele, Milton Bradley

name: X-tiles
description: Each player starts with 7 X-shaped tiles. On your turn you add a tile. If your tile has two matching borders, you may play another. It's a race to get rid of your tiles first.

name: The Couch Potato Game
description: A television commercial-watching game designed for rapid party play. Players get a hand of five cards, either objects or special "Goof Proof" cards. The game owner selects a channel to watch on television, and when the commercials come on, players race to either find their own objects, or the objects of other players' face up cards so as to block them. Everybody is trying to get rid of their hand first to win the round. Perhaps the most engaging aspect of this game is that the card tray is specially designed to hold snacks as well. The rule book can objectively be designated as quite humorous.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Real-time

name: BLARF
description:
Backwards...Left...Any Straight Angle...Right...Forward...let's "BLARF"

Each player has five pieces with the letters B, L, A, R or F printed on one side and A on the other. On each turn, players roll a six-sided die and move one piece the number of spaces indicated in the direction allowed for that piece, or in any direction if the piece is resting on a free (black) square. Then the moved piece is flipped over. Landing upon a free square earns an extra turn. Capturing opposing pieces is by displacement, but capture by jumping is also allowed on a roll of two. Any capture also earns an extra turn. Moving a piece up against the edge of the board indicated by its letter, thus making further moves with that piece impossible, causes that piece to be removed. The last player with pieces remaining on the board wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Congo The Movie
description: Your mission is a deadly one, find the Laser Diamond in the City of Zinj. If fear doesn't stop you - hippos, earthquakes and gray gorillas just might, Can the expedition survive long enough to reach the city, then find the hidden diamond? Set your life energy dial. Then roll the dice to follow the jungle path. Escape danger by spinning special spinners and rolling dice. But watch out. Life energy levels can get critically low. Players may have to protect each other to survive. In the City of Zinj, search for the diamond. Leave no stones unturned. The player who finds it wins the game.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Sea Battle
description:
Sea Battle is a card game played in a manner similar to Battleship. The components are 89 water cards with identical fronts and backs and 32 ships cards whose backs are the same as the water cards. The game is packaged in a nice hard clear plastic box that is divided into 3 compartments to hold the cards and rules. A full color cardboard slip case shows three ships in battle on the front and a brief description. illustration of a grid layout, component list and the name Altenburg-Stralsunder Spielgarten AG.

On the side of the slip case is printed: Altenburg-Stralsunder Spielgarten AG Leinfelden bei Stuttgart and SEA BATTLE a GAME BY ACE. The logo is the word ACE over a red heart inside the letter V and inside a circle.

According to the very brief and somewhat vague rules, "Each player selects 20 or more water cards and 8 ships cards..." There are 3 colors of ships. The cards are laid out in a grid all face down. 3 Red ships are independent and may be placed face down anywhere in the grid, Brown ships are part of a small fleet and must be placed adjacent to one other Brown ship orthogonally and Yellow ships form a large fleet and must be placed adjacent to 2 other Yellow ships orthogonally or diagonally.

The very brief rules refer to a players ability to move or exchange ships during the turn but give no specifics on when and how. Also not given are any specifics regarding more than two players. Players alternate calling out grid locations and revealing cards. A hit entitles the player to another shot. A player wins when he has sunk all the opponents ships. (Pix will follow).

name: Barrier
description:
Barrier: The international game of tactical momentum

As in checkers, the object of the game is to eliminate the opponent's playing pieces by jumping them from adjacent squares. In Barrier, however, the freedom of being able to move forward or diagonally, plus the additional "barrier" rows in the center of th eboard, add an entire new dimension to the game.

Players first set up the barrier rows by placing their set of tiles on one by one. These tiles show a diamond shape which signifies which direction a piece may move when in the barrier area.

Then players take turns moving their pawns until only one colour remains.

name: Lucky Shots Golf Board Game
description:
In this golf game played over multiple holes, players select clubs after determining their target yardage. Players shoot the ball by rolling a white die for line direction and a green die for distance. Results are determined by cross-referencing to a shot index chart. While the player with the lowest total number of strokes wins in standard scoring, other golf formats can also be played.

From the box back:
It's golf for everyone.
It's fun and exciting.
It's educational and challenging.
It's Lucky shots golf.

A game where club selection allows safe of aggressive play as in real golf.

name: Operation Brain Surgery
description:
Reach into the head of Cavity Sam to find out what's on his mind...

Players receive three cards which list various "head ailments" - train of thought, block head, bright idea etc. On his turn, a player presses Sam's nose, reaches blindly into the head cavity, and has 15 seconds to locate an item on one of his cards. If he takes too long, or if the player is too rough, Sam's nose lights up and a buzzer sounds meaning the operation was unsuccessful. To add to the fun, the patient ridicules the "surgeon" with wisecrack remarks. The first player to collect all three items on their cards wins the game. The game teaches children to recognize shapes using only touch.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Humor, Medical

name: It's a Pharaohs Life
description: A single player paper and pencil game where you play as a pharaoh, how long can the reign last and what impact will individual pharaohs have on the world is the question this game seeks to answer.

name: Stoopido
description:
For setup each player gets a big red pair of plastic glasses on which different parts of masks can be attached: one part for the hat (or top of the head), one for the nose, two for the ears, and one for the eyes (some of the later also hinder sight).

Player take turns to roll a six sided custom die with faces, which determine, which part can be added to a face. Then everybody tries to first hit the correct "button" tile in front of the players, to be allowed to place such a part onto another player. Additionally there is a "wild" die face, which allows to place any part and a "bad luck" one, were another player may put a part onto the player, who rolled the die.

Whoever is first full attached with all pieces looses the game and a photography can be taken from him or her.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Dice, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval, Pirates, Real-time, Science Fiction

name: Hedbanz: Pokemon X Y
description:
The game that's all about using your head! Discover the quick question game of 'Who am I?' featuring favorite Pokémon characters.

Play the game where you never know which character you are until you start asking questions! Are you Pikachu, Bulbasaur, or maybe Squirtle?

Be the first player to guess who you are and win! Pokemon Hedbanz—where everybody knows but you!

—description from the publisher
categories: Deduction, Party Game, Real-time, Video Game Theme

name: You Be the Judge
description:
You Be The Judge - The game of Real Life Court Dramas.

You be the Judge contains brief descriptions of 500 court cases from around the world.

Players divide themselves into two teams and take it in turns to decide on the outcome of a court case.

One person from Team A selects a card from the box and reads it out loud to Team B, who then have the opportunity to consult with each other before announcing whether they, the jury, are FOR or AGAINST. If they answer correctly then they advance 0, 1, 2, 3 places round the scoreboard, dependant on the number thrown on a dice. If they answer incorrectly, their turn ends immediately.

Team B now reads a case to Team A, who in turn, deliberate and announce their findings . And so on...

The game ends after one Team has completed a circuit of the board (16 spaces).
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Paul Lamond Games Ltd, Spear's Games

name: Across the Continent
description:
Each player draws a list of cities that they must visit, in sequence, which starts and ends at a particular city. Players roll the dice and move along their chosen routes to reach their target cities. Every time they throw doubles they must draw a card. Most cards have a question about a state capitol that rewards the player for answering correctly, or punishes them for answering incorrectly. Occasionally the cards have no question but just advance the player's car to the next destination. The first player to reach all of their cities and return home is the winner.

Originally published 1890 (patent no. 469089), re-released by Parker 1901, 1910, 1922, 1952.

This game may well have been the inspiration for the later games Pirate and Traveler, Boxcars and Rail Baron.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: You Gotta Be Kidding Card Game
description:
Card game version of the board game with same name. You Gotta Be Kidding gets kids and grown-ups thinking, laughing, reasoning and having a blast making goofy decisions and completing the wild "Would You Rather" Challenges. Best of all, kids have fun speaking up for a change, instead of always saying "I don't know." Watch imagination rule and confidence build as kids get comfortable standing up for their choice while laughing the whole time. Players must choose between two difficult scenarios such as: eating a bucket of apple stems or eating 20 banana stems. "Neither" is not permitted as an answer in this card game.

Contents:

160 "Would You Rather" Questions
2 Choice Chips
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Take Me Home O.K.O
description:
This 1950s French-Canadian game is a form of bingo or lotto but played with a regular deck of cards. The game consists of a roll of red tokens and a set of 12 player boards, each showing 25 different cards in a five-by-five grid. Unlike bingo, there is no free center space on a board, nor are card values restricted to any given row or column.

The dealer or caller shuffles the card deck and turns over the top cards one at a time. Each player with that card showing on their board covers it with a red token. As in bingo, the winner is the first to cover a line of five horizontally, vertically or diagonally and call "O.K.O". The winner then becomes the next caller.

The numbering on the player boards suggest that there were at least three series of 12 available (to allow for larger groups).

The rules are printed in English and French on the inside of the box lid, along with Patent No. 207035 and the designer and publisher's address and phone number.
publishers: (Self-Published), Chieftain Products, Éditions Gladius International, Inc.

name: Mystery Date: Catfished
description:
Mystery Date Catfished is an adult party version of the classic Mystery Date board game that many people remember from their childhood.

This game brings you into dating in the digital age. By picking, swapping, and collecting the trait cards and action cards, you'll wade through a sea of weirdos as you search for love in the dubious world of online dating. Once it's time to open the door on the game board, prepare to meet the companion of your dreams and your dating scenario. But watch out! You just might get catfished instead!

—description from the publisher

name: Prendi e porta a casa
description:
Bilingual edition: Italian/English

Prendi e Porta a casa! is a fast game in which players give each other politically correct insults.
Every player has a deck of insults and special cards to give away their insult faster and make other players' decks grow. The first player to end his deck wins.

name: Crosswords for Dummies
description:
Have you ever played a crossword game in which you end up with all consonants or all vowels? Or you get some combination...and still can't come up with even a three-letter word? As you rearrange the letters one more time, the other players are getting, well, impatient. That was then but now it's time to play crosswords The Dummies Way.

In this game you begin with 10 word strips and 100 points. Each word strip has a word from 3-7 letters. On one side the word is written from left to right, on the other it is written from top to bottom. Players take turns playing their words crossword fashion on a board. There are bonuses that allow the players to "go again" or "give a word" to another player. The object is to get rid of all of your words first. Other players then lose points for the words they have left.

Rounds are played until someone gets to zero and then highest score wins.

name: Trango
description:
From the back of the box:

Strategy meets opportunity with a little bit of luck in this truly original game for two to four players!

Players must try to complete different patterns with the interlocking game pieces to score points without being blocked.

There's only one problem, your opponents will try anything to trick, deceive and outwit you every step of the way!

Trango is played with interlocking triangular plastic pieces, which the players place on the table, constructing the board or "matrix" as they go. On a player's turn, he or she rolls a die to determine how many pieces he or she places (1, 2 or 3), and tries to complete geometric figures worth varying numbers of points (or block other players' attempts to do the same).

The game includes 128 game pieces in four colors (32 pieces per player), a six-sided die, a scoring pencil and a scorepad, and comes in a triangular white box.

name: Chill Out!
description:
Players attempt to get rid of all the cards in their hand. The roll of two dice determines what you can do on your turn:

Dice Total 1 through 6 = Discard a card, discard a run of 1-2-3-4 in the same color, or play an action card.

Dice Total 7 = Discard a card and give one card to another player.

Dice Total 8 through 12 = Draw a card from the deck or discard pile.

Rolling doubles gives you twice the reward/penalty as you can discard 2 cards, or you have to draw 2 cards.

Action cards are all different ways of adding more cards to a specific opponents hand.

name: Chainstore
description:
"The Highstreet Battle of Takeovers and Mergers"

One of the Monopoly-inspired family of games. Players purchase chains of high street shops and London department stores, furnish them with stock and charge their opponents as customers.

Later in the game, players may pair up and pool their assets to become mergers. Players drop out as they become bankrupt until only one player or merger remains.
mechanics: Ownership, Roll / Spin and Move, Semi-Cooperative Game, Set Collection, Trading

name: War of the Sky Galleons
description:
One of the "Warriors of the Green Planet Trilogy of Games". The games are set on a future Earth that has suffered an "axial flip of 72 degrees", resulting in various disasters and changes that result in this hypothetical post-apocalyptic game world.

War of the Sky Galleons is the aerial combat game. Units include Scouting Ships, Cruising Ships, and Ships of Battle. The game provides for boarding, grappling, and lase-gun combat between these airborne sailing ships.

A set of expansion rules allowed War of the Sky Galleons to be played together with the companion games Warriors of the Green Planet and Mind War.

name: The Secret Garden
description:
A tie-in to the Warner Brothers film that was based on the Frances Hodgson Burnett book.

The object is to claim the most of the 12 magical items in the Secret Garden. Each object is competed for in turn, with the players engaging in a roll and move race to get to the item in contention. When someone claims it, a new item is revealed and the race is to that item. Once all the items have been claimed, the game ends and the player with the most items (one of them counts double) wins.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Mr. Pop!
description: Mr. Pop is a combination of Mr. Potato Head and Perfection. A player sets the timer and then flips over a card. The card pictures a completed face in one of three difficulty levels. The player must place the correct plastic facial features into the slots on Mr. Pop's head to match the illustration. If time runs out before the player finishes, the head pops up, scattering the poor sap's incomplete face across the table.
publishers: Chad Valley Co Ltd., Clipper, Crown & Andrews Ltd., Games Galore Ltd, Goliath Games, Lakeside, MB Jeux, MB Juegos, MB Spiele, Milton Bradley, Tobar Ltd, Toy:Lobster, Viozach

name: Society Today
description:
The object of the SOCIETY TODAY Game is to reach The Best of All Possible Worlds before any other player, using your knowledge about people and social institutions, your intelligence, and sheer luck to overcome the many obstacles that life—and your opponents—may put in your path.

A roll-and-move board and trivia game. Contents are:

8 player tokens
32 Refusal tokens
32 shot-in-the-dark cards
16 limbo cards
24 imponderable cards
timer
dice rules with 300 questions

The true/false questions are about "society today". Many are factual (such as Q40: During the early 1960s income differences between black and white males with some college increased (true)). Others are subjective (such as Q37: At the same job level, Catholics are more conservative than Protestants (false, apparently)). Gameplay is roll and move, following the instructions on the square you land on. Shot-in-the-dark, limbo and imponderable cards are similar to community chest in Monopoly - random events that may be good or bad. With shot-in-the-dark cards you have to convince a judge (another player) of the merit of one side of a social issue.
publishers: Communications/Research/Machines/Inc., Dynamic Games / Dynamic Design Industries

name: Strategy: An Introductory Wargame
description:
"Strategy postulates a military conflict between two neighboring island nations. On each island there are a number of cities, airfields, and ports, linked together by a road net, and coastlines covered by radar (the technology is approximately that available during World War II)."

There are two 8 1/2" x 11" color maps, 80 die-cut counters, played over a maximum of 25 turns. The other side of the counters are used in another game, 2WW.

name: Megallo
description:
From the publisher's website:

Megallo is a three-dimensional strategy game for two players. This is an alignment game, in which four playing boards form a winged-box with three levels. The objective of the game is to place game chips on the board in any one of six winning combinations. The unique design of the game requires players to use spatial reasoning and strategic thinking to outwit each other.

name: Breakout
description: A two-player game attempting to recreate the feel of command of the opposing forces during the period 25 July 1944 through 29 August 1944 as the Allies broke the stalemate in Normandy and raced to the Seine, as German resistance melted.

name: Jeopardy! Junior
description:
Jeopardy! Junior is a Danish version for kids of the American television quiz show. The game's format follows the show's.

One player acts as the Quizmaster and is responsible for asking the question from the chosen card and determining if the answer given is correct. Players select the cards from six categories, which are tailored for children, and from the easiest (and lowest value) first. If they buzz in earliest and answer correctly, they receive the chips from that spot and the next higher value question becomes available. The game also has a Chance (Daily Double), in which the player wins double his wager if he correctly replies in the form of a question.

When all cards on the board have been attempted, the Final Jeopardy round begins. All players wager on and attempt to answer the Quizmaster's question. The Jeopardy Grandmaster is the player with the highest total value of chips at the end.

name: Monopoly: Historic Boston
description:
Traditional tokens are used, however the properties have a local historic flavor to them.

From the box:

Few cities in the United States have had more of an impact on American history and life than Boston. From Pilgrims and patriots to her legendary resistance, heroic battles and stalwart ships, Boston served as a hotbed of revolutionary activity and cradle of the thirteen colonies' desire for liberty and self-determination.

"Freedom of thought and the right of private judgment in matters of conscience, driven from every other corner of the earth, direct their course to this happy country as their last asylum," Samuel Adams, Boston Patriot and Politician On Freedom of Thought.

Come. Gather family and friends to play this Boston edition of the Monopoly Game and watch historic Beantown come to life. Be risk takers and deal makers, as were our Boston ancestors. Trade in landmark properties and become part of the living history that is Boston.

The Monopoly Brand proudly salutes the city famous for its pivotal insistence on freedom and independence.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Securicor
description:
SECURICOR - An exciting game of chase involving banks, bullion and banditry.

One player is the Securicor Operator and the other player or players the thieves. The Securicor Operator's aim is to move the Securicor vans with the bullion loads safely from the banks to the factories. The Securicor Operator can choose whether to load both lots of bullion into one vehicle and use the other as a decoy, or load one lot into each vehicle.

During the journey the thieves try to intercept and rob the Securicor vans and take the bullion back to their own Headquarters. If a robbery takes place, the Securicor operator uses the police cars to try and recapture the bullion from the thieves. The thieves also can try and capture bullion loads from each other after a Securicor van has been robbed.

A complete game consists of five rounds (2 bullion loads per round). Players take it in turns to be the Securicor Operator.

At the end of five turns the winner is the player to have collected the most bullion.

name: Hermans Historiespel
description:
Herman is Herman Lindqvist, Swedish journalist and author. He has written many books on Swedish history, most of them not well received by scholars. However, a lot of people read his books and he is an important part of the booming interest in history in Sweden. This game was however designed by Camilla Borgström, also a journalist, with Mr. Lindqvist just acting as figurehead.

The game is about answering questions on Swedish history, and there is also a gambling mechanism. The gameboard is colourful with portraits of kings and queens.

Components:
Gameboard
5 tiles
23 king cards
750 question cards
140 money chits
1 die
rules

name: The Yoga Garden Game
description: In The Yoga Garden Game you roll a die and move a bumblebee through a circular garden. If you land on a yoga space, you try to do a classic yoga pose or invent your own. This game is for teaching young children Ages 4 and up about yoga.
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Het Elfstedenspel
description:
This is a game about the Elfstedentocht (Eleven Cities Tour), a 200-km ice skating race that leads through eleven different cities.

Each player tries to win the race by being the first to reach the finish. Every turn, a player rolls a die and moves his pawn (a skater) as many spaces forward as the die indicates.

Depending on the field where he ends, several follow-up actions are possible, such as having to move back some spaces (due to adverse wind) or taking another turn (because the public cheers you on). On certain fields, the player must answer a trivia question on the Elfstedentocht. The questions are about the race itself and about the eleven cities.

name: Négoces
description: Negotiate with the other players the purchase and the sale of goods and become the Great Negotiator. Each player is a merchant. At the beginning, it holds the monopoly of 2 goods and has gold coins. To gain, it must hold 8 different goods and at least 10 parts. For that, exchanges are organized between the players. Simple and original game, Négoces will astonish you by his subtlety. In this play the chance never intervenes, only your direction of the negotiation will enable you to gain.

name: The Kama Sutra Game
description:
From the back of the game:

For more than a thousand years Kama Sutra has been a guide for lovers of all ages. We have interpreted this great work and offer it to a couple as an interactive game experience.

The Kama Sutra Game™ offers lovers the opportunity to explore the sensual and sexual aspects of their body, mind, and spirit on the journey to experiencing ecstasy.

Object of the Game
- To have fun developing a deeper understanding of what you and your lover like and want in your intimate relationship.

- To engage in an extended session of lovemaking that builds on anticipation, creativity, adventure, and a progression of physical intimacy.

- To expand your sensory awareness through activities using sight, hearing, taste, smell, and... touch.

Game Play
Rolling the die and moving your game pieces, each of you will travel a different path. During the game, the two of you will be communicating, sharing, and participating in a multitude of pleasurable activities and accumulating "Sexual Position" cards. These cards will be played to complete your "journey to ecstasy."

Included in the game:
A playing board, 56 activity and position cards, a die, 2 playing pieces, and instructions.

A Journey to Ecstasy awaits you!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Go Fish Dice
description: A novel new twist on the classic children's game Go Fish. As the product name says, this edition uses dice instead of cards. So instead of drawing a card when your opponent says "go fish" you get to roll another die.

name: Monopoly: Cornwall Edition
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Cornwall, in the United Kingdom.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Parker Brothers, Winning Moves UK Ltd.

name: Was zählt?
description: The players look at several images (holiday pictures) and try to find out who has the most cars, animals, trees, etc. in their pictures.

name: Tavern Heroes
description:
A game in which players play boastful, drunken knights at a bar, making descending bids over how little weapons or armor they need to defeat a dragon.

Eventually, one knight will have his bid challenged, and he will have to attempt to make his bravery stand up. The other players make bets on the outcome. Hopefully the knight hasn't "enjoyed" himself at the tavern too much...

The game ends after eight dragons are challenged.

name: Castle Keep
description: A game of medieval conquest. The object is to be the first player to control seven castles on the map. The players must construct their own hex mapsheet containing twelve castles. Five terrain types are used to create the map: clear, forest, mountain, river, and sea. Each player starts the game in control of three castles and three armies. The game uses a custom deck of cards which are played to resolve battles.

name: Astrojagd
description: The players are astronauts trying to find out and get as many super-crystals from Super-crystals galaxy as possible. They start from their space stations and and travel through the stars following the number obtained on the dice (from 2 to 6). Additionally, a space shuttle travels into the galaxy and it is moved every time the dice shows its figure (corresponding to number 1). When a player lands on a star containing a chip he must turn it out: if the chip shows a super-crystal the player take it. The players should bring as many crystals as possible back to their space stations before the space shuttle reach the galaxy. However, the chip can show no crystal but a monster, a crystal-breaker. In this case, the astronaut rolls the dice to fight against the monster, which power corresponds to the number of its teeth. If the player wins, he captures the crystal-breaker and can bring it to his station as his prisoner. If the monster wins, all crystals owned by the player and still not safe in his station are put on this field and become property of the monster. These crystals can be recovered by a player who defeat the monster in another battle. The game ends when the spaceship arrives at the galaxy and the winner is the player who has the majority of the points given by the values of crystals and the amount of monster teeth he has brought to his start station.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Global City
description: Global City is a game of skill for two to four players. Players travel among twelve international cities developing six aspects: Communication, Culture, Finance, Media, Sport and Transport. Players gain victory points by influencing the development of the six aspects in these twelve cities.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Hand Management

name: Auf und Davon
description:
from espenlaub.de

"It dawns the morning and the time to dive into the grave. And then the race starts. Head Over Heels is rolled to the right signposts. And then, on the way, they must be extremely careful to not fall into the evil Garlic fog. Which vampire trio go first to the tomb?"

Logic game in which players goes theirs vampires to the crypts.

Player thrown cube and moves his vampire on first free symbol (vertical or horizontal). When a garlic appears, player moves "garlic-clouds" which are blocking opponent move.

name: Hello Kitty Muffinsspelet
description:
Hello Kitty Muffinsspelet (Swedish. English translation: Hello Kitty The Cupcake game)

Game components:

Game Board,
4 Hello Kitty playing pieces,
1 6-sided die,
20 cupcake counters
4 Hello Kitty counters
4 Hello Kitty and Daisy counters
4 treat tokens
1 rulebook

The basic idea of the the game is to roll the die and move around the edge of the board where the counters are laid out. When you land on a counter you flip it over and either take an action or keep it, depending on what the counter shows. The goal is to collect 4 of the same kind of cupcake and then move to one of the cupcakes depicted in the center of the board and put a treat token on top. The first player to do this wins the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Mysterion
description:
Mysterion is a fantasy themed roll and move game in which players take turns and move around a labyrint style game board.
Many spaces of the game board have special efects on the player, such as an extra roll or change of direction.
The central point of the game board is a spin mechanism that is triggered when players step on specific tiles, changing the boards layout and altering the game board itself.

The goal of the game is to colect seven keys that are situated in seven chambers at the begining of the game, and succesfully enter the lock chamber.
publishers: Hračky a hry s.r.o., TOHIS-Autohit spol.s r.o.

name: Fingerpori
description:
Based on the popular finnish comic Fingerpori by Pertti Jarla, players assume various roles as characters from the comic.

Fingerpori is a party game, and has similarities with games like Alias, Pictionary and Balderdash.

The tasks the players takes on include:


word explanation
guiding the other players drawing a picture in the hope they will guess what they are drawing
acting out strips and wordplays from the comic
guessing other player's secret identities by asking yes/no questions


By successfully completing these tasks the players advance on the board. The first player to enter main protagonist Heimo Vesa's left ear wins.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Party Game, Racing, Word Game
mechanics: Acting, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Point to Point Movement

name: Football Game
description:
Football game is an "educational game" aimed at children and families. Players take turns rolling the die, advancing their player down the pitch. The first player to score a goal wins.

Score the first goal to win the game!

A roll and move game similar to snakes and ladders. However the game also come with two spinners to simulate the decision of the umpire's whistle (can be good or bad) and the attempt of the goal keeper to block the shot on goal.

Each player has their own player board and football counter.

Game description from the box:
Watch the ball pass backwards and forwards as you race to score the winning goal in this exciting game of football!

name: Who Am I?
description: A brilliantly fun new guessing game from Purple Donkey. Attach the mats to your face, then try to guess who, or what, you are by asking the relevant questions. Whether family fun at Christmas or breaking the ice at parties this is an engaging and riotously funny picture guessing game.

name: Resolvers: Time to Shift
description:
Augmentations and artificial intelligence, synthetic twins and temporal relocation. This world is challenging you. Your goal is to catch criminals as well as to prevent crimes. Why accept the reality as is if you can edit it? Collect evidence, hack gadgets, buy super arms and implants. Overpower passion-filled Redport, feel megalopolis wide pulse and gain the respect of city-ruling forces!

A fully cooperative role-playing adventure. Several investigations connected by an epic plot and a legacy system. Unique features include replayable investigations and crime prevention. 1-4 players choose heroes and dive into a cyberpunk world to investigate crimes then travel to the past and prevent them.

Resolvers: Time to Shift is a cooperative game. During their turn, a player selects a desired action for their character from the list provided by the app and follows the instructions on the screen, such as moving player/npc pieces, opening new location tiles, performing skill checks, adding equipment cards e.t.c. Each player action takes time, which is tracked by the app and used to select an active player. The app also keeps all the information gathered by the players during their investigations. When players think they have accumulated enough knowledge, they can jump back in time to prevent a crime. Successfully preventing a crime opens the next campaign mission.

Replayability is delivered by an app generating detective stories. The app explains rules, tracks time and saves players progress.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Deduction, Events, Legacy Game, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Negotiation, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Rechen-Piraten
description:
Pirate Arithmetics

The pirates have discovered a treasure chest! But how to divide up the booty? Very easy, the pirate, cleverest and quickest at arithmetic gets the most gold coins! The arithmetic disk shows the right result. A game collection about addition, subtraction and multiplication for 2 - 4 arithmetical pirates.
With increasing degrees of difficulty.

Ages 6-99.

name: World Cycling Game
description:
This is a game from Denmark, designed by a former Danish professional cyclist, Niels Kristian Andersen. The game comes with a rulebook in four languages: Danish, German, English and Italian. Game components include seven different teams with seven cyclist pieces of each, one team leader, two climbers, two tempo-riders and two sprinters each, plus special pieces for the yellow, green, polka-dot and World Champion jerseys. The game comes with modular pieces that allow the player to design any course and comes with instructions for major cycling races like the Liege-Bastogne-Liege and Paris-Roubaix classics, the 2009 Tour de France, and the 2009 World Championship. Movement of the cyclists is controlled by die rolls and play of tactical cards.

From the advertising on the game box:

"World Cycling Game is a fun and intense game for the whole family. In World Cycling Game you need to see the big picture and have patience as the game is not won by luck but by the right tactic.

You set your team with your own favourites and use your tactical cards wisely. In World Cycling Game you battle against your friends for the yellow and polka dot jersey or the World Championship and the rainbow colored jersey. You'll find the greatest and historical races in this game or you can build thousands of different routes yourself with long mountains and dangerous downhill passages. World Cycling Game is a very varied and always exciting game and you can play it over and over."

name: Das Krokodil-Spiel
description:
A gripping duel between two hungry crocodiles and a bold "oarsman".

One player steers two green crocodiles, the other player owns a red rowing boat (wooden playing pieces). Both start opposite of each other in the middle of a 4 by 8 "river" board. The boat player secretly chooses one card (printed with the values 1 to 4) to select the column on the board he wishes to move to. The crocodile player has to guess this column and place his crocodiles on two spaces to block the boat. If the crocodile player was right, the boat has to retreat one row into the direction of "its" river bank, if the other player succeeded in choosing a crocodile-free space, he moves one step to the river bank of the other player.
Whoever reaches the opposite bank first is the winner.
No tactics involved, just blind guessing.

Was available as a big box with nicely designed components first, later followed by a small version (1988) with tiny pieces and (flimsy) cardboard river (with lots of air in the box).
publishers: Crown & Andrews Ltd., Dourios, Noris Spiele

name: Kids Battle the Grown-Ups
description:
From the box:

"When talking escrow or Elvis, grown-ups clearly know more. But do they know Bunnicula from The Backstreet Boys?

Designed to help parents and kids learn more about each other's interests, this team game is truly a fair match. Kids are asked questions that most grown-ups can answer, and the grown-ups are asked questions that most kids can answer."

The board portrays a tug-of-war battle, where the rope is pulled with each right answer. The first team to pull their opponents into the center of the board wins the game.

Sample questions for the kids to answer:

"Which painter is famous for putting noses and eyes in the wrong place?" (Picasso)
"What kind of animal was TV's Mr. Ed?" (A horse, of course)

Sample questions for the grown-ups to answer:

"What kind of dolls are Chloe, Yasmin, Sasha and Jade?" (Brattz)
"Name all four of the Earth's oceans." (Atlantic, Pacific, Indian, and Arctic)

name: Monopoly: Doctor Who – Regeneration Edition
description:
Tour time, space and beyond.

In this Regeneration Edition of Monopoly, people and places are all up for grabs.

This brand new Regeneration Edition of Doctor Who Monopoly lands on Earth just as the Twelfth Doctor takes to the TARDIS console for the first time. Relive the final days of the Eleventh Doctor, his adventure with the Tenth Doctor and the War Doctor, his quest for the truth about the Impossible Girl and all the excitement of a Regeneration and a new body.

With beautifully crafted special tokens and customised U.N.I.T and TARDIS cards this is the perfect companion piece to the thrills and spills of Season 8.

The aim of the game is to buy and trade properties to collect rent from your fellow players. In this edition the properties are people that the Doctor has met, planets, and locations featured on the show. To win you try to keep your money whilst trying to bankrupt everyone else, as when you are bankrupt you are out of the game.
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Zobmondo!! Would You Rather...? Pocket Version
description:
From the Publisher:
In this version you'll find questions that are ethical, bizarre and mind-bending, but each is a field-tested conversation starter that is guaranteed to provoke ridiculous fun, break the ice at any party, and - if played correctly - open a unique window into the wild imaginations of friends and family!

name: The Grid Game
description:
The Grid is a colorful board game that creates beautiful patterns as you play it. Based on the rules of the Dominoes, it is a mix between a puzzle and a strategy game that you can play alone or with/against up to 10 friends.

The game consists of 88 hexagonal tiles, each made of three diamond-shaped faces. Visually, each piece looks like a 2D representation of a cube. The tiles are made from six varieties of color, plus some black tiles.

The rules of The Grid Game are simple:


Each player gets a number of tiles, depending on the number of players.
You have to connect tiles by color and height.
In order to play a tile it has to touch two tiles at the same time
There are special black tiles that serve to block further advance; no tile, even another black one, can touch a black tile.


Players take turns placing tiles according to these rules until no one can make another move, first one to use all his/her tiles, wins the game.

name: The Rescuers
description:
The object of the game is to move your playing token around the board, trying to get enough help from Bianca, Bernard, and all the other kindhearted creatures to rescue Penny from the villains. The first player to collect five rescue chips will save Penny from Medusa, Snoops, and the two crocodiles - Brutus and Nero.

Ages 6 - 12

Includes:
Game board
3 large villain cards
28 rescue chips
Devil's Eye Diamond Spinner
4 tokens with Penny pictured on them
4 plastic stands
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Space War!
description:
From the publisher's web site...

"Blazing Lasers! Titanic death-dealing dreadnoughts! Faster than light travel! None of these has anything to do with Space War!.... It's Los Angeles, city of six million cars and one lousy parking space."
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement, Variable Set-up
publishers: Inner City Games Designs, Truant Spiele

name: Arena of Blood
description: A board game originally published in Games Workshop's White Dwarf magazine (In the U.S. it was issue #229 of White Dwarf.). A gladiator-style game that features deadly Dark Elf Wyches fighting to the death in the arena. Each Wych has their own particular strengths and weaknesses. The last Wych standing is the winner.

name: Antikrundan
description:
Themed on the popular Swedish TV show Antikrundan. Players bid on antiques, trying to estimate their true value. If you bid too high, you loose money. Players also may pick up old things at the flea-market. Some items may be fake. This is decided by experts at the end of the game. Money is also awarded for answering questions on antiques. Questions are multiple choice, so you need not be an expert to stand a chance.

Contents:
Gameboard
91 auction cards
129 question cards w/ 774 questions
60 value cards
20 flea-market cards
1 die
4 player’s pieces
money
rules

Ages 15 and up. Language: Swedish.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Thank God You're Here: The Game
description:
Based on the popular TV show, players will adlib their way through one of seventy different scenes. Scripts supplied will guide the scene through several twists, before the judge's verdict is delivered.

The game includes 5 pieces of wardrobe (medal, nerdy glasses, all-areas pass, microphone, superhero cape), 5 envelopes, 70 scripts, judges pad and pencil.

name: Spiel des Wissens: 1000 zusätzliche Fragen
description: This expansion contains 252 cards with new questions both "Allgemeinwissen-Karten" and "Planeten-Karten".
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Space Exploration, Trivia

name: Wrath of Dragons: Copper Dragon
description: An additional dragon, with a unique level 2 upgrade ability option. Files provided freely by the publisher, and unpainted meeple made available separately.
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Worker Placement

name: Jumanji
description:
Danger lurks at every turn and on every turn, as you embark upon this epic adventure. Decode the secret rhyming messages, then race against time to roll the dice that can save you and your fellow player from the vicious crocs snapping jaws, the stealthy lions ferocious bite, or the charge of the trumpeting elephants. Double cross your opponent by strategically placing the rampaging rhino to block the path as you scurry toward the center of the board.

Using the same mechanics and board as the standard version, just slimmed down to a two player travel version.
mechanics: Action Timer, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement
publishers: Cardinal, Editrice Giochi, Spin Master Ltd.

name: Monstrosity
description:
In the not-too distant future, a group of underground mad surgeons assemble creatures from spare mutated body parts and make them fight. Join the insanity and send your own personal monstrosity into battle against your opponent's creation.

Monstrosity is played in two phases, with two distinct decks (50+ cards each). During the first round, players acquire spare body parts (arms, legs, torsos and heads) from the black market and construct creatures in their operating theaters. As each player collects mutated limbs and tries to assemble them, their opponent attempts to steal parts, sabotage the supplies, and generally dismantle the opposing creation. Round two pits the creatures against one another, as their owners play attack and defend cards to bolster their monstrosity's fighting abilities. It's a fast-paced, gruesome, and strategic battle game best suited for two players (although up to four can play).

name: Star Wars: Eye Found It!
description:
Blast off on a location-hopping adventure through the Star Wars galaxy, from Tatooine and the Death Star, to Jakku and more! Search the galaxy for over a thousand characters, starships, Droids, and artifacts in a quest to find R2-D2!

R2-D2 is lost somewhere in the galaxy and must be found! Earn points by following his hologram transmissions. The player with the most points when R2-D2 is found is the winner!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Knights and Castles
description: Players must move three knights around the board and back to the player's home spot on a manner similar to parcheesi. "Dubbing spots" are safe spots in the corners of the board and are used in an advanced game as places to raise your pawns from Page to Squire to Knight by answering medieval themed trivia questions.

name: A Shepherd and His Dog
description:
A SHEPHERD AND HIS DOG is a two player game, one of whom plays the part of the Shepherd and his Dog and who tries to secure all five sheep behind the fence in the field. The other player is the sheep, any of which has to escape from the field through either of the two gates.
