The Shepherd player starts by moving either of his two pieces from their starting point (at the two gates) to any adjacent space (hexagon). The Sheep player then moves any one of his sheep to an adjacent hexagon, but not one that is also adjacent to either the shepherd or his dog.

Play alternates between the two with the Shepherd player moving either his shepherd or dog and the Sheep player one of his sheep. If the dog or shepherd is moved into a space next to a sheep then that sheep has to move on its next turn - no sheep may occupy a hexagon next to either the shepherd or his dog, unless it is unable to move.

The Shepherd and his Dog win the game if they succeed in herding all five sheep into the penned off area, behind the fence, and the fence is closed. The Sheep win the game when any one sheep leaves the field by either of the two hexagons marked with a gate. In the event of a stale-mate the sheep win.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Children's Game, Farming

name: Twenty-Five
description: A very popular card game in Ireland. A trick-taking game with fairly complex ranking rules of cards depending on what suit is trump. Typically players will post an ante to the pot to start a hand. The goal is to be the first to take 5 tricks and win the pot.

name: Stork's Nest
description:
This game claims to be a 19th century Bohemian game replicating the problem people have with storks constructing their huge nests on top of chimneys.

The game consists of a 3-piece wooden house (house, roof, and chimney), and 60 sticks.

The sticks are divided evenly between the players, who take turns placing them in a stack on the chimney.

If a player knocks any sticks off of the nest, they must take all of the fallen sticks and add them to their supply.

The first player to run out of sticks is the winner.

Comes with instructions in English, French, and German.

name: Grabsch
description:
Content:
48 picture cards

As time runs all players try to fit cards in their hands at the same time. It is important to catch the cards as fast as lightning. The winner is the player with the most caught cards.
publishers: Mattel, Inc., Orda Industries Ltd., Otto Maier Verlag, Piatnik, The Really Useful Games Co.

name: Be-Rhymed!
description:
The symbol on the die determines whether a player will speak his clues, act out his clues, or draw his clues. He draws a card and, using only the specified type of clue, attempts to get his teammates to guess the two rhyming but unrelated words (eg, match catch) that are written on the card next to the symbol that matches the symbol on the die.
Run through as many cards as the two-minute timer permits.
Score one point for each spoken rhyme and two points for each acted out or drawn rhyme.

name: SnailTrail
description:
This game is a close relative of the Slimetrail game.

There are two players: red and blue snails. Initially snails are placed in the opposite corners of the rectangular board.

The snails can be moved to adjacent cells and may not move to a cell occupied by the opponent's snail or re-visit a visited cell.

The game ends up when one of the players cannot move his snail on his turn. The other player wins in this case.

Usually played with progressive-moves variant.

name: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King Board Game
description:
One player takes the role of Mordor, and the opposing two to five players represent the Fellowship. Each player has a hand of cards taken from corresponding Mordor and Fellowship decks. The board shows tracks to record the progress of pieces representing The Army of Mordor, Merry and the Rohirrim, Gandalf and Pippin, Aragorn, Legolas and Gimli, and Frodo and Sam. Along the board tracks are seven locations to represent the key conflicts of the movie : Minas Tirith, Osgiliath, Shelob's Lair, etc.

Each player takes a turn to roll dice, accumulating movement points which will allow them to draw a Journey card (again from corresponding Mordor and Fellowship decks), this card then instructing them to draw battle cards, or sometimes to force the opposing side to discard cards. Players must manage their hand of cards bearing in mind the different cards that 'trump' in the conflicts to come.

As each of the locations is reached by the piece moving there, different rules apply to determine the exact course of combat. The goal of the Fellowship is to survive these encounters long enough until Frodo and Sam reach Mount Doom : Mordor has the opportunity to bring an early victory by defeating the Fellowship before the Ring is cast into the fire.

Though this may have a cover similar to The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King, this was accepted to the database on the premise that it is an entirely different game.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Schaken voor 4
description:
Chess for 4 is the second game in Gpip Design's 'for 4' series of games.

Two rows of 8 fields are added on each side of a standard 8x8 chess board. 3 or 4 players can play; each player starts at a different side of the board. Standard chess rules apply, except that a piece that threatens a king cannot be captured. One king cannot be placed in check by two or more opponents at once.

The game ends when only one king remains on the board; that player is the winner.

Chess for 4 can also be played as a 2 vs 2 partnership game. In this case, you cannot capture your partner's pieces.

name: Silver Stories
description:
Silver Stories is a game similar to Black Stories. One player reads the riddle aloud from the front of the card. The other players try to guess what's happened. The answer stands on the back of the card and is only read by the storyteller.
Silver Stories' themes are aliens, weightlessness, space, and astronauts.
categories: Party Game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Call My Bluff
description:
A game of bluff and double bluff.
One player each round is the Bluffer who has to take a Bluff Card. He reads out one of the two words on the card and the three definitions for that word, and then chooses one of the definitions of his choice and the other players can bet on whether it is true or not. They have three possible bets (they must bet on the word, but you can bet 5, 10, 15, or 20).
After everyone has bet, the result is made known. If it is true, those who correctly predicted the result get points equal to their bet. The incorrect bets are totalled up and the points given to the Bluffer. The Bluffer role then passes to the left.
The first player to score 250 points is the winner
Contents
56 Betting Cards
672 Bluffs
1 Scorepad

Game is based on the BBC revival program in the 1980's and features various team captains who have taken part.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia, Word Game

name: Fifth Gear
description:
Roll your dice and Place your Gears!

The rules are simple: interlock five of your color gears with the white gear and keep others from doing the same. Players roll 2 twelve-sided dice on their turn to determine their gear placement and get the option to: place 2 gears, one on each number rolled OR place 1 gear on the sum of the roll? But here comes the monkey wrench, players can bump opponents off peg(s) that match their roll and replace it with their own. The family fun factor: No two games are ever the same! The unique game board allows players to randomly place number tokens at the start of each game which results in fun new challenges and endless playability.

Family game night will never get old!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Take That, Variable Set-up

name: The Daring & the Doomed: The Elder Dooms
description: Prepare yourself for the mind-bending madness of The Elder Dooms! This Cthulhu/Zombie inspired expansion adds more tentacles and craziness to your game with 74 more cards!
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Revenge of the Dinosaurs
description:
"The Game of Prehistoric Fun!"

This is a simple roll and move game for children. It consists of some nice dinosaur figurines and a board with a central ring of stones and four loops connecting to this. The aim for each player is to start from their home cave and make their way around the board back to their home by rolling a die and moving that number of spaces.

In Revenge of the Dinosaurs each player chooses one of four different coloured dinosaurs. The roll of a die at the start of each turn determines how many spaces a player must move as players work their way around the board, while trying to avoid the Tyrannosaurus Rex. Some of the spaces have dino footprints on them. If you land on one, you roll the die a second time and move the T-Rex that many squares, either to get him out of your way, in someone else's or, better still, to frighten an opponent's dino back! The object is to be the first player to return to their home cave.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Alga, Crown & Andrews Ltd., Holdson, Holdsworth Thos & Sons, Waddingtons

name: Gossip
description:
Why are you always the last to know? Everybody seems to know about that fight you had with your girlfriend - everybody but you. And did you realize your neighbour is the most popular guy in town? For now, at least. Because people are saying...

Gossip! is a fast-paced card game about reputations. Players spread rumours, some bad, some good, in an attempt to be seen with the most popular people. Or, even better, to become popular themselves. Timing is all-important: that guy at the other side of the table might seem like a nerd now, but he might be Mr. Perfect in just two or three turns. Playing cards can kill your reputation!

name: Elephant Ride
description: Be the first player to climb on the elephant’s back and you are the king of the jungle. Each player builds a stack of monkeys by placing tiles on top of each other on his side of the board by matching the colors on the top and bottom of each tile.

name: Whizz Bing Bang
description:
In Whizz Bing Bang, a quick card game for 3 to 6 players, players take turns reading the top card of the deck, with the word on that card dictating how gameplay will continue:


Whizz: Game play continues in the same direction.
Bing: Game play reverses direction.
Bang: Game play continues in the same direction, but skips the next player.
Boom: Everyone must slap and leave their hand on the Boom while saying "BOOM!".


Penalties for playing out of order, slapping the deck when no Boom was played, being last to hit the Boom card, playing too slowly, etc. are distributed in the form of tokens, with players starting with one face-down token for each sound: Whizz, Bing, Bang, Boom (ordered low to high). The player who is first to hit the Boom card gives a token to the player who hit it last, but in all other penalty situations, players must race to find the lowest face-down token they hold and give it to the penalized player face up; whoever does so first gives the token away while all other players keep theirs and reshuffle them. When one player gives his Boom token away, each player scores one point for each token he holds. When a player has scored 15 or more points, the game ends and the player with the fewest points wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game

name: Suuri avaruuspako
description:
It is near future, the energy sources and drinking water have almost depleted from earth and the apocalypse is closing in. And it is closing fast. Humanity's last hope is to escape to space stations, in which there ain't enough room for everybody.

Players represent different nations with different leaders, all having different powers. Their goal is to build a working rocket and launch it to space before everybody else. The requirements for the working rocket change every game, and are only partially known to players. The rockets have four different aspects which can be build to higher levels, highest one being level 3.

Each turn is separated to phases which happen simultaneously to all players. First there's production in which each player produces whats printed in their country-sheet, plus any specials they might have earned throughout the game. After production comes building/trading, players can only build one part of the rocker per turn but can freely trade anything (knowledge, materials etc).

After producing and building players draw one card from the event deck. Some of the events help players, some don't. Some give them more time to build, and some bring doomsday clock closer to midnight.

Game ends when event-deck runs out, or when somebody decides to launch his rocket and the launch is succesful (meets all the requirements).

The basis and rules for this game were created in a 25-hour happening organized by Helsinki city library in 14.-15.3.2014. The game will be available mostly through libraries in Finland, but currently there are no plans to repringt it.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Trading, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Mamma
description: A family dinner is arranged and you are one of the members: however, this family has trust issues, and no one's certain who will spoil the pot! Dinner is served in this game of bluffing, cruelty and fun.

name: Flip Out
description: Be the first player to score 21 or more by a combination of skill, chance, and flip of the "stone". Larry Hagman of Dallas (and I Dream of Jeannie) fame is pictured on the cover!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Rancher
description:
Players are ranch owners buying and selling cattle. You want to get as many cattle as possible to the market in "Beef Town", where the players can sell it. On the way they must cross many dangers and watch out for cattle thieves (but if you land on another player's ranch you may steal some of his cattle instead).

The board shows a round trip around the old western town "Beef Town". There are 7 ranches on the board, which have different prices depending on the number of cattle they can hold.

A herd is doubled every round and the ranchers (players) must try to bring their cattle back to Beefy Town, where they can be sold with profit. No surprise, that cattle can also be stolen from other players, but the thieves take a high risk to get captured, because two shortcuts on the board make it easier for the owner of the herd to catch the thief.

Winner of the game is the richest player after a previously arranged amount of time.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Alga, ASS Altenburger Spielkarten, Damm / Egmont, Palet spil

name: The Lewis & Clark Adventure Game
description: Join Lewis and Clark on their expedition from St. Louis to the Pacific Northwest! As you follow their route, you'll explore the wilderness by keel boat, canoe, horseback, and on foot. Along the way, you'll meet Native American tribes, see spectacular places, and encounter unfamiliar plants and animals. Your survival depends on knowledge, skill, and luck! Supplied with a provision of beads, you'll give gifts or trade for goods -- just like Lewis and Clark did! You'll also get a chance to spin a special compass, answer questions, and win four types of charms. If you're the first to complete the journey with all four charms, you win!
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Educational, Racing, Trivia

name: Ins & Outs
description:
ReKords / Ins & Outs is an abstract race game with a movement mechanic similar to Lines Of Action: a pawn moves equal the number of other pawns in the same vertical and horizontal line. The goal of the game is to be the first to arrive to the opponent house.

The two players' tokens race in opposite directions along a spiral track marked on a 6x6 grid. However rather than rolling a die, the distance forward a token may move is determined by the number of tokens (of either color) in the same grid row or column as it.

name: Monopoly: Köln
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Köln, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Super Mario Bros. Card Game
description:
From the back of the box:
"Super Mario Bros. Blockbusting Card Game!!

50 cards featuring those zany, wacky characters from the unique world of the Super Mario Bros. Turn over the cards, collect the gold coins and be the first to collect the correct amount. BUT BEWARE, turn over the wrong card and you could lose some coins, or all of your coins, or even worse ... give them to another player! This is a fast and furious game that needs a lot of luck and a little memory to remember where the bad cards are hidden."

Identified on the box as being for Ages 5 and up, this Children's game is a simple exercise in random drawing of cards from one of six piles, collecting gold coins and sometimes following instructions on the large cards. The little memory required in this video game spin-off is in remembering which of the six piles one has discarded useful or nasty cards to.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Memory, Video Game Theme

name: James Bond 007: Das Agentenspiel
description: Players are secret agents who try to be the one who defeats the evil guys located on an island in the center of the board. To do this they've to arrive there with a certain (secret) combination of microfilms (every player starts with 10 microfilms in his own color - different colors can be acquired by fighting other players). Agents travel around the board rolling a die and using transportation cards to acquire equipment cards and transportation cards to fight other players. Fights are resolved by secretly choosing up to two equipment cards - better equipment (total number) wins.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Beam Me Up
description:
From publisher:

It's the Annual Alien Conference and the aliens are stuck on the moon without transportation. This is your chance to take an alien home! Maybe not your home... but it's your job to get the aliens back to their home planets. In this trick-taking card game the highest card wins the round. Call out "Beam Me Up" when you have collected three aliens from the same home planet and a Space Racer will come to the rescue. The player who send the most aliens home by the end of the game wins the title of Star Space Traffic Controller!

The game is played in rounds with each player trying to win tricks by playing the highest numbered card. For every trick won, the player who played the highest card gets to choose 1 card from the trick to keep and add to his Beam Me Up line. The object is to get 3 cards with matching elementals in your Beam Me Up line so a Space Racer can be launched to come and transport the aliens home.

name: Fancy Nancy Big Easy Game
description:
Learn to be fancy just like Nancy! Choose Colorforms® items from some of Nancy's favorite places: her room, the Ice Cream Parlor, the King's Crown and the Butterfly Pavilion. Larger than a typical game board, this super-size Big Easy Play Mat will delight your child. This game reinforces important learning skills such as color matching, critical thinking and decision-making. Come join Nancy and learn how more is ALWAYS better when it comes to being fancy.

Contains Giant 25"x35" Big Easy Floor Mat, 45 Colorforms® pieces that Stick like Magic!™, 4 Character Cards with Stands, 1 Collection Card, Game Spinner and Instructions. For 2-4 players. Ages 3 and up.

name: Robot Explorers
description: Navigate our wonderful solar system in a race to collect research specimens! Your robot might encounter asteroids and malfunctioning rocket parts, or have some of our galaxy’s finest (and friendliest) lend you a helping hand in this quest to beat the rest! Your Robot races round the sun to all eight planets - every one has specimens that you must grab for research in your rocket lab, the first player to fill their science shelf wins!

name: Endless Working
description:
User summary
Endless Working is the English title of 今日も帰れない (Kyou mo Kaerenai), a card game released during the Tokyo Game Market 2016 Spring (ゲームマーケット2016春) in Odaiba, Tokyo, Japan.

It is the 4th game by the group MR Entertainment (MR エンターテイメント).

The title can be translated to" 'Today I won't be coming back home either'. It is a name nicely fitting the context of the game.

The game is set in a fictional "black company" called CHI-KU. Each player is an employee at this company and has to work hard and do many hours of overtime work every day. The players are trusted 'slave workers' all affected to a new project called 'Endless Working'. They are expected to work super hard to make it a big success!

The game got popular thanks to its theme, which is a real and well-known problem in Japan.

In Endless working, the players take turn in drawing cards from the deck. There are 3 kinds of cards: TASK, STOP and END.
The player who can collect the most TASK cards wins the game.
You start by drawing as many cards as you want, one by one. When you stop drawing you have to carry out the action on the last card you drew.

TASK cards are 'safe' but change the state of your hand.
STOP causes your turn to end right away and is a penalty for you or all players.
END cards either ends the whole game immediately, or forces the rest of the game players to draw more cards before they can chicken out.

To put the players in the right atmosphere for the game, they recommend the players to say '進捗をすすめます！' (Let's make progress!) before drawing a new card and '帰ります！' (I'm going back home!) when they want to stop drawing cards.
publishers: MR エンターテイメント (MR Entertainment)

name: The Lion Guard Boulder Burst Game
description:
Hold the water back from flooding the pride lands with a teetering stack.

The pride lands are in danger of flooding and the boulder dam could burst at any time! Take turns either Adding "water" balls behind the wall or removing a stone and restack it on the top. The last player to successfully add "water" or remove and restack a stone before the a player knocks down the wall or lets out the water wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Afrogym
description: Afrogym is the first board game you can enjoy while exercising. You need to overcome challenges and duels to reach the end of the board. The goal is to reach the end and earn the gold ancient trophy. All the exercises are able to be performed at home without any special equipment.

name: HumAliens
description:
From the website:
Humaliens is a game of flexibility and variables, where actions and reactions build a constantly shifting tide of effects. It’s unique, seat-of-your-pants play style allows players to perform actions that may very well change the direction of the game in a single turn, or with a single card played at the right moment. In Humaliens, you don’t know who’s going to win until the game is over.
After selecting a front line team of up to 5 Humaliens, your team works together to either defeat your opponent’s front line, or to metamorphose into Super beings – the next evolution for universal life forms. Victory is always within your grasp.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Collectible Components, Fighting, Science Fiction

name: Illiniopoly
description:
The Game Includes:

Tokens:
Alarm Clock, Pencil, Gym Shoe, Bicycle, Graduation Cap

Board Spaces:
The Quad, Memorial Stadium, Kam's, Papa Del's. Illini Marching Band, Illini Grove, Wright Street

Cards:
Recite the Fight Song or Lose One Turn.

Parking in Faculty Parking! Pay $50.

Graduation Fee! Pay $25 for each Year of Credit and $100 for each Diploma.

Illinois vs. Michigan. Advance to Memorial Stadium. GO ILLINOIS!

All Campus Party! All tokens advance to Fraternity Row.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: How Tall Am I?
description:
Players roll the die to get various body parts. Each character is built up of a hat, a head, arms, body and feet. The various body parts has different hight, and the object is to collect 5 different parts to build the tallest character.

Ages 3 - 8
Game components: Thirty character parts, custom measuring ruler, one die

name: PoPalotsy
description:
PoPalotsy is a speedy dice game in which players try to be the first to get rid of all the cards in their hand.

Players are each dealt 5 ring shaped cards - each card depicting a die face on a colored background. When all players are ready, 5 different colored dice are popped out of the provided popper. Players then race to encircle the dice with their cards by matching the color of the die or the number on the die. A number match beats a color match and an exact (color AND number) match beats all. The first player to drop all of their cards wins.

Contents:
Popper
5 Dice
40 Ring Cards
Rule Book

name: Yeti Eats Alien
description:
Hilarious Headline Card Game! This game is a little different. You're dealt a hand of Headline Cards with words on them, each with a point value. When it's your turn, construct the headline that earns the highest points... and often the biggest laughs! The winner is the first player to get 500 points.

Grown-up fans of Man Bites Dog will love this adult twist!

name: Jassin 1915
description:
Jassin was a small, but pivotal, engagement fought in East Africa in 1915 between Lettow-Vorbeck’s now veteran German Schutztruppen and Askari and a mixed force of Indian regular army and Imperial Service troops.

Tactical combat system with offensive & opportunity fire, Line of Sight, melee and artillery fire.

8.5 x 11 map and almost 100 two-sided counters representing units and leaders.

name: Run Off
description:
Up to six players battle it out to win the majority of electoral votes and become President of the USA.

Each player answers questions about America and every correct answer usually gains them 5 chips to place on the board. They can place these in no more than two states. As soon as a player has got 51% of the votes in a state they win all of the votes in that state. For example, Indiana returns 12 electoral votes. As soon as a player has staked 7 chips in that state they win ALL 12 votes. As soon as a player has grabbed 275 electoral votes he/she is declared the President!

The designers advise that if six start then only two should be left at the end and Run Off to see who wins the Presidency.

The board is quite large and the playing pieces are brightly colored counters. The board is simply a map of the USA with how many electoral votes are assigned to each state.

name: Arne Junior
description:
Arne Junior is the simplified version of Arne classic. The game is playable from the age of 5 and takes about 10-25 minutes to play. artwork on the cards is based on aquarelle hand painting.

pick a fruit. The one to collect most fruits of his color wins. but...you really can do everything to prevent the other players of obtaining exactly this.
You can steal cards, change places, pass on your hand to the next player and play before it is your turn. Also there are big hungry birds flying around on the look out for fruit!

Arne is available in a designer metal tin with instructions in English, German, French and Dutch.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Party Game
mechanics: Action Points, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: UNO: Hannah Montana
description: For Hannah Montana fans Ages 7 and up. Customized Uno version that comes with two special cards that change the game play. 112 cards with lots of pictures from the show.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music

name: Pokémon Poké Ball Flip
description:
It's a Pokémon-filled game of fun and action as you try to be the player with the most cards when the timer signals the end of the game.

Turn over a card from your stack to see if its number is higher than the "number to beat." If it is, you get all the cards that have been played so far and are closer to winning.

When Ash shows up, a totally different kind of action begins. You get three tries to flip a card on the special Poké Ball paddle. Complete the challenge and your stack of cards will grow even more.

name: Quiz Royal
description: Players have to try to answer as many questions as they can by traveling through a town.

name: Sexy Folies
description: The object of the game is to gain control of all the parts of the body depicted on the board, thus winning the hidden wager. The players move their tokens round the board and win parts of the body as they go along. When a player lands on a space that already belongs to the other player, he or she must meet a challenge whose 'level of difficulty' depends on how parts of the body the other player has in his or her possession. There are thee categories of challenges: Romantic, Sensual and Erotic. The players can also land in a cabaret in Paris where they will enjoy a striptease performance. Landing on one of Cupid's spaces means that the players have to go along with what he asks them to do and adapt their lovers' play accordingly.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Gregs Tagebuch: Mir Stinkt's!
description:
Game description from the publisher:

In the fast-paced card game Gregs Tagebuch: Mir Stinkt's!, you want to pass the stinky cheese curse around as quickly as possible, while also ridding yourself of cards. Whoever runs out of cards first wins the round, and whoever scores the most points after nine rounds wins the game!

name: Guinness World Records: The Board Game!
description:
This is a board game in which players will roll a dice and move around a board, with their space indicating the task they have to complete.

Spaces include:

Trivia challenge: Answer a trivia question.
Who am I?: View a photo and then determine what world record is being displayed.
House Record Challenge: Perform challenges involving dexterity or memory skills.
Guinness World Records: Perform tasks based on actual world records.

Players earn chips for every correct task they complete. Winning is accomplished by winning chips and also completing one of the Guinness World Record challenges.

name: The Big Bang Theory: Ultimate Genius Party Game
description:
THE BIG BANG THEORY Ultimate Genius Party Game features 4 different game challenges, each inspired from some of THE BIG BANG THEORY'S funniest moments. Players are divided into 2-4 teams and roll a special die each turn to determine which game they will play. These games include Counterfactuals, Fun with Flags, Sketch Charades, and Celebrity.

In Counterfactuals, a member of the opposite team will draw a card that suppose a world that is different from our own in one key aspect, and asks a question about that world. The competing teammates must choose from multiple-choice answers, and gain points if their answers match each other's, as well as if they match the game writers' answer.

The goal in Fun with Flags is for a player to guess flags from a deck of cards based on clues given by a teammate. The twist is that there are 3 Oops Words that the Clue-Giver cannot say.

Sketch Charades is a simple drawing game, where one teammate will draw a card with a phrase, then has to draw it for another teammate to guess.

Finally, Celebrity is a charades game, in which one teammate is chosen to be the Actor and all the other teammates are the Guessers. An opposing team chooses answers for each of 5 categories for the Actor to act out.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Micro Play-Break: Castles
description:
From the publisher:

In this fast-paced multi-round game, you control a small castle of three walls, behind which you will defend your Princess, fire your Catapult, and rule with your shrewd and protective King. Simultaneously, you will send forth your own Knight to abduct said rival’s Princess.

For each game purchased, you will receive 14 game cards, an instruction document and a quick reference card.
Both players will begin the game with three castle walls, a King, a Princess, a Catapult and a Knight.

Setup, play, and cleanup can all be completed in 2-5 minutes for most games.

Summary of play:

Players take turns placing their Knight to attack their opponent's castle in order to capture their princess. The first player to capture a princess wins! Conflict resolution is chart based, cross referencing which units are participating in the battle.

name: Virus Veteran: The Cardgame
description:
Virus Veteran is a card game in which it is your goal to have less virus points than your opponents. The card game is split in two kinds of cards, action cards including tourists, mutations, veterans and more... and into standard virus cards. The standard cards will determine your number of points at the end!

To gain the upper hand you can either use tourists and mutations to double the numbers of your opponents points, or you can use medics and lockdowns to block or annihilate aggressive cards of the other players. Bottlenecks and veteran cards allow you to draw cards from your opponents or to get rid of your own virus points.

The single cure card determines the end of the game and boosts your chance to win the game.

The cards are designed in a humoristic comic style which is inspired by the ongoing pandemic. I mean look at the toilet-paper hoarders, aren`t they perfect fitting joker cards?

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Humor

name: OXO: The mandala card game
description:
OXO is a card game with a wonderful mandala look. You can learn it in 5 minutes and you're ready to play.

In OXO, you have to form palindromes with the cards in your hand and in the table in order to get rid of your wealth counters and reach a new status of wisdom.

OXO is a fast, portable, family game. It comes with 2 different modes and can be player in solitaire.

name: Plug-A-Jug
description: The object of the game is to be the first player to spell plug a jug. Players take turns rolling a six-sided die. The sides of the die show either a blank, a jug, or a cork. Players take turns rolling the die. When one player rolls a jug symbol they open the jug and shake out the small plastic letters and try to spell "plug a jug." While they are doing this the other players takes turns rolling the die, until one of them rolls the cork symbol. Once a cork symbol is rolled, the jug is plugged, and any additional letters are returned to the jug and the play continues until one player spells "plug a jug." If, while shaking letters out of the jug, the black marble falls out, that player must return all of their letters from this and previous turns to the jug. The jug is then plugged and play continues. The game contains enough plastic letters (32) for four players to be able to spell plug a jug, the six-sided die, and the dreaded black marble.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Dice, Real-time, Word Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Pattern Building

name: Music Mania
description: Music Mania is a music trivia game with categories covering rock and roll, country western, blues and jazz. The questions are at the expert level, so this is a game for true music fans. The game provides answers to questions you've never wondered about, and makes you wonder why!

name: Pegleg
description:
Description from the box:
"Ahoy Matey! How fast can you find the buried treasure? Using all of your pirate skills, see if you can be the first to collect all the pirate loot shown on your treasure card and win! Sift the deck looking for gold doubloons, precious gems, a pirate flag and other items from the high seas. The first to find it all WINS!"

Each turn, players can take last player's discard or draw from face down deck. First to collect all five items on personal treasure card, wins.

name: Cranium Tune Twister
description:
From the publisher:

Have a blast putting your own creative twists on familiar tunes like, "She'll Be Comin' 'Round the Mountain" and "Twinkle, Twinkle, Little Star."

Collaborate with friends and family to build your twisted tunes one line at a time. Then grab the mike to perform your lyrical masterpieces with style and flair. The rotating judge awards points for both your songwriting and your performance!

Kids and adults will laugh out loud as they create wacky lyrics and perform renditions together.

name: Rush
description: Rush is a territory game played with a Go set. Players take turns adding their own stones. Players cannot add a stone which is horizontally adjacent to two or more stones, if all of the connecting stones are the same color as the added stone. If a player adds a stone which forms two or more connections, he must add another stone during his turn, and keep adding stones during his turn until his most recent stone connects to one or less stones, concluding his turn. The object is to have the majority of stones on the board when the board fills up.

name: Star Wars: The Clone Wars – Blockade von Ryloth
description:
Planet Ryloth is suffering from blockades and players are tasked with destroying the enemy ships in order to free the planet’s population.

Each player sets his Jedi Sternjäger on Square One of the Score Track on the box edge. The blockade tiles are shuffled face down and ships are put into their holders, set up and placed at a minimum of one box length distance from the board.

In your turn you first turn over one blockade tile; the number on the tile determines the number of ships participating in the current blockade. One of your fellow players places this number of ships on spots of the board, in any orientation and position he likes; one of the ships must always be the Droid Control Ship. Then you as the active player take the five star chips and try to topple all ships by throwing chips at them, with a maximum of five throws. If you manage to topple all with less than five throws your turn ends with the last toppled ship. If you toppled the Droid Control Ship you score two points and you score one point for each other ship you toppled; one extra point is scored for each star chip you have left over. You move your Jedi Sternjäger forward accordingly along the box edge. If your Sternjäger reaches a score of 20 you win at the end of this round if you have most points. In a variant you must topple the Droid Ship with a certain kind of chip and score penalty points for ships you did not topple; in another version there are no given spots for the ships, you can put them anywhere.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Noisy Neighbors
description:
Noisy Neighbors is an eavesdropping game where you have to guess what your teammates are doing solely by listening to them act out various activities from behind a wall.

You are separated from your teammate behind a handheld folding board that serves as a thin apartment wall. The wall prevents you from seeing what's going on. Your teammate draws a card and acts out the activity shown using sound effects only. Listen carefully and shout out what you think they're doing. If you guess correctly, you teammate shouts "yes!" and quickly moves on to another card. You have two minutes to guess as many activities as you can, earning one point for your team for each correct guess.

The game is very simple to play and can accommodate large groups.

—user summary

name: Dealing with Murder: Fatal Error
description:
In Dealing with Murder - Fatal Error , 2-6 players get together to try and solve a murder mystery. Each player is dealt a hand of 3 cards that comes from a deck of cards where each card is unique, and has either has some information pertaining to the mystery, or has actions that a player can take. Each turn a player plays a card (reveals evidence) to the discard pile where everyone can read the information. The cards a player keeps in his hand are considered 'withheld evidence'. A player may also play a subpoena card to look at all the cards in a given players hand or to increase their own hand size. Play continues like this until a player thinks they can solve the mystery. They announce their solution (Who, Motive, How) and then reads (silently) the solution. If correct, they win, if not, they are out of the game and play continues.

Game is (very slightly) compared to the 'How to Host Your Own Murder' series, in that once the game is played, it cannot be played again by the same players, as there is only one solution.

The box even references said product, by stating that to play 'Dealing with Murder', you don't need to cook a dinner or show up wearing a costume to play.
publishers: Paul Lamond Games Ltd, TDC Games, Inc.

name: Spy Code: Mission – Diamond Heist
description:
Bringing a new addition to the Spy Code range, this co-operative skill and action game requires communication and teamwork to win. Can you beat the impossible mission? Enter into a movie moment and manoeuvre through the board to complete different objectives. When the alarm triggers and alerts the police the race against the clock is on to escape with the diamond and win the game.

If you can recover the Diamond and escape in the Getaway Car before the Guards arrive, you win the game! If the Guards arrive before you can escape, you’ve been caught! Set up the game and try again!

name: Silly 6 Pins
description: A simple, silly bowling game for pre-schoolers (Ages 3 - 6). Players take turns rolling the plastic bowling ball into the pins. The pins wobble back and forth and tease the players (the game talks). The unit automatically keeps score, though only for one "frame".
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Electronic, Sports

name: Devil Horsemen
description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

A simple solo (or two player) game of annihilating Napoleon's march from Russia. Cossack units are rated for speed and anger/patriotism, while the French units are rated for speed, military gain, and treasure gain. The cossacks (played by the solo player) tries to eliminate as many military gain points as possible before all of the French units have moved off the area map.

name: Monopoly: Nottingham Edition
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Nottingham, in the United Kingdom.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Parker Brothers, Winning Moves UK Ltd.

name: Ταξιδεύοντας στην Ευρώπη
description:
Each player receives six destination cards that he has to visit in Europe. They can visit them in any order they choose. In some of them, they get a chance to answer a question correctly and if they do they roll the dice again and continue moving.
The first player to visit all his destinations wins the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Humanity Hates Trump
description:
Each player is dealt 7 white cards, each including a word or phrase. Each round, players take turns serving as the judge, drawing one black card containing a question or fill in the blank sentence.

Players answer the question or fill in the blank sentence by choosing their favorite white card to fill it in. Each player takes turns judging, choosing their favorite option and the funniest answer wins the round.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Apequest: The Search for Geoffrey
description:
Your monkey has stolen your time travel trousers, and you must fight your way through time and space to get him back.

To accomplish this, each player selects a card representing one of many parallel incarnations of Professor Elemental, each equipped with unique and unlikely weapons. Their collective challenge is to navigate a timeline, generated from the timeline deck, and to cooperate to defeat the dangers and vexations it throws in their paths.

On their ape-pursuit, the players will find a deck of items to assist and amuse them, and will be plagued by the problems that emerge from the malfunction deck. Once the final card of the timeline has been revealed and overcome, the players are victorious, but if just one of the many Professors runs out of health before the quest is complete, the whole team loses - that’s just how parallel timelines work, apparently.

A charming game of trousers, butlers and alternate realities inspired by the steampunk chap-hop concept album of the same name by Professor Elemental, renowned scientist, exotic dancer and explorer.

name: Looping
description:
Ages 5 to 8.
Each player is trying to spend as much time as possible in the amusement park. The player who'll take longest to go through the attractions and leaves last wins. (So this is a reverse race) Cards can be picked up and used to move back or to force the other players forward, etc. Amusing and thankfully short.

name: Trivial Pursuit The Sci-Fi Master Game: Star Trek Edition
description: Hundreds of questions and classic clips from the original series including all six movies and every TV episode. Comes with a PAL VHS tape.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Science Fiction, Trivia
publishers: Horn Abbot Ltd., Telstar Video Entertainement

name: Disneyland Riverboat Game
description:
The object of the game is to be the first player to move his boat around the board and return, by exact count, to the Mark Twain Dock.

The equipment consists of 1 die, 4 metal boats, a playing board and a movable track.

The Riverboat Game is one of a series of Disneyland games, the others being: Monorail, Adventureland, and Fantasyland.
categories: Children's Game, Maze, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Nautical, Racing, Transportation
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Super Yatzi
description:
The well-known and most popular dice game enters a new dimension. Now the points just acquired may be pilfered from other players. And now is the "road" away ... but wait, I'll get it back again!

Das bekannte und weltweit beliebte Würfelspiel erfährt eine neue Dimension. Nun können die gerade erworbenen Punkte von den Mitspielern stibitzt werden. Und schon ist die "Straße" weg... doch warte nur, die hol' ich mir wieder!

name: Holly Hobbie Wishing Well Game
description:
This game is based on the eponymous character created by writer and illustrator Holly Hobbie.

In the game, players try to guess their opponents secret wishes as they move around the board. Each player starts the game with two wishes. On their turn, players roll a die and move the corresponding number of spaces. They must then follow the directions for the space on which the marker lands. On spaces, players may ask questions, go to the well, collect pennies from other players, give pennies to other players or exchange wishes. When asking questions, players can ask whether another player has a wish of a given color, one of two wishes of a given color or a specific wish of a given color. Players may ask questions by paying pennies (free on some spaces) as long as they receive "Yes" for an answer. When a player guesses correctly, he can pick up from the wishing well the number of pennies rolled on a die. Players whose wishes are guessed lose these wishes but have the opportunity of buying more of them until all wishes have been used up.

The last player to hold a secret wish wins.

From the box
Join Holly and your friends as you try to guess the secret wishes that are held by the other players. You'll move around the wishing well, pay a penny and ask a player about a wish. Every time you guess a wish you can try to empty the well. Pay close attention and remember what everybody says because the player with the last secret wish is the player who wins the game.
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Storytelling

name: The Walking Dead Trivia Game
description: Based on the Hit AMC Television Show The Walking Dead. Over 400 questions will challenge even the most savvy survivors. Players start as humans, but a few wrong answers will get you turned into a Walker!
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia, Zombies

name: Conveyor Belt
description:
From the publisher:

Created by Franklin Wright, the winner of University Games' National Young Game Inventors Contest, Conveyor Belt is a game of strategy where the only thing that changes faster than the lead is the direction you're moving! Players move pawns along the conveyor belts and play special Belt cards to flip the arrows or even move the finish to a new place!
mechanics: Action Queue, Grid Movement, Modular Board

name: General
description:
English:
As a general, each player rules over the regions of influence of his continent. By employing their regions of influence in a carefully considered manner, each general can optimise the fighting power of the army under his command. In battle, each general commands the individual combat units and thereby influences the action. His strategic and tactical conduct determines victory or defeat. The objective is to conquer all regions of influence.

Deutsch:
Als General herrscht jeder Spieler über die Einflussgebiete seines Kontinents. Durch überlegten Einsatz seiner Einflussgebiete optimiert er die Kampfkraft seiner Armee. Im Kampf befehligt er die einzelnen Kampfeinheiten und beeinflusst so das Kampfgeschehen. Sein strategisches und taktisches Vorgehen entscheidet über Sieg oder Niederlage. Ziel ist die Eroberung aller Einflussgebiete.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck

name: The Tooth Fairy Game
description:
Petersen Games’ first kids game, under the new imprint Larva Games.

The Tooth Fairy Game is actually FOUR games in one, complete with 125 plastic teeth in 5 colors, five bags in 5 colors, 1 six sided die, 5 tooth fairy cards, and rules in English, Spanish, French, German and Italian!

While all games are good for ages 6 and up, each game is a bit more difficult than the one before it:

That’s My Tooth is the “Baby Teeth” game.
After you’ve had fun playing that game a few times, you can try out Pulling Teeth, the “Adult Teeth” game.
Then there is Lie Through Your Teeth which is a game for those with “Fake Teeth.” That game works best for those who know how to bluff. It is a clever take on the classic “liar’s dice” game.
Finally, there is Treasure Teeth for those rich tooth fairies with “Gold Teeth.” In Treasure Teeth you bid on valuable teeth, trying to get the most money. However, your bid is secretly split up any way you choose between your two hands. But beware, another player will pick WHICH of your two hands will be your real bid! Will you put all your teeth in one hand, hoping they pick that one, divide them evenly, or do you have another ingenious plan in mind?
categories: Action / Dexterity, Bluffing, Children's Game, Fantasy
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Memory, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Variable Set-up

name: InCube
description:
Description from the publisher:

InCube has you trapped! What seemed to be only an innocent game in a strange little box has now revealed itself to be a true nightmare! Stuck in this peculiar prison, you have to move in unison, rolling towards freedom — but be careful as only the one who ends up at the top of the cube will be able to escape from the game!
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Tweedledum: The New Adventures with Alice in Wonderland
description:
Sort the 49 photo cards by color. Each group will then have 7 photos of varying quality of a place in Wonderland.

The quality of each exposure is different, and is marked by the number on the card. There is the good photo of each subject valued 5, 1 worth 3 points, 2 worth 1 point each, and 3 0 point photos for each subject.

In the center of the board is the start space where the Alice cards are placed and players begin.

The interior track shows the 7 places to go in Wonderland. Photo cards are placed here. Player try repeatedly to enter the interior track to gain good photo opportunities.

Object of the game:

Each player tries to get good photos of Wonderland, and take high value cards of the sights.

Whoever manages to collect photos of all 7 sights is able to finish the game (although he might not want to do this.) Because the sum of the point values of photo cards determines the winner of the game.

End of the game:
Once a player has 7 photos of all of the different places, he may end the game.

The player must make it back to the rabbit hole on the start space. To move back there, a player must choose the correct potion while on the inner track.

A player MUST move into the start space and end the game if he has all of his photos.

Players then score their photos. Each player sums up the values of their photos. If a player has multiple photos of a place, only the best one counts.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Cargoes
description: A game where players travel to seaports all over the world, picking up and delivering cargoes. The first player to return to home base receives a bonus but the amount of money held determines the winner of the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement

name: The Grinch: Sing Your Heart Out!
description:
The game of team-work, singing and surprising sleigh-rides!

The Grinch is out to steal the Whos’ gifts—but your family can save the day. Only your singing will warm the Grinch’s heart and bring his sleigh full of stolen gifts speeding down Mt. Crumpit and back to Who-ville!

Collect Who tiles and gifts with each player’s turn. But watch out—draw the wrong tile and the Grinch will steal the gifts back! When that happens, team up with your family or friends: If you sing LONG ENOUGH and LOUD ENOUGH, the Electronic Singing Detector will hear your singing and actually launch the sleigh on its wild ride down Mt. Crumpit! Connect all 12 Who Tiles plus matching gifts, and you win!
categories: Electronic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Kapteeni ja pilssihiiri
description:
Based on the books of beloved Finnish childrens author Mauri Kunnas, Kapteeni ja pilssihiiri ("Captain and the bilge rat") is a roll and move game where players try to get their three pawns to complete a circuit around the board.

Movement is color-coded: red symbol on a die means the red pawn moves to the next red tile, blue moves blue and so on. There are also arrows that let players remove tiles from play. This has two effects: it makes the circuit shorter as players skip over removed tiles and it can also remove a pawn from play, trapping a player until she can return the tile in play.
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: PRL: Planszowa Rozrywka Ludowa
description:
Trivia game about life in PRL (Polska Republika Ludowa, People's Republic of Poland). The title means "People's Board Pastime".

Players in turn move their pawns by a number of spaces rolled on a single 6-sided die, and follow the instructions printed on the space on which they land. Most of the spaces have players drawing cards and answering questions in one of four categories; correct answers are rewarded with game banknotes (representing Polish money from before the redenomination in 1990s).

Other spaces may provide players with money or trigger an auction of scarce commodities (represented by tokens). When an auction is triggered by a player drawing a card or landing on a certain space, everyone, starting with the player on whose turn the auction occurred, gets to bid for the commodity, to increase their previous bid, or to pass. Whoever offers the most gets the auctioned item.

The game ends when all 25 scarce commodity tokens are sold out. The player who has the most of them is the winner. In case of a tie, the victory goes to the richest tied player.

Game can be expanded by an official mobile app with extra questions and digital accessories, available for Android and iOS.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Chase The Card Game
description: Outwit and outrun the Chaser and your opponents in this race to win the most cash. Gamble or play it safe, just don’t get caught! Packed with over 120 questions

name: Snowblind: Race for the Pole – A Glorious Death Promo Card
description:
Description from the publisher:

This card is both a thank you and a memento for being part of the realization of the game. Produced in limited numbers and only be available during this Kickstarter campaign, at our rare convention appearances, and a select online store after the campaign, the card introduces a rather unique story function into the game

Card effect: Should your Captain perish on the snowy tundras of the Pole, you may claim this card. Though your team is eliminated from the race, the annals of history will see fit to remember your Captain, above all others. Everyone loves a polar hero - especially a dead one! Let the Glorious Death card be your historic vindication.

name: Trillõn
description:
From the box copy:

Trillõn (pronounced Trill-yõn), the game with a trillion faces.

Trillõn is a game unlike any you have seen or played before. It's different in many ways, but most of all, because its unique game board can be arranged in more than 1,000,000,000,000 different combinations. Trillõn is so unique that it's patented! A destined classic, its' brilliant design will outlast the test of time.

Trillõn's board is made up of 100 blocks that are a different color on each side, allowing the board to be arranged in more combinations than you can imagine. Designing the board is half the fun! Add some of your own optional rules to the already mind-boggling equation, and you are in for nearly infinite excitement.

Trillõn is a lighthearted game of math and counting and visualization. It's easy to play and offers both right and left brain stimulation. This is a game where the journey is as much fun as reaching the destination. A game of both luck and strategy. Be the first to maneuver your way across the board and you win!

Trillõn is a game of never-ending possibilities. If you started playing right now and never stopped playing for the rest of your life, you would not even come close to having played Trillõn in all of its nearly incomprehensible combinations. So, come on, you better hurry up and play! Time is ticking away....
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Math, Maze, Puzzle, Racing
mechanics: Modular Board, Pattern Recognition, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Hike It!: The Backpacking Board Game
description:
Hike It! is a highly thematic mid-weight board game that puts you deep into the Great Smoky Mountains with just your backpack and your wits. Choose your gear, plan your route, and learn skills while avoiding injuries, dehydration, bad weather, and pesky bears.

At the start of the game, players choose a trailhead and three scenic locations to visit during their trek through picturesque Great Smoky Mountains National Park, as well as the amount of gear and water they want to lug along. A lighter pack mean faster travel, but less capacity to deal with unforeseen events.

Players must cope with inclement weather and obstacles that present themselves while hiking toward their destinations. Along the way, they can stop at campsites and water sources to pick up more gear and water, build skills sets that make it easier to overcome challenges, and take side hikes and visit scenic spots for additional points.

And when a player is finished hiking, they return to the game as an aggressive bear to chase down any lollygagging hikers still in the park!

The hiker who had the best experience (most victory points) wins the game.
mechanics: Action Points, Events, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That, Trading

name: Gold am Yukon
description:
Players roll dice and move their teams of prospectors across the game board to stake gold claims.

Components include board, 72 pieces in six colors and a die.

Intended for children Ages 6 and up.

name: Iron Chef Board Game: The Ultimate Cooking Challenge
description:
(From the back of the box)
Welcome to Kitchen Stadium!
Get ready for codfish and tomatoes to start flying as The Iron Chef: Ultimate Cooking Challenge comes to your home. Based on the hit TV show, Iron Chef, this frantic board game pits four culinary challengers against each other in a race to build the perfect meal!
Do you prefer Chinese? French? Italian? Or how about Japanese? It all begins when the surprise ingredient is revealed. Spin the wheel and race about the board in an attempt to assemble a complete meal - appetizer, main course, and dessert!
The real Iron Chefs chop, dice, and mince - you need to collect, trade, and discard cards to beat your opponents. But pitfalls abound! Watch out for dull knives, burnt vegetables, and stoves that don't work. Complete your meal, enter the inner circle of Kitchen Stadium and await the Judge's decision! Defend your title! Will you be King of the Iron Chef? Allez Cuisine!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Shifty Checkers
description:
Components:

Gameboard (with moving parts), red and yellow checkers, instructions, scoring pegs

Publisher's description:

"Checkers with a new twist. The game board really shifts! Strategy and luck combine to make SHIFTY CHECKERS a fast moving board game. If you can't outplay your opponent, you might still get the breaks and win."

Brief Notes:

Don Adams (as Maxwell Smart) and Barbara Feldman (as Agent 99)
appear on the game box. Game play involves checker mechanics with movable columns on the game board.

Further Brief Note:

Actually, that isn't Barbara Feldman on the box. It's probably the actress that featured opposite Don Adams in the Casablanca-themed humorous TV commercial for the game.

name: Relate
description:
Relate is a 2-player game where the goal is to move one's blocks from his or her starting space to the starting spaces of the opponent. A player does so by pushing the block into an orthogonally adjacent space, which will force the block to rotate to a new face. This typically changes the color showing on the top of the cube, although the blue and orange faces are repeated. The key to the game is that a player cannot move their own pieces so that both cubes show the same color, and if a player moves a piece so that the color on it matches the color of an opponent's block, the opponent must then move the block with the matching color. The first player go get both blocks to the opponent's starting spaces wins.

Each block has two blue, two orange, one red and one yellow side.

name: Centurion
description: As leaders of their respective planets, players try to achieve the topmost level of development in four areas (social, transportation, health, and natural resources), by collecting tiles or taking it form the other players.

name: Soccer Manager
description: In this game, you play a soccer manager and you have to make your club the champion club in the First Division. Starting at the bottom, you chose a club, put together a team, purchase star players, play football matches and build amenities for your club. All without going bankrupt of course! It is for 2-4 players Ages 8 and up.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Open Drafting, Simulation, Trading

name: Lucky Luke: Wanted
description: Players are Sheriffs trying to capture outlaws and collect reward money. The roll of two dice is split on each turn. One die is for movement, the other corresponds to one of six event cards. Players move from space to space, trying to find the exact hat/kerchief color combination matching the wanted bandit. Notes are kept as players deduce the whereabouts of each outlaw. Event cards can penalize players by eliminating outlaws or restricting a player's movements, or reward them with a free peek at a bandit card. When all bandits have been captured, the player with the most reward money wins.
categories: American West, Comic Book / Strip, Deduction
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Hasbro, MB Jeux, MB Spiele, Milton Bradley

name: Go Wacky!
description:
From Back of Box:

Go Wacky! is a super speedy dice-rolling match-to-win card game. Different cards have different rules, but your goal is to collect as many of them as you can. You may have to roll your dice at the bull's-eye cards, roll your dice as fast as you can while the others count, or race your opponents to roll for a card the quickest. You may not be wacky now, but you'll get wacky when you play Go Wacky!

name: Monopoly: Centennial Olympic Games
description:
The Official 1996 Olympic Games Edition.

This one was sold at the souvenir booth at the Atlanta Olympic games. On the bottom of the box are printed the Games pictograms of the major sports and there is a numbered holographic "Authentic" sticker on the box bottom, upper right hand corner.

The game remains the same, however the spaces depict the posters of the Olympic games and their host cities over the years:

Purple: St. Louis 1904, London 1908
Lt. Blue: Stockholm 1912, Belgium 1920, Paris 1924
Maroon: Amsterdam 1928, Los Angeles 1932, Berlin 1936
Orange: London 1948, Helsinki 1952, Melbourne 1956
Red: Rome 1960, Tokyo 1964, Mexico 1968
Yellow: Munich 1972, Montreal 1976, Moscow 1980
Green: Los Angeles 1984, Seoul 1988, Barcelona 1992
Blue: Athens 1896, Atlanta 1996
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Katopsi
description:
With intimate knowledge and experience in designing buildings, Konstantinos D. Zois company created, designed and manufactured a new and revolutionary game, named Katopsi!

The game came from the fields of architecture and design. Katopsi is a Greek word which means ‘ground plan’. The game has a very special concept, based on the creation of residence ground plans with cards as well as on the hard competition between the players for the creation of the ‘smartest’ ground plan!

It’s about a really fascinating game with recreational and educational character, a completely different and subversive suggestion in the world of games!

Katopsi becomes the new way of entertainment, attracting thus the most demanding players to participate in a hard ‘battle’ against their opponents. Players are challenged to sharpen their mind and ‘test’ their imagination by ‘building’ their own houses smart!

name: Pony-opoly
description:
From the manufacturer:

Players collect ponies as they make their way around the board and “TAP! TAP!’ with their imaginary hooves the number of treats owed when another player lands on their pony. Game play includes “High Hoofing” other players and collecting horseshoes. This is a younger version of a property trading game where it’s SNORTS AND GIGGLES until someone gets sent to the Stable! The deed for each pony contains fun facts about the breed and helpful pony tips too!

2 – 4 players, ages 5 – 8
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Perfect Sense
description:
The five riddles on each card describe the same object, and each riddle relates to one of your five senses. How quickly can you solve these Riddles That Make Sense™?


Sight:


I come in all colors and sit in a dish.
I’m never dirty. Guess if you wish.


Touch:


Slip and slide, I glide on your skin.
I make you feel clean, leave you with a grin.


Smell:


Wish to smell clean? You’ll want me near.
I’ll give you a pleasant scent, my dear.


Hearing:


Hear the rubber ducky song.
I’ll make you clean before too long.


Taste:


If you’ve been nasty and used words in bad taste,
they’ll wash out your mouth with me in haste.

If you guessed “Soap,” you’re right. Players travel around a game board, moving ahead based on the number of riddles they need to guess the correct answer. The more riddles you hear, the easier it will be to guess, but you won’t move ahead as many spaces.

name: Honeypot Chase Game
description: The object of the game is to collect one card of each of the characters (5 cards), or any 10 cards. The cards have two different colours, one on each side. Attach the honey pot collecting pads (with suction cups) to your hands with the velcro strap. Scatter the cards in front of the players, press the randomizer and start hitting the cards with the collecting pads!

name: Inventum
description:
The year is 2450. The players, who represent different universities from around the world, will travel five hundred years back in time to the 20th century, where they will plan and deliver one of the great advances in that century. Each of these advances has some requirements on personnel, materials and funding. During the game players take turns to play cards on the table (while keeping some cards to achieve their secret agendas); the cards played on the table help in meeting the requirements, but as more cards are on the table there are more probabilities of problems arising in the common research (at the end of each turn a number of dice is rolled depending on the number of cards on the table, and the result of the dice roll sometimes forces to remove some cards). After 10 turns, players win if they have reached the requirements, and one of the players will be the top winner if he/she has also reached his/her secret agenda. If the players have not reached the requirements, they collectively lose.

Inventum is a game of collaboration that highlights the role universites play in transferring knowledge to the community at large and hereby contributing to our economic and social well-being.

The game is published with the support of the University of Barcelona and the Fundació Bosch i Gimpera, from an original proposal by Marga Becerra and Mariona Ferrer.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Tile Placement
publishers: Devir, Fundació Bosch i Gimpera, Universitat de Barcelona

name: Ruddy Vikings: Heroic Deck
description:
The Heroic Deck is an expansion for the standard Ruddy Vikings Deck filled with all sorts of goodness that brings more crazyness to the game!
The expansion includes Heroic Vikings with unique abilities. The Heroic Viking Cards have built in buffers which make them more likely to get past defences.
This coupled with new defences and new buffers mean that players never have to stop having fun filled bearded gaming sessions.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Angry Birds: Action Game
description:
From the publisher:

Angry Birds Action Game is full of familiar fun, in a more compact form! With more wooden blocks, birds and pigs you can let your imagination run wild. The rules are easy: build a structure, place the pigs in/on it and see how far you can fling them with a couple of Angry Birds.


Exciting Angry Birds launching Pig Action that's designed to play on any tabletop surface! Includes a sturdy gameboard, 10 wooden structures, various cardboard platforms, 2 pigs and 3 abs & gold stars to track who wins each round. Player who wins 3 rounds, wins the game!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Video Game Theme

name: Lucky Five
description:
extrapolated from Schildberg translation:

Preparation
• Place the card tray in the middle of the table.
• Shuffle the cards and place them face down in one side of the card tray to form the draw pile.
• Roll the three dice and place them next to the card tray.
• Give each player 10 chips worth a total of 270 points, as follows: 7 light green chips worth 10 each, 2 dark green chips worth 50 each, and 1 black chip worth 100.

Play
• The player who has been the luckiest today begins the game. Play then proceeds clockwise.
• A player’s turn must always be taken in this order (during which steps 1 – 4 may repeat several times):
1. Turn over a card. The cards show what dice must be rolled in step 3.
2. Put down a chip. Then the player decides — based on the card and the intended dice roll — which chip he would prefer to put down. You can only put down one chip per card (one 10-point chip, one 50-point chip or one 100-point chip). Place it in the middle of the table next to the exposed card.
3. Bet and roll the dice. Now the player must predict the total roll of the respective dice on the card when compared with the numbers currently showing on the dice.
4. Evaluate the roll. The player’s bet will be right or wrong. Right bets mean two possibilities for this player:
• He/she may take another turn, going through steps 1 – 4 again.
• Or he/she may end his/her turn. He/she takes all the upturned cards from the middle of the table, puts them in a stack in front of him/her and puts the chips from the middle of the table on the stack.

The game ends when only one player has chips left. This player gets one final turn. If he/she bets wrong, the chips are left in the middle of the table; nobody can use them in the scoring. The same goes for chips that were not yet used in betting.

The game also ends if no more cards can be drawn. In this case chips not yet used in betting do not score, either.

Scoring and winning
Each player scores his/her stacks separately, by multiplying the number of cards in the stack by the total value of the chips in the stack. Then add the separate stack scores together for a grand total. The winner is the player with the highest grand total. In case of a tie, the player with the most cards wins.

name: Mickey Bingo
description: This is a children's bingo game with a Mickey Mouse Theme. Each player receives a bingo card with a 5x5 grid of Disney characters with different colored backdrops. A spinner is used to call spaces. The outer circle of the spinner shows the various characters while the inner circle shows colors (5 per character). For example: If the spinner arrow points to the color blue and Donald Duck's face, "Blue Donald Duck" is called out. Any player with a Blue Donald picture on their card would cover it with a chip. The first player to cover 5 characters in a row with chips wins.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Dog's Luck
description:
One of Haba's Mini-Spiels that come in a small tin (similar to an Altoids tin) and contain small wooden pieces.

Components: 4 dogs in 4 colors (one for each player), 5 bones, 1 die (sides are 1/2/2/3/doghouse/doghouse) and game tin with the lid half open (doghouse).

Place the doghouse in the center of the playing area and place the 5 bones in it. The players' dogs begin next to the doghouse on the long side to the left of the doghouse opening (door).

Players take turns. On your turn, roll the die. If the doghouse is rolled, turn the doghouse one quarter turn in any direction. If you roll a number, move that many 'spaces' in a clockwise direction around the doghouse, each 'space' being one side of the doghouse. If you can land inside the doghouse with an exact roll (jumping in from the short side with the door), you take a bone from the doghouse. If you are in the doghouse and you roll a doghouse, you cannot leave it on that turn.

First player to collect 2 bones wins.

Ages 5-99

name: Dylematy 2
description:
Do you think that after playing Moral Dilemma you know your friends inside out? Nothing could be more wrong! Thanks to the "Dylematy 2" you will face new moral choices and get to know each other from a completely different angle!

Sit in a circle in a group of 4 to 15 people and give each player 2 voting cards ("A" and "B"). Choose a deck to play and who will start playing. Each turn, the Dilemma card lands on the table – a moral issue with two possible solutions. Your task is to predict which option most people will choose at the table. The group can – and even should (you are strongly encouraged to!) – discuss possible solutions, after which each player makes a decision. You score if you have correctly predicted the majority vote.

The ultimate goal of the game is to collect 5 points, but the secret to having fun is to talk. The cards are to be an excuse to discuss more or less awkward topics.

—description from the publisher (translated)
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Negotiation, Party Game

name: 3 for me
description: 3 For Me is made of 48 tiles with a different drawing on each of them. The idea of the game is to find 3 tiles with something in common; it can be "red things", "warm things", "things with a hole", "things that fly"... There are 3 games in one: the search game (4 and up), the fish style game (6 and up) and the advanced memory game (8 and up). It's very enjoyable for the whole family.

name: VeggieTales Don't Sink in the Sink!
description:
Who but a bunch of veggies would think of having a race across a sink full of dishes, pots and pans? Usually the Veggies will be able to hop across the sink, balancing on dishes and other things hidden under the soap suds. But be careful! Sometimes then will fall into the sink and disappear for the rest of the game! So remember where the solid landings are or wear the life preserver.

The board has an "understory" that you can change around, to vary the placement of the solid landings. Spin the spinner, and try not to fall in.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Lauf rauf!
description:
Everyone wants to get their three game pieces on the mountain as quickly as possible — but that is easier said than done as both the opponents and the grouchy mountain spirit want to hinder a player who's on the rise. Those who come too close to him will find a spell cast on them to slow their progress.

Whoever has the best tactics and the most luck with the dice in Lauf rauf! will win this family game!

name: I.Q. Challenge
description:
A lateral thinking game in which players draw puzzle cards and attempt to solve them before the timer runs out. Each puzzle has a score which is proportionally related to its difficulty - harder questions equal more points.

Play solo, or against as many individuals or teams as you want.

name: Wild Animalopoly
description: WILD ANIMALOPOLY has all the fun of a traditional real estate trading game with some wild animal twists. Instead of buying property, players become Caretakers of animals. Instead of rent, players pay Meal Fees.
