A player collects 4 Elements - the land, water, food and clean air that all animals need to survive and trades them in for a Habitat where an animal can survive on its own. Flip over the Animal Certificates and you'll find several fun facts about each animal. Did you know a polar bear has coal-black skin? Or that a flamingo is pink because it eats shrimp? How about the fact that a giraffe hoof is the size of a large dinner plate? It's all fun and games until you land on HIDE FROM PREDATOR... then it's time to run to HIDING and you're out for 3 turns! So grab your token and advance to EXPLORE. Who knows? You may become the caretaker of a two ton rhino. Or you might get fleas! Whatever Happens... It's howling good fun! IT'S WILD!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Yamodo!
description:
Read, Draw, Write... Pass it On!

A card is drawn from the stack and players must attempt to define the made-up word written at the top. Each card also has a small drawing for players to add on to. When you draw or get passed a card, you add to both the definition and the drawing, passing the card around until the word has been full defined by the players.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Storytelling

name: Epidemia
description:
Each player has tokens representing 5 different organs (heart, lungs, brain, kidney, and liver). In your turn, you must play a card in order to damage another player organ, cure yourself, lower the defense of other players (easier to damage organs), raise your defense, exchange an organ with another player or damage an organ of all the other players.
When a player has all the five organs damaged, he can't win, but still can annoy the others.
A player is declared the winner when he is the last alive.

name: 4 Pics 1 Word
description:
4 Pics 1 Word is a card game based on the app of the same name, and the gameplay is similar between the two.

In the card game, players are shown four images at once, along with a selection of letters that could belong to a word that relates to all of the images. Can you pick out the right letters to determine what the proper word is? In the co-operative mode, players compete against time to solve as many puzzles as possible before the clock runs out.

name: Phart!  The Dispersing
description:
A parody of Magic The Gathering which is all about...Farts.

College-level humour.

The mechanics are mostly borrowed from Nuclear War: you play food cards followed by fart cards. The "damage" to the target's "fresh air points" is the product of the two card values. Upon having to "leave the room" because you ran out of fresh air, you get an "act of ultimate flatulence": firing off all remaining food and fart card pairs.

The only parody of Magic here is the title. The game is a variation of Nuclear War, The food cards are the warheads and the Phart cards are the delivery system. There is no propoganda-peace phase though.

name: My Brain Is Bleeding
description: Players are future hackers trying to avoid a deadly computer virus. There are three different types of cards in the game: Nodes, Double Nodes, and Specials. The nodes represent the different nodes on the net that you need to move through to stay ahead of the virus. Players are eliminated one-by-one by the virus until the last person remains and is the winner. A quick and dirty little game. The quality is fair and the rules are simple.

name: Meet the Presidents
description: Game features collectible metal coins of all the presidents from Washington through Lyndon Johnson. By answering questions on American presidential history, players move their presidents around a track and on to the White House. First player to put 8 presidents in the White House wins.
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Track Movement

name: Schiffe Versenken
description:
Schiffe Versenken has the same rules as Battleship but instead of 5 ships from lengths 2-5 each player has 10 ships from lengths 1-4.

Each player has:

4 size 1 ships
3 size 2 ships
2 size 3 ships
1 size 4 ship


Players place their ship on a gridded 10X10 piece of paper and keep track of their hits and misses with pencil.

name: Crackers in My Bed
description: Players try to match sets of crackers by using a spinner to dictate what color cracker they pull out of the bed. Player with the most cracker matches wins.

name: My Dog Has Fleas
description: This game has a large plastic dog with small holes in its back. Players each have a set of colored plastic "flea" pieces with pegs on them. Players compete to see who can be the first to place and keep all of their fleas on the dog. When its tail is pushed down, it randomly pushes some of them out, making it a challenge to keep them on it.
publishers: Arxon, Chad Valley Co Ltd., Ideal, Tyco, Vivid Imaginations

name: Kick Bones
description:
Kick Bones is a free print and play dice game for two players. All you need to play are two regular six-sided dice, one hundred coins (or pencil and paper), and the following from http://kickbones.com:

Instructions
Doubles Sheet
Two Shields

name: Hellas
description:
Hellas is the most complete trivia game regarding knowledge about Greece.

It's a trivia game with a variety of easy and difficult questions.

It includes 6 categories of questions: Culture, History, Sports, Linguistics, Geography, and General questions.

It has the following question types: multiple choice, enigma, rebus, tongue twisters, and visual questions.

All of them are regarding Greek History, Geography, etc.

Published ca. 2002-2005.

name: Dirty Words: Party Edition
description:
SETTING UP THE GAME
Plan to play this game with someone you love (or would like to).
The following is suggested before starting the game:

Soft lighting: but not so soft that you can't read the Word Dice.
Music: whatever you turn on, or turns you on.
Drinks: BYO (or take from your host's fridge).


When the mood is all set, place all 28 Word Dice on the table. Use the lower half of the cylindrical package as your Dice Cup. Grab a piece of paper and a pen for scoring (not included).

OBJECT OF THE GAME
The object of the game is to use as many of the 28 Word Dice as possible in the three minutes allotted to form logically correct sentences. All sentences must intersect at one or more points.
Correct: They desire her lips
Incorrect: They lips her desire
The player or team with the highest score at the end of the game wins.

PLAYING THE GAME

Any number of consenting adults may play. Create two or more equal teams of players. If there are only two players, you can just play with yourself.
It doesn't make a damn bit of difference who goes first, so to start, the first team places all 28 Word Dice in the Dice Cup. The bottom half of the package is used as the Dice Cup. Shake the Dice Cup thoroughly, and roll all the Word Dice onto the playing surface.
Invert the timer immediately and begin forming sentences with words on the top side of the Word Dice. Play stops when the timer runs out (after approximately three minutes). IMPORTANT! Any blank Dice rolled may be used as any word the


players desire. It should be noted, however, that blank Dice have no point value when calculating the point total.

Any noun may be made plural. Example: Man to Men or Woman to Women
Any verb may have an -S, -ING, -LY, or -ED added to suit the sense of the particular sentence it is used in. Example:


I SPANK SHE SPANKS YOU ARE SPANKING WE SPANKED
(Note: the ending of -PERY may also be added to the verb SLIP, making it the adjective SLIPPERY.)

You may use any punctuation you like! This is one time where you don't need to panic if you have a missing period.


SCORING

Five points are scored for each Word Die used at the end of the three minutes.
Deduct three points for each Word Die not used.
Any Word Die used in two sentences is given a double value–


10 points!

WINNING THE GAME
The suggested game length is three rounds...if you can last that long. The person or team with the highest score at the end of the game is declared the winner, and presented with an M.D.W. (Master of Dirty Words).

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Team-Based Game

name: World of Tanks Winners
description:
Get ready for tank battles! In the board game World of Tanks: Winners, each player will have a hangar with equipment, and you will have to compete with your rivals in accuracy, speed and combat power. Lightning solutions and accurate calculation will lead you to a sure victory!

Winners consist of a deck of cards that are equally distributed to all players. Unfolded cards lie in front of players in stacks, face down. Then one of them opens the top card in his pile and looks at the parameters of the tanks indicated in its upper part.
The player announces what parameter the competition will take: mass, power, speed or shooting, after which all other players open the top card from their piles. The one from whom the chosen parameter will be maximized takes the opened cards to himself, puts them under the bottom of his stack and makes the following move: he opens the card and chooses the parameter by which the tanks compete.
The game ends at the moment when one of the players runs out of cards. The winner is the one who has the most cards in the pile. In the rules there is also the option of a long game, when the game ends only when there is only one player left with the cards.
The kit includes a promo card of the Soviet T-54 tank for World of Tanks: Rush.

name: Hamster Race
description:
Line up your hamsters on the starting grid, roll the die and you’re off! Race around the track, pick up cheese and tip the see-saw to let your hamster ride the wheel.

Cheer on your hamster as they whizz around and try to hold on! The last hamster on the wheel wins the round and gets to keep the cheese in their mouth. The player with the most cheese after 3 rounds wins the game!

name: Color Addict Puzzle
description:
In this dominoes-like variant of Color Addict, players must lay out their cards so that the edges match the color patterns on cards that have already been played. If a player is unable to act on his turn, he draws one of the "joker" black and white cards.

The goal is to be the first player to get rid of all of his cards.

name: El juego del siglo
description:
A trivia game that rewards boldness, strategy and luck.

The questions are about significant events of the twentieth century.

After know a historical fact, before the real question is known, it should be bet on the table about the possibility of answering correctly. You will be able to guess the question? Without risk there is no gain.

name: Monopoly: Corvette
description:
From the back of the box:
"Shift into high gear with 50 years of your favorite corvette models. Experience the thrill of owning the most collectible Corvette cars ever produced.

"The Corvette debuted in 1953 at the General Motors Motorama at New York's posh Waldorf Astoria and has since become the uncontested master of the American-made sports car. The MONOPOLY Brand proudly introduces a game designed exclusively for the dedicated Corvette collector. Featuring 50 years of celebrated vintage shark coupes, classic Sting Ray convertibles and the limited edition 50th Anniversary, this version of the world's most famous board game puts you right in the driver's seat.

"Fuel your Corvette passion -- play this high performance edition of the MONOPOLY game and leave the competition in the dust."
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Music Quiz
description: Be the first to correctly answer 5 quiz questions.

name: Energy City
description: "Energy City" is a game about energy saving. On a 6x5 grid 20 companies are placed. The red ones use old-fashioned light bulbs, the green ones energy saving lamps. On a player´s turn first tiles with these two sorts of lamps are placed, then the player can move his meeple up to 3 steps and then the player chooses from: a) getting victory points for adjacent lamp tiles b) placing lobby-tiles face-down on company-tiles or c) changing a company into an energy-saving one if the sum of the lobby-tiles of this company is greater then the number of the action card (the player gets VPs in case of success).
mechanics: Memory, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: Im siebten Himmel
description:
Im Siebten Himmel (translated to In Seventh Heaven) is a fast-paced card game about cute boys.

It is one of three games in Kosmos' “Freche Madchen – freche Spiele” (Sassy Girls – Sassy Games) line, based on a line of successful books by the name of ‘Sassy girls – Sassy Books’ of which more than 50 titles have already been released.

name: Olsen
description: Olsen contains 52 cards in four colors and a joker. The game is reminiscent of games like Uno and Crazy Eights..

name: The Goonies Board Game
description:
From the Wired.Com review of The Goonies 25th Anniversary Edition DVD Set:

".... the set’s true treasure - a special Goonies-themed board game.

The bulk of the box set’s real estate is devoted to this game, and immediately upon cracking open the shrink wrap you are taken by its diminutive size. Still, if The Goonies taught us anything it’s that size doesn’t always matter, and I’m happy to report that this is the case here. Though the board itself is only about half the size of your average game, it’s actually a brilliantly colored fold-up printed on super sturdy laminated stock that appears perfectly capable of standing up to multiple years’ worth of play sessions. The same can be said for the game’s Move Cards which, while not quite as brawny as most CCG cards, are thick enough to get the job done.

Gameplay is fairly simple and properly reflects the spirit of the source materials - players take the role of one of five Goonies (Mikey, Data, Mouth, Chunk or Andy) and use a three-card hand in an attempt to escape One-Eyed Willy’s cave. Players disarm traps to collect Gold Doubloons, and the first to reach the "Escape" square with three such Doubloons wins the game. The process is complicated by a trio of tricky Skull Spaces (only one of which contains the necessary key) that must be passed to reach the exit. This is balanced out by a fun selection of Special Move Cards that allow players to switch places with or steal gold from opponents. While certainly not the most engaging board game experience in movie fandom, it does manage to channel the proper amount of nostalgia and charm in a small but effective package."

name: Zen Blocks
description:
From the box:

A special three-dimensional experience for the intuitive, the dreamer, & the thinker... Match symbols to form a cube. Bring together Lion & Lamb, Heaven & Earth, Rain & Sun into a harmonious Whole. Rules for a basic, beginner's game, and advanced play for teen & adults. A genuine game which unfolds differently each time you play. Not a one solution puzzle. Thus, excellent for family play, in classrooms as a logic game, in groups assessing cooperative skills or just as a gift for that clever person. Everyone plays together to realize the common objective of the cube.

name: Elephants on Parade
description:
Four elephant families are ready for the great jungle Olympics. The colorful elephants need to line up behind one another to create their own parade route. Who can help them to create the most beautiful and most colorful parade in the shortest amount of time?

From the Ravensburger website:
Let´s have an elephant parade! There are several parade routes that need to be filled, and the colored spaces along the route will tell you exactly which little elephant needs to be next. You have to have two large and six small elephants in your parade. In order to add your elephants, pay close attention to the color that has been rolled on the die. If the color on the die matches the color for the elephant that has to be next in your parade line, then carefully connect the matching color elephant to the elephant in front of him. The first player to have all of their little elephants in the parade wins. What Do You Learn? Color recognition, dexterity.

Ages 3-7.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Educational

name: Aaargh !
description:
Each player gets 7 cards. The first who finishes his hand wins the game. But: there aren't any rules yet which tell you which card can be played onto which other card. When it's a players turn, he plays a card, or draws a card and makes a new rule before he plays one card. So you have to remember the rules set by the players to finish your hand and win the game. It's not as easy as it sounds, why do you think it's called AAARGH !?
Rules are printed in English, German and Dutch. The box contains 50 playing cards.

name: Mamoonia
description: Mamoonia is a 2 to 3 hour–length adventure fantasy game for 1–6 players, where every player plays the role of one of the King Joseph’s sons. They should try to put together the amulet powers again, seeking and discovering which ones, among the 12 fragments, are the 4 real ones. In order to reach such a goal, players must make their own characters progress by increasing their physical strength and mental powers, and by gaining enough experience points to be admitted in the different Orders. The High Priests will help them to face such a difficult task: their heroes start as Apprentices, then they grow into Mystic Warriors, Knights Wizards, Sorcerer Sword-Masters and conclude their evolution becoming capable and powerful Masters of War and Magic.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dinosaurs and Things
description:
A dinosaur learning/adventure game.
Players move around a track answering dinosaur trivia questions and collecting dinosaur-shaped puzzle pieces.
Comes with a large sturdy game board and well-constructed tokens.
Graduated question sets allow mixed ages to play together.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Prehistoric, Puzzle, Trivia
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Borderline:  World Edition
description:
This Crazy Eights variant was designed by TV star John Davidson and his wife.

Players start with hands of 8 cards which come from a deck consisting of nations of the world, bodies of water, and wild cards. The cards have the name of the location on one side and a map on the other side, showing contiguous locations.

The object is to void your hand by playing a card with something that shares a borderline with the last card played. Wild cards when played are automatically considered a match and can then be named as any location in the deck except for those in the player's hand. If a player cannot play a contiguous card, cards are drawn from the deck and added to the player's hand until a card can be played.

Instead of drawing, a player can play a card that does not share a borderline and hope to not be challenged. Challenges can happen after any play. If the challenging player is correct, and the card played does not share a borderline, then the challenged player has to take back the card and take a card from the challenging player's hand. If the challenge is incorrect, the challenger takes a card from the deck and the challenged player gets another turn.

name: Monopoly: Philadelphia Eagles
description: This is a version of Monopoly based on the National Football League (NFL) team, the Philadelphia Eagles. Players can buy and trade the team's most famous players, including Ron Jaworski and Donovan McNabb.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Joggle
description: The square black plastic board has 8 x 8 spaces which are coloured indents that accommodate a player's black or white marbles. The indents are coloured blue, green, red or yellow. On their turn a dice is rolled and the player places their marble in an indent of the colour shown on the dice. The aim is for a player to create a 3 x 2 rectangle of their own coloured balls. The dice also includes two 'joggle' sides that allow players to move or swap pieces, but not to complete a winning move.
publishers: Green Board Game Co., moses. Verlag GmbH

name: Bang Box
description: Inflate a number of balloons equal to one less than the total number of players and place them under the Bang Box. Each player on their turn spins the spinner and must drive that number of nails into any holes of their choice without busting a balloon. When a player bursts a balloon that player is out of the game. The remaining players continue until there is only one player left, the winner!

name: Tripoto
description:
Tripoto is a wooden regular tetrahedron, with six holes on every face.

Players take turns putting (or moving, or removing) their fingers into the holes. The player(s) who obtain(s) three of his/her/their fingers in-a-row is/are the winner(s) (!).

An interesting mix between abstract strategy and dexterity games. Very fun, also for people watching the game.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement

name: Where's Waldo? Join The Search
description:
Review by Time for Kids:

"The search for Waldo began 25 years ago. So, where is he? As fans of the books know, Waldo is a master of hiding in plain sight. Now the hunt continues in the Where’s Waldo? Join the Search board game from Techno Source. Arrange the eight game cards in any order, spin the wheel, flip a playing card and race to find the hidden objects on the card. Get your eagle eyes ready: The player with the most cards wins! – Kelli Plasket"

From the publisher:

Where's Waldo? Join the Search Game is fun for the whole family. Join your friends in a race to find to find the hidden objects in this board game featuring the Waldo and his friends. The super detailed scenes are right out of the beloved picture books by Martin Handford. Arrange the game boards in any order. Then spin the wheel, flip a card, and you're off! Fans of the Where's Waldo books will recognize the colorful characters from the Waldo universe. And if you're meeting Waldo for the first time, you'll be amazed at all the ways he can hide in plain sight. Includes an adjustable game board with 12 double-sided tiles, cards, spinner, and game tokens. The game offers a new game experience every time you play. You'll even receive two Where's Waldo postcards with classic book scenes. Fun for 2 - 6 players age 8 and over. University Games offers you and your family a wide selection of creative games that are easy to learn and fun to play.

name: Joylings
description:
A long mane, a soft nose, and a warm look – every little girl dreams of having her own horse. With Joylings, horse lovers both big and small get a full herd of their favorite animal. Discover the world of horses with two different game variations.

In "Cross Country" players ride across the fields, collecting prize chips in six different categories. Which horse jumps highest? Which one gallops fastest? And which one has the longest mane? When playing the "Birthday Party" variant for younger children, the smartest horse celebrates his birthday in his stable. While making their way to the party, players must collect tournament ribbons as a present. The first player to arrive at the party with six different ribbons wins.

name: Wordsmithery
description:
Wordsmithery is dead easy. Guess the meaning of word. All 700 of our words are exactly the kind of words that you pretend to understand…when you don’t. Words like egregious, phalanx and salubrious. Don’t worry. You get three possible – and fun – definitions to choose from. First to ten points wins. Over to you.

Game for 2 players or teams. On each turn a player draws a word, reads it to their opponent, and the opponent attempts to guess the meaning from three options. Each correct guess is two points, first one to ten wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Square Deal
description: A tile-placement game, where players are trying to play out 12 tiles, one-at-a-time, before their opponent. The catch is that the square tiles, which are sectioned off into 4 triangular sections with different colors, must match colors with the side of the square(s) it is being placed next to. In addition, the tiles must stay in a 5x5 grid and cannot be placed so that the grid would be larger than 5x5. The first person to place all 12 twelve of their tiles (or has placed the most if neither player can legally place more) is the winner. The game includes a solitaire challenge and a "brainy" version that increases the challenge.

name: Beat the Count
description:
(from the web site)

Knock out your opponent and be the first to play ll of your cards successfully. Go ahead, "Beat The Count!"

Ages: 8 and up
Players: 3 to 8 players
Contents: 112 number and action cards and instructions
publishers: Inter Hobby Co., Ltd., Winning Moves Games (USA)

name: Croc: Le jeu qu'on rit!
description:
The Croc board game was based on the French Canadian magazine of the same name, which was a rough equivalent of MAD magazine published in the province of Québec, Canada, from 1979 to 1995.

In the game, you are a comedian going on tour throughout Québec, trying to collect 75,000 fans. The game features various types of challenges (trivia questions, improv duels) through which one can win or lose fans. The game itself was heavily humour-oriented, containing mostly culture-specific jokes.

name: Pipeline
description:
Pipeline is a surprisingly fun 3D pipe laying game. Presented as a kid's game, gamers will enjoy it as a light contest too. 4 players have colourful plastic sets of plumbing; straights, angles, T joints and capping pieces. Start from one side of the board, spin a spinner (or roll a special die) to select your piece and try to build a pipeline over to ending points on the opposite side. You can rotate your pipeline if required, but not backtrack, so when your neighbour's pipe gets in your way, you have to build over or around. First to connect wins.

Compared to Pipeline, this has a 5x5 grid and fewer components.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Tile Placement
publishers: HCM Kinzel, New Entertainment Ltd, Paul Lamond Games Ltd

name: Out on a Limb
description:
Out on a Limb is a simple card game about family history. Although the game is published by a Mormon company, there are no specific religious doctrines mentioned in the game and it would be appropriate for any players looking for a genealogy game.

The game play is similar to Hearts. The starting player plays a family card. The other players must play another card in that color if they can. The player who has played the highest value card takes all the cards and starts the next round. After all the cards have been played, players look through the cards they won, and use them to fill in a "Family Tree" card. The first player to fill in their family tree up to great-great-grandparents is the winner.

The deck of 60 cards is comprised of 4 colors (or suits) numbered 1 to 15. There are 5 ancestor cards in the blue suit (1, 5, 7, 9, 13), 4 in the yellow suit (4, 6, 8, 12), and 3 ancestor cards in the red (4, 6, 8) and green (5, 7, 9) suits.

A card game based on the exploits of James Bond, Agent 007, where you compete to become the top agent by acquiring Plot and Villain cards with a higher total Danger Level than those of the other players. A special minor victory is awarded to the player ending up with the most cards in his Seduction Pile. The game features specific card sets for Dr. No, From Russia With Love, Goldfinger, Thunderball.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Scilly Gold
description:
The object is to be the first player to land on the space where the infamous Jim Bone has hidden the gold that was removed from the 18th Century wreck in the Scilly Isles (off the tip of Cornwall, England).

A set of normal and compass dice (one die with N,E,S,W on and one die with NE,SE, NW, SW on) direct the movement.

In the first phase of the game, you each aim to collect three clue cards outlining the location of the treasure. When one player has one of each type of clues to complete the set of three, they claim the Golden X card. The location of the treasure is now defined.

In the second phase of the game, players scramble to obtain the whereabouts of the treasure, attacking each other. The race to claim the gold is on.
mechanics: Area Movement, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Auction America: The Trivia Game for Any Collector
description:
Described by the Publisher/Designer:

Auction America: The Trivia Game for Any Collector contains 2000 trivia questions from over 500 books. Questions cover anything and everything people collect like comics, toys, books, cars, toys, and other memorabilia. If you are a fan of Trivial Pursuit then this game is for you.

name: Towers of Wyoming
description:
This game is available for free at http://www.invisible-city.com/play/58

Object: To Construct a Tower of cards - a pile containing only one suit - faster than the other players, or to be the last player in the game.
You Need: A deck of cards with four distinct suits and 25 cards in each suit. Shuffling two poker decks together and then removing one card from each suit works nicely. You can also use extra cards you have lying around from certain collectible card games (think of ones that rhyme with tragic)

The game has a moderate combination of luck and skill and takes about 15 minutes to play. Several variants of play are available as well.

name: Het 1845 Spel
description:
As your life progresses (from 1-100, in a 'snakes/ladders' environment) you will need to have certain insurance to avoid major personal disasters. The one with the most of money after becoming 100 years old, wins.

Interesting mechanic is that you can buy all kinds of insurance that prevent disaster or bring you money. You cannot buy all of the insurances available though and you have to choose which insurance policies you buy at the beginning of the game. During the game calamities happen which cost money unless you have taken out the correct insurance.

This is a promotion game, but it also has an educative purpose as you teaches what insurances are intended for.

Published in celebration of the merger of two companies, namely "De Nederlanden van 1845" and "Nationale Levensverzekering-Bank", into "Nationale Nederlanden". The company later also published Verzekeringsspel, a re-implementation, in remembrance of the 125-year anniversary of the company's.

Re-implemented by:

Verzekeringsspel


Be aware: only Dutch versions exist.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Divine Right: Scarlet Empire
description:
Starting in 1997, Glenn Rahman designed an extension to his fabulous game Divine Right. Scarlet Empire took place in a different period in that game's world, and further to the south of the original map. It was designed as a stand alone game that could also be played in combination with the other one. The campaign game pits most of the players against the one playing the Scarlet Witch King.

If you liked Divine Right, you'd like Scarlet Empire -- everything that made the first game great is also present in the other. Mercenaries, special locations, diplomacy, magic, etc.

Scarlet Empire was supposed to be published by Excalibre Games and made it as far as the advanced play-test stages, but the publisher hemmed and hawed and tried to cut costs, so much so Glen eventually gave up in disgust. A very few play-test copies are in existence as a result.

Expands:

Divine Right
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Political, Wargame

name: New America
description: The cooperative board game about a technological, social design for the survival of North America. --from box
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Morecambe & Wise Game
description:
Eric Morecambe & Ernie Wise were a famous comedy double act on British TV for 3 decades, now both deceased. This is a simple speed action game where 2 players knock cubes out of a vertical frame. The 48 cubes have various monochrome pictures of the comics, faces, costumes, dancing etc., the same picture on either side. Roll 4 dice showing the pictures and poke out the corresponding 8 cubes first. Keep poking until the player with least fallen on their side wins.
The box shows the duo actually playing the game, grinning like idiots, with Ernie's gold Rolex clearly on show! Bring me sunshine.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Patch Worlds
description: Innovative board game presenting you the theory of Chaos in the Nature.

name: Mime Smashing
description:
Free PDF game. You must print out the cards and rules. While it works with B&W printouts color are far superior.

Simulates going out and beating up mimes. Pair colored mime cards to score points. Cop cards reduce points earned and sometimes force players to spend a turn in jail (lose turn). Very fast and simple play.

Available free at http://web.archive.org/web/20020821192420/www.philipjreed.co...

name: Link
description:
A Scrabble variant, published in Israel in the 70's (guessing). In this version, plastic letter tiles can be connected three dimensionally, so words can be formed vertically and horizontally, creating a 3-D "sculpture" of words.

Letters have values as in regular Scrabble. Double word score is given for a word on a "new" dimensional plane. Triple word score is given for a word that "breaks" across more than one plane, by connecting existing letters.

Simple, yet has some depth to it. The game comes with 100 letter tiles and 20 special connectors that allow the structure to hold itself up. No board is needed.

name: Rosetta
description:
Rosetta is a tile laying game where players are trying to match the designs on the tiles to form a complete picture.
The two main game types are co-op in that players are all working together to complete the design. It can be thought of as a puzzle, with square pieces, that has multiple solutions.

On one side of the tiles, the "Rosetta", 1-3 players work together to make a 6x6 square picture. When complete, the picture shows different coloured flowers, each made up of two corresponding square pieces. You may choose to use the 4 joker tiles as wild cards.

On the other side, "Puncola", you are creating a 6x6 square picture by matching the edges of the tiles with a similar pattern on an adjacent tile. At the corners of certain tiles is a 1/4 circle that is paired with 3 other tiles to form a complete circle.

"Domino-Puncola" is an alternate version of the game that adds competition. Each player picks 5 tiles at random and, in turn, tries to match an edge of the "Puncola" side to a tile on the table. If that person cannot place his/her tile, he/she draws a new one. The first person to place all of his/her tiles is the winner.

name: K-Tel Superstar Game: The Original Rock 'n Roll Music Game
description: Players are rock stars and collect gold records to win. Roll dice to spiral in the player counters from the start to end square on the board. Squares have events for players to collect or lose money or release an album, which may turn out to be a hit, a dud, or break-even. Game comes with a 45 RPM record which must be played when any album is released. A random track determines the success of the album.

name: Run For President
description:
A contest between two players or teams to win the most electoral votes by answering questions about the states, the Presidents, and Washington, DC.

The players roll dice and move around the board, answering questions based on which space they land on. A question is asked about the state landed on, if it is a state or Washington, DC square. If the answer is correct, the player gets the electoral votes for that state. If a bonus square is landed on, a bonus question about Presidents is asked and if the answer is correct, the player gets the electoral votes from an unclaimed state. There are also swap spaces, which allow a player to attempt to steal a state from the opponent by answering a more difficult question.

name: Market Mania
description:
Market Mania is a card game for 2-5 players Ages 10 and up. The goal is to make money faster than your opponents and be first to reach 2 million dollars. This is a card players game, with 116 colorfully illustrated cards. Each turn gives you the chance to make decisions; selling your best stocks, or combining them into a "mutual fund," and draw cards for events such as collecting inheritances, paying or avoiding margin calls and moving the market. Matching stock cards is easy with 11 companies; collect groups and sell for big money. Market Mania makes fun of the market. A great way to introduce financial ideas to kids while enjoying a game where they can compete equally with adults.

Required materials (not included):

pencil & paper, or chips to keep score
2 markers to track the index prices

name: Piedestal
description:
From the instruction sheet:
PIEDESTAL is a three-dimensional strategy game for two players, and is played on a somewhat pyramid-shaped playing board. The Pawns start at the bottom-most spaces on the board and try to move up to the large, central top-most space: THE PIEDESTAL. Meanwhile, the Knights guard the PIEDESTAL and try to remove the Pawns from the game before they can reach the PIEDESTAL.

The Pawns win the game if five of them reach the PIEDESTAL, otherwise the Knights win.

SETUP: The twelve Pawns are placed three to a corner on the three lowest level spaces in each corner. The eight Knights are placed next to the PIEDESTAL, on all eight of the second-highest spaces on the board.

MOVE: A Pawn can move to a space on the next higher level directly beside it. Or it can move any number of spaces around the same level, unless blocked by another Pawn or Knight. The Knights can move the same way, with the additional advantage of moving either to a lower or higher level.

CAPTURING: During his turn, if a player is able to capture an opponent's piece, he must do so instead of making an ordinary move. To make a capture, the player moves his piece onto his opponent's space, and removes the opponent's piece from the board. A Pawn is able to capture a knight only if the Knight is one level higher than the Pawn, and directly beside the Pawn. A Knight is able to capture a Pawn only if the two pieces are on the same level, and directly beside one another. A player can never make more than one capture in his turn.

name: Rolomatic Bridge
description: Great way to learn how to bid and play complex Bridge hands. Endorsed by Charles Goren himself. The Rolomatic Bridge machine has a roll of paper inside it with 100 Bridge hands printed on it. You see the initial deal, then a quick turn of the wheel shows what cards the opponents play as well as what is recommended that you play. Great learning tool for the moderately skilled Bridge player.

name: Tri-Umph
description:
This game is distantly related to the Mill game or Nine Men's Morris, in that the object is to make alignments of three pieces: each such alignment created removes one opposing piece (miller's choice). You win when you've reduced the opponent to two pieces or put him in such a bind that he cannot move. If both players become immobilized, a draw occurs.

The 5×6 board is set up by both players by plunking down each of their 12 pieces alternately. Strategy is crucial during this phase. The only restriction is that alignments of three cannot be formed during this phase. Once all pieces are set up, on your turn you move one of your pieces one space horizontally or vertically (diagonals aren't allowed or considered).

Strategies are alluded to but not explained in the short rules. Shan Ruwa ("to drown") consists of setting up so as to force the opponent to place in positions that will aid the starting player and drown the opponent. Conversely, Turi ("to push") prevents the starting player from forming alignments and makes his opening move bad for him.

A mill is called here Doki ("galloping horse"). It is a combination of five pieces such that you form an alignment on each leg of the back-and-forth motion of the fifth piece. The game terms are all taken from Hausa, a West-African language (presumably the first author's maternal tongue).
mechanics: Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement

name: Campaign
description:
This 1966 publication is a fairly simple roll and move contest to collect electoral votes. The center of the board has an outline map of the United States with the Electoral College votes of each state marked. The map divides the states into six color-coded regions.

Players move around the edge of the board on a 64-square track. Most of these are individual states, and landing on one allows a player to take the state if uncommitted or to contest it if held by another player. To contest, he rolls 2D6, and on a 2-6 wins the state, while on 7-12 the challenged party gets to take a state in the same region from a challenger.

There is a deck of Political Fortune cards which are collected on eight of the spaces. These can be positive or negative: losing a state or a turn or even all states in a region; or winning states and becoming a "favorite son" in a state, which confers unchallengeable ownership of that state for the rest of the game.

When a player collects the majority of the states in one of the six regions, he takes over all the electoral college votes for the region and all of those states are locked (can no longer be challenged). First player to 270 Electoral College votes wins.

name: Piratas Paraguaios
description: Paraguay Pirates, it is a "what if" ironclad combat game in the XIX century, during the Triplice Aliança War, between Brasil, Argentina and Paraguay. The game is free for download in PDF format . The game is not available, and your basic engine was improved and changed for the wargame Riachuelo´s Naval Battle.

name: X from Outer Space
description:
This is a basic "roll-and-move" children's game with a twist, as each turn you roll one white and two red dice.

You move your ship forward along the path using the value of the white die. If you land on a space with a number, you then multiply the large blue number on the space by the sum of your red dice. If the result is equal to the little red number in the space, you move forward 5 spaces. If the result is greater than the red number, you move forward 1. If the result is less than the red number, you move back 1. Planet Zoomer and Black Hole cards are drawn at different places on the board and move the player's pawn forward or backward along the track.

The first person to reach the sun (the end of the track) wins.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Math, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Het Groot KLM Spel
description:
Game sponsored by KLM. There are some other similar games for other European Airlines.

Players roll and move their planes along airports. In the first round players hgave to fly charterflights. The players only land on the airports named on the card. When they land on a airport they could buy the airport. If another player lands on a airport which is already bought by a player, he/she has to pay landingrights.
Along the game players can sell or auction their own airports when money is needed.

In the second round players have to fly holiday tours. The players have to land on all the airports they pass. If a 6 is thrown players have to take a surprise ticket and follow the instructions of the card.

If there is no flightcard left the game ends.The player with the most points wins the games. Points are granted for airports and money.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Yaddy-Yadda
description:
From the publisher's website:

The Hustler will call out a word. Everyone else has to slam a letter down on the table that's in that word. You don't have a letter in the word? Grab any letter as quickly as you can. If you're last to play, you might get a penalty. Grab a wrong letter, though, and you suffer a bigger penalty!

Show off your vocabulary, laugh at your friends. Yaddy-Yadda' is a word game in a class all its own. A game takes about 20 minutes and comes with everything you need to play.

Rules to other games that use the cards are available at the website too: www.blacknwhitegames.com

name: Smellory
description:
Smellory is an interesting "snuffel" party for 2-8 players Ages 4 and up

Because of the need to learn quickly, together with the need for a good memory for scents and motifs, Smellory is good to play for both grown-ups and children. It furthers the concentration and during play makes one aware of one of the most fascinating fingerprints of nature: SCENT.

Contents:

16 Motif cards with pictures of different sources of scent, for example fruit or flowers.
16 containers of the scents to match the pictures. The containers are marked on the base with the name of the scent.
4 motif identification tables, with the pictures and names of all the scents.


The winner in Smellory is... really each and every player. Because you will learn once again, that the eye and the nose are equal, and that each in its' own way holds the key to different parts of our environment."
categories: Children's Game, Deduction, Memory, Party Game

name: Epoch Wargame Electronics #1: The Battle In the Japan Sea
description:
1st of 12 games in the Epoch Electronic Wargame Electronics series.

Each of the games features:

Easy to learn rules (in Japanese)
Quick games that average about 30 minutes (not including setup)
Magnetic pieces on a set board
An electronic dice-roller with 6 LED dots to work out the effects of combat.


As long as one player knows the rules, the other player does not need to know any Japanese in order to play the game.

This particular entry in the series centers around a naval battle between Japan and Russia in the Japan Sea during World War 1.

name: Second that Emotion
description:
A simple card game for 2 to 6 players based on the world of Agent 13. The game was published in 13: Assassin magazine #4.

The game is basically a rummy-like game where some of the cards have special powers. Cards are melded to the table either in front of the person who played it or in front of an opponent. Each card has a specific number of points... either positive or negative (range -4 to +4).

The first player to have cards totaling 12 points is the winner.

name: Race for the Crystal
description:
A two-player boardgame based on the Agent 13 comic published in 13:Assassin magazine #3.

One player takes the role of Agent 13, the other is Agent 13's nemesis, China White, and her minions. Players alternate moving (resolving any random encounters) and then resolve any combat.

The first player to capture the power crystal and escape, or eliminate all of his opponent's characters, is the winner.

name: Witches and Wizards
description:
User Review:

Each player begins with a pawn on the Start Space and a hand of four Spell-Caster cards and two Spell-Buster cards. In turn, each player will roll the six-sided die and advance that number of spaces on the game board. A player’s action is dependent on the space on which that player lands.

Players may play Spell-Caster cards against their opponents before rolling the dice. Spell-Buster cards can be played to counter Spell-Caster cards. There are some save spaces on the game board where a player can not be served with a Spell-Caster card.

The first person to reach the end of the track seizes the gold and must race back to the starting space with the gold to win! Along the way back the player may encounter the other players who may steal the gold by catching up and passing the lead player.

name: Star Wars: Death Star
description:
"The Game of Death Star Combat in Star Wars"

Complexity level 3 on Tsukada's 1-6 scale (1=easiest)

Only released in Japan, this Star Wars themed hex-based wargame recreates the Battle of Yavin and attack on the Death Star seen at the end of the first film. It includes smaller scenarios for shorter games, including a recreation of the Millennium Falcon's escape from the Death Star after rescuing Princess Leia.

While the box says 2-8 players, like many of Tsukada's games, over two players means "get on one of the two teams and share the counters"; it's really a 2 player game.

Some game boxes have the Star Wars logo in the upper right front corner covered with an Empire Strikes Back logo. The game recreates the events of the first film, but at the time the game was published in 1982, Empire was the most recent film in theaters.

The rule book and back of the box have a typo in English: "May the forth be with you!"
categories: Aviation / Flight, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Three Dimensional Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Gunbuster: トップをねらえ！ (Gunbuster: Aim for the Top!)
description:
Alternate name: "Gunbuster : Top wo nerae!"

In this game, you play female giant robot pilots defending the human race from aliens. However, the girls are still high-school-age students, and spend as much time teasing and tormenting each other as they do fighting. You can put a tack on the cockpit seat of another girl, write graffiti all over someone else's robot, and spread rumors of them being lesbian, among other things.You encourage your own character, and yes, you do fight the aliens.

Art is by Mika Akitaka, who is the artist behind "Galaxy Fraulien Yuna" and is the mech designer of "Martian Successor Nadesico"
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Good Old Houses
description:
The game consists of eight puzzles of houses representing different architectural styles popular in American history. There is a series of games for different age levels, all designed to familiarize players with these architectural styles.

From the rules:
"GOOD OLD HOUSES is a series of games about American architecture. The objective in all the games is to entertain while building an awareness of some basic architectural styles. The houses in this set are illustrations of general styles rather than portrayals of specific, existing buildings. (Neighborhood houses seldom show all the style traits illustrated here. In some houses only a single feature makes a style recognizable, while in others there is a mixture of style traits.) The range of styles, from Federal to Bungalow, isn't intended to encompass the breadth of American architectural history, but to represent the basic building styles most frequently employed between the late 18th and early 20th centuries when the greatest thrust of settlement and urban development occurred in the United States. After playing the games in GOOD OLD HOUSES, players will be more observant of houses in their own neighborhoods and better able to describe what they see.

"The eight house puzzles (12 pieces per puzzle) are used in four different games for 2 to 8 players. The games are divided into three levels determined by age: under 8, 8 and over, 10 and over."
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Logistic
description:
The idea of the game is based on the organization of a worldwide transfer of goods.

From the editor:
"In Logistics’ the two players are managers of competitive companies. They have to use tactics and control to plan a build up optimum routes of transport for delivering their goods to the destination. Both players may use the routes of transport of the opponent. At the time the player may limit the range of action of the opponent and delay his strategy by skillful moves.
The winner and top manager of the game is the player, who delivered the largest amount of good to the destination"

The game contains English rules.

name: The Archie Game
description: From the Archie comic books. Play as Archie, Jughead, Veronica, Betty or Reggie. A quick check of the dice to determine whether they're both odd or even determines which character Archie attempts to capture. That character must pull his piece away before Archie captures it. A quick thinking then reacting game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Number

name: MiG Killers Expansion Kit
description:
A bare bones set of expansion components plus two new "special" scenarios (Rodan and Firefox). Also includes a new set of aircraft data cards which are slightly larger than the cards in the original game.

"Enclosed you will find 240 die-cut counters that have been mistakenly cut off-register and/or improperly bonded to the cardboard. Cut out the blue aircraft counters in units of 20 and use glue stick to bond them to the cardboard, centering them carefully, over the old markers. Be sure to remove any improperly bonded paper before gluing down the new markers. Then carefully use a razor-knife or Exacto-blade to cut the markers apart so that they may be removed without tearing."

Expands:

MiG Killers
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Three Dimensional Movement

name: Interstate Highway
description:
Object of the game is to travel the newly implemented Interstate Highway system based on a randomly drawn Trip Card (ex. Seattle to Miami) and be the player with the most money at the conclusion of the game.
Along the way, players can be forced to pay fees to other players by stopping at the Motels, Filling Stations, Restaurants and Repair Shops. They can also be fined for speeding along their selected route.
Conclusion of the game occurs when the first player reaches his destination (receiving a $50) Bonus. Monies are totaled and the player with the most money wins.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Tournament: Melee
description:
Tournament Melee simulates the foot combat of the medieval period. Combining the use of graphic sheets with a map sheet, combat between teams of men armed with mace, ax and sword is portrayed.

The players fight three simultaneous battles between pairs of combatants.

name: X-C Cross Country
description:
Object of the game: Be the first to arrive and land at your destination airport."

The game is patterned after real life experiences in flying. Players first earn pilots ratings, then 'take off' and climb to sufficient altitude for their Cross Country flight. Once they start Cross Country they encounter 'in flight' problems, the severity depending on how high a pilots rating they earned before they started. As they proceed, the weather may move into their flight path requiring them to detour or climb above it. As the players approach their destinations they must descend to 'pattern altitude' and shake the right sequence of numbers to land and win the game. Good judgment and correct decisions must be made during the game to arrive first at your destination.

name: The Simpsons: What Would Homer Do
description: A trivia game in which players try to correctly guess what Homer would do in different circumstances (given on the game cards). Player's "buzz in" to answer the questions, and are greeted with Homer's congratulations or jeering, depending upon whether or not the player is correct.
categories: Electronic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Sex Quest
description: Provocative and outrageous adult card game authenticated by Dr. Ruth Westheimer. Players respond to actual situations and questions as fielded by Dr. Ruth on her radio and talk show programs.

name: Foxhole: Grand Tactical Battles in World War II
description:
Foxhole is a grand tactical game of Second World War ground combat. The object of the game is to defeat the opposing forces within the confines and conditions of a given scenario . . .

"Each hex on the map represents an area approximately 100 yards across. Each playing piece represents about 40-60 men (a platoon) or half a dozen vehicles or towed weapons . . . For ease of play, the game scales are approximated. Time is also abstracted, thus turns represent several minutes."

The game is set on the Eastern Front and features 6 scenarios pitting the Germans against the Russians.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Movement Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Trial Lawyer
description:
A game of courtroom strategy. Each player is charged with a crime, arrested and forced to stand trial. OBJECT of the game is to be the first player to win 6 or 12 jurors and thereby be found 'not guilty.' This is done by landing on certain spaces on the board, seizing certain Stop & Frisk cards, and knowing your rights.

Trial Lawyer is subtitled "The Jurisprudence Game". Designer and publisher James Vail originally released the game under the name "Jurisprudence" in 1974. According to an insert in the earlier game, the original release of Jurisprudence was limited to 5000 copies.

name: Mighty Morphin Power Rangers: Battling Dice Game
description: Players play as one of the six Power Rangers trying to defeat Lord Zedd's Evil Space Aliens by rolling dice off the backboard into the tray to knock over the evil space aliens tiles. Players win by collecting matching pairs of Evil Space Aliens.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Fast Golf
description: A family card game for 2 or 4 players. Components include 54 stroke cards, 2 golf ball tokens, gameboard, and instructions.

name: Blue's Clues Big Easy Game
description:
This simple children's game based on the popular TV show "Blue's Clues", consists of a large vinyl mat, spinner, large cardboard characters, and vinyl reusable stickers. Players move around the mat collecting items from each room they come to.

A very simple game for the very young to start on. From this who knows where they'll go next, maybe chess!
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: In 80 Tagen um die Welt
description: This game contains a board with 80 fields on it. 24 fields are special. There are also some counters and a special token. The story of the game is about Jule Vernes Book. The goal is to go as often as possible to the special fields. There it is allowed to read out a card and collect it. The player with the most cards wins. The game ends when all players are at the finish line on the game board. So it is not important to be the first one who is finished. It is important to collect the cards. You move the tokens by cards. Each player as the same set of cards.

name: Mission Terra
description:
The players have to find the robot/computer Microlino, who hides in one of 20 local fields. At the beginning the 20 "Mox-cards" with the fields' names are shuffled, then one is taken and put aside for Microlino. This is his whereabouts. The remaining field tiles are distributed and the players are allowed to look at them before placing them in front of them in a row. They are not to be moved or looked at afterwards. On the game board there are 20 local fields, which resemble the Mox-cards, and four fields with a star. The players must get to know as much information as possible about the Mox panels of the fellow players to find out where Microlino is. One receives information by means of the Mox panels, which each player has, as well as the so-called Rho and Kyra panels. The player can use the Rho panels to extend the points of the dice, Kyra panels bring knowledge questions, which, if they are answered correctly, teleport the figure on any field. The Mox panels let’s the player look at Mox-cards of other players.
The player wins, who knows where Microlino is, is located on that field and gets an 11 or higher or the same two numbers after throwing his dice.

name: King's Men
description:
A gameboard is divided into 105 squares, the 49 center squares printed in grey. These are called the Field Squares. The 28 white squares immediately adjoining the field squares are called Entrance Squares or Corridors, 7 on each side of the board. The 28 outside squares are called Home Squares or Lodges, and are colored alternately to match the colors of the Players' Tokens. There are 28 Tokens, 14 of each color chosen.

The object of each player is to reduce the number of his/her own Tokens to 2. This is done by forming rows of tokens, upon which all but the end tokens may be removed.

name: Overdrafts
description:
An abstract strategy game in which players attempt to cross the board.

Each player has six cones and seven checkers and moves one of each on a turn; checkers move normally (one space diagonally forward) but cannot capture, whereas cones are moved using one of a set of cards. Once a card has been used it cannot be used again until all cards have been used. Cones can capture opposing cones or land on opposing checkers; this does not capture them but prevents them from moving.

The object is to get a checker to the opposite end of the board without a cone being able to immediately move onto it.

The first version of the game, Chafts, used a set of six cards showing Chess moves for the cones. The second version, Overdrafts, used a set of eight cards with arrows giving movement directions.

name: Your Money
description:
From the Rules Booklet -

In this game you will play a fictional role - either as an adult individual or a married couple. You will make investment decisions for your character over an imaginary 25-year period of his or her life or lives. You will be faced with a wide range of investment options - some safe but sure, others risky but potentially very rewarding. Whatever investments you choose will be affected, favorably or unfavorably, by the economic climate - which rarely remains stable for very long. The object of the game is to provide your character with as much financial security as possible. To be successful, you'll need a combination of skill and luck, as you try to anticipate changing economic times while also taking into account your character's special strengths and weaknesses.

name: Hexostrategy: 300 Spartans
description:
300 Spartans is a classic step-by-step strategy game, i.e. players make moves in turn by moving their troops on a map and roll dice to learn the results of their actions.

The game is dedicated to the events of the Greek-Persian wars. One player commands the Persian army and the other leads the Greek militia. The game has 3 levels - financial-political, strategic, and tactical. It means that a player collects money, forms an army, leads them in marches, and commands them in a battle.

This game can be used as a strategy module for the Age of Battles system. In this case you should add some sets to it, the first of which should be the Greek and Persian cavalry. The strategy rules stay the same, but the tactics of the Age of Battles system are used.

name: Picture This
description:
From the back of the box:

Picture This is the new fast paced drawing game for adults that's bound to have everyone laughing. Imagine drawing the word "yodel", or even more crazy, "stock broker!" It doesn't matter how well you can draw, it's how well you can think. (The ability to draw stick figures doesn't hurt either!)

Players form teams of 2 or more people and draw words within the one minute time limit in a race to earn points. There's never a dull moment since all players are actively participating at all times. Plus there's the added element of strategy with the special "challenge card" which gives players a chance to "zing" their opponents with particularly difficult words. When there's just 3 people playing, just pick a permanent "doodler" to draw for the 2 opposing players.

Picture This comes complete with a topics card, game cards containing 2600 words, colorful game board, challenge card, 8 markers, one-minute timer, die, 4 drawing pads and 4 pencils.

name: The Secret World of Alex Mack
description: Object is to be the first player to move all four of your special items from your backpack to your home base.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Charades for Juniors
description: Object is to act out your secret Charade so that your partner can guess it and score points for your team. At the same time, you must keep your opponents from guessing and scoring points for their team.

name: Sudz
description: The object of Sudz is to be the first player to get rid of all your cards while helping to build a soap opera storyline. It is a game of speed in which all players play at the same time, racing to play cards to the center stack.

name: Teed Off
description:
Tee Off, swing, stroke and putt your way through 18 exciting holes. A golf dice game for those who can't get on the course.

The game comes with a set of 5 dice, a golf ball which doubles at the dice holder and shaker, and a set of score cards. Different dice are used for different shots - the red on to tee off, the green one to put, the yellow one from the fairway, the blue die for your approach shot and the white die for a second approach shot. Play is purely mechanical - you roll the die necessary as a result of the previous shot, with no scope for player judgement or skill.

name: Trivia Adventure: Plus
description: 2000 question - Supplementary Question and Answer set for Trivia Adventure Game.

name: Dice Prix
description:
Roll just one race
Whether racing against your own best "time" or racing against other players, feel the thrill as you cross the finish line. Don't spin-out, and be sure you re-fuel at the Pit Stop in time!
Or play for Track Circuit Points, and Race your friends for the cup! Choose the number of races in your Circuit, run Time Trials, then score your Finish Points, Finish Spread, Lap Points and Race Points to win it all!
(License not required)

name: Dance Party
description:
What do you get when you mix dancing, music, crazy stunts, and fun? Dance Party. Turn on the radio or your favorite tape, pick a partner, and try to do dances like the Plunge while back to back with your partner. Sounds crazy? It is.
Do the moves correctly and win charms to add to your Dance Party bracelet. Be the first to fill your bracelet and become a finalist in the Dance Off. The dancer who can keep up with the crazy dance steps and stunts is the winner.

name: Piepmatz
description:
Grandfather tries to defend his fruit from the birds. A children's memory game.

The players trie to find out where the bird is hidden. A gameboard with holes is placed in the middle of the table. Under the board a beeper is placed. In a player's turn, the player puts a stick through the hole to find out if the beeper goes off. The first player who find the beeper wins the game.
publishers: Alga, F.X. Schmid, Milton Bradley, Piatnik, Playtoy Industries, Pressman Toy Corp., Western Publishing Company

name: Mayhem: Warring Nations
description:
From the designer: "Covering the Napoleonic Wars, MAYHEM Warring Nations is man to man combat at it's finest. With over twenty historical enemies every theater in the wars can be covered. Whether you're leading a squad of 95th Rifles in Spain or covering the rear guard with French Voltiguers in Russia, MAYHEM - Warring Nations allows you do do it in a realistic way. Linked by a simple "encounter" system all battles can be fought as a campaign. Playable with any already based figures. Perfect for playing alone or with a group of friends..."

Napoleonic skirmish combat with miniatures.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Ingenuity
description:
Ingenuity is an interesting attempt from an obscure Israeli company at a Mastermind/Black Box type deduction game (where one player sets up a puzzle and the other solves it) with a murder mystery theme.

The setter decides which of the 8 characters was murdered, who killed him or her, and with what weapon. Clues to these elements are attached to the characters (for example, whether the killer was male or female, a family member or servant, etc.) and the pieces placed on the board. The murderer can have a false clue.

The solving player moves a detective figure around the board (which shows the floor plan of a small mansion and garden) encountering characters and looking at their clues. The setter gets turns to move characters to get away (presumably) from the detective. The object is to solve the mystery in as few turns as possible - as in other games of this type it is always played twice, with the roles reversed for the second game.

The pieces really make the game - the characters are large Lucite blocks with simple pictures on the fronts and metal circles on the backs - the clues are on small magnets which attach to the circles. In addition, a piece of red plastic is provided to serve as the pool of blood in which the victim is found.

name: Satellit
description: Space exploration race game, where players work to reach a destination in space and return to Earth first.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Breakfast at daVinci's
description:
Taken from the publisher's website:

Breakfast at daVinci's is a quick game requiring some observation skills, for 2 or more players. Each card of the deck depicts a unique combination of ingredients and special symbols. Players are called to identify, after three cards have been placed face up on the table, how many complete breakfasts can be put together. As you may know, a "complete" breakfast is made up of milk, coffee, sugar and donuts: all you have to do is quickly count all the relevant symbols on the cards but careful! The waiter's hand cancel an ingredient, while the " 2" doubles it... can you still find out how many happy clients you will have? If yes, congratulations!, but in order to score you still have to be the fastest to do so! After 9 rounds the game ends, and whoever has scored the most points is the winner.

This game was available in the free web magazine GiocAreA OnLine (former partner of daVinci Editrice) as a promotional tool.

name: Things That Crawl
description: Players race to complete their animals by trading cards. Their are 15 animals to complete, each with three parts. Ages 4 and up
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Racing

name: Bridgehead
description:
"Bridgehead is a game of military tactics a two teams maneuver to build and control a bridge of men across the board between two base positions."

Simple abstract game with a 5x8 position board and 6 pieces per side.

name: Slap Jak
description:
OBJECT: To win all the cards you need to capture Jak, Earl of Evil, by being the first to slap your hand over his picture.

THE PLAY: Each player in turn puts a card face up in the center of the table. The first player to find Jak, slaps the card and collects all other cards in the center pile.

There are 8 different kinds of cards, each with a picture of a character. These are original Sci/Fi - Fantasy type characters in the same vein as "He-Man and the Masters of the Universe" or "Krull", although the "Corel the Leader of Good" card has a more distinguished "Battlestar Galactica" look.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Fantasy, Real-time, Science Fiction

name: Twisty Turtle
description:
CONTENTS
a 8x8 squares boardgame with 4 starting corners
5 turtle shells
a spinner

OBJECT
To be the first player to move his turtle-shell across the board to the opposite corner.

A player spins the arrow of the spinner. Sections show a choice of two numbers. If s/he wishes to move chooses one of these two numbers.

The board indicates what direction the pieces can move. If the board shows a turtle heading right, that piece can only move right. If the board shows only the shell the player on that square can decide what direction to follow.

The brown shell acts as a blocker.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Roller Coaster
description: Move marbles around the three dimensional game board, but if you land at the top of one of the treacherous chutes, you must let your marble fall down into the hole below. The marble can come out of one of the eight exit possibly putting you ahead (or far behind.) First player to have both marbles cross the finish line wins.

name: DoubleTake
description:
Double the Fun with this Exciting, Unpredictable Gin-like Game!

Your opponent uses a Take card to take your cards. You use a Take card to take them back and "Protect Them". Your opponent uses a DoubleTake card... "Takes" them back again and "Freezes Them" (just when you thought you could trust your friends)! OBJECT: To "Take" your opponent's cards away from them and "Freeze Them" with a DoubleTake card.

name: Nicht geheuer im Gemäuer (Kleiner Geist und Wirbelwind)
description:
If you can catch the ghost, you get a scorecard. The first scorecard you can get is worth 3 points, the last card you get is worth 46 points. After you catch the ghost it moves randomly to another place on the board. The other players can interrupt the turn of another player if they use a whirlwind stick. Then the ghost moves without been caught.

If all Cards are collected the player with the highest score wins. Unused whirlwind sticks are worth 5 points.

In the Box (Tube) :
14 wooden playing pieces in 7 colors.
1 wooden white pawn ( Ghost).
1 Die W6 (for player movement)
1 Die W12 and 1 Die W20 (for random Ghost placement)
21 wooden whirlwind sticks (for interrupting)
20 score cards ( 3,3,3,4,5,7,9,11,13,15,17,19,21,24,27,30,34, 38,42,46).
1 whirlwind card.
Board (imitation leather)
Rules

name: Measuring Monkeys
description: Kids will go ape over this unique measuring board game. Players learn and reinforce standard measurement skills by moving their monkeys up the tree 1/4", 1/2", 3/4 " or 1" as directed by the spinner. The first player to reach the top wins. Two levels of play make learning measurement fun. Tree measures 18". For ages 5 to 7.

name: Don't Miss the Boat
description: An exciting new grade school action game for 2 to 4 players. Each player tries to roll his or her colored marbles down the curved ramp and into the boat. The boat travels at a changing speed for added excitement. This colorful game should add hours of excitement to any home.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Nautical, Real-time

name: La Courte paille
description:
A curious game playable in two variants. In both games, a variety of piratical types are adrift on a raft and gradually some get thrown in the water. At the end of the process, one type is left on the raft and you score for each card you have kept of that type. In the short game, you go through the process once, in the long game, you repeat the process, removing cards from the deck each round.

The cards have nice graphics of the crew, the captain, the cook, the look-out, the cabin-boy, the dancing girl, the parrot and so on, each with values 1-9. Players are dealt a hand and five cards are dealt up in a row, and several cards are dealt face down in a column. The first of these is turned up and each turn the next is shown. At the end of the round, the type with the majority points is the one ejected.

Players play one card from their hand and draw from the row, and so try to manipulate events, especially by using the parrot. Unlike the others, the parrot has special abilities, allowing you to sneak a look at the last 2 cards in the face-down column, add another card to the column or thrown one out.

It took a while to get the hang of the game and it's an odd mix of switching tactics, but the long variant may be too elongated for repeated play.

name: From Coast To Coast
description: The game is for four players. Each player uses a "railway spike" (.4cm diameter x 1.1cm high) of metal with a glass top either in back, blue, white, or orange. During play of the game, these "spikes" (much like map tacks) are placed in the black dots along the railway lines to indicate player progress in the game. Movement in the game is dependent upon chance derived by tossing dice. Dice are placed in a wooden cylindrical dice box. An included bi-lingual instruction booklet explains how the game is played.

name: Salvation
description:
This is essentially a Monopoly clone with a tongue-in-cheek evangelistic theme. It's perhaps best described by the rules introduction:

The game is suitable for all ages and beliefs, and is based on a synthesis of orthodox Christian beliefs and practices over the past two millennia, The board is divided into spaces representing services or works as well as Temptations, Acts of Divine Providence and various Benevolent or Malevolent eventualities administered by the Church. The aim is for each player or soul to gather sufficient Heavenly Credits to be assured of Salvation and to avoid Damnation.

One difference from Monopoly is that a player can win immediately by landing on the Eternal Salvation space with adequate credit or be eliminated by landing on the Eternal Damnation space without enough.

Rather than building houses and hotels on the green properties, one can employ priests, canons, bishops, archbishops and saints on a mission to the satanic intelligentsia. There is a fine for using "cash", "money" or similar terms instead of "heavenly credits".

Production values are reasonable for what is probably a self-published game. The board is only on thin card, but the heavenly credits, mission cards and providence and temptation cards are similar to what one sees in Monopoly. The playing pieces are small metal figurines and there are cardboard discs for clerical staff rather than wooden or plastic houses.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Civil War 2061
description: A Risk-type variant, Civil War 2061 explores a possible future of the United States of America, one where the states have broken into different factions, facing off against one another for total control of the USA. The New South has risen again, and must deal with not only the US governmental troops, but militia from other states. Two to six players decide the leadership of the new United States!
categories: Civil War, Dice, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction

name: Enlighten
description:
Enlighten helps players compare major religions. Players answer questions about Christianity, Judaism, Islam, Hindu, Buddhism and New Religious Movements while circumnavigating the playing area. The winner is "enlightened."

Has the traditional square board through which players move by casting a die, but the board is divided into the six major religions and three historical categories -- prehistoric, Eastern and paganism. As players successfully answer questions, they enter the Enlighten Path, where they have to identify quotes from major religions and philosophical leaders.

Charles Flores, a friend of the designers who was getting a master's degree at the California Institute of Integral Studies in East-West psychology, helped write the questions.

name: The World of Micronauts Game
description:
"Capture Baron Karza-Intruder Into the Micronauts' World"

This is a boardgame based on the classic Micronauts toys. Gameplay is the usual roll-the-die-and-take-a-card fare. Playing pieces are photographs of the toys mounted on cardboard with plastic bases.
