name: Fantastic Mr Fox
description:
Based on the book by Roald Dahl, players take the role of Mr. Fox, racing towards the feast at the end of the track but avoiding the farmers Boggis, Bunce and Bean.

Microbadges:
Fantastic Mr. Fox Fan

name: City Limits
description:
From the box:
The world has never been smaller. Never before have the people and nations of the world been drawn closer together. Modern technology, transportation, communications, economics and politics - all have played a part in the creation of our Global Village.
The four map-related games in this series have been designed to interest students in their world. Students start by learning the geography of a small community, then move on to explore the United States, the Western Hemisphere, and ultimately the world. Along the way, students practice a battery of skills useful for the understanding of any map. In addition, the challenging, action-oriented games will convince students that exploring their world is more than a necessity, it can be a pleasure.

Educational Objectives: Students become familiar with the basics of directionality, distance and scale, geographical detail and problem solving.

The "Exploring Your World" Geography Games set consists of four (4) games created to provide meaningful and interesting experiences for students in the instruction and application of geography and map reading skills. The four games, and the instructional objectives of each are:
City Limits - Directionality, distance and scale, land formation, transportation modes, and problem solving.
States Race - Position and shape of the 48 continental United States, capital cities, time zones, geographical and cultural landmarks.
Hemisphere Hunt - Principles of latitude, longitude, political divisions, national capitals and natural resources as they relate to the Western Hemisphere.
World Wiz - World time zones, latitude and longitude, continents, the International Date Line, the Greenwich Prime Meridian, topographical and meteorological world conditions.

name: Kong
description:
An Italian game in which the players try to build a track with cards.

Every card has a value, the first who catches 600 points wins.
There are action cards and track cards, use the first to hinder adversaries.

name: A Trip With Phoebe Snow
description:
A roll-and-move race game involving a train trip from New York to San Francisco. Pre-dates World War I. The spaces are marked with various symbols representing penalties and bonuses.

Phoebe Snow was an advertising figure for the Lackawanna Railroad running from New York to Buffalo. The rail line advertised cleaner burning coal which helped Miss Snow's white dress stay white.

There was a re-issue done of this game in 2011. It is clearly marked as a reproduction.

name: UFO Signal
description:
The object of the game is to be the first player to fly all four of their UFO's from outer space and land on Planet Earth.

On your turn you cover your eyes with the mask provided while the player on your left picks up the big UFO from its 12 o'clock starting position and circles it clockwise over the board. As long as the UFO is in the air you can hear it "beeping". The UFO must circle the board at least once before landing in a new location. Now you have to guess which number it landed on by guessing where the beeping stopped. If you guess correctly May do three things. You may move your own UFOs up to 5 spaces around the board aiming for earth. The five spaces movement may be distributed over your pieces at your discretion. You may Move the Large UFO to a new location and you can also "ZAP" another player back into outer space.
If your guess is wrong, the other players get a free move of five spaces each.

Pieces can be moved in either direction and landing on another player's piece will block them from moving. The stacks can be many pieces high you you can park multiple UFOs on other players.
Another thing, the Large UFO can be leapfrogged towards the center. So being able to move it can give you an advantage.

name: Slots'n Dots
description:
Slots'n Dots is contains 48 plastic chips (six each of the numbers 1 through 7, portrayed with different numbers of dots, plus three each of single-ring and double-ring chips). It is played on a special plastic board which contains seven recessed areas that allow a chip to be placed face-up and six slots that hold a chip invisibly. The board is arranged with a single recess at the center surrounded by an alternating pattern of recesses and slots.

There are several different ways to play: a basic game, two levels of advanced play, a children's version, and a variety of optional rules. All follow the same basic theme: after the board is set up with chips in some or all of the recesses and slots, players take turns drawing a chip for the center recess and looking for patterns of chips (generally lines or triangles) containing runs of consecutive numbers. When a player spots a pattern on his or her turn, he or she takes one of the non-central chips from the pattern and moves the chip from the center of the board into the vacated spot. If the player cannot find a pattern, the center chip is instead taken off the board as a "dead chip" that can be played later in place of a random draw. Single-ring chips are wild, and double-ring chips allow other chips to be stolen from opponents. The game ends when the chip supply is exhausted and no more dead chips can be played -- at this point, players add up the values of the chips they collected and subtract any dead chips to determine to winner.

In the more advanced variations of the rules, legal patterns and playable areas of the board change so that slots are used more and more, adding a stronger element of memory to the game.

name: Who Am I? Bible Game
description: "Who Am I?" Bible Game is a quiz type game with 44 cards, describing Bible characters, 21 from the Old Testament and 23 from the New Testament. A "reader" announces one clue at a time for each character, and players (individually or as groups) try to guess the Bible character. The first to identify the character is given the card to keep, and the player with the most cards at the end wins the game.

name: Nonentity
description: The players sit around the spinning board. Two knowledge cards and one spin card are given to each player. The arrow is then spun. The letter it points to is the word-start letter. The arrow is spun again and the person it points to must say a letter. This letter must follow on from the word-start letter. Play continues until a word is finished that cannot be extended. If a player is successfully challenged (a ‘finished’ word can still be extended) the player forfeits a knowledge card. The spin card is used when a player can’t think of a way of extending a word or bluffing. When a player loses both their knowledge cards they become a non-entity and are out of the game. However they still play a role. Non-entities must be completely ignored. If a surviving player acknowledges a non-entity they lose a knowledge card. The winner is the last survivor.

name: Hictas
description:
Hictas is a card game with the aim of moving the marker on the board to the 50 goal zone. The 46 numbered cards are numbered 1-10, and there are two each of the Special cards, Skip, Reverse, Draw and Throw (Uno-like actions, with the Throw card forcing the next player to discard a card instead of having a turn). The cards 1 to 5 give the player the option to move the counter forward or backwards; the cards 6 to 10 are advance cards only.

There are three rounds. The winner of each round is the player who reaches the goal by using his last card to move the marker into the goal zone. The losing players pay the winner in chips the value of their remaining cards. The winner is obviously the player who has most chips at the end of three rounds.

The two sides of the board have the Standard and the Risky Wheel game. The Standard game’s goal zone is 50 to 61. The Risky Wheel game offers less leeway as the goal is exactly 50.

The name Hictas comes from the Japanese verbs to subtract and to add.
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Point to Point Movement

name: Quanta Costa?
description:
Quanta Costa? is a game about checkout lines. Players place their items - flowers, coffer, gift baskets, home improvement supplies, seafood, and travel goods - in line, and then work to bring their items to the register to score for them.

Title, as any tourist to Italy knows, means "What's the price?" (but is actually misspelled, the correct form being "Quanto Costa?").

name: Dual
description:
Abstract from the old FX Schmid Series

Try to jump with your 3 pieces on three spaces with same color and the same value before your opponent does. If you are successful you opponent looses that many points (1-5 chips). Everybody starts with 6 chips . Winner is the first with a total of 12.

name: The New Adventures of Gilligan
description: 3D Set up and display game based on the early 70's Gilligan's Island Cartoon series. Players move pawns around board racing to be the first back to the hut.

name: Bamaopoly
description:
The Game Includes:

Tokens:
Alarm Clock, Pencil, Gym Shoe, Bicycle, Graduation Cap

Board Spaces:
Rose Administration Building, Woods Hall, President's Mansion, Malone's Bookstore, Big Al, Abercrombie Hall

Cards:
Recite the Fight Song or Lose One Turn.

Parking in Faculty Parking! Pay $50.

Graduation Fee! Pay $25 for each year of Credit and $100 for each Diploma.

Alabama vs. Auburn. Advance to Bryant-Denny Stadium. ROLL TIDE!

Denny Chimes 2 o'clock. You are late for class! Advance immediately to Woods Hall.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Clemsonopoly
description:
The Game Includes:

Tokens:
Alarm Clock, Pencil, Gym Shoe, Bicycle, Graduation Cap

Board Spaces:
Skies Hall, Death Valley, Tiger Town Tavern, First Friday, Clemson House, Sloan Street.

Cards:
Recite the Fight Song or Lose One Turn.

Parking in Faculty Parking! Pay $50.

Graduation Fee! Pay $25 for each Year of Credit and $100 for each Diploma.

Calhoun College! Collect a $200 scholarship!

All Campus Party! All tokens advance to the Quad.

Clemson vs. Carolina. Advance to Death Valley. GO TIGERS!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Dukeopoly
description:
The Game Includes:

Tokens:
Alarm Clock, Pencil, Gym Shoe, Bicycle, Graduation Cap

Board Spaces:
Duke Chapel, Perkin's Library, Cameron Stadium, Law School, The Circle, Bog, North Campus.

Cards:
Lose one turn Benching.

The token of your choice is "ponded" and loses one turn in the center of the board to dry out.

Duke vs. UNC. Advance to Cameron Indoor Stadium. GO BLUE DEVILS!

Recite the Fight Song or Lose One Turn.

Parking in Faculty Parking! Pay $50.

Graduation Fee! Pay $25 for each Year of Credit and $100 for each Diploma.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Bambi
description:
Players turn over number cards, highest gets to steal letter from another player. Try to collect letters that spell Bambi.

Cards are divided into numbers and letters. There's four cards for each letter in Bambi's name. All letter cards feature a picture of Bambi. There are four copies of each number card.


1 features Flower
2 features Chipmunk
3 features Squirrel
4 features Thumper
5 features Birds
6 features Owl
7 features Bambi's Mother.


Players select cards to spell Bambi. Number cards are dealt out face down equally to all players. Each player then turns over the top number card. The player with the highest number steals a card from another player. The round is over when all number cards have been turned over. Players are out when they have no letter cards left. Players score an increasing number of points for each Bambi they can spell with their letter cards. Play continues until someone reaches 100 points.

All illustrations are copyrighted W.D.P. [Walt Disney Pictures]

This is Volume 4 of a 6 Volume Disney Set of Card Games.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Premium: The Insurance Game
description: In Premium, a single pawn is moved around the board. When it lands on an unowned property, the moving player may purchase it and may also insure it for 50% or 100% of its value. After the first circuit of the board, players draw cards on every turn which may cause damage to the property landed on or specific named properties - the owners get paid if they have insurance policies but lose the properties without compensation if they do not. At the start of each circuit players collect income from every other player for each property they own. The object is to be the last player with money.

name: Wild Kids
description:
Children´s game (Ages 8 and up) with title taken from a Swedish TV show. The show was a bit like "Robinson" ("Survivor" in the U.S.) but more friendly and starring 11- and 12 year-olds. In the game, players move around the board and take part in five competitions. These include solving riddles, answering questions about wild animals, and forming patterns with wooden sticks. The first player to complete three competitions is the winner.

Contents:
Gameboard
4 pawns
1 ordinary die, 1 color die
240 cards with 5 card boxes
1 hourglass
4 wooden sticks
rules
categories: Adventure, Animals, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Quest
description:
The exciting game of Biblical knowledge. The game is similar to Trivial Pursuit in which you roll the dice and move your piece around the board acquiring "pieces" of the Armour of God. Once you have answered the Biblical questions correctly and acquired the six pieces of the Armor of God, you can move towards the center of the board to win the game by landing on the Circle of Victory and correctly answering a question.

The questions are divided into 5 categories: "Quotations", "Unbelievers & Believers", "Events", "Saviour", and "Towns, Places & Objects".

Before you can obtain a piece of the Armor of God, you have to obtain 2 Character Points. You get one Character Point for each correctly answered question. Each player must gain two character points before he may attempt to obtain additional pieces of the Armor of God.

name: Sound Off
description:
Two teams attempt to reach the end of the board by acting out. When a team lands on a space, the actor on that team (it changes every turn) must act out what's on the card in 30 seconds or less. The catch is, they *must* use sound - the rules include a provision where if the other team catches them not using sound, they lose credit for a right answer. Only sound effects - no speaking - are allowed however.

The board spaces are as follows: Action Reaction, which is a long form charade such as "passing gas and blaming it on the dog." Famous Expressions is usually a cliche or popular phrase. People, Places & Things is self explanatory.

The fourth category is "Hot Spot." Five items are on this card, and the team gets 60 seconds. If the actor can convey three out of the five, they get credit and continue to roll and move. Getting all five earns a "Safe & Sound" card. This can also be earned via its own space on the board. Safe & Sound allows an actor to pass a charade - but only once on a given turn, regardless of the amount of S&S cards they have.

Some spaces are designated all play by an arrow. The finish space of the game is an All-Play Hot Spot. Whichever team gets the majority of the five items in 60 seconds gets credit - and if you're on the team on the final Hot Spot space, that means you're the winner.

name: Borderline
description:
An abstract strategy game where the object is to reach the other side of the board (or take all your opponents pieces).

The game takes place on a 6x9 grid and each player has 12 pieces. Each piece is quartered and each quarter numbered from 1 to 4. This indicates the number of spaces that piece must move in that direction. Opponents pieces are taken by moving over them (jumping) or by landing on them.

name: Secret Weapon
description:
An action packed family boardgame, fast playing with lots of give and take. The secret plans keep moving and players must remember what parts are in the vault!

Each player is a spy attempting to steal the blueprints for a SECRET WEAPON from the inventors laboratory. The first agent to decode the blueprints on the decoder card is the winner.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: Chieftain Products, Parker Brothers, Selchow & Righter

name: Rustlers
description:
A strategy game where one person takes the roll of the Cowboys (along with their cows) and the other takes the roll of the Rustlers (along with their horses).

The players take turns rolling the die and moving a piece, within the grid on the board, attempting to steal your opponents livestock or attempting to throw your opponents cowboys/rustlers in prison.

The first player to capture their opponents 11 cows/horses or 3 cowboys/rustlers wins.

name: All-Star Face-Off
description:
"Face-Off was designed to provide fine family entertainment for children and adults in conjunction with promoting their awareness of hockey. This game offers sociable, stimulating, exciting, competitive action." -From Instruction

Players roll the dice and move around the board attempting to land on the Goal spaces while trying to stay out of the Penalty Box.

The first player to score 5 goals is declared the winner.

name: Antonine!: The Battle for Caledonia
description:
Antonine! The Battle for Caledonia is a game where the Picts and the Romans go Head to Head fighting to either gain control 4 of the Antonine Wall Forts or to capture 4 of the opponents pieces.

The game is played on a 13 by 13 board which represents the area around the Antonine Wall between the Fort at New Kilpatrick and the Fort at Kinneil.

The game play is via die roll. Players roll 1d6 and 1d4. The result is the number of squares you may move in two different directions but not diagonally. If you land exactly on an opponents piece it is captured and is taken to one of your own camps where it stays unless released by an opponents counter landing on the camp it is trapped in.

You can capture a fort in the same manner. If it is occupied by an opponents piece that too would be captured.

A fun little game which can be challenging and frustrating as you must use your exact die rolls and you must move! Can get tricky in the latter stages of the game! A good move and capture game.

Components:

Board
6 Roman Soldiers
6 Pict Warriors
1 D4
1 D6
Rules

name: Cowboys and Indians
description:
An entry in the 2001 About.com 8x8 Game Design Competition.

This game is designed to utilize those plastic cowboy and Indians lying around your house and put them to use in an entry-level wargame.

Goal: Capture your opponent's Fort or Village.

name: Elementari
description: An abstract game that many can play with pleasure, because the rules are really elementary! Limited release at Essen in 1998. Players place colored chips to form specific score-generating patterns.

name: Triangulate
description:
An entry in the 2001 About.com 8x8 Game Design Competition.

Triangulate is an abstract strategy board game that can be played with 'found objects.' In other words, it's a game, not unlike checkers or chess, but one that can be played with game pieces or other objects that you probably already have at home.

The first player decides which of their small pieces they would like to move first. In order to actually make the move, the player first takes one of their LARGE tokens and places it onto the square to which they intend to move a SMALL token. (The proposed square must be directly adjacent to the original square, touching on any side or corner) They then move their small token from its current position to the new square; placing it on top of the newly placed larger token. Then the next player takes his turn, etc. A player may move one of their small tokens onto a square already occupied by one of their own or one of their opponent's small token. In this case, the player does NOT place one of their large tokens in advance of the move, but simply places their small token on top of the other small token already in place. If this move is onto an opposing piece, that piece is not captured, but effectively blocked. Until the player on top moves their small token, the piece below may not move.

Play continues in this manner until one of the two players is able to Triangulate three of their own small pieces on a single square on the board.

name: Go to Texas
description:
from front of instructions -

"Wheel & deal in oil, cattle & cotton"

Objective of the Game...

is to own property and to become the richest player in the game. The winner is the last player left in the game after all other players have gone bankrupt. To acquire wealth you buy property and drill for oil, raise cattle, or plant cotton; then you charge other players for your products when they land on your property. You may also acquire wealth by owning railroads, riverboats, stage lines, or hotels and charging players fares.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Abounding River
description:
The ABOUNDING RIVER GAME is an exploration board game that introduces people to an unfamiliar view of BEING ABUNDANCE. It encompasses both training people in a day to day practice as well as discovering a Spiritual foundation that opens up to a whole new way of looking at money and resources.

People experience themselves being at the source of unlimited supply.

name: Doubles Checkers
description:
From the publishers:

A game designed for two teams of two. The DOUBLES CHECKERS board is an octagon, gridded with eight parallelograms per side. The size and shape of the parallelograms adjust throughout the octagon to allow total coverage of the area.

The board contains 64 shaded parallelograms. Teammates sit across from each other, with opponents to the left and right. Diagonal movement, jumping, and kinging rules of traditional checkers apply in this game. However, the octagonal shape of the board causes the crowning rows to exist to ones left and right.

Players win by capturing or blocking from movement all opponents' pieces.
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Point to Point Movement
publishers: DCP, Limited, Make Your Move, Inc.

name: Alfa-Kubes
description:
Alfa-Kubes comprises six dice with letters on each face; each letter has a value - as in 'scrabble'. The aim is to create the highest value word over 3 throws, keeping the dice you want and re-throwing the rest - as in Yahtzee or poker dice.

Simple, but infectious.

(Dating note: The box and rules are not dated. However, the place of manufacture is Harborne, England, where Chad Valley shifted production in 1920. Their Royal Charter mark, granted in 1936, is not printed on the box, so this edition of Alfa-Kubes must have been created between these dates. Hence this submission of 'c.1928')

Alfa-Kubes is a word dice game.

name: Dragon Run
description:
Dragon Run is a game of desperate combat and flying maneuver. One player takes the part of the Dragon summoned by Lord Ethamon, the dragon priest. He must reach Dragon's Tower and devour the fair maiden. The other player commands the troops loyal to King Corvallis, daring soldiers who ride upon the backs of swift, flying steeds. This player must slay the Dragon before Princess Tanis is consumed.

The heart of the game is maneuver. Each turn the Dragon secretly selects a maneuver, then watches as the wind riders choose theirs. The player who wins is often the one who can most often out-guess his or her opponent.

Published in the first issue of Pandora magazine (Volume 1, Number 1).

name: Ponytrail
description:
Inside a wooden box there are 28 Horses, pieces of horse dung, question cards, a sand timer, a big board and a lot more, mostly made of wood.

Each player has to gain a small herd of Ponies and make more money out of them. Thematically at the horse farm you undergo the ups and downs of a farmer and breeder of ponies.

Different levels make it possible to play it with kids or play it more strategically.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Tiny Tins Charades
description: This is one of the games in the Tiny Tins series by Patch Products. It is a child oriented game based on the classic charades with the categories limited to Books, Songs, Movies, TV Shows, and Quotes. Included in the rules are some nice instructions on how to signal your ideas to your teammates. The game is played in two minutes increments by alternating teams until one team reaches 15 points.

name: Treasure Hunt
description:
Swashbuckling adventure game with 4 magnetic sailing ships, colorful metal board & spinner.

Exciting magnetic game, wonderful for travel, sick bed, and regular play.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Inve$tor
description: A game of stock market investing, Inve$tor allows two to six players to vie for the coveted Investor of the Year Prize awarded at the end of the game. Players choose a year in which the investing is taking place (1991 to 1995) and then begin their investment careers. For each year, there are market index and news events that affect the stock market. The person at the end of the game with the most assets wins.

name: Z-Cars
description:
Board game based on one of the first T.V. Police series in black and white. Check out the Ford Zephyr on the lid!!

Description:

The Object of the Game is to Move Your Piece From the Corner Starting Square to the Police H.Q. in the Centre of the Board.

Movement is by the Throw of a Die.

You Must Follow the Instructions Printed on the Square That You Land On.

There Are Road Junctions, One-way Streets, and a Roundabout.

You Must Try to Avoid the Hazard Squares.

Passing, Overtaking, and Crashing Are All in the Game!!

Contents:

1 Game Board
1 Die
4 Cars

Rules Are Printed on the Inner Box.

name: Checkers4
description:
"More players and more FUN!"

Checkers4 uses a larger board and four sets of pieces to accommodate 2 to 4 players.

The X4 board is similar to a standard checkerboard, but with an additional 3 rows, 8 ranks wide, at the top and bottom of the board, and 3 ranks, 8 rows wide, at the sides. This gives the board the appearance of a Greek cross. The other side of the board is printed with a standard checkerboard so it can be used for traditional checkers.

There are 4 sets of pieces: red, black, ivory and gold. Red and black are usually placed opposite each other, as are ivory and gold.

Play is similar to traditional checkers, and has two possible methods of kinging (to be chosen by the players in advance). The first is the traditional method, in which a piece has to cross to the final row on the opposite side of the board. The second requires a piece to merely reach any edge, left, right or opposite.

The game can be played with 2, 3 or 4 players. 2 players can play using two sets of pieces, either side-by-side or on opposite ends.

name: TriQuest!
description:
A game based on horse racing. There are six horses. Each horse is rated for its relative speed on each quarter of the track.

A hand held electronic gizmo selects the post position and regulates movement of each of the horses. It also determines the leading horse should two or more of them finish the race during the same turn.

Each player selects a horse for the duration of the game at random. The players also get two Crop Cards that may allow an extra movement for a player's horse when a card is spent. A Hold Back card is also given to be used in close race. The card is exchanged for a Crop Card and deducts two spaces from the horse's movement.

A player receives money for having one's horse finish in the top three and betting correctly. The player with the most money after three races is the winner.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Kellogg's Sports Car Rally Game
description:
From the rules page:

"If you don't know locations of U.S. cities, this game will teach you. If you do know locations of U.S. cities, this game will be a challenge to your knowledge."

This is a one-page insert that came with a Kellogg's product (Pop-Tarts, I believe) and, despite the name of the publisher, is not a computer game. Play results are determined by drawing cards from a standard deck of cards, instead of using dice.

This is just one in a series of about 6 sports games distributed this way.

name: VeggieTales Puzzler
description:
From the Publisher:

"It's exciting! It's Baffling! It's VeggieTales Puzzler, the most amazing game you've ever played! Find 4 cards on the playing grid that form a picture. Shout "PUZZLE" then take the cards off the grid and flip the timer over. Correctly arrange the cards to form a picture before time runs out... it's that simple!"
categories: Card Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Puzzle

name: Great Art Close up: National Gallery of Art
description:
Great Art Close Up...

Discover art of the great museums of the world as you play 5 fun card games, including "Memory," "Old Maid," and 2 new matching games for children of different ages. Turn your next visit to the art museum into a treasure hunt with each Close Up deck.

National Gallery of Art Closeup Deck...

Play matching games with this deck of 48 cards featuring masterpieces from the National Gallery. Ages 5 to adult.

name: High Ground
description:
High Ground is a hex-based expansion for Risk that takes place on a particular battlefield of the American Civil War. At the beginning of the game, each player gets to place 3 cities and 3 hills on the board secretly. The cities are not only the recruitment centers where new troops enter the board, but they also are the means of generating troops. The more cities you own, the more troops you receive each turn. The hills provide defensive bonuses and range increases for artillery. Four hills come preprinted in the rear of the battle field.
This game includes a 17" x 22" hex map, 6 City hexes, 6 Hill hexes, 8 Flag hexes, and a set of rules. Playing pieces are not included - the newer pieces from Risk (infantry, cavalry, and cannons) are required for play.

name: Psychic Power II
description:
The first New-Age PSI Game: Extra sensory development games

This very unusual game include six separate games designed to increase your personal psychic powers and develop the "sixth" sense everyone can possess. Each game can be played alone or in teams of up to 8 players.

The six games are:
- Radiesthesia
- Magnetism
- Precognition
- Clairvoyance
- Psychokinesis
- Telepathy

The package include:
- 1 folded board
- 2 decks of cards
- 2 wooden pendulums
- 2 wooden "symbol" dice
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Team-Based Game

name: All'Appalto!
description: The object of the game is to complete contracts for public works. You must discard corrupt, jail and tangent cards that you are dealt at the beginning of the game. The first player who complete his objectives wins.

name: 20 Squares
description:
Aseb, 'The Twenty Squares game' (frequently misidentified as Tjau, ‘The Game of Thieves’ or ‘The Game
of Robbers’) was played from 3000 B.C. until 400 A.D. and is one of the oldest known games. It is similar in play and design as Senet.

The object is to be the first player to bear off all 5 of his pieces, by landing them precisely on the last square.
Once successfully borne off, a piece plays no further part in the game.

PLAYER TURNS
The players throw once each alternately, and move a single piece by the appropriate number of positions. A
move must be made, and made in full. If no move is possible, then the turn is forfeit (passes to the other
player). When forfeiting a throw, the opponent has the option of adding the forfeited throw to his own.

HOW TO MOVE THE PIECES
Each player enters the pieces onto the board from his reserve and moves them as follows:
Pieces move forward only. As pieces reach the last square (by exact throw), they bear off; be the first to
bear off all your pieces and you win! The marked squares give you an extra turn; when you land on them, you
get to throw the sticks and go again. Only one piece may occupy any given square; if you land on an opposing
piece, it is removed —sent back to the player’s reserve.
To bring your first piece on, you must first throw a 4 or a 6; when that happens, you throw again and move
the piece in by that amount. The remaining pieces can be brought in on any throw. Waiting for that initial
throw of 4 or 6, particularly while the opponent is already moving, can be quite frustrating, so it is an acceptable
variant to forego that rule entirely.

name: Terra: Aventura Pelos Caminhos do Brasil
description: More than a game about radical sports, its a sightseeing trip through the marvels of Brazil. Strategy and luck are needed to conquer your objective which is to pass trough 15 tourist points using your abilities in sports.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Sifferleken
description: You're given a number and from the different number tiles you have you'll have to use exactly three and operate mathematically with them to acquire the given number.

name: Plan Barbarossa
description:
(translation from back of the box:)

PLAN BARABAROSSA is a wargame for 2 players which recreates, during game plays which can last 2 hours and more, the invasion of USSR by Wehrmacht [German] forces in 1941. For confirmed beginners, it is an excellent introduction to World war Two strategical wargames.


(extract from rule book:)

Each turn represents one month or two (winter turns only); total of 8 turns (July 1941 to April 1942).

name: Go For Launch!
description:
From the publisher's website...

It doesn't take a rocket scientist to play Go for Launch!, but if your not careful you could become one!
The Go For Launch! board game shows you how to prepare a Space Shuttle for launch as you journey through: Deep Space, Early Rocketry, Mercury, Gemini, Apollo, Apollo-Soyuz, Sky-Lab, Astronomy, Planetary Exploration, Space Shuttle, Mir Space Station, Space Spin-Offs and more!

This game is fun for the whole family and great for classrooms. The Go For Launch! board game depicts Complex 39 of the Kennedy Space Center as it exists today. It is designed for one to four players or teams of players.

The players can be assigned as Shuttle Commanders, Pilots and Mission Specialists. Each player obtains their mission instructions from the Commander/Pilot check list. The board game consists of nearly 500 full color photo question and answer cards (T or F and Multiple Choice), four plastic Shuttle game pieces, a pair of dice, instructions and category divider cards.

The game takes the players from the landing strip through Space Shuttle Processing, Launch, Low Earth Orbit and back to Kennedy Space Center. The first Commander to successfully return to the primary landing site wins!

name: Campaign Trail '96
description:
Can you win the 1996 Election?

Gaffs, Media, Scandals, Spin Doctors, Jingles, Negative Ads, Road Trips, Millionaires, divisive Issues. A politically incorrect, short-lived game.

name: Driver-Ed
description:
Driver-Ed gives each player a chance to drive! The game exposes drivers to the hazards of the road. Violation cards penalize the driver for violating the law and are based on the point system. Safety check cards reward or penalize the driver for his driving attitudes and his car maintenance

Includes gameboard, 27 violation cards, 27 safety check cards, 4 cars, 2 6-sided dice, and instructions printed on the inside of the box top

name: Geoclues
description:
You're on a deserted island. But don't worry, you're not stranded - you're with friends and family and you're having fun. You're playing a game where players hide "caches" (treasure chests) for each other to find. The caches contain coins and clues, and you'll use your navigational skills to tour the island and find them. The first person to collect a coin from each player and follow the clues to the "mystery cache" wins the game.

Home Page : http://www.scholartainment.com/pgc.html
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Simulation

name: Professor Noggin's Civil War
description:
From the Publisher's website:
Keeping in mind that in order to know which way we are headed, we need to know where we've been, this game has trivia on the battles, soldiers, and different aspects of the American Civil War.

Professor Noggin's series of educational games encourages kids to learn interesting facts about their favorite subjects. Each of the thirty game cards combines trivia, true or false, and multiple choice questions.
A special three-numbered die is included which creates interaction and promotes communications between players. Easy and hard levels keep kids interested and challenged - while of having fun!

Card topics include:
Famous Military Leaders
The Civil War Starts
Confederate States of
America
Before the Civil War
Raising Armies
Uncle Tom's Cabin
African Americans during the War
Jefferson Davis
Fun and Games
Ford Theater
The Hardships of War
Battle for the Sea
Battle of Gettysburg
Life as a Union Soldier
Abraham Lincoln
Battle of Manassas
Rebuilding After the War
Nursing the Wounded
Siege of Vicksburg
Life_as_a_Confederate Soldier
Famous Battles
Famous Women
The Underground Railroad
Food and Agriculture
The Civil War Ends
Technology
Heroes of the Civil War
Ulysses S. Grant and Robert E. Lee
Freedom
Ships and Boats
categories: American Civil War, Card Game, Civil War, Educational, Trivia

name: Warzone: A Modern Day Chess Game
description: The game is played on a 20x20 grid superimposed on a map. The map’s terrain consists of various lakes, flatlands, caverns and mountains. Each player controls an army that consists of a variety of modern units depending on the scenario. Players set up their units any way they choose in their designed corner of the gameboard. A player may take four actions each turn but no piece may take more than two actions during a turn. Move, fire, rapid transit (move a piece in one’s own corner without using the dice), place a jet or pass are the possible actions. Units within range of each other undertake combat by rolling the appropriate six-sided or eight-sided die. The victory conditions are dependent upon the scenario.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Swordplay: Arena
description:
For those about to die... we salute you.

It's no longer important how you came to be here, only that you survive to fight another day. Heroes enter the arena in a fight to the death armed only with what they find there. Will you reign victorious this day?

Swordplay is an easy, fast paced card game of Arena Combat with Medieval weapons. Quick to learn yet challenging to master its subtle strategies. Go for the quick kill unarmed, or better prepare yourself for battle choosing from a wide variety of weapons, armor, and deadly combat moves to defeat your opponents.

name: Miss Spider's Tea Party Card Game
description:
Each player starts with 7 cards in their hands and is trying to get all of Miss Spider's friends in a set in front of them. To do this, they ask a person for the card they need, and either take the card from that person, or gets a card from the draw or discard piles. The first person to get all the friends (no duplicates) is the winner.

A simple card game, listed on the box as for ages 4 and up.

name: Ice Age 2: Mammal Crossing
description:
From the publisher:
Kids will love the challenges of the Ice Age 2 Mammal Crossing Board Game. They'll embark on adventures with their favorite characters - trying to dodge rocks, serpents and geysers to get to safety! Be the first to reach the other side of the valley to win. Comes with four sculpted and painted character movers.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Inspiration
description:
Inspiration is one of Wolfgang Kramer’s not so well-known games, which he designed together with his wife Ursula. It is a party game in the vein of Taboo or Activity, although the players do not paraphrase terms or play charades. Rather, the players try to solve picture puzzles faster than their opponents. In each round, one of the players acts as the moderator and chooses two picture cards, that together represent a two part noun (e.g. ball game (cards 73 and 20) or treasure chamber (cards 54 and 104)). The player may choose between asking an easy, medium or difficult question. Then the other players try to solve the puzzle, while a sand timer runs down. Depending on the difficulty, the player who calls out the correct answer first, may advance 2, 3, or 4 spaces on the track. The first player to reach the goal is the winner.
Inspiration features a clever card index box, to keep the picture cards organized and two bookmarks to quickly find where to put back the previously selected cards.

name: Moxie
description:
According to the given rules, the pieces, eight on each army, start in reserve off the board. A move consists of either: 1) placing a piece from your reserve on any vacant square; 2) moving a piece to any adjacent square, orthogonally or diagonally (as a chess king), or 3) capturing an enemy piece by jumping it, like an 8-directional checker. Multiple jumps are allowed. When a jump is possible, jumping is compulsory, though the player may choose any jumping move available and need not capture the greatest possible number of pieces.

The object is either to form a line of three of your pieces, orthogonally or diagonally with no intervening spaces, or to capture six enemy pieces (i.e. reduce your enemy’s forces to two so that he cannot win).

name: Quick Pix Multiplication
description:
From the publisher

Each game features a set of problem and answer cards. Players need to be the first to match the correct answer card to the problem card that is turned over. To win, you must think quickly, match faster and capture as many card pairs as possible.

Quick Pix Multiplication -- Commonly used multiplication facts

name: Quick Pix Money
description:
From the publisher

Each game features a set of problem and answer cards. Players need to be the first to match the correct answer card to the problem card that is turned over. To win, you must think quickly, match faster and capture as many card pairs as possible.

Quick Pix Money -- Recognizing and adding different coin values

name: Hexago
description:
Hexago from Hexagames is played on a purple hex gameboard with about 300 hex spaces.

It's kind of Go-Moku, but you must get 6 stones in a row here. The colors of the pieces are green, orange and purple, which it not the best choice, since the purple stones on the purple board are much harder to see than the others.

name: Golden Trivia
description:
The game consists of 999 Question & Answer cards with 5 questions on each card. Upon each card are 5 dice symbols (1 dot through 5 dots.)

A roll of the die determines which question will be asked (by the player to the right of the answerer). If the answerer fails to answer the question, the question is passed to the player to the left and so on but excluding the questioner.

On a roll of 6, the player misses their turn. On a correct answer, the answerer earns points and the turn is over.

Players play to an agreed upon score.

The game also features a gang-up on the leader mechanic, potentially prolonging the torture for everyone. :)

name: The Monkees Game
description:
"The Monkees Game", also known as "Hey Hey The Monkees Game", was a licensed game from Transogram (makers of many other 1960s licensed games) based on the popular NBC musical comedy series.

Players used pawns based on one of the four Monkees - Peter Tork, Davy Jones, Mike Nesmith, or Mickey Dolenz. The board is designed to look like sheet music. The element of chance is added by a spinner. One unusual feature in some editions is a colorful six-note xylophone, with which players can make the Monkees theme tune, for which sheet music is included. Another edition includes a "four string" (two rubber band) plastic guitar along with the sheet music insert.

The box art is an illustration of the Monkees riding in a red GTO hot-rod convertible.

name: Casino
description:
2-6 players start with 18.500 gaming money and when the first player goes bankrupt, the game ends and the player with the most money wins the game.

Included in this game is 1 color-die and 6 dice in the colors shown on the color-die. There is also a paying board, which shows numbers from 4-20 and the corresponding payout amount.

Each turn consists of several dice throws, done by the "active" player. The inactive players can place fix bets (of 100) before each dice throw and all winning amounts are to be paid by the active player!

The dice throws are done by using the following procedure: the dice with the color showing on the color-die is placed on the paying board and it's number is added to the numbers of the dice already there.

Before the active player goes on throwing the remaining dice, the other players can retire and let them give the won amount from the active player. Fortunately, the active has also a winning option: when the color-die shows a color of a die already on the paying board, his turn end immediately and he collects all bets from the other players.

name: Hawaiian Scene
description:
"You are about to experience the Hawaiian Scene -- living and working in a Pacific paradise while purchasing and developing your favorite Island properties. A weekend in Maui, snorkeling at Hanauma Bay, and the excitement of Waikiki -- all part of the Hawaiian Scene. Before you play be prepared to deal with the "Big Five," make peace with labor leaders, influence the Mayor and hire a Kahuna to ensure your success. Get ready to move fast, play hard, and take risks -- for you're in Hawaii and rolling for high stakes!"
Basically this is a travel variant of Monopoly, with some added mechanics in the form of collecting labor leaders and Kahunas to increase your capital and leverage. The properties are all Hawaiian businesses circa 1978.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Robinson
description:
The center of the huge board shows a scene from Robinson Crusoe, on the outer part of the board are 4 images in 4 different colors. Each player plays with the 4 images of his color, that is he collects multi-colored tiles, which match the drawings on the images.

Tiles are won through the throw of 2-4 dice, depending on the number of "finished" images.

Winner is the player who completes the 4 images first.

name: Word Rally!
description:
Word Rally: The Fast-Paced Word Search Game! This travel game, published in 1999, is composed of a large plastic d6 that contains 9 six-sided lettered die. Players roll the large die, count words a la Boggle*, and score them by the multiplier on the outer cube.

*All the words you find on your turn score for you. For the other players, only the words they find that you didn't score for them. There is no adjacency, like in Boggle. All shown letters are available in any order. So not quite "a la Boggle".
publishers: Endless Horizons Entertainment, Inc., JA-RU Inc., Toysmith

name: Piraten-Schatz
description:
(Treasure of the Pirates)

The players are sport divers or deep sea divers who try to retrieve as many treasure from a sunken ship as possible by picking up small plastic parts with tweezers, not disturbing the octopus. This does not only sound like Operation - it actually has the same board layout but with other plastic parts (the heart for example is a golden crown here - the rubber band is referred to as a necklace, which strangely has to be put back(!) into its compartment) and of course another illustration (the patient's nose of Operation is one of the eyes of the octopus here).

Not to be confused with the MB game "Sunken Treasure" of 1976, where the players had to pull metal coins from a similar board.

name: Famos Spiel: Das Geheimnisvolle Dreieck
description:
From the instruction booklet:
"The Tricky triangle: This is just the thing for those who don't give in easily! This is a game for 1-2 players, either as a team or in competition. In all there are 25 geometrical figures which have to be assembled, and in each case the same basic forms are used. This is a real intelligence test, a must when parties grow dull. A fascinating game for adults: Intelligence in colored pieces.

name: The Reader's Digest Word Game
description: A Word game based on the Reader's Digest monthly feature "It Pays to Increase Your Word Power". Players attempt to choose the correct definitions for a list of words, and guess as to the correctness of the other player's answers.

name: Cool Cash Bingo
description:
The Cool Cash Cat makes learning money skills fun for kids with this bingo game. Children create their own bingo cards, playing at appropriate levels of challenge while learning to add coin values and make change. Set contains four bingo cards, reversible spinner, 94 plastic coins and instructions. For 2-4 players.

For ages 7 and over.

name: Tip Top Tally
description:
Embark on a mathematical adventure by adding and subtracting dice numbers. Race your penguin to the top of the mountain. Oops! Watch out for Slippery Slide and Icy Icicle. Land on a Tip Top Tally card and win a free turn or take a shortcut across Creaky Crevasse. Be the first penguin to reach the tip top and you win.
Children love crating new ways to play by using the even/odd marker!
Skills:
Addition and Subtraction
Number Recognition
Counting
One to One Correspondence
Even/Odd
Multi-Level Play Variations
Supports NCTM Standards
Connects Math To Literacy
Encourages Social Skills

Contents:
Game Board
2 Number Dice & 1 Operation Die
1 Thermometer Number Line
4 Penguin Game Pieces
20 Tip Top Tally Cards
6 Even/Odd Markers
12 Snowball Counters
Penguin Fun Facts

name: Mind Reader
description:
From the box cover: "An exciting game of skill that challenges your power to read minds. Match wits with your opponent and be the first to decode the 'secret word' or color. Can be played in any language between two players. Age group 7 years and above."

This game plays like Mastermind, but in addition to colors, words can also be used.
publishers: Galvin Productions, SPM: Syarikat Permainan Malaysia

name: Candyman: Farewell to the Flesh
description:
From the rules:

"As you travel the streets of New Orleans looking for pieces of the puzzle to solve the Candyman Murder mysteries you have to make sure you do not become a victim yourself. To win, player must proceed clockwise along the streets of New Orleans and get to the Mansion with the key card in order to unlock the secret to Candyman's power."

1 playing board, 1 die, 10 Hook Cards, 19 Candyman Cards, 1 Mansion Key Card, 30 Voodoo Cards, and 5 player tokens.

"Inspired by the imagination of the Gramercy Pictures Marketing Team and Designed by Jacobson & Atkins Advertising, Inc. For Promotional & Publicity use only."

name: Spellway
description:
This game combines card and board play. At its heart, it's a letter-by-letter word game, where you spell words from your hand to get points. The Spellway track of the board keeps track of your total points, and the game is won by reaching the castle at the end of the track.

Several other features make it more like a board game race:

a) What you can do in your turn is determined by rolling a die and moving a shared piece around the S-track: you may draw 1-3 cards, discard a card, lay down a word, or draw a Spoiler card. Several junctions allow choices of play.

b) The Spoiler cards allow you to give and/or take letter cards from other players.

c) The Spellway track has some spaces that let you try to spell a random word on a Speller card, for 5 extra points. There are 2 levels of cards so different ages can play together.

d) If you play all your cards to spell a word, all the other players move back 1 space per card they hold, up to 3 max.
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Strange Words
description:
Players start with 20 points. A random 6-9 letter word is selected. Each player, in turn, must make an anagram of the current word, losing one point for each discarded letter and gaining one point if no letters are discarded. If no word can be formed, the player loses one point for each letter in the current word and selects a new random word. No word can be used twice in the game.

When one player has zero points, the game ends and the player with the highest score wins.

Strange Words was published (without the word list) in the Origins 2000 preregistration book. It was included in Chief Herman's Holiday Fun Pack.

name: Monopoly: Coca-Cola Classic Ads
description:
Over the last 100 years the Coca-Cola Company has served up some of America’s most iconic advertisements. From the 1959 "Santa’s Refreshing Surprise" to Norman Rockwell’s 1935 "Out Fishin’". . . to 1971’s "I’d Like To Buy The World A Coke" and "Drink Coca-Cola" from 1925, compete to own the best COCA-COLA ads of all time.

Buy, sell and trade COCA-COLA festoons, delivery trucks, calendars and serving trays as you relive the history of the COCA-COLA brand. Includes six collectible pewter tokens: 6-pack, vending machine, contour bottle, contour glass, Santa and the Polar Bear. Enjoy this refreshing twist on America's favorite board game, MONOPOLY!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Chapters
description: Produced by the bookstore chain Chapters in Canada, this is a trivia game with 3,000 questions in five categories: Fiction and Literature, Classics, Non-Fiction, Children's Literature, and Canadian Literature.

name: Weichei
description: This is the sister game to Hartei. There are several unusual German words (eg. "Warmduscher") players have to find out. One player has to act or to draw and the other ones have to find out what that should be.

name: A-divino
description: A Mexican trivia game based on Catholic religion. Questions are divided in two groups: Practice and Culture; Practice questions refer to activities and behavior related to the Catholic Church, while Culture questions refer to historical and general knowledge questions that are somewhat related to Catholic religion.

name: The Reel to Reel Picture Show James Bond 007 Movie Trivia Game
description:
An expansion for the Reel to Reel Picture show game, this game could be played on its own with home rules.

The questions fall into four categories which are color coded

Yellow covers the Bond Basics, questions about Bond Girls, Villains and the props. These questions are usually the easiest of the four categories.

Pink covers the films of the Connery and Lazenby era.

Blue covers the Moore, Dalton and Pierce Brosnan films. At the time of this game being made, only Goldeneye had been made for Brosnan.

Silver covers Extras and other background characters, credits, the various music of the films and catchphrases and quotes. This category can be either very easy or quite obscure.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Team-Based Game
publishers: Daisy Reel Productions Inc., The Reel to Reel Picture Show Ltd.

name: Passe et Drop
description: Passe et Drop is a Rugby game from France. The goal of this dice-controlled game is to be the first to win 2 matches.

name: Les Canonniers: Un Jeu de Football
description: French language vintage soccer game from 1965. The game contains a soccer terrain board, a dice, a tiny wooden ball and tactical cards.

name: Men in Black 2
description: Based upon the movie with the same name. You play one of the characters of the movie in a quest to save the earth from the extra terrestrials. In your quest you have to prove your courage by completing some tasks, and this has to be done fast because Serleena, chief of the extra terrestrials is not wasting time. Although based on a movie, this boardgame looks very much like a Monopoly board with a theme pasted upon it.

name: Paranoid Delusions
description:
In the game, each player adopts simultaneously two roles: the “Paranoid”, who represents a lone conspiracy nut; and the “Enemy”, who represents a network of real or unreal groups hiding a nefarious secret.

Each Paranoid must struggle with his own weakening grasp on sanity to reveal the Groups, Methods and Goals used by the other players' Enemies. Meanwhile, the Enemies do their best to mislead the Paranoids, betray their competing plotters to them, or just drive them insane (for purposes of entertainment only, though some people do take their games much too seriously).

There are two ways to win the game, and part of a winning strategy is attacking yourself!

This game was one of the entries in the 2006 Microgame Design Contest.

Now available at https://brtrain.wordpress.com/free-games/
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Secret Unit Deployment, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: The Rainbow Fish Card Game
description:
From the box:

"Match four cards by their colored picture symbols. Arrange the set of cards to create a glittering picture from Marcus Pfister's popular Rainbow Fish books. Make the most sets and you've won the game!

The Rainbow Fish Card Game, a variation on the ever-popular game Go Fish, will delight children ages 4-up as it helps reinforce basic counting, color identification, and memory skills."

Game includes: 32 cards with holographic foil stamping, instructions, and convenient plastic draw-pile tray.

name: I'm a Celebrity
description:
Based on the ITV TV show.

The game captures the full flavour of life as experienced by the celebrities.

Brave the trials, avoid the hazards, find the celebrity chest and gain the votes to win the game and be crowned "King of the Island".

name: Money Money Money
description:
The game consists of a canvas money bag and 77 coins. There are 17 each of yellow, red, blue and green stackable coins numbered $1-$16 plus a 'wild' coin. There are also 9 white 'instruction' coins.
Each player attempts to collect the most coins and stack them according to color in front of him. When all the coins have been used, each player joins his four stacks together and the winner is the player with the tallest stack (or most coins).

name: Die Leute von der Shiloh-Ranch
description:
A game for 2-4 players, a tie-in to the TV series "The Virginian", called "Die Leute von der Shiloh-Ranch" in Germany. Suitable for children 5 years and older. Each player has three pawns and three judges (Garth, Virginian and Betsy) meeples (wooden sticks with the letters G, V, and B imprinted respectively). The objective of the game is to reach the cowboys located in the middle of the game board.
(game number assigned by Schmidt: 601 1097)
(name of publisher on box: Schmidt Spiel + Freizeit GmbH)
categories: American West, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Hideyoshi's Greatest Defeat
description:
Hideyoshi's Greatest Defeat details Toyotomi Hideyoshi's invasion of Korea in 1592.

Components:

A2 format map
70 counters
8 page rulebook


Published in Command Magazine Japan #69 in 2006 (along with True Record of Nobunaga).

name: Grand Prix
description: Game comes with two tracks. Each player uses a steering wheel to 'drive' their cars around the track. The steering wheel operates a magnet on the underside of the track for guiding racing cars around the circuit. The game includes four cars, two for each player. There are a number of track side obstacles including hedges, walls, fences, bridges, tunnels, bridge walls. First player to complete the circuit is the winner.

name: Flippit
description:
Flippit ... the word game you'll flip over!

A multi-player competitive solitaire alphabet card game of luck that reinforces correct spelling for kids of all ages.

Choose a name or word ... shuffle and deal only those cards letter-side down in a row.

Pick a card, any card - and, to follow the letter positions and spell it out ... flip it ... the more cards flipped and correctly repositioned in their proper spelling sequence, the more points acquired.

The most points scored, wins the game.

name: Monaro City Racing Game
description: Make your way around the chosen race route and be the first player to reach the checkered flag. Watch your fuel, beware of nasty weather conditions, manage pitstops, and avoid detours in your pursuit of glory.

name: Yellowstone Treasure Quest
description: This is a trivia game based on Yellowstone Park - the object to collect unique sets of park "treasures (which are cards of photos for example). Each trivia question has 3 level of difficulties.

name: Montabaur
description:
This game is a memory-variant with pictures of the city or region the game is developed for. There are many different editions for about 200 cities or regions in Germany.

Each pair of tiles has a set of corresponding questions on it, where each tiles also gives the answer to the other one.
This way, several trivia-games can be played. Two special dice are included.

The rules describe 7 different way of plays.

name: X Factor
description:
Magnetic based board game from the makers of Magz magnetic construction sets.

Each player has a set of Magnetic X tiles. Each tile has different symbols on its sides (hearts, spades, clubs and diamonds). The timer is started and players race to add tiles to the board, making sure the symbols match. Tiles can be added either 2 dimension or in 3D.

name: Tudor's True Action Electric Sports Car Race
description: True action sports cars in an exciting rally over country roads. Sharp curves and twisting roads keep you cheering to the finish. Fascinating fun for ages 6 and up. This game is on the same line with other electronic sports games where the track vibrates because of some kind of electric current which makes the cars move around the track.

name: Who Said... Book of Mormon Game
description:
From the back of the box:

Who said what in the Book of Mormon? If you know, you win! If you don't, you learn! And if you're just a kid, you match the pictures! You can use the cards according to game instructions, or you can make up games of your own.

Individuals and families will love matching up their favorite Book of Mormon characters with the memorable things they said. Popular artist Val Chadwick Bagley has created dozens of charming, colorful drawings that bring these characters straight out of history and into your life.

Perfect for:

-Family Home Evenings
-Sunday Activities
-Primary and Sunday School Classes
-Whenever you're in the mood for a great time!

name: Master Hockey
description:
The challenge, excitement & strategy of hockey now brought into your living room, bringing hours of fun for two players. Coach your own team to victory.

The object of "Master Hockey" is for two players to face-off and score the most goals in the selected time period.

The equipment consists of a folding board, three dice, 2 teams of 6 players and 1 hockey puck.

As in hockey, the flow of the game from offense to defense is governed by your strategy, for example, "the best defense is a strong offense". We urge you to play and enjoy the challenge of Master Hockey.

name: Time Travel
description:
This is a simple historical card game, which contains 56 cards from different historical eras - Tudors, Viking, Romans, Victorians etc. These cards also have different objects such as coins, head wear, weapons, transport.

There are two games in the instructions.

The first is similar to Mau Maus but without the penalty points - you have to follow suits or objects. There are 4 "joker" cards to help the flow. The first to get rid of their cards is the winner.

The second game is a variant of rummy. You have to make 2 sets - one of four cards, and one of 3 and they can be either objects or eras.

There is a strong history theme and children pick up historical information as they play.

name: The Comedy Company
description:
The Comedy Company is just about to go to air, but the characters are scattered all over Pittswood Shopping Center! As trainee TV producer your job is to track down three of them then catch the bus back to the TV studio. Sounds easy but things keep changing along the way. You will need luck and strategy to win The Comedy Company.

Contents: The Comedy Company gameboard. Character cutouts and bases, Con The Fruiterer, Kylie Mole, David Rabbitborough, Uncle Arthur, Colin Carpenter & Russell the Postie. Player Tokens. Sets of three matching markers. Character pursuit cards. 136 Comedy Company cards. 2 Playing Dice.

name: Jackie Gleason's "And Awa-a-a-a-y We Go!" Game
description: This game is based on characters created by Jackie Gleason (Ralph Kramden, Joe the Bartender, The Poor Fool and Reginald Van Gleason the 3rd) during his Jackie Gleason Show.

name: The Snowman Game
description:
The object of this game is to be the first player to arrive back in the garden with a present from the Snowman Party. Before you can do this, you'll have to complete the rest of his costume by collecting 4 cards that represent the building of the Snowman - the body, the head, the face and the scarf plus hat.
Contents:

Instruction Sheet

16x Building Cards with 4x cards in each set of body, head, face, hat and scarf

4x Present Cards

Dice and Shaker

4x Snowmen Pieces

Counters

Deluxe Playing Board

name: Robots
description: Based on the animated film, players are robots moving around Robot City (the board) collecting spare parts tokens. Watch out for The Sweeper - he's a wind-up robot who runs in a grooved track in the board - if he touches you, you lose a token & go back to the last station.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Nickelodeon Trivia Game
description: [From Box] 1000 trivia questions from over 30 Nickelodeon toons and shows. For two or more players. Ages 5 and up.

name: Drill For Oil: Oil Well Game
description: Drill For Oil is a game where players can enjoy the fun and excitement of drilling for oil as in real life. One player is elected banker. The banker issues $10,000 to each player. (The banker is considered a player as well.) After unfolding the board, the banker shuffles the 10 drill for oil cards and places one face down on each site. To drill for oil, it costs $10,000. The banker goes first, and must state which oil well he wants to drill for oil on. He must then appropriate $10,000 to drill. There are 10 stock certificates representing 10% ownership in a well being drilled. The player drilling may sell all the stock or part of the stock. He must, however, offer a percentage of stock depending on the amount of players. (50% for 2 player, 60% for 3 or 4 players, 80% for 5 players.) At times a player may have to buy all the stock in a well if no other players want to invest in it. After the $10,000 is raised, the player pays the bank and flips the card. If it says dry hole, the stock is worthless. If it says have struck oil, each player who invested receives the dividend stated on the card. (Amounts vary on 6 of the cards, 4 are dry holes.) Play continues to the left until all 6 oil producing wells have been drilled. The game then ends and the player with the most money wins.
publishers: J. D. Neff & Son Game Company

name: I Spy 3D
description:
From the Press Release:

Everyday objects leap off the cards when players wear their oh-so-cool 3-D glasses. Players read rhyme cards and search to find floating objects that they can almost touch on a colorful game board that they create using 40 3-D tiles and 10 rhyme cards. By mixing up the tiles, no two game boards are alike. Collect the most tiles to win. For 2-4 players. Complete game rules are included. Ages 5+.

name: Twenty-Six
description:
According to the encyclopedia, This was a dice game popular in the Midwestern United States from the 1920s through the 1950s, in which a player selects a number from 1 to 6 and then casts 10 dice 13 times, attempting to throw the chosen number 26 times or more, or exactly 13 times, or fewer than 10 times. The house edge (advantage) in this game is approximately 18 percent.

Apparently this game lost popularity once anti gambling laws went into place. Standard odds were give from tavern to tavern and payoffs were usually settled by the winner getting drinks.

name: Nordmennenes egen historie
description:
(Translated from the box, in Norwegian)

Undertitle: Experiences through generations

This game is a board game about every day life in Norway throughout the generations. Be entertained by the more than 2000 questions about everything from goat cheese to Bobbysocks, singing housewives to the Quartfestival, coffee supplements to ice cream.

Enjoying and funny questions about large and tiny events that involved everybody and has had a profound effect on the way we live our lives today.

The game is easy to learn and may be played again and again. The game is based around answering questions related to 252 of the country's best historical photos.

The game suits everybody who thinks it's fun to look back on events, people, products, trends and everyday stories that has made the our society. A family game for all generations and people of all ages.

Sit down with the family and be entertained by "The Norwegians own history".

Home Page: http://www.egenhistorie.no/

name: Junkyard Jalopy
description:
Junkyard Jalopy - Can you take out the parts?

A game very similar to Operation.

Take a card and pick out the part. If you touch the sides, the horn and lights will start!

name: Guess Hue?
description: For Ages 8 and up. A trivia game with a colorful twist. Every answer is a color.

name: Penguin March & Match
description:
From the Great American Puzzle Factory catalog:

The waddling walking memory matching game! Wiggle, waddle and walk like a penguin from ice float to ice float. Try and collect a matching family of penguins, Dad, Mom, and Baby to win the game - but watch out for the nasty Leopard Seal! An action game that creates lots of laughs.

Ages 4 and up.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Memory
publishers: Blue Opal, Great American Puzzle Factory

name: Spider-Man, The Boardgame
description:
"In the Spiderman game you are Spiderman. Each player has his own Spiderman adventure, and the first to finish their adventure and beat the Green Goblin wins."

The game is divided into 4 stages. Each stage is managed by a set of cards:

On chapter 1 you collect 3 power points by traveling on the board.
Chapter 2 is dexterity test, either using the Spiderman swinger to knock 4 baddies or the maze connecting 5 entries.
Chapter 3, Spiderman recovers from wounds, by collecting both power and knowledge points.
Chapter 4, players have a showdown with the Goblin.

Players progress from one stage to the next as soon as they are ready.

Movement is with dice and spinner.
A mix of luck and dexterity game for Spiderman's fans.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Fantasy, Maze

name: In and Out
description:
In and Out is a simple roll and move game based on a swimming "Bath". The edge of the pool is numbered 1 to 54. Ten of the squares are entrances to the pool and when the player lands on them they must roll again and follow the path of a swimmer through the water back to the poolside. The pool sections are similar to the familiar snakes and ladders, with one difference - the paths through the pool are marked out in squares and thus may represent delays as well as the usual short-cuts or backward steps.

The game appears to consist of only the board, counters and a die to be supplied by the player. The instructions mention "dice" but it is likely that the game was intended to be played with one die. Each player must roll "3" to begin and the exact number to finish which might be impossible with a pair of dice.

The board illustration is quite pleasant, possibly representing an Art Deco swimming pool. All the swimmers are male, in red or blue trunks.

Valentine's Games were proud to proclaim the board as "British Manufacture". The game is marked as copyright, but this is undated, although the provenance of the game suggests the game to be no later than 1950. It is marked G12 suggesting that other boards were available from Valentine's Games.

name: Tensation
description: Players place tiles numbered from 1-10 in vertical or horizontal sequences on the gameboard to try to score the most points. TENSATION is a game of skill because where a player chooses to place a tile will have the potential to substantially increase their score.

name: Monopoly: Swansea
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Swansea, in the United Kingdom.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: The Gothic Line
description: The Gothic Line campaign game pits the Allied forces in Northern Italy against German forces desperate to hold the last line of mountains before the Allied forces enter Austria. The German must be very skilled at knowing when to hold and when to run. Delay the Allies long enough and you win.

name: Oli's Tier Quiz
description:
The name of the game translates to "Oli's animal Quiz".

Oli the lion is main figure of the transmission in the animals and their habitats to be introduced. Popular elements of the series appear also in the play. A child gets quizzed over animals posed and may so long guess/advise like another child necessarily around a action Parcours to go through. Then the roles change. Here the knowledge over animals as well as in demand with the Parcours skill and mobility. Winner who answers the most questions correctly wins.

Age: Ages 8 and up
players: 3 to 5
contents: 90 Quiz cards, 9 action maps, 1 moderator map, 3 lion paws, 1 jungle longitudinal dimension.

name: Irishopoly
description:
Designed for the University of Notre Dame. Made by Late For The Sky Production Company.

COMPLETE contents include: 1 game board, 5 tokens, 2 dice, years of credit cards, diplomas, campus mail and contingency cards, property deeds, play money , instructions and original plastic insert.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company
